text: Light golden hue with a lasting thick white head poured into a tulip glass from a can. Strong aroma of citrus and tropical fruits. Sharp bitterness followed by a complex flavour of citrus and tropical fruits with dank resinous finish. Light malt profile with just enough sweetness. Mouthful on the dry side. Delicious beer, highly recommended.
12 fl oz can. Pours slightly hazy orange gold. Pine, dank, little citrus, some toffee. Huge bitterness. Nice.
Vom Fass im Muted Horn Berlin 2017-04 getrunken. Hmm ein typisches IPA ohne viele Frucht am Gaumen eben. Nicht schlecht aber auch nicht was Besonderes.
(bottle) clear, very bright honey amber colour with a tall white had; intense aroma of tropical fruit; creamy palate; balanced flavour with a long, medium bitter finish

Hazy honey orange, good ivory head. Hoppy nose delivering citrusy and resiny notes. Honey malts background. Medium body. Very solid bitterness characterizes the flavour. Resins and grapefruit. Medium to heavy bitt

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Having a can in the Basking Ridge. Might be known for the rave reviews I heard in the kitchen of "it's not the worst I've had," "you know what's just above this? Focal Banger," and "I don't remember it tasting like caramel." Very malty IPA, but you know what I always say - better malty than salty! Full disclosure I've never said that about beer before but I might start, I see it sweeping the nation as the new beer slogan for the growing craft market. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Caramel, lots of tropical fruits, mango and passion fruit, some grass, medium intense, very pleasant. Hazy to cloudy orange color, huge sized white head with good retention. Nice amount of bitterness, Atlantic unfortunately did his job again, too much caramel and peach, dead/old hop notes but there is some pine underneath, again mango and passion fruit. Nice medium long to long medium to high bitter finish. Medium to medium full body, soft to average carbonation. It is one years old but still great, I can only imagine what its like when its fresh.

Bottle somewhere between 50 and 75cl, my GF brought me from San Diego.
Aroma is lovely. Loads of tropical fruits, grapefruit, lychee.
Pours dark blond with a white fading head, which left laces though.
Taste is obvious bitter, but some grainy maltyness, bit sweet as well.
Soft mouthfeel, long fading bitterness.
Might be one of the best IPAs I had so far.

Clear amber with little white head. Aroma is lychee, grapefruit, orange, mandarin, cake dough, resin, very fruity fine and fresh. Heavy bitterness in the taste. Smooth and very drinkable as everything else from Alesmith. Oily on the tongue. Long rather bitter finish. A bit unbalanced for Alesmith standards actually. Good.

A tiny but too powerful but has a good palate which helps and lots of great taste

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours clear deep golden with reasonable white head which lasts fairly well. Aromas of lemon zest, honey, cereal, hint of pine. Reasonable carbonation and decent mouth feel. Taste is very fresh and lemon/citrus with a nice malt balance. Fairly sweet and very bitter finish. A good solid IPA but not has aromatic hoppy as I was hoping. Just noticed it was canned exactly a year ago so the hoppiness has probably gone.

Slightly hazy golden colour, medium white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, citrus, caramel, piny hops, hint of herbs. Sweet dry taste with bitter hot finish and aftertaste. Medium body and average carbonation. Excellent IPA.

Aroma: resin and pine, herbs.
Appearance: golden color and white head.
Taste: high pine bitterness, resin, herbs, thin malty backbone, stalky, dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation.
Overall: one-dimensional IPA, resin and pine, rather bland.

from beyond beer in hamburg in can. appearance: clear yellow orange color and small white head. nose: sweet oranges, grapefruit, overall a tropical feel and floral notes. taste: starts of with oranges and grapefruit flavours also see perhaps some mango. then kicks of the bitterness which bring in pine and resin profiles. this is really well balanced i like this brew alot. great stuff.

Canned 355 ml, from Pivoljub. One yr old. Shared with JFK10000. Pours hazy yellow, white head. Fruity jammy aroma. Citrus, oranges, grapefruit, smooth, lasting bitter finish. Medium bodied. Not bad, have to try the fresh one.
Kroger (Rio Hill), bomber. Golden with a large off-white head. Nice juicy aroma: citrus and floral hops, minor pine. Flavor is pine, grapefruit juice and peel, resin, very minor fennel. Tasty.
Balsamiczne, żywiczne, gorzkie, tęgie ipa, klasyk dla miłośników tego idiomu - jeśli ktoś woli cytrusowe bomby to nie piwo dla niego.

0.33l can. Hazy golden color with medium white head. Aroma: mango,pine, papaya, caramel. Taste: resins, mango, grapefruit. Medium body, moderate carbonation.Higher and long bitterness. Dry with oily texture.
bomber pours orange with frothy white head aroma tangerine and pine taste is citrus and bitter pine finish

Aromas citricos y tropiacles
Buen aspecto espuma persistente
En boca balanceada, maltosa al principio para un final citrico resinoso

Pours golden orange from the bottle with a frothy white head. Aroma is mango, pine, coriander, tangerine. Taste is bittersweet and quite fruity, mango and citrus being dominant. Finish trends bitter but still in balance with a dry, lightly warming finish. One of the best IPAs I have drunk.

(AleSmith IPA) Can 355ml at home, served into a shaker.
Orange coloured body, clear, with a tall and thick off-white head on top, good retention.
Aroma of biscuit, cookie dough, oranges.
Taste has light citrus, orange, biscuit, caramel malts with a nice bitterness on the finish.
Medium body, good carbonation.
Good.
Bottle 65cl. Orange, hazy with a offwhite head. Nice balanced , tropical fruit aroma. Bitter taste with a warm tropical end, Nice.
How: bottle Appearance: clear golden, medium white head. Aroma; pine, caramel, citrus peel, grass, floral. Palate: full to medium body, average carbonation

Can. Hazy honey orange, good ivory head. Hoppy nose delivering citrusy and resiny notes. Honey malts background. Medium body. Very solid bitterness characterizes the flavour. Resins and grapefruit. Medium to heavy bitter. Some sweet malts behind it. Very long bitter finish. Well it is not surprising. It is just damn very good.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Mucho pino y mucha resina en nariz. Algo de fruta en boca. Espuma impresionante. Amargota. Intenso postgusto. Merecida fama, aunque diría que es un poco de la vieja escuela. Hoy se buscan IPA más finas. Espectacular. Canned 05/10/16

Drank half year after canning, disappointing I dont think that it should get old so fast in can. Nothing much to say mango aroma, honey in taste and heavy bitterness. I hope that Ill have more fresh batch next time to say something better
Golden w white head. So tropical and piney on the nose. Smells really good. Flavour is malty with a very generous hop forward bitter finish. Very good one

Otra gozada de la fábrica. Una IPA que no sé si hace mucho bien al estilo west coast por subir la media o mucho daño por fijar un estándar al que casi nadie llega. Seductora en aroma, florales, pomelo, mandarina y naranja dulce sobre maltas​ y caramelo. Seca, viva, sedosa y de final breve con postgusto afrutado y resinoso, pelín especiado. Como siempre, una base muy británica sobre la que edificar sus recetas. Muy buena!

Clear light golden colour with thin head. Sweet tropical fruit with piney aroma and hold tropical fruit upfront flavours too. Sweet syrupy mouthfeel leading to firm hop bitterness and subtle malt backbone. Very drinkable. Bold hop flavours. Well balanced and quite refined. Crisp finish.

Crystal clear golden with a large fine poring white head offering good lacings. Aromas of caramel, pine, resin, grapefruit zest and orange jam develop. Fine carbonation, slick with a surprisingly lean body. Soft sweetness with a developping solid yet harmonious bitterness. Light dry lasting finish.

Color naranja, medianamente turbio, con capa de espuma blanca de tres dedos de grosor (muy buena retención). Carbonatación mínima. Textura acuosa. Aroma a fruta tropical, humedad, resina, naranja, malta si se agita. Sabor frutal (pomelo, naranja, mango), con buena base maltosa casi dulce y final de amargor muy moderado. Seca. En postgusto queda algo de amargor resinoso y algo de fruta tropical. Es una auténtica pena, porque está enlatada en mayo de 2016. Si está tan buena a estas alturas es que fresca es una IPA del carajo. Modificaré oportunamente mi puntuación y opiniones en caso de que la prueba más fresca en un futuro.
PD: he mentido de manera inconsciente. Está enlatada en octubre de 2016. ¿Fresca? Habría que discutirlo entre opiniones divergentes.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2017 Puszka, data zapuszkowania 05.10.16 więc jak na IPA to już trochę ma. Ciemnozłote, półprzejrzyste, z ładną pianą. Armat średnio mocny, są w nim słodkie owoce tropikalne, landrynki, trochę cytrusów. W smaku przyjemna słodycz, znów owoce tropikalne i cytrusowe, słodki smak skontrowany jest mocną goryczką, mocną cytrusowo-żywiczną, ale przyjemną, w sam raz. Goryczka chwilę zalega w ustach, jest jeszcze odczucie ściągania się na języku. Finisz lekko miodowy, chyba przez wiek piwa. Mnie rozczarował głównie brak uderzenia aromatów chmielowych w piwie, ale i tak bardzo dobre.Jak uda mi się kiedyś dostać świeżą wersję butelkową to na pewno ocenie ponownie, bo teraz wydaje mi się że to piwo sporo straciło przez swój wiek
Great piney aroma, hops aplenty and alcohol well hidden. Very tasty. Could be the base IPA to compare others to

A 12 fl oz can, canned on 5th October 2016. Poured into a Lost Abbey teku glass. It was a lightly hazy, light copper orange colour with a nice two finger off white head with good retention and great lacing. Aromas of tropical pineapple and apricot with citrus orange, pine and sweet biscuit malt. Tastes of citrusy and bitter orange peel, mandarin and grapefruit followed by sweet-ish pineapple, biscuit malt and pine. The finish has a nice long resinous bitterness. Crisp, dry-ish, medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall, a wonderfully tasty and balanced West Coast IPA. Also loving the cans!
Can from Beer Gonzo, Coventry. Hazy warm golden appearance, orange, piney, tropical, dank aromas. Taste is piney, dank, citrusy, dry, finish is medium bitter and lasts long. Very solid
On tap at Alus celle in Riga. Nice and good IPA - not that strong aroma, but typical bitterness in taste and aftertaste.

Pours orange with white head. Aroma; fruity, grassy, some pine and citruses. Taste: the same, up to medium bitter. Dry. Medium body. Nice but not so good as ratings are.
Leicht trübes goldgelb mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, sehr fruchtig, Zitrusfrüchte, Grapefruit, Mandarinen, harzig, bitter.

Orange amber color. Nice head. Smells of grapefruit and orange confit. Malt mixed with grapefruit rind and some herbal highlights.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

15/20 good IPA but not worth its high rating. Grapefruit and orange to taste, not much bitterness, very drinkable at 7.25%, actually it is bloody good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

DER SÜCHTIGMACHER !!! ICH WILL SOFORT EINEN BOMBER 🚀!!! Haarscharf vorbei an der Perfektion wird hier operiert. Besonders der wundervoll satt, saftige Weinmalztropicfruitschmeichlertrunk und komplex verwaldete Hoppynachhall, schaffen es fast auf den 10/5 Thron. WOW!!! Aber auch der krasse POTsmell und die unkaputtbaren Tropic/Pinienaromen halten nicht hinter den Berg. A REAL MASTERPIECE. Meine 355ml CAN war ein halbes Jahr alt und FRESH AS HELL. Uiuiuiui...5 bei BOXBEERS. Halleluja!!! 🎆✨  Und Kräuterhefe-Belgien klatscht sowieso ab 😋...

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2017 0.65l bottle ( just 6$), fresh one at home in Sf; pours golden color, slightly haze/clear with foamy white head with good lacing. Aroma: intense hop profile with notes of tropical fruits, citruses, pine, supported with grain/ bread like malt notes. Fla or is very similar, with dominant hop profile, which is perfecly balanced with malts....hop bitterness is high, bitterness lingers through finish into aftertaste. Body is moderate medium, texture soft, carbonation moderate medium.

12oz can at home courtesy of Saeglopur, big thanks. Canned 10/05/2016. orange clear color, medium big white head. smells of pines, resin, bit old hoppy, caramel, oranges, parfumy, lemon grass, some lychee. overall nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of oranges, some grapefruit, mango, earthy, light pines, lemon grass.finishes lightly bitter with earthy notes, pines and some exotic fruits. quite good one, overall a bit old hoppy, but taste is still quite nice, rather on the earthy side though. overall nice stuff.

355ml can. Pours a hazy golden orange colour with a white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, pine, grapefruit, tangerine. Taste follows suit matching the aroma exactly, light malt in the background. Medium bodied, smooth mouthfeel. Really good.

Pours hazy golden with a low white head. Aromas of citrus, peach, resin, apricot, pine. Taste is very fruity with light grassy notes and moderate bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.

Style et résumé: IPA américaine de grande classe. 
Comment: Cannette à Boston.
Portrait: Une bière dorée classique avec une mousse blanche. Un nez dagrumes, de miel, de pamplemousse et autres fruits exotiques. Une bouche sucrée et amère avec des saveurs intenses de fruits exotiques. Digestibilité légendaire. Quoi demander de plus. 
Note:  8+/10

Puszka i wersja lana

Piwne legendy szybko upadają. 
W aromacie nie powala jak na sztosową TOP IPA Owszem są nuty tropikalne, ale nie jakoś sczególnie wyraźne. Miałem wrażenie, że jest lekko wodniste. Goryczka na finiszu mało przyjemna.
355ml bottle at House of Belgium, Xiamen. Pours slightly hazy orange with a thick creamy head. Aroma of mango, citrus and pine. Balanced bittersweet finish. Smooth, definitely one of the better ones.

Thanks D.! MBR. Misty orange golden body. White head. Sweey dough and assorted citrus fruit. Lovely! Mixture of peachy and doughy notes on a solid malty base. A touch of lime and a well integrates herbal bitterness. Lovely indeed, superbly drinkable for the ABV.

Burk från Beergium. Tappad 5 okt 2016, så drygt fyra månader gammal. Ganska klar guldfärgad med högt vitt skum som ligger kvar längs sidorna. I doften granskott, kåda, grape, rivet apelsinskal, citruszest. Medelstor kropp, ganska rund och len. Som i doften är det mycket granskott, kåda, beska från citrusskal. Lite oljig och klibbig känsla från humlen. Lite större beska. Välbalanserad, klara smaker. Känns lätt för att vara över 7%. Gott, och om inte annat lite omväxling från hajpen kring NE-IPA just nu.

Legendás hírű ital, melynek beszerzése manapság nem több, mint egyszerű vállalkozás, így kíváncsian vártam, hogy hírnevéhez hű módon váltja-e be az elképzeléseket. Bár a könnyű elérhetőség és a kivételes minőség nem feltétetlenül zárja ki egymást, ez esetben mégis inkább egyfajta kiugrásoktól mentes, kikezdhetetlenül sima főzet megtestesülésére számítottam. Méz színű IPA hófehér, tömött habkoronával a tetején, trópusi gyümölcsök húsának mézédes, s egyszerre fanyar illata járja át aromáit. Gyantás, komlóolajos jegyek rajzolódnak ki elegánsan, üde jelleggel, valóban összeszedett ital benyomást keltve. Kortyai teltek, grapefruit és narancs képét idézőek, kekszes malátával megalapozottak, kifinomult, tartalmas, lekerekített kesernyével záródóak. Valóban kifogástalan főzet, csupa jómodor, nem az a kirobbanó, vad jellem. Ez utóbbi vonások vélhetően az "imperial" jelzővel felruházott stílusok sajátjai az Alesmith háza táján is.

Ocena przepisana z notatek / innego serwisu, w ramach uzupełnienia profilu na RateBeer. W aromacie świeże białe owoce z winogronami na czele, dalej tropikalne i cytrusowe, głównie pomarańcze, trochę nie do końca dojrzałych owoców. W smaku dość gęste i pełne, liczyłem na mocniejsze uderzenie ze strony chmielu, a tu podbudowa słodowa jest dość mocno zaznaczona, po ogrzaniu nawet trochę w stronę karmelu.

Wazig oranje/donkerblond bier met wand klevende witte schuimkraag. Geur: hoppig, zeer fruitig, abrikoos, marmelade, hibiscus, mandarijn, wat kruidigheid, doet wat denken aan likeur. Smaak: bitter, fruitig, roze pompelmoes, hars, druivenpitten, gentiaan, drop, anijs en redelijk veel moutzoetigheid. Volmondig. Medium koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: bitter, hard. Lekkere IPA, maar de moutzoetiheid is wat op het randje voor mij.
Pours hazy light orange with a large white head. Good flavor but light mouth feel. and didnt finish with a punch.
UPDATED: FEB 4, 2017 Bottle 12 fl.oz. Pours orange hazy with large white head, long retention and nice lacing. Malts, citrus, orange, caramel, hops. Nice mouthfeel. Medium body and carbonation.

33cl-blik op degustatie USA-bieren van H.O.P. in t Rusteel te Gullegem. U: Helder donkergoudblond-oranje met een dunne witte schuimkraag. G: Perzik, abrikoos, citrus, mandarijn, mango, karamel en hibiscus. S: Zoet met een bittere afdronk. Tropisch fruitig, karamel, citrus, roze pompelmoes en harsig. M: Medium body en medium carbonatie.
Bottle 65cl. Orange, hazy with a offwhite head. Nice balanced , tropical fruit aroma. Bitter taste with a warm tropical end, Nice.
Pours golden honey like in color, nice bright. Aroma is fresh citrus, pine classic IPA. Finishes with a great tart bitterness.

Bottle. Aroma is light malts and caramel, hints of orange, resin, pine, some herbal tones. Golden, hazy, small white head. Medium sweetness, medium bitterness, taste is slightly fruity, light malts, caramel, notes of orange zest. Medium body, medium carbonation, medium long finish with nice bitterness and some malty sweetness. Nice ipa.

Hazy gold, tall and lasting head. 
Medium body, flavorful, discrete mouthfeel, silky texture with high carbonation but low heat, lingering aftertaste. 
Bitter, dry but well balanced. 
Deliciously hoppy all the way to the finish, resiny, herbal, definite malt but in background. 
Not as good as the "double" version but still a great IPA 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy honey color with a nice white head. Aroma nice, spicy, flowery, grassy. Taste full, spicy, hoppy, flowery, nicely balanced. Hoppy without being that bitter, nice fruity but dry finish. Very nice ipa

Kíváncsian vártam az egyik top IPA sör megkóstolását. Nem kellett benne csalódnom. Nagyon finom ital. Ízre hozza az IPA-k összes védjegyét. Ugyanakkor nem kaptam meg azt a lehengerlő élményt, amit a helyezése alapján vártam tőle. Mindenesetre ajánlom.
Flott aroma og smak. Rikelig med amerikansk humle. Rett og slett en meget bra india pale ale, en av de bedre.
malty/ piney hoppy aroma. golden and lightly hazy in color with decent head. taste is hope forward with piney, resinous notes. underlying light caramel malt notes. finished clean.

On draft. Its dumb that its taken me years to drink this -- there always seems to be something else on draft or other bottles in the shop. Well, that was a mistake, because this beer is fantastic. Even in a world saturated with IPAs and DIPAs, where I can drive to Tree House or Vermont in a couple of hours and get cases of cutting-edge hop bombs, this holds up. Its got a west coast IPA "bite" and its body is crisp, balanced, and dry, but theres a lot of citrus and tropical fruit hop aroma, which adds a ton of enjoyable complexity. This is the real deal.
Duft citrus lime græs humle frisk, smag citrus lime appelsin frisk frisk lidt tør

355ml can into shaker. Slightly hazy golden copper beer with perfect two finger white head. Steady fine carbonation. Nose is citric and earthy. Light and fruity at first then a long lingering descent into bitterness, seems to grow through grapefruit, quinine, pine until a last little burst of sweet fruit and malt balances it all. Complex and contemplative.

Can. Pours unclear golden with small off-white head, good lacing. Aroma is heavy hoppy: pine and resin up front, citrus - grapefruit and tangerine in the back. Taste: very light sweetness with floral and tangerine notes followed by medium to heavy resiny and piney crisp bitterness, which quickly falls to lower level, leaving resiny, fruity aftertaste. Medium body and carbonation, quite slick and smooth. Great balance. Awesome IPA, appriopriate beer for my 100th rating.
Not much to say but...perfect!, the balance is fantastic and the ease at which this beer drinks with the 725% abs is scary. One of the best I have had.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2017 Cloud golden, medium head with nice retention and lacing. Aroma: exotic fruits, citrous, malt, pine. Medium to high sweetness, medium body, medium to high bitterness. Malty flavour with sweet fruitness. Quite long finish. 7.5% abv is boundary between ipa and iipa, and it tastes more like iipa.

65 cl, bottle conditioned, BB April 1th 2017. Slightly hazy, golden amber, thick head, nice level of carbonation Aroma is nicely balanced, sweet malts and tropical hops, some citrus and piny notes. Mouthfeel is resiny an well carbonated. Flavourwise, I think (again..) that this bottle is a bit too old. It lacks the hop freshness, but by all means, its a nice and tasty IPA, but not sensational.

Bottle. Hazy golden with big white head. Medium malty and heavy hoppy. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruits and pine - caramel notes. Starts medium sweet but finish light heavy crisp bitter with lingering fruity notes. Balanced and smooth. Light and juicy. A great IPA.

To say AleSmith IPA is textbook for the style is a severe understatement. It would be better to say that this IPA is the IPAest of all the IPAs to have ever IPAed. Yep, this is getting stupid, but you get the idea. This is pure West Coast IPA straight out of SD. Huge doses of pine and grafefruit. Crisp, dry, bright, resinous, and hop-forward. Its a modern classic. Itll leave your palate - and, in my case, my pants - sticky.
Draft, sample at Ratebeer Best 2016. When beer become a classic you dont need to say nothing.

Tasted from a 12oz. can. It poured a cloudy amber/orange with a frothy offwhite to light orange head with spotty laceing. Hop, citrus fruit, and pine nose with a flavor profile to match. Nicely bitter front to finish.
UPDATED: MAY 3, 2017 Couleur dorée, trouble; mousse blanche; arômes et goût maltés, fruités et de résine; texture un peu crémeuse; finale bien amère

Out of the bottle, poured a medium copper, hazy, with a thin white head that dissipated relatively quick. I got aromas mainly of grapefruit pith and resinous pine against a solid caramel malt backbone. The palate was refreshing, assertively hoppy but well balanced by malt - I got more stone fruit (peach, apricot) and tropical fruit (mango) that I didnt pick up on the nose. Very good IPA.

Pours slightly hazy golden orange without a head, thin ringed retention a few bubbles. A bit of honeyed citrus hop oils on the nose. Thick mouthfeel, slow entry, very grassy hops, dry cone greenness, perfumey mids mixed with 5-sweetness malts. Creeper bitterness from the hops but they linger for a long while. The entire taste experience makes a lasting impression. Good quality stuff. The hops give the illusion of dryness.

Bottle conditioned. 4 months after bottled. massive pour with white and smooth head, long lasting. very clear golden color. floral, tropical fruit boom. very dry, sweet, fruit candy taste with a bit bitter finish.

Rating no. 8,000. Bottle from Total Wines and More, Sterling VA. Amber in colour, with a frothy, white, head. Massive tropical fruit and floral hop aroma, with grapefruit, pineapple tangerines and mango on display. Flavour had plenty more, tropical fruits, balanced by some crisp and slightly biscuity malts, before a well-balanced, dry, finish. An excellent beer.

Orange/gold pour with a decent white head. Orange, pine, fruity and malt aromas - smells fantastic. Taste is orange, pineapple, not overwhelmingly bitter, great fruit and malt combo,then a fair whack of resin and bitterness at the end. Damn fine IPA

DATE: November 27, 2016... OCCASION: Christmas decorating, almost complete... GLASSWARE: Howards Pub pint... pours a swirling storm of bubbles, spinning through a translucent, light amber body that supports a thick, creamy, pillowing white head--a perfect picture... orange, grapefruit, melon, tangerine, resin and pine weigh in with an earthiness that suggests a dankness... the malts are bread-like and mellowing... this ale sips efficiently, if not smoothly, in belying its 7.2% ABV... front to back, a full ticket, with the teeth experiencing an initial hit, while the throat holds fast to a lasting, subtle sweetness... creamy and medium-bodied.... in other words, how is this an IPA at 7.2%? the tangerine is most notable, with the grapefruit and orange lending to a hop-forward experience, one that rewards as a sippable, powerful IPA... the undergirding malts match its dry finish encouraged by its hops... I have waited a long time for Alesmith to reach the East Coast, and here it is, in all its glory... incredibly balanced, setting the standard for the IPA not wanting to be a hop bomb...

Közepes, tartós hab, narancsos félbarna szín. Nagyon kellemes, déligyümölcsös, citrusos illat, némi gyantával. Enyhén édeskés, zöldfűszeres, citrusos, citrushéjas ízvilág, déligyümölcsös aromákkal. Testes, de nem nehéz, könnyen iható, erősen szénsavas és keserű. Rendkívül ízgazdag, a testessége ellenére szinte frissítő. Kiemelkedő sör.

Appearance: Hazy orange, good amount of white head.
Aroma: Good hops, light fruits, citrus.
Taste: Nice hops, light fruits, citrus. Lingering bitterness. Great balance.
Bought: Courtesy of Julien C thanks!, 750 ml
Info: 24/11-2016
Pours hazy dark golden with lasting clingy bone head. So balanced with malty backbone thought-out, evenly distributing a healthy dose of pine and citrus.
Bottle. Bronze and clear with a small head. Hoppy and floral with a gentle bitterness. A classic of its style but 100/100 ? I dont really think so.

Bottle: Light amber coloured, hazy, small and stable creamy off-white head; moderate to solid sweet-bitter aroma of caramel with traces of soy-sauce, backed by both herbal and piney hops; solid sweet-bitter flavour, almost full bodied and quite soft; lingering drier and more bitter and more " medical" hoppy-caramelly finish. Impressive amount of aromas, but - was I overly impressed? No, I wasn?t...

Bottle purchased at 7 Eleven, Kittery. Color shows pours a golden orange, thin lasting head, some clarity. The aroma is floral hoppiness, grapefruit, pine also mild pale grain. 
The brew has bready malt backing that provides a great balance. The flavor flavor is very piney and grapefruity. This is a classic hop profile in every regard. This is old school in the sense of the hop flavors, dominated by pine and florals. What is so impressive to me is how this is nearly flawless. Plus the fact this is there standard IPA which is now offered nation wide. I will seek this out on draft.
This pretty ordinary IPA, still a excellent brew reminds me of saying: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, therefore, is not an act but a habit. - Aristoteles
This is a fantastic IPA. Right up there with Pliny in my opinion. Smooth with notes of tropical fruit.

Aroma is very much leaning towards the malt here and I catch a lot of dried red fruits. Subtle hops, with a slight grassy touch and lemon zest. Taste is round and smooth with caramelly malt flavors and toffee. The hops brings some bite to it, but its too laidback and gentle for my taste buds nowadays. Well balanced and more or less an easy drinking IPA - but its not what I seek first and foremost nowadays.

Lata de 12oz, servida en un Spiegelau IPA, un mes de haber sido enlatada.
APARIENCIA: de color ámbar con algunos destellos naranjas a contraluz, se observa ligeramente turbia y una mediana actividad de carbonatación; corona de espuma color blanco, copiosa y de buena retención, de burbujas compactas y algunas abiertas.

AROMA: muy frutal, notas a mango, piña, durazno, ligeramente cítrica como cáscara de toronja y un dulzor de las maltas que llegan inclusive a notas a caramelo. Conforme toma temperatura ambiente se hacen más presentes notas herbales como de pino y resina.

SABOR: de entrada un amargor medio seguido de los lúpulos usados de carácter herbal con notas a pino, resina, algo de dankness y eso lo que predomina, atrás de eso notas frutales y cítricas, algo de piña, mango, durazno, cáscara de toronja pero en menor medida y un dulzor de las maltas que apenas está presente para balancear lo anterior. En el retrogusto queda un amargor medio alto, seco y que queda pegado al paladar.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio ligero con sensación oleosa en boca, mediana carbonatación.

RESUMEN: excelente cerveza
12 oz bottle: Dark golden color. Sweet dank hop aroma, spicy citrus and resin. Palate is on the dry side with a pronounced bitterness.

Tapped at the source. Super hazy golden red orange color. Thick soapy head. Fantastic balanced aroma of tangerines, oranges, green tea, floral bitter hops. Taste mirrors the aroma plus dry floral hops finish. Super pleasant hops, nothing aggressive. Perfectly balanced. Overall excellent!

Hazy orange color. Nice creamy head. Balanced hop and malt aromas of caramels, pine, coriander seeds, citrus fruits, mint. Surprisingly malty flavor, combined with a deep hop resiny bitterness that lasts long on the tongue. Really rich flavor. So well layered. A superior IPA.

Orange aroma. Big pillowy head that takes a long time to dissipate. Piney flavors come to the forefront but orange sweetness still present. Maybe a bit too thin in the body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Chalk this one up as one of the best IPAs of all time. The balance of malt to hoppiness is down to a near exact science. Creamy, dense white head sitting pretty on a pristine gold colored appearance. The aroma is grapefruit with soft tropical fruit in the background. A delicious and juicy IPA that I will come back for more and more and more...and more.
Orangish pour, small head, slight haze. Aroma is citrus, caramel, jasmine. Flavor is grapefruit rind, bready caramel backbone with strong resin follow up. Very long bitter finish. Solid IPA.

660ml bottle bought at Vinmonopolet Langnes. Pearl white head resting over a hazy orange coloured body. Crocheted lacing. Ripe citrus taste with a slight touch of caramel sweetness. Sappy taste profile of citrus, pine and moderate malty sweetness. A lingering bitter aftertaste of resin and citrus peels. Well bodied. Smooth in the mouth. Drinking pleasure, indeed (Shared with friends, Prestvika, Sommarøy 02.09.2016).

Aroma: citrus, flowers, resin, a little grass in the background sweetness.
Appearance: red copper color, with consistent white head.
Taste: hops taste with citrus and flowers, a little malt.
Palate: sweetness, middle body, bitterness in finish.
try in italy,hot stuff,aroma of grapefruit,full body,good variety of american hop,very bitter

golden amber lens with high vividness creating a lather white. outstanding aroma, which floods with citrus shades (grapefruit, orange, shells), pineapple, resin, pine and some candy and cereal. On the palate we have the same citrus shades (tangerine), resinous aroma but that comes with a moderate sweetness of roasted malts. Something spicy. The final drink is long and dry, with a marked bitterness which melts between effervescence and pleasant citrus and resinous flavors that create an unforgettable experience. Medium bodied and very creamy.

Bottle. Pours golden with a thick, rocky white head. Very hoppy aroma, grapefruit, citrus herbs, oranges and some malty caramel. Medium body and carbonation, bitter finish. Flavour is mostly bitter, grapefruit. Nice.

The aroma is hops, citrus, spruce. Pours a orange/copper with big off-white head mostly diminishing and excellent lacing. The taste is bitter. The body is medium, the texture creamy, the carbonation lively and the finish bitter. An excellent beer!

Flaske 660ml fra Vinmonopolet Tromsdalen. Drukket på Lillehøgda 11 Aug 16. Gylden. Litt uklar. Pent luftig skum som varer. Heftig & god ferskenaroma. Smaken tørket aprikos. Lett syrlig etter hvert. En god del bunnfall & gjørmete siste kvelling. Utmerket øl.

Solid taste, very slight color with a nice fizzy head. Great bitterness. Lots of bubbles

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pour into nonic pint glass from Spruce Creek Provisions. Appearance is cloudy dark yellow/orange/light brown with fair sparkle, finger-width off-white head with poor retention and decent sudsy lacing. Aroma is tropical fruit, grapefruit, citrus, pine. Taste is as aroma balanced with moderate resin bitterness. Palate is medium bodied with thick, foamy texture, average-to-lively carbonation and balance of sweet and bitter finish. Overall, nice complexity of flavors and balance of sweet and bitter. Top notch.

12oz bottle. No apparent code date. Appearance: Deep golden and clear like apple juice, with a light, thick bubbled off white foam head. 

Aroma: Caramel maltiness followed by a strong tropical fruit, pineapple, berry, and resinous hop aroma. 

Taste: Rich caramel malt sweetness slowly turning to a resinous, light citrus hop bitterness that intensifies through the swallow. Well balanced malt profile against the bitterness. 

Mouthfeel: On the heavier side for an IPA, with a low to moderate carbonation. 

Finish: Despite the balance, a strong resinous hop bitterness stands out after the swallow. 

Overall: A very well balanced IPA despite the aggressive bitterness. Does a better job than some other west coast IPAs of providing a strong malt backbone that balances it out. Nothing stands out as sharp here, which speaks to the balance

Slightly hazy dark golden color with creamy, off-white head. Aroma has a nice perfume, floral and citrusy. Taste starts really balanced with some clean malts, citrusy hops, a bit of pine resin and finishes with medium hop bitterness and lingering grapefruit and a touch of white grapes. Medium body with nice carbonation and pleasant mouthfeel. Its a really good IPA overall, classic west coast and well brewed.

The aroma is full of hops, pine, grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, mango, flowers and citrus. The color is hazy golden with a minimal, white and frothy head. The taste is full of hops, pine, pineapple, mango, citrus, tangerine and grapefruit. A really nice IPA!
Bottle. Cloudy golden color, airy white head. Pleasant hoppy aroma. Rich, aromatic flavor with floral notes and a hint of resin and grapefruit. Medium-full body, medium carbonation. Very nice!

Gylden brun lett tåkete med høyt beige skum. Lukter fersken, lett trevirke og moden ananas. Middels fylde. Mye bitterhet, citrusskall og druestener. Fruktig sødme, noe vanilje og ananas. Middels lang.

On tap at Sparkling City on Tap festival in Corpus Christi. Clear golden with a lacy off-white head. Delicious aroma of citrus, resin, tropical fruit and caramel malt. Taste is very nicely balanced but plenty well hopped. Medium bodied, crisp, and dry. Wonderful.

(330ml bottle from boxbeers.dk) Pours a clear pale amber with a moderate, dense white head that fades very slowly with lots of lace. Aroma of grapefruit, clementine, pine resin, pale raw sugar, touch of dough, Flavour is orange, mandarin, grapefruit, citrus oils, pine resin, slight tropical fruit hints, light caramel malt thats a bit sweet and a little bready. Moderate pine resin, grapefruit peel and hop oil bitterness builds into a dry finish. Medium bodied, creamy filling carbonation. Very crisp, clean take on an IPA, more malt, citrus and pine than most new-school versions. Modern classic. High drinkability!
Amber color. Nose is grapefruit, some orange, sweet malts. Taste is light citrus, cracker, flowery bitter hops. Soft oily mouthfeel with a dry bitter finish.

Miltei kirkas kuparinruskeaa hieman vaaleampi olut runsaalla ja pitkäkestoisella pitsiä jättävällä vaahdolla. Tuoksu eksoottisen hedelmäinen, karamellisen maltainen ja hieman häivähdyksenomaisesti ruohoinen. Maku samoin eksoottisen hedelmäinen, greippisen hapan sekä hieman havuinen ja taustalla häivähdys karamellista mallaspohjaa. Keskitäyteläinen suutuntuma, hiilihappoja vähäisesti. Pehmeää ja samettista, ei liian humaloitua ja varsin tasapainoista IPAa tässä saa nautiskella.

from bottle, poured a light hazy golden colour with a white head, nose of crisp malts, tangerines, sweet orange, sweet tropical fruits, citrus, light pine notes, earthy crisp mouthfeel, without a overpowered bitterness. clean, sweet aftertaste. nice

Draft. Im not even going to break this one down. A good IPA is all about balance and harmony; its a Zen moment of suspension where bitterness, dryness, sweetness, and generosity meet in a single moment of carbonated satori. When perfect, it is extraordinary. When out of balance, its shite. Theres a lot more shite in the world than there is extraordinary. This, however, is extraordinary; one of only a handful of IPAs Ive had where I said to myself, "Yeah, this is it. This is worth the hype." Go get yourself some.
Outstanding flavor. Almost an imperial IPA. Balanced flavor and bitterness. Had at the brew pub

On tap at brewpub. A clearish golden ale with a short lived white head. Aroma is grapefruit, lemon, lime and melon. Flavor is loads of fruits: grapefruit, lemon, lime and melon. Finish is very bitter, with flavors of lemon, grapefruit, lime and...melon. Medium body, soft mouthfeel and average carbonation.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2016 Malt forward ipa but very citrusy with tangerine. Flavor has pine. Bitterness is high. 

Just giving this one more attention because of the high acclaim... sacriledge, I know... Lets see if it pans out... Its completely cloudy and orange in colour. The head is 1/2: of frothy foam throughout the drink. The aroma has notes of "sounds nicer" malted caramel, citrus and pine. Its just too sweet with all that caramel for my non-American palate American.taste buds. This beer is great for Americas sweet tooth.6 on the aroma is really pushing it with all that sweetness. The forgettable palate cany be raised above 2. Tastes-wise, its hoppy, bitter and citrusy, all the cliches of an American IPA. I wanted to be a sheep with this one. My good taste just wont allow me to inflate it any higher than originally rated.

This will likely have to re-rated. Ive had this before and do not recall it tasting like the following. 

Bottle into a tumbler showing honey amber with a finger of clean white foam. 

The nose shows orange zest with a malt undertone. 

The palate shows a lot of the same with a sharp IPA bitterness on the finish. Moderately carbonated and light bodied. Nothing terribly special.

Bottle 0,75l. Pours a slighly hazy golde. colour with a big thick white head. Aroma of piney hop, pinapple and tangerine. Taste is piney hops & grapefruit with really nice bitterness & some biscuity malt. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Originally rated on 10/2/08. My first Ale smith product, i had to have these shipped in by finewinehouse.com, overall i was pleased with thier service. Anyway back to the IPA, the aroma was wonderful with hints of pine, citrus, apple, malts and some floral notes being present. Apperance was a cloudy deep copper colored body, mouthfeel was thick and chewy. Flavor was similar to aroma with apple, pine and citrus sharing the stage, and the finish was malty. Overall a very good IPA, that is certainly worth your time.

pours a light orange amber with a thick white head that has great retention. Aroma has lots of tropical fruits and toasted malts. Flavor is much the same with a nice resinous back end. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Lasting dry finish. This beer is good but IMO a little overrated.
Fine IPA with light aroma. Balanced with average hop bitterness. Absolutely no better than fresher MI IPAs!
UPDATED: JUL 13, 2016 Jauka svaigs ananass, maigs iesals, nedaudz herba. Garsa: nu etalons ko lai saka. Iespejams bija iestavejusies pudele.
This IPA is really good. By that I mean that it is quite delicious. And tasty too.

Pours a dark golden amber with a long lasting creamy off white head. some light lacing. Aroma of sweet citrus tropical fruit, citrus pine hops, caramel malt and yeast as it warms up. Taste is sweet citrus, orange fruity flavors with a good amount of citrus pine hops bitterness. A medium smooth bodied brew. Finish is sweet citrus tropical fruit flavors with a well balanced citrus pine hops bitterness. This is a top tier IPA, very much enjoyed, tasty and well balanced. very nice indeed.

12 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 5/10/2016. Pours lightly hazy/cloudy golden orange color with a 2 finger dense and rocky off white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Dense soapy lacing clings around the glass. Awesome appearance. Aromas of big grapefruit, tangerine, peach, pineapple, mango, lemon zest, orange peel, pine, light caramel, toasted bread, and floral/grassy earthiness. Incredible aromas with awesome complexity and balance of juicy citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big grapefruit, tangerine, peach, pineapple, mango, lemon zest, orange peel, pine, light caramel, toasted bread, and floral/grassy earthiness. Good amount of pine/citrus rind bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, peach, pineapple, mango, lemon/orange rind, pine, toasted bread, and floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of juicy citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and minimal astringent hop flavors lingering after the finish. Moderate dryness from bitterness, that increases through the glass. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, sticky/resinous, and fairly creamy/bready balanced mouthfeel that is awesome. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an insane IPA! All around incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of juicy citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt flavors; very smooth and easy to drink. A highly amazing offering.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2016 Gylden med medium høyt hvitt skum. Mildt grapefrukt og sitrus i aromaen. I smaken er det sitrus, noe tropisk frukt og furu samt malt. Fin/behagelig bitterhet til tross for at flasken ble brygget i slutten av januar. Smakene føles velbalansert og harmonerer bra med hverandre. God grapefruktbitterhet i ettersmaken. Medium konsistens.

12 oz bottle: Aroma is a wonderful citrus hop bomb that smells just scrumptious. Appearance is golden with a light hue of amber mixed in. Taste is great hop notes grapefruit with a tinge of malts in the backing. Palate is medium carbonation with an slight hop after taste. Overall, Really good stuff. Cheers!

Poured from a 22 oz bottle, cloudy gold with a small off-white head. Aroma is pine and grapefruit. Nicely bitter with just a little bit of sweetness coming through, medium body, fresh and clean on the palate. Very fine, light lacing on the glass.

Bottle from Flask at home. Pours hazy amber with white head. Immense aroma of hops, some pine, and some fruit. Taste is delightfully hoppy and bitter with an earthy quality to it. Perhaps some grapefruit and pine to the taste. Truly astonishing.

Celestial good fragrance of fruitiness. Perfectly balanced taste between the sweet and the bitter part. Occasionally fruity. Perfectly balanced bitterness that fills the mouth for a long time. This is perfection in the bottle. One can not more than to enjoy! Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Light amber and medium-bodied. The aroma is mostly citrusy hops, with notes of pine and spice. The flavour is richly hopped; fruity, citrusy, spicy, and a little pungent. Moderately sweet taste with a highly bitter finish. Overall, a very good IPA and nothing less than I would expect from AleSmith. It is very tasty, balanced and harmonious, despite the significant hop profile.

For once I ran across a new-to-Texas brewer at a store before having it at Hughies - but I didnt see the ipa so lunching on it now. Lightly hazy amber with a firm beige cap that laces nicely. Bitter fruit aroma and the taste is more of the same along with more grain and spice. Or maybe thats the fried rice.

Renowned West Coast IPA, draught at Gollem in Antwerp. Very thick and densely moussy, fluffy, egg-white head over a hazy, warm orange blonde beer. Lovely dank and completely flawless aroma with hints of pink grapefruit, mandarin, some pine resin, mango, green banana, flowers, biscuit, sweet onion, hemp, lychee. Crisp, clean and refreshing onset, lovely rounded and utterly well-balanced fruitiness (orange, mango, lychee), somewhat sharpish carbo with slightly minerally effect, full soft malt sweet background, long, resinous, aromatically hoppy finish, gently bittering the back of the mouth with grapefruity, spicy and lightly piney retronasal aromas. Righteously a classic, Its Pretty Awesome indeed.

33cl bottle. Semi-hazy pale orange with a medium height white head with good retention, that ultimately gives way to a sticky lacing. Smells like grapefruit, caramel, passion fruit and pine resin. The taste follows the same notes, grapefruit, pine, unripe tropical fruits and green hops, all very well balanced. Medium bodied with a smooth mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
Superb. Perfectly balanced. Lots of juicy, marmalade, sticky fruity goodness. Moderate bitterness. Hint of pine. Awesome beer.
Burnished gold pour, solid finger of white foam. Nose is tangerines and limes. Wonderfully bitter. Middle is orange marmalade, creamy malt, mango. Finish is scouring, long , bitterness. Yum.

250 ml. draft @ Gollem. This one is a real classic of American Brewing. Very dark orange with a big creamy tanned head, nice lacing. Taste is big pine resin, big herbal bitterness & substantial bread malts base, orange & some sugar. Taste is big pine resin goop bitterness with a clear herbal character, leading into big malt presence, dried orange peel, bready malts, sugar, finish features some raw wet barn & mothballs hops, touch odd & bit lesser, low apricot & candy qualities overall. Boyd is lightly milky & thick. Meltier than your average modern day IPA & hop is more herbal and pine bitterness rather than some of the modern day fruit explosions. It is more classical profile (if that term means anything with regard to the USA beer scene were even classics get completely rearranged from time to time que Stone for instance). Nice old(er) school beer, drinks well, not to my exact preference but quite nice.

Bottle. Nose is saturated with huge rind, grapefruit and tangerine, orange and sugar, big resin, oil, touch of cookie dough. Pour is pale orange with a touch of haze, rocky beige head. Taste is strongly bitter but squeaky clean, utterly scrapes the tongue dry, big citrus and resin, pine. Great lingering aftertaste, dry throughout. Exemplary, a fully-realized idea. [2016.06.12: 4.0]
Tap at Craftsman Yokohama. Nice. Lots of fruit, citrus, decent maltiness, bit of nice tropical stinkiness, some resin. Nice stuff!

33cl flaska från Boxbeers. Orangedisig färg, doft av tangerin och apelsin. 
samma tangerin i smaken, blandat med lite grape och apelsin. ganska bittert, lite kakig smak också. rätt fyllig.
Aroma of much citrus and orange. Very fruity. Light head. Normal carbonation. Taste of dried fruits, a bit dry. A very distinct and nice IPA.

Outstandingly clean balanced ipa bursting with flavor. Slides down with grapefruit mango and pine flavors. Mes mouthfeel. Long finish. Lingering warm hop bite. Very good!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

No no, konkretne IPA. Bardzo dobre i jak dla mnie odbiegające niewiele od kanonu tego stylu. Po pierwsze ciekawy zapach glownie wyczuwałem suszone pomaranczowe owoce: morela, jazebina i rokitnik. Wyglad tez niezły, spora i trwala piana oblepiajaca mocno szklo. Metne bardzo, pomarańczowe refleksy glownie. Smak przewazajacy cytrusowy, pomarancze czerwone, grejfruty, rokitnik i brzoskwinia. Nieco ziemistego posmaku na zakończenie. Bardzo treściwe i sycące. Szkoda tylko ze po piwach z tego browaru nie będę miał etykiet. Wiec drobny minus za pomysl butelek lakierowanych.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2017 Bottle from Asahiya, about 7 weeks old. Pours a hazy copper-gold with great frothy head. Tropical and citrus nose, gentle pine, caramel malt. Taste follows suit, pronounced tangerine, pine bitterness, balanced by malt sweetness. Smooth bright feel, doesnt put a step wrong front to back, moderately bitter, chewy middle, drawn out sweetness and bitterness, some citric residue. Along with Sculpin, just a classic faultless interpretation of the style.

Flaska Soernaes. Finfin doft. Luktar kvalitet. Torkad frukt med lite gödseltoner. Smaken krämig frukt. Inslag av lite blommig smak. Den goda beskan smyger sig fram i gommen. En riktig bra balanserad ipa. Den drickes gärna igen.
Full body, slightly oily. Amber coloured with a small white head. Strong malt base, with lots of pine, and orange and apricot sitting behind. Long bitter finish. Powerful stuff.

Golden with big foamy head. Big piney aroma. Grapefruit, resin, long bitterness that covers the palate. Quite strong and heavy. Classic huge Cali style ipa. I like ipas that are a bit fruitier, but this one still tanks quite high.

Bottle from Hops & Crafts Exeter,pours slighly hazy orange with a big thick white head,aroma piney hop,some pinapple & tangerine ,taste is piney hop,alcohol,tangerine & grapefruit with really nice bitterness & some biscuity malt ,smooth & light to medium bodied & almost perfect carbonation,the finish is bitter ,dry & full of piney hop & biscuity malt. Nic!

0.66l bottle. Light amber body, lasting white head. Aroma of bread, caramel and honey packed with loads of hops(pine, grapefruit, grass, resins). Taste of caramel, honey, apricot, citruses and pine. One of the best IPAs I have ever tasted.
Keg. Cbc islington. Good drop despite being almost a fiver for a half. Ticks all the boxes you want - pine, pineapple, percentage.

Laranja de leve turbidez, espuma de otima formação e persistência, cremosa. Aroma misto de mel/caramelo, lúpulo, resina, fruta amarela madura. Paladar de médio dulçor e amargor um pouco mais intenso. Corpo médio e carbonatação leve/média. Final de média persistência, mantém as ótimas impressões iniciais do paladar e aroma. Praticamente sem palavras do que poderia melhorar.
Pours a nice deep amber color. Aromas of hops/hops/citrus. Strong hop flavors with sweet malts and a peppery crisp dry finish.

Bottle, 355ml. A clear amber beer with a small head. Intense floral aroma with citrics, hops, pine resin and alcohol. Taste is bitter with a strong floral finish. Medium bodied, astrigent and with some carbonation. Very well-balanced with a perfect hoppy and malt character.

Bottle, 355ml. Clear golden/amber with a frothy/creamy offwhite head and intricate lacing. Aromas of fruity hops, caramel, pine. alcohol. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Smooth and creamy. Medium sweet with medium to heavy bitterness. Delicious fruity and hoppy character into an astringent bitter finish. The epitome of IPAs.
In bottle, massive piney aroma leads to a bitter taste which sweetens. Lively carbonation leads to a bitter finish.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden copper with a decent soapy white head and nice lacing. Smells a nice bouquet of citrus berry; very impressive. Has a good flavor (not great), a bit more alcohol in the taste than I like, with a much better aftertaste than the initial flavor suggests. Has a good amount of bitterness on the finish but is extremely well balanced. Really enjoyable!

Typical of the west coast IPA from a few years ago, malty, piney and citrusy. The grapefruit, orange and melon aromas dont quite stand up to the bitterness and solid malt backbone. A fine IPA but have had many that I would chose before selecting this one.

Barwa złocisto-pomarańczowa, piwo lekko opalizujące z bujną pianą. Aromat może nie tak intensywny, jak można by się było spodziewać, ale są nuty białych owoców, mandarynek i owoców tropikalnych. W smaku raczej wytrawne, z zaznaczonym wyraźnie cytrusowym rysem. Goryczka nawet wysoka, przyjemna.
Perfectly balanced with good hoppy flavour and taste. You dont feel the high volumen.

Aroma: tropical fruit, some sweetness
Taste, tropical fruit, mandarin bitterness at the end

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,66l bottle from Alko. Pours light amber colour with no haze and medium head. Aromas has tropical fruits like mango and citrus and pine in it. Taste is light to medium body, quite bitter and hoppy. Pretty soft carbonation and long finish. One fine IPA, but quite expensive (price / liter) from the Finnish monopoly.

Amber/orange color with medium white head. Strong and amazing aroma of grapefruits, pine and citrus. Taste is first fruity but then it turns to grapefruit, pine and malty bitterness. Excellent carbonation. This is just so good IPA, smooth and tasty to drink. All aspects in this beer are in perfect balance.

F: big, good retention, off-white.
C: amber, hazy, opaque.
A: malt, caramel, toast, citrus, dusty.
T: malty, grapefruit, earthy bitterness, tangerine, toast, good not disturbing bitterness, creamy, refreshing and worth to try, 0,25l from tap at Jopen in Amsterdam.

Z kranu w Czeskiej Baszcie (!). Niezwykły, bardzo intensywny aromat z wyczuwalną nutą loukoumi. W smaku - synteza wszystkiego co najlepsze w amerykańskich chmielach: żywica, grejpfrut, mango i papaja. Pełne ale nie ciężkie. Pod koniec pokazuje wspaniałą podbudowę słodową (świeży ciemny chleb, herbatniki). Majstersztyk z Zachodniego Wybrzeża.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2017 Niedawno zmierzyłem się z tym piwem. Nie sądziłem, że to jest aż taka legenda, niemniej spróbuje podejść do niego obiektywnie. Pisane z pamięci
ETYKIETA: pełen minimalizm, który lubię. Ocena na plus.
ZAPACH: uderzająco chmielowy. Jak ekstrakt ziołowo-żywiczne. Bardzo charakterystyczny, w żadnym innym piwie nie spotkałem się jeszcze z taką intensywnością. Od razu wzbudziło to moje zainteresowanie. Na plus
PIANA: drobnopęcherzykowa, opada powoli. Na plus.
SMAK: potężne uderzenie chmielu. Pierwszy raz spotkałem się z piwem które było tak skoncentrowane na nutach ziołowo-żywicznyo-trawiastych. Niemal czułem się tak jakbym przyssał się do jakiejś sosny i spijał żywice :D. Wysycenie średnie. Delikatny alkohol, wpasowujący się do całości. Na plus. Delikatna słodycz, smak syropu na kaszel czy nalewki ziołowej. Całość zbalansowana acz niesamowicie intensywna.
OCENA: pozytywna. Jednak rozumiem, że piwo może nie smakować, jeżeli ktoś nie jest gotowy na takie chmielowe uderzenie. Sam nie jestem jakimś wielkim fanem więc nie będę się szykować na kolejną butle. Niemniej przeżycie warte sporej ceny.
piny aromas, with hints of nuts, caramel, and mango. taste medium bitter with sweet notes. average carbonation, full bodied, with a bitter aftertaste

7.25%ABV.  IPA.

Poured out deep gold. 10ºSRM.

Nose has pine, magnolias, and toasted malt sweetness.

Mouthfeel is soapy.  Palate is graham cracker with honey,  There is a bit of a curious almost "fishy" pop which then disappears to slide into malty, hoppy finish land.  Hops are bitter melon, oily, resinous, nice  floral flavor notes of magnolias, freesias, carnations. 

Goes on Favorites List!

Tap at Public House. Dark amber with a thin white cap and medium lacing. Clover honey, apricot, light floral quality, black pepper and resiny. Medium sweetness cut by a spicy, floral bitter finish. Lighter medium body with a watery feel.

0,65 L Bottle. Clear golden with a lasting head. Aroma of pine, citrus and tropical. Taste is citrus, tropical and caramalt. Its bitter and even if the caramalt is there its still on the bitter side (as IPAs should). A very good IPA. Just as I hoped its not overrated.

Medium amber with some suspended particles. Aroma is big fruit cocktail, blood orange and tangerines, mango. Sweet malt backbone, big citrus, pine, grapefruit in mouth not nose. Very refreshing. Long developing finish with drying giving to last bits of carbonation. Wow.

Bottle - 12oz. Beautiful hazy amber body with a thin, off-white frothy head. Awesome, well balanced hoppy aroma with malty, mango, melon, and some subtle butterscotch hints. Its sharp, robust hoppy taste carries malty, woody, citrusy, and grainy notes. Ends with a long, moderately warming, bitter finish. Fantastic IPA.

Clear dark yellow with white head. Nose is citrus, pine, and tropical fruit all combined over a caramel body. Sweet, perhaps overtly so. Bitter with abovementioned tastes. Medium body and slick palate. An excellent IPA.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2017 Saturday, March 19, 2016. Tap at Uiltje bar, Haarlem. Clouded amber with a small white head. Aroma is light citrus hops, not picking up too much, could be my cold... Taste is moderate bitter, light sweet, light fruity hops, malts, bitter hoppy aftertaste. Not bad. 7/3/7/4/15 Tuesday, April 4, 2017. Can at home (canned 10/16/16). Pours hazy amber with a white head. Aroma of grapefruits, pine, floral, grass, light sweet malts. Taste is moderate bitter, light sweet, soft carbonation, resiny bitter aftertaste. Nice.

22 oz bottle from Whole Foods in Western Henrico The IPA poured a clear amber with a white frothy head and lacing. This is one ale I have been looking forward to having. The aroma of floral hops, grapefruit greets you. A very balanced IPA with citrus bitterness filling your mouth at each swallow. The medium body ale has average to fizzy carbonation. Great ale with a nice warm bitterness at the finish on the front of your tongue.

Tap at Craft Heads. Big white grapefruit, citrus and lemon nose with crackery malts and some light tropical notes as it warms. Above average carbonation with a medium body that feels light. Tons of dank weed on the palate with some grassiness as well. Bitter on the palate and bitter finish. Lots of citrus in the finish as well. Very nice.

A really fine West coast IPA. Pours yellow orange, big fluffy white head. Nose is pine, apricot, resiny. Taste is beautifully bitter with some sweet fruity notes. Big flavors but refreshing. Not quite Pliny but damn close.

Bottle. Deep, cloudy orange, finger width white frothy head. Grapefruit and tropical aromas, followed by pine and big caramel bill. Plenty of refreshing grapefruit and pine resin bitterness. Elements of stone and citrus fruits. Huge malt backbone which stops it getting too bitter. A hint of alcohol just hits you at the end. Terrifically smooth, highly drinkable considering its size. A great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Amber honey orange in color. Bitter piney citrus flavor with some tropical notes mixed in. Similar aroma... Pine citrus etc... Overall, a tasty beer considering it was 3 months old. Thanks to BarZigKin for bringing me this gem!

Poured from a bottle. Pale gold color. Somewhat cloudy. Medium head. Lots of lacing. Citrus aroma with a little pine thrown in. Bitter grapefruit taste with an underlying sweetness. Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber. Po przelaniu do szkła piwo prezentuje sie cudownie. Złocista barwa, bardzo delikatnie opalizujące. Piana drobniutka, trwała i zbita. Pozostawia piękne krążki na ściankach szkła i dobrze się utrzymuje. Piękny, niespotykany aromat buchnął już po otwarciu butelki. Cos niesamowitego! Sporo owoców, tropikalnych i cytrusowych takich jak: grejpfrut, mandarynka, mango, ananas a także landrynkowość i sporo żywicy. Do tego jeszcze dochodzą aromaty pochodzące od słodów - ciasteczkowe, miodowe ( ale nie utlenienie ) zachowując perfekcyjny balans. Wysycenie jest średnie w kierunku niskiego co sprawia, że pije się je bardzo gładko. W smaku chmielowość dobrze skontrowana bardzo przyjemnymi akcentami słodowymi, owoce jak w aromacie, biszkopt, delikatne toffi, landrynka. Goryczka grejpfrutowa, solidna i szlachetna. Ideanie zrownowazone. Alkohol ujawnia się jedynie swoim działaniem po wypiciu całej butelki, natomiast w zapachu i smaku ukryty zupełnie. Podsumowując, jest to najlepsze IPA jakie piłem.

Aroma is a blast of citrus and grapefruit and pine and hops. Pours a fairly clear orange/amber, with a thick white head. The taste is upfront perfectly balanced citrus and pine with a nice bite. Beautiful balance. Delicious and refreshing. First class all time IPA.
Sampled @ Pgh Beerfest. Nice citrus and pine aroma. Pretty good citrus flavors. Not too harsh but a little on the bitter side.

Aroma: Classic west coast ipa aroma, very hoppy with tropical fruits and pine, also malty on background. 
Appearance: Clean orange to amber, white 2-finger head. 
Taste: Medium sweet, medium bitter, tropical fruits juice, malt. 
Palate: Medium body, juicy texture, average carbonation, bitter finish with solid malt backbone which keeps everything in great balance. 
Overall: Masterly balanced as every alesmith beer I have proved so far, delicious, world class west coast ipa.
Keg at Doghouse. Pours golden yellow with a slight white head. Aroma is caramel, mango and pine. Taste is caramel, mango sweet, slightly earthy, medium bitter, slightly grassy.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a hazy amber with off-white head. Excellent lacing. Aroma is grapefruit, citrus, pine, and malt. Taste is citrus, grapefruit, caramel, malt, and pine. Has a nice piney, bitter finish, but has enough of a malt backbone to keep everything in balance. Medium-bodied. Very tasty. Nice to finally see AleSmith in Texas.

Aroma: fruity and piney; nicely balanced; Appearance: golden straw with fluffy head that dissipates slowly; some lacing; Taste: grapefruit with piney hops; malty undertones; also nicely balanced and crisp; Palate: medium body with long, bitter finish; Overall: delicious IPA; truly refreshing; would definitely buy again.
Aroma is on the citrusy side. Taste has that light citrus balanced with medium bitterness. Overall nicely balanced IPA.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours gold with a white head. Taste pine, citrus, lightly sweet. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a slightly hazy orange golden color with white head. Citrus, grapefruit, other tropical fruits, with some pine on the nose; follows onto the palate. Very juicy. Medium bodied. Finishes with tropical fruit and pine.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2016 Rerate: bottle at home. Nose and taste is more intense than I remembered, no yeast, just straight up hops all over the nose and mouth. On tap at hopaholic. Hazy yellow colour, with a small white head. Nose is sweet, somewhat citrussy and yeasty. Taste is low bitterness with some tropical fruits and zest. Very nice ipa.

Poured from 12 oz. bottle. 

Cloudy, golden orange with a 1-finger khaki head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of orange, pine, grapefruit and tropical fruit. 

Taste of pine, bitter tropical fruit, citrus, peach and pineapple. 

Medium/full body and medium/high carbonization. 

Quite bitter with little balancing sweetness. Yet, it is still a great flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pretty good West Coast IPA. Im a Lagunitas fan and for me, this is certainly a similar brew to Sucks, but falls short in the balance. Bottle poured into a Lagunitas jar. Good aroma of floral citrus, nice enough golden orange color, some head. Not very malty and lingeringly bitter. I would happily drink this if my first choices were not available.

Keg @ Republic. Amber with a small head. Orange juice and a bit of pine. Some general onion and resinous pine. Flavor is sweet with a fairly bitter finish. Mango and grapefruit. White onion. Resin. Fairly chewy. Medium body, soft carb.

Draught. Pours orange in colour, slightly hazy with frotty head. Aroma of grapefruit, pine and lemons, really nice. In taste the beer is super citrusy, light malty base. Finish is bitter. Really good ipa.
Large Format - Cloudy golden color with a nice white head of tiny bubbles. Hoppy citrus flavor on the nose. Very dry on the palate. Flavorful and balanced IPA. Citrus flavors.

IPA   
苦味がつよい&
This is my go to IPA. Very well balanced with respect to most IPAs on the market. Refreshing.
Bue en bouteille. Blonde orangé, mousse blanche. Nez houblon et malt. Palais bien fruité, équilibré. Finale assez longue, bien amère. Beau produit, équilibre quasi-parfait.
12oz bottle. Pours Golden orange with thick off white head. Aroma of citrus grapefruit and pine. Taste is sweet piney citrus up front with a piney citrus finish. Very well balanced and excellent.

Golden yellow color with a thin white head. Aroma of grapefruit, limonene, Christmas tree, and sweet biscuit. Flavors were loaded with juicy citrus, pine, and sweet graham cracker maltiness. Nice soft silky mouthfeel with good carbonation. Clean astringent piney finish. About as good as they get.

Kolor: Nie mogło by być - ciemnozłoty, królewski kolor. 100% klarowności.
Piana: Bogata, biała, drobno- i średnioziarnista czapa.
Arcyprzyjemnie dziurawi się pozostawiając ogromną ilość puchu na ściankach.
Każdy wypity łyk odbija się kolejnym krążkiem piwnym. Gruba otoczka do ostaniej kropelki pozostaje na powierzchni.
Nie ma się do czego tutaj przyczepić. 
Zapach: Ponieważ kolekcjonuje kapselki piwa otwieram zazwyczaj bardzo delikatnie, aby nie uszkodzić kapsla.
Bardzo rzadko zdarza się taka sytuacja gdy już przy pierwszym podważeniu nożem uwalnia sie silny aromat z piwa, który wypełnia całe pomieszczenie.
Tak było tutaj.
Początek to gwałtowna eksplozja żywicznych, leśnych, sosnowych nut.
W tym piwie jest tego co niemiara.
Wkrótce już do nich dołączaja owoce cytrusowe - sporo grejpfruta, ananasa, mandarynek.
Po pewnym czasie aromat robi się bardziej słodki, delikatnie uwydatniony karmelem, a potem owocami tropikalnymi. 
Smak: Czysty, wytrawny, bezkompromisowy smak.
West Coast IPA w pełnym tego słowa znaczeniu.
To co pokazuje AleSmith IPA to całe bogactwo lasów tropikalnych z ich żywicznymi, sosnowymi nutami.
Skórka od białych, świeżych grejpfrutów, mandarynki, ananasy, pomelo i odrobina gorzkich pomarańczy.
Nie ma tutaj ni kszty słodyczy.
Karmel, cukier czy inne sugestie nie istnieją.
Słodowa baza z minimalnym chlebowym posmakiem szybko zostaje zmieciona z powierzchni przez amerykańskie chmiele.
Goryczka jest średniej siły. Jest krótka, grejpfrutowa i znika jeszcze przed kolejnym łykiem.
Określenia takie jak: sesyjny, pijalny, rześki, lekki, delikatny, czysty idealnie odnoszą się do tego piwa.
Arcydzieło! 
Wysycenie: Niskie. 
Podsumowanie:

Trudno określić czy jest to najlepsze IPA jakie w życiu piłem.
Bez najmniejszej wątpliwości znajdzie się w Top 3.
Królewski trunek stawiający tak wysoko poprzeczkę dla innych browarów, że ciężko nawet się do niego równać.
Miarą jakości tego piwa jest KILKA TYSIĘCY najwyższych ocen na portalu RateBeer.
I niech nikt tego nie neguje.
Ludzie z całego świata zdecydowali, że to właśnie to piwo zostało wybrane Numerem 1 na świecie w szerokiej kategorii India Pale Ale.
Oczywiście w pełni zgadzam się z tą oceną.
Piwo oferuje czysty chmielowy, wytrawny profil.
Złożone nuty cytrusowo-żywiczne, nienaganna piana, lekkość, orzeźwiający profil i przyjemna goryczka - wszystko to tworzy perfekcyjny obrazek.
Ciszę się, że miałem okazję dostarczyć swoim kubkom smakowym takich emocji.

Piwo otrzymałem od swojej przyjaciółki.
Przywiezione zostało z Nowego Jorku i pochodzi ze świeżej warki, tym bardziej głębokie są doznania.

Pours a bright, slightly hazy golden with a medium, lingering white head. The aroma contains floral hops, grapefruit, orange, pine, and a little bit of resin. The taste is dry and very bitter, with just a hing of sweetness. Its big on pine and grapefruit. Pineapple, orange, and peach can be found in here as well. At the end is a short and sharp pine aftertaste. Medium bodied, sticky in texture, and a heavy amount of carbonation. This one is simply wonderful. An IPA done right.

Clear yellow orange pour with a dense lasting off white head. Aroma is orange, tropical, and pine. Taste is grapefruit, tropical fruits, pine, and caramel in layers. Clean bitterness. Medium body. Great balance.

I drank this beer yesterday in Lausanne. It is the idea of which kind of I.P.A we could have. There is an interesting balance between malt and hop and one side sparkling with grapefruit side. Refreshing beer during the summer with a face orange-troubled, regular foam and carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 keg w jabeer. na szybko: bardzo fajnie wywazone (zadne tam west coast), mocno owocowe, nieco zywiczne, troche slodowe, kapke landrynkowe, bardziej wytrawne niz slodkie, dosc intensywne. srednia goryczka. srednie wysycenie. ciut lepkie w ustach. troszke w strone IIPA. w sumie same zalety. ale zarazem po prostu bardzo dobre, mialem nadzieje, ze ipa majaca 100, 100 na RB dostarczy lepsiejszych wrazen...Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Aroma - big resiny and pined hops. There is a bit of citrus (grapefruit) and caramel as well.
Appearance - cloudy citrine colored body. White head is 2" and white and rocky settles very slowly. Foamy lacing.
Taste - abundant West Coast hops balanced on caramel malts. The hops range from resinous, floral, to citrus. Very well balanced.
Palate - the body is medium, the texture slightly oily, the carbonation is average, and the finish is bittered and hoppy.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2016 Works class IPA. From aroma to taste about as good as it gets. Classic west coast bitter, citrusy goodness. Got a single from total wine and next time need to get a sixer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a nice hazy Amber yellow. Tart and sweet up front, with juicy hop oil and then a big transition to bitter grapefruit. Tastes like a DIPA bit a bit pulled back on the booze.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is citrus, grapefruit rinds, mild pine. Taste is the same but not too overpowering on any front. Very balanced and refreshing. A perfect dinner IPA. Surprised these guys havent been bought up by one of the big dogs looking to lock-in a mainstream IPA...this would be an ideal candidate.

Aroma: citrus, tropical fruits, light candy, spruce
Taste: heavy bitter, light sweet, fruity, candy, citrus
Great one

Aromat: przyjemne i intensywne cytrusy i owoce tropikalne, delikatna żywica.
Wygląd: barwa bursztynowa, piana średnio obfita.
Smak: sporo słodyczy, na pierwszy planie cytrusy i owoce tropikalne, w tle żywica, spora goryczka.
Tekstura: sporo ciała, umiarkowanie nasycenie.
Ogólne wrażenie: bardzo dobre piwo, mocno aromatyczne, ze sporą goryczą. Pomimo sporego ekstraktu i wyższej, niż w typowych IPA ilości alkoholu, to piwo jest wysoko pijalne.

Rating #1541 - 20.03.2015 - #150 IPA Review - Birthday Brew Tour - On tap at Alesmith. Pours a rich golden, small white head, minimal lacing. Aroma is grapefruity, pine, pastry dough. On the palate, similar citrus and pine zest, mild resin, mild pastry dough malt. Medium bodied and extraordinarily balanced. Lots of toasted malt complexity and a great balance of grapefruity, pine hop notes. Superb.

12 ounce bottle - $2.75 at Tasty Beverage Company in Asheville, North Carolina.

Appearance: Coppery body in a hue, mostly clear with a full-sized flush of plush, off-white foam crowning the brew. Lovely lacing on the descent.

Smell: Citrusy - fruity, zestful and juicy with a backing of pine needless atop some slender pale maltiness and light touch of orange blossom honey.

Taste: Pale malts with a little honeyed sweetness. Fresh, chin-running citrus juices and a playful fruitiness is cut by a vein of resinous pine. Moderate bitterness. A little touch of honey dew and mint. Near dry and lightly bitter on the finish. 

Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. Medium carbonation. A beer that moves with ease, really.

Overall: With hundreds of reviews already on the record for this beer, it probably isnt going to change anyones mind, but I really liked it.

Pours a translucent orange into the glass with a huge foam head that retains well, leaving thick, chunky moss lacing. The nose is of citrus and pine. Flavors are superbly integrated, of grapefruit and tangerine citrus, light cracker and spruce-pine needles throughout, finishing with a nice peppering pine resin bitter that revisits the grapefruit citrus, lingering appropriately. The medium body and semi-active carbonation makes for a lively mouthfeel and easy pull on the palate. Everything about this classic IPA makes for a top-tier offering, combining appropriate grapefruit and pine notes to a tee. It is extremely complex, substantial and smooth. One of the absolute best IPAs out there. Legendary in name, it lives up to its reputation. Kudos!
Thin head. Citrus.....grapefruit. tangerine. Dark hazy copper. Tasted at Carters NYE party.

Medium/strong aroma of slightly overaged fruits and tangy resin. Darker golden color with small/medium white head and semi-hazy liquid. Strong taste with dominating resin, slightly overaged fruits and lots of hops. Some malts in the background. Averagely balanced with wide taste spectrum and long malty aftertaste with fruits and resin. Medium/light body with medium carbonation. Overall, unique, very resinous taste with sweeter American IPA elements. Too much resin and dryness, but very nice to have malts in the taste.
Small off-white head. Cloudy rusty orange body. Aroma is tangerine, pine, toffee and orange zest. Mostly bitter on the tongue. Dry on the palate.
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is pretty malty, orange, pine, dank hops, resin. Taste is alike. Sticky, malty, orange peel, orange, citrussy, pine.

12oz single purchased from Lifesource natural grocer in Salem OR.
$1.79
 Its a gusher..as i poured it int the shaker..eventually settles down and it is a 
hazy orange coloured ale with a large frothy head
Aromas of orange marmalade and caramel..smell of pine in the back.
Taste is rather different and I get more bitter pine and orange peel hops..but balanced by a substantial caramel goodness in the malts.
Nice overall palate..smooth yet not boring.
A very nice example of an American classic IPA

DWF; Bottle, from Vinmonopolet. Pours large, hazy gold with a frothy creamy and lacing white head. Nose is moderate to heavy, pine, tropic, moderate citrus, light floral and spice. Taste is moderate sweet and bitter, balancing with a lasting sweet citric, light spice and soap finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat to soft.

Aroma: floral hops with caramel. 
Flavour: floral bitterness with some sweetness and a dry finish. 
Colour: cloudy orange amber with a white head.
On tap at Haymarket. Poured deep hazy orange with white head. Aroma sugary juicy citrus. Light carb med bod. Taste candy sugar light orange

Bottle: pours cloudy amber with khaki colored head; tropical fruit aroma with some pine and floral notes and a hint of caramel; taste tropical fruits with some caramel and pine and is mostly bitter with a touch of sweetness; finish is bitter and dry; very well balanced; one of the best IPAs I have had yet
Various occasions, draft and bottle. Dont know why I have never punched in a rate on this beauty. THE west coast ipa, piney, resiny, dry. Always really awesome
Keg at Craven Arms, Birmingham. Extremely good. Sticky, sappy, massive juicy, fruity, tangy hops. Addictive.

Pours golden orange and clear with a thick and creamy head. Rich and floral aroma of citrus (mostly orange), peaches and hops. Medium body, slick feel, average carbonation. Taste has lots of pine resin, lemon zest and grapefruit. Long and deliciously bitter finish with notes of tropical fruit lingering in the background. One of the best IPAs Ive had!

Hazy amber color, tan head. Citrus nose, grapefruit, tropical fruit, caramel malt, hint of grass. Grapefruit taste, resin, caramel, moderate bitterness, well balanced. Medium body, soft carbonation. Personal stats: Rating #800.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2016 Finally come to western PA. 6 Pack at Whole foods, nice frothy head that holds over a very slight cloudy golden beer. Plenty of hops and a quite bitter finish.
On tap at whole foods wexford. Carbonation a little high

22 oz bottle shared by ebone1988. The pour is a nice orangey gold with a nice white head and some great soapy lace. The aroma is pretty good. Lots of tropical fruits and a great juicy hop presence. There is a bit of malt that adds a little complexity, but for the most part, it's bright, hoppy, and a little fruity. Pretty good. The flavor is bitter up front. Nice and resin-y. There is a good wet hop and strong dank fruit to go along with it. The malts are a lot more reserved here. It's bright, bitter, and delicious. I'm a fan of this beer. The mouth feel is well carbonated and nicely thick. It carries a smooth creaminess that is a touch out of place. It's delicious, for sure. Well done, AleSmith!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with koleminer20. Aroma is great citrus, tropical fruits, a bit of grapefruit and orange, pine, very good. Appearance is golden amber, off white head. Taste is very piny, a bit of citrus, orange peel, grapefruit, a resounding bitterness. Mouthfeel is crisp carbonation and medium body. Overall, an enjoyable offering but I expected it to be better.

Ale smith ipa
Look; off white head, somewhat hazy golden body. 
Aroma; solid bouquet, resiny malts, peachy solid hops, floral strong spices - very inviting. 
Taste; soft resiny malts, leafy hops, spices, leaves, wood. 
Finish; hops, spices, roasted malts. 
Palate; semi dry, good. 
Overall; a nice n friendly IPA, gently and fully.
