Tap @ Sörmanufaktúra/Sörspecialista. Resinous and pine hoppy aroma, bit cloudy, Medium Amber colour, Small long-life creamy off-white head, Medium body, soft carbonation, Sweet malty and vibrant hoppy Bitter taste, hoppy Bitter palate with pine, grapefruit Orange peel notes. Well-balanced and Smooth. Nice one!

This was poured into a becher pint glass. Bottled on 10/19/2015.
The appearance was a hazy semi-burnt orange color with a decent transparency about it. Carbonation can be seen rising at a moderate pace. A one finger white foamy head started and dissipated at a nice pace. Messy clingy and semi-foamy lacing runs around the glass nicely.
The smell starts off with sharp resinous pine rolling into some bitter citrus rind and then a light malt backbone.
The taste wraps up the previously mentioned flavors in a nice bittersweet fashion. Lingering sweet citrus aftertaste collides into the finish nicely, somewhat dry.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a fairly decent sessionability about it. Carbonation comes across fairly nice. Hop bitterness shows enough harshness on my tongue.
Overall, I say this was a pretty good AIPA that I wish I wouldve bought the rest of the sixer. Well done!

Mel starts off with a yeasty Brady smell finishing up with a hoppy delicious tropical fruit of papaya pineapple mango and other tropical fruits maybe even some Kiwi in there. Tasted delicious flood your mouth with water at first followed up by a nice papi resinous finish. When youre on your tongue for just a tad bit longer than would like. Flavors tremendous with all the tropical fruit flavor hops with a nice crisp finish. Has a nice orange e golden light tint to the beer which is delicious. First few I tried from you guys would like to try more.

Golden appearance with lots of foamy head. Complex tastes of citrus, tangerine, grapefruit and spruce. Medium-heavy body, good carbonation and a lasting lasting finish of bitter tangerine. Its pretty awesome

New 12oz bottles at 14.99 a 6 pack. Pours golden/Amber with tight 1/2 inch head that laces nicely. Aroma of pine and dank hops with a malty bread aroma. Flavor is bursting with pine and resin. Soapy, sticky texture, but crisp, bitter and dry. Damn good regular ipa. Stone ruination, classic style west coast shit. Yum!
Draught @ Draught 55. Slightly cloudy dark orange with small foamy off-white head, piney hops aroma, medium carbonation, smooth body, medium bitter finish. Smooth and balanced IPA.

Bottle:
Cloudy, light brown with a small white head.
Slightly bready, leafy aroma.
Resiny, piney....tropical flavours...caramel malt.
Some tea....leafy, resiny bitter...
Very good.
Hazy orange with white head. Mango, resin, green, caramel and floral. Sweet, dry and fruity finish. Overall: hoppy!

Aaahhh! Nothing like a fresh IPA! The bottle in front of me, that I bought from the supernaturally efficient Norwegian wine monopoly a couple of weeks ago, was bottled 24. April 2014. 24th of April last year! Thats more than 1.5 years ago! I realise that its a long way from San Diego to Oslo, but this is ridiculous! So, not surprisingly, the aroma is not as hoppy as Id hoped for. However, the aroma is actually quite inviting, and I get intriguing DIPA-like notes of overripe tropical fruits and sweet caramel. Pretty strong flavour of overripe grapefruit, ditto tropical fruits, especially peach, some pine and lots of caramel. The taste is light to moderate sweet and the long-lasting finish is moderate+ bitter. Mid-bodied, dry and with a moderate carbonation. I actually enjoyed this one very much, despite its old age. Tastes like a moderately hopped DIPA.
[65.5 cl bottle, enjoyed 1 year 7 months after bottling, from Vinmonopolet Online]

Tap @ Toronado. Medium head with light lacing. Body light amber and extremely clear. Aroma of light citrus, honey, and hops. Flavor is perfect. Light sweet maltiness with great citrus hop flavor. Medium carbonation. Great beer!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From the tap poured a clear brew with a nice white head. Malty aroma with hint of chocolate.

Tap @ Mekong. Dark golden with ample head and lacing. I get a perfumy nose plus some light pine. Flavor is a little tropical and antiseptic then bitter. The deScription sounded wonderful, but Im not getting all of that.
Flaska från Tychojames. Dimmigt gul med vitt skum. Fruktig och lite kryddig doft med ananas. Fruktig smak med cintennialkryddighet och balanserad beska.

Aroma has tons of resinous grapefruit, pine and citrus. Flavor is really well balanced with still tons of grapefruit, citrus and pine. Bitterness and sweetness is amazingly well balanced in this IPA. A true benchmark.

Bottle. Sensoric. Golden, little hazy with huge, white, semi-densed head. Perfect head retention and lacing. Medium citrus hops aroma - grapefruit, orange with some light to medium fruity and floral accents. Some light caramel notes in the background. Taste is medium to high bitter broken by some light malty sweetness. Pretty well balanced. Medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation, finish is semi-bitter and quite long. In overall pure, balanced and well made IPA. Beer mainly dominated by citrus hop, definetely worth a try.
Great beer. Aroma of strawberries and nuts. Taste has a great balance of sweet and bitter, and very long length.

Vinmonopolet, Norway. Pours copper yellow. Nose is citrusy, fruity. Light to medium body. Taste is all about the hops (as expected). Big citrus IPA (pine and grape). Bitterness is quite strong, but balances the beer perfectly.

Flaska från whole foods bowery, NYC.Dimmig orange vätska med smutsvitt fluffigt skum. Kryddigt doft med massor av färsk humle. Citrus, barr och lite russin. Tjock och fin humlesmak på rejäl maltbädd. Hö, torkad frukt och lite mandel. Fyllig munkänsla med hög beska. Ändå rätt krämig.

Bottle @ home. Pours golden with a slightly off-white big head, hazy.Grapefruit and lemon on the nose also floral notes and big pine. Dry finish, slight caramel, big fruits bitter fruits, big bitter finish, hides the alcohol well. Good beer, i might have been expecting too much.

Bottle. Earthy orange malt and pine/grapefruit peel aroma. Hazy golden yellow with large white head. Sweet earthy orange malt and moderately bitter grapefruit peel/pine flavor. Nice body. Dont know how fresh this was - probably not very, but still very good.

Aroma: citrus, pine, 
Appearance: clear gold, off-white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Fantastic
UPDATED: DEC 12, 2015 Bottled. Cloudy golden brown. Has a really light taste. Has a bold hop taste. Has a piney taste with a fruity orangy after taste.

bottle @ Jungle Jims / Eastgate OH --- Clear medium orange amber color, heavy white head, broken sheets of lace. Aroma of citrus hops. Taste is semi-sweet toffee malt that grows into a medium carbonated swallow, only yielding to strong citrus hops deep in the finish. Solid, but not heavy, full-bodied, but not filling, well-balanced, and well-conceived. An exceptional IPA.

Oh this is a tasty brew from the lands of San Diego. Subtle hop aroma, medium white head with a crystal clear deep orange hue. The taste is very unique with a hop assault up front and mild bitterness as she walks out of the door.

Bottle (from beergium). Pours amber with light beige head. The head stays. Aroma is sweet, fruits, peach, citrus, mandarins. Flavor is sweet and bitter, citrus, pine, caramel. Finish is pine bitter. Alcohol is well covered. Overall: great brew.

Hazy orange beer, big off-white head. Very smooth and fruity nose, lots of tangerines and grapefruity sweetness, mild bitterness, caramel and toasty malt notes. Flavor is smooth hops, tangerines, caramel sweetness. Finishes with flowery notes, hoppy and grapefruity bitterness. Lingering mild caramel and grapefruity bitterness. Very drinkable and balanced, great stuff.

De couleur orange et un peu troublé avec assez everfesssance. On une bière typique du style avec des notes floral avec un côté conifère. C est avec beaucoup d attende avec son classement et et c a veut cette place . Bravo alesmith. Acheté à nyc lors d un voyage

Pours a brilliant orange color with a medium sized puffy white head. Notes of caramel, orange citrus, grapefruit, and glazed carrots. Medium weight mouthfeel and long finish. Great balance and not overly hopped.

Bottle at home. 
Poured clear orange gold with decent white head. 
Nose is orange, citrus, floral, hops, tangy. 
Taste is citric, orange peel, lemon, lime, floral, hoppy bitterness. 
One of the better IPAs but then you know that!
4 oz pour on draft at Spacebar. Clear golden orange with off-white head. Aromas of malt, floral notes. Tastes of stone fruit, citrus, floral notes, malt, light booze. Medium body with a dry finish.

1 pint 6 fl oz bottle at home. Hazy amber appearance with an ample white head and decent lace. My bottle was not the freshest (bottled 19/3/15) but this is still an outstanding US West Coast IPA deserving of its iconic status. Heaps of hops on the nose (pine resin, oranges, grapefruits, limes, lychees) on top of a robust caramel malt bill. Lovely smooth mouthfeel and softish carbonation with balanced flavours and a substantial resinous dry hop bitterness. The ABV is hardly noticeable.

Bomber shared that poured a light yellow to medium orange color with off white head great lacing on the glass. The aroma is mind malt base and s nice citrus blend and some pine hops. The flavor is all that and more. More hops than malt. Enough malt to know its there but the citrus and pine hop flavors are dominant and delicious. Why I waited to try this is beyond me.

A hazy, yellow-orange pour with a white head. The aroma has a big dose of citrus with prominent grapefruit. It has a medium body with oily texture and average carbonation. The taste is bittersweet with a lingering finish.

Bière dun majestueuse beauté :orange, trouble, mousseuse dune mousse opaque, dense et riche collant indéfiniment au verre. Cette mouse est certainement une des plus riches qui ma été donné de voir! Une grande quantité de fleurs et de conifères me monte au nez. Des arômes mielleux, riches, floraux, collants... Ça sannonce puissant et complexe. En bouche, le liquide est collant, sucré et un peu lourd. Le mouthfeel est très rond. Collante au fond de la gorge, la bière est très très longue en bouche. Amertume légère, du houblon floral en cône, des fruits mais surtout de la résine. Délicieuse mais un peu difficile à boire.
Fine smell of grain... Hazy blond color. Alcohol taste, not so hoppy (deception). Good beer but not much more...

Perfect IPA mango orange and passion fruit hop aroma. Clear orange pour and perfect carbonation that brought out fantastic hop aroma. Light ready malts the hops swirled around endlessly. The bitterness is not harsh but there, very well balanced with hop flavor and bitter finish.

Big bottle purchased in Portland and consumed in Minneapolis. Primarily orange with hints of golden interlaced within the IPA. The frothy white head sticks around at the half finger level the entire time. Heavy citrus notes in the aroma...probably grapefruit. Taste is just ridiculously smooth and well balanced. Healthy malt backbone which is part of what differentiates this IPA from other offerings. Citrus is a big star in this one but its offset by a nice tropical fruit sweetness. So, so happy this brewery is distributing to Minneapolis now. This is basically a perfect IPA.

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co., and shaker served showing a clear, orangey gold color, with a frothy & fairly persistent layer of off white head foam, and wavy, spiraling cling to the lacing. The aroma was a presentable nose that offered a blend of grapefruit & tangerine, with a touch of tropical scent. Medium bodied, backed up by good carbonation, the taste added a touch of malt sweetness, and citrusy bitterness combined with a resinous nature that prompted the lingering side of the astringency. An altogether decent IPA.

Poured from the bomber ($5.99) a steal at that price. Looks a orange amber with a nice 2 finger collar. Im getting dry grapefruit, floral hops, just a touch of sweet, a little bit of dry at the end, some gritty, a little bit of everything I like. Guess thats what they call well balanced. After reading reviews on Ale-smith beers I am seriously considering taking a vacation to San Diego to visit their brewery.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2015 Botella, @XXXII The Great Power of Beer & Wine, Sevilla. 25/09/2015
Color amarillo, aroma frutal, sabor frutal dulce 
Botella . @Cimmeria, Oviedo  11/11/2015

Aromat: przyjemne połączenie amerykańskiego chmielu (pomarańcze mandarynki, owoce tropikalne) z charakterystycznym ciasteczkowym słodem i odrobiną karmelu.


Wygląd: barwa złota, klarowna. Piana w kolorze ecru, drobno pęcherzykowa, dość obfita i trwałą. Ładnie oblepia szkło.


Smak: wyraźna nuta słodowa (ciastkowo- karmelowa), słodka i szybko skontrowana owocowym chmielem (ananas, grejpfrut, pomarańcze). Goryczka powyżej średniej, jedynie lekko drażniąca, przyjemna. Krągła pełnia, umiarkowane wysycenie i goryczkowy, lekko kwaskowy i alkoholowy finisz.


Świetna IPA, warta swojej renomy. Jednocześnie jedna z niewielu, które zachowują swoją świeżość po przewiezieniu do Polski. Warto.

Enjoyed this the more I drank it. Aroma was a nice pine citrus. The lingering bitterness struck me at first, like piney tire treads in my mouth; but, this was not a bad thing as it turned out, as these laid the tracks for a great blend of dry and juicy citrus flavors.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
22FL OZ ($5.99) wow! this was a great beer with tons of character. In a world of overpopulated IPA out there this stands a decent cut above. check it out for yourself. 100 points well deserved

Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. Its kinda hard to believe that this is "just" an IPA and not something stronger. Very fruity, some pine, and full of aroma. A sweetness just on the right spot to make it well-drinkable, and a nice bitter palate to round it all off in a smooth done. Well done, Alesmith, well done!
Not bad for an Indian pale ale. The hop is good.  The taste is a tad overbearing.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

22oz bottle. Pours golden orange with a frothy white head. Aroma is of pine, hops, citrus, caramel, and biscuity malt. Taste is of piney hops, citrus, bubblegum, and caramel. Has a dry, biscuity malt backbone. Lingering taste of pine and bubblegum. Has a well masked booziness, that really warms. Goddamn, is this one tasty. Bitter, but still juicy. I like it a lot.

Bottle. Not sure how its possible that I still havent rated this beer, but thnx to my SecretSummerSanta I now finally did. It pours a hazy golden beer with a nice amount of white, consistent head on top. Clings on to the glass and stays on for a long time. Aroma has hay, grass, light citric, white fruits, piney resin influences. Very nice and hoppy aroma.. great. Flavor is just amazing, with loads of complex hoppy flavors. Bitter grapefruit, sweet tangerine, piney and grassy. Longlasting, bitter finish, great level of carbonation and an overall amazing beer! Very happy to have finally tried this beauty!
A: Medium light, twofinger head. N: Hay, tobacco, Floral, passion fruit, hint of smoke. T: Hay, mango, pine O: AleSmith does it again, great classic IPA.
Opaque light amber, medium white head. Wonderful citrus and pine aroma. Medium body, balanced bitter with strong citrus notes, finishing bitter and a bit malty. Wonderful.
Pours in a cloudy amber golden and a white head! Aroma of citrus, fruity hop, grapefruit, tangerine and pine. Tadte; sweet fruity hops, citrus with a very nice fresh bitter aftertaste.

750ml bottle - pours gold with off white head . Herbal piney aroma . Taste is mild citrus , bitter pine . Nice IPA . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Light amber with medium off-white head. Nice, bit sweet hoppy aroma. Nice bitterness with fruity notes, lasting bitter aftertaste.

Bronzed body with a fluffy, off-white head. Pineappley burst in the aroma and flavor. After some aeration, pine makes its way onto the palate as well. Well-balanced bitterness. Medium-bodied. Overall--just solid--was expecting more from this one after all the hype. May have to try again.

Bomber pours a hazy golden/orange with a lasting dense white head that leaves good lacing. Aroma is full of grapefruit, tangerine, and pine. Taste is bitter but this is not an all-out hop bomb. Plenty of malty sweetness in the middle provides good balance before a short bitter, slightly dank finish. Body is medium with slight carbonation and a surprisingly crisp mouthfeel. This is one of the most memorable IPAs Ive tried and one Ill definitely seek out again, now that Alesmith is available in the Midwest.

Big bottle in Amsterdam. One of the great ones. Nice amber body with huge head. Nose of hops, floral, grassy, pine. Taste of fruits, sweet, hops. Really nice extended release of hops and pine and grapefruit. Very nice finish.

Ive had some awful ipas/beers and this is polar opposite to them. This is a West Coast ipa to the fullest extent of the law. Absolute grapefruit, pine and citrus bomb on the aroma. Really resinous and dank. Tropical fruits shine through as it warms up as well. Taste is super dry, bitter and full of citrus and more pine and tropical fruit. Really juicy and fresh ipa. I finally found this in Virginia and I dont know if I just got lucky or Alesmith is sending beers out east, but this was an absolute perfect ipa and Im so pumped I finally go to try it. Will definitely seek this out again. Cheers!

Pours straw with some haziness. White, dense head, some lacing. Nose of fresh cascade hops, dried fruits, and grape. Nice, mellow grapefruit, dried hops on the aroma. Some sweet malts. Somewhat weak finish, but a good IPA.

Bomber->tulip. Orange-gold with huge offwhite head. A: loads of citrus and floral hops, caramel malt. Fresh and juicy. T: bittersweet pine, citrus, and floral hops, resin, grapefruit. Somewhat crisp, with great lingering bitterness. Top notch.
Aromas of tangerine, juicy lemon, grapefruit. Clear yellow-orange with a fully lasting white head. Dry, hop-forward, very aromatic, nicely balanced, zesty. Light-medium bodied.

Aromas of fresh hops and sweet caramel malt some minor dry citrus. Bright white foamy head and golden body. Light piney citrus flavors and and a sweet fresh hop flavor that ends with a nice bitterness. Smooth and crisp on the palate.
Very very interesting and enjoyable ipa. Citrus, grape fruits, tea leafs, exotic fruit, pineapple, peach.
Nice citrus aroma from a bomber. Golden hue with solid head. Drinks easy and finishes with nice solid hoppy burst. Like it!
Way solid ipa...great hop and malt balance....so glad they r in Minnesota now...great finish....

Pours a really nice golden amber with fluffy white head. Hop aromas are really fresh, grassy, some grapefruit peel, lime, good and piney as well. Has a ridiculously smooth mouthfeel, and a very fruity, sweet, but not clingy flavors, that really slowly evolves into a solid hoppy, lingering finish. 90 minute was my favorite IPA, but this one just might take the crown.

Bottle kindly donated by Santa SlackerMads. Shared with my wife and sister-in-law. orange golden color with huge white head. Grapefruit, zest, resin, caramel in aroma. Nice citrus hoppy taste with pines, resin, grapefruits, caramel. Solid malty backbone. Warming alcohol. Long hoppy bitter finish. Very tasty.

Strong aroma of tropical fruits, grapefruit, tangerine, and pineapple. Clear amber, thick sticky yellow head. Flavor is mainly floral with lillies in the forefront, grapefruit and honey are also present. Grapefruit finish. Medium body, soft carbonation, smooth. Extremely well rounded.

22 bomber to cervoise. Pours clear gold, frothy white ring head. Aroma of grapefruit juice, orange blossom, pine needles and caramel malts. Taste is exactly how it smells. Very well balanced bittersweet with malts and hops. Mouthfeel is thick oily, good carb. Finish is pine, OJ and grapefruit bitter with some pale malt backbone. So good for a single IPA.

Pours clear amber, almost golden. Nice foam, beautiful lacings. Aroma is fresh, bit of fruits, bit of really fragrant and fresh resins. Perfectly balanced. Tastes clean, not overly sweet although fruitiness is there, resins strong but not overpowering. Just perfect. Lingering resins, pine needles, pleasant bitterness. Just right, IPA I would drink and drink and drink.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange with a lasting foamy white head. Aroma of orange, mango, passion fruit, some pineapple. Taste is of more exotic fruits and orange, pine also. Sticky oily mouthfeel. Great ipa.

Bottle. Light orange color with small white head. Aroma has citrus, caramel, grapefruits. Taste is malty with bitter long aftertaste. Flavors of malt, citrus, grapefruit. Old bottle so I this one has lost some of its elements.

Bottle. Orange-amber with a medium, dense, foamy tan head. Aroma is big floral hops, juicy citrus, pine resins and hop oils atop a sweet malt backbone. Taste is pine and floral hops with citrus fruit, caramel, sweet malt and hop oils right behind it. Body is medium with a strong, dense carbonation. Slightly oily with a mild, lingering hop bitterness. Ends with more pine notes, floral hops, citrus fruit, caramel, hop resins and toasted malt.
Great pine aroma, clear orange perfect white head and white lacing. Great light malts. Hoppy fresh. Fantastic

UPDATED: APR 16, 2016 Caña en el Lupulo en 15..04..2016. (r2203). Ipa con intensos herbaceos frescos y ligeros afrutados. Bastante bastante buena. No cambia. Para repetir sin duda.
Botella 65 cl en el Lupulo mayo 2013. (r2063) sin lote ni fcpref. Ipa tremenda con cuerpo de 7.2 vol con sabores y aromas afrutados y amargo final duradero. Bastante buena.

As perfect an IPA as one can expect. No weaknesses, no faults. Bring it to Maine, please. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler fill from GAT Beer in NE Phila. Pours clear golden-amber with a 2-finger off-white head. Aroma of piney hops mixed with tropical fruit, maybe some biscuit underneath. Body is medium, moderately oily, with a light astringent dryness to the finish. Flavor of resiny and pine hops mixed with tropical fruit, perhaps guava. A bit of a biscuit note underneath.
Bottle at tasting. Golden pour. Aroma of pine, citrus and caramel. Taste has caremel, citrus, pine, soft malt. Solid IPA, but not worthy of the praise.

Draught. This is a nice hop forward ipa with lots of grassy notes and solid malt backbone.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2015 Appearance is a hazy, golden amber, a 1-2 finger off-white fluffy head which lasts. Leaves plenty of lacing around the glass. Aroma- loads of tropical fruit, lemons, orange, tons of grapefruit, hop resins, almost smells bitter, hints of bread, malt and brewers yeast. Huge aromas. Taste- lots of hop bitterness, pine, clinging hop resins, bitter orange peel, pineapple, fruit juice, peach, hint of mango. Mouthfeel is exceptional as IPAs go- smooth and a little chewy towards the finish, a definite malt presence. Finish can be measured in minutes, with no trace of alcohol. The fruitiness is slightly understated, perhaps due to the age, but this is still exceptional stuff.

Pours clear and golden orange. Aroma fills the room when opening the bottle, tangerines, grapefruit and some slight pine.

Taste confirms what i already suspected at this point, this is one of the best single ipas in the world, granted it does push the border towards a double in both strength and bitterness (aroma as well, holy shit!). 
Impressed by this beer!

Bottle from saveur biere.

Bottle. 
Clear caramel pour, small white head. 
Fresh hoppy nose, hints of citrus. 
Very crisp and clean IPA. 
Medium body, average carbonation.

From the 650 ml. bottle dated 02/25/15 so it is a few months old. Cloudy, orange amber pour under a large, lingering white foamy head. The aroma is full of grapefruit, tropical and other fruity characteristics more than anything else. Some caramel malt underneath. The body is medium to better than medium. The taste is well balanced in its sweetness, fruity characters, and the lingering yet mild bitterness on the backside. This is quite delightful.
This is one of the best examples of the style. Cheap, always reliably good from a great brewery. What more could you want?

From bottle in tulip glass. Pine and citrus aroma Id expect from West Coast with nice clean look. Excellent crisp taste with nice balance and range between malts and hops with nice resin bitterness. Glad its made the trip down under!

Bottle: very light haze, straw to copper, medium head and good lace. The nose is a good balance of hop and malt. Slightly funky piney edge. Maybe a hint of reduction or slow fermentation. Dry, not sour and moderately high bitterness. Lovely rich malty flavor. Some caramel and tropicals. 
Im not really into the pine profile which is a slightly unpleasant distraction for me. Everything else is great.

Bottle shared at Black Swan, post CBC - fuzzy golden copper coloured pour with white head. Aroma and taste is a medley of tropical and citrus fruits, some caramel sweetness, tangerine, pineapple, big pine needles, hoppy bitter finish. Lovely stuff.

LET ME TELL YOU. STICK TO PLINY (ITS THE BEST BEERS IN THE EARTH!!!!!) MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE MOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS (200++ IBU) MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS MORE HOPS
Smells of intense citrus and pine. Medium carbonation and semi-foamy. Taste is heavy on hops and flowers and grass. Medium length aftertaste of bitter hops and floral herbs. A bit of alcohol warmth.
very good India Pale Ale, Aroma fruity and hoppy with a nice golden amber coloring. taste was a nice initial sweet taste with a slightly bitter after taste.

Draft. Poured a clear gold with small sudsy white head. Aromas of floral, citrus fruit, tropical fruit, and pine. Flavor had grapefruit, floral, mango, pineapple, and pine. Medium body, fairy thin texture, good carbonation, and a medium bitterness to finish. Very nice.

Pours a deep golden brown from the bomber with fluffy off-white head. Aroma of big resinous piney hops with nice caramel and biscuit malt behind. Taste follows, definitely hop forward but nice balance. Soft carbonation, medium body, no booze, great IPA.

Pours copper with a nice white head that leave lacing down the glass. clear with moderate carbonation. Aroma is dominated by citrus: orange and grapefruit. At a sip, it starts off sweet with definite grapefruit zest. Transitions into a very thick pine resin for a lingering finish. A solid malt sweetness, but it is definitely just enough to balance the aggressive hopping.

Overall a very good ipa with just enough malt to keep it exceptionally drinkable.

Pours a bright copper body, frothy white head that leaves excellent lacing. Big aromas of grapefruit and tangerine with subtle scents of pine. Malt flavors up front with fresh tropical citrus fruit tastes. Some herbal and resinous notes come through as well. Medium body with somewhat sticky feel. Slightly dry bitter finish. Very nice IPA overall.

Pours pale amber with thick stable white head. Nose is floral and sweet intens nose of hops. Taste is citric fuit like bloodorange or pomelo. Midway there is some dryness that is however quickly vanishing. Leaving behind intense hoppy Aroma. The last taste remaining however is grass or hay, long after the last sip. Also there is very much carbonation going on in this beer. This is great

650ml bottle enjoyed @ my vacation apartment pours clear yellow/golden with a huge floffu white head. Aroma is floral, pine citrus and tropical fruits. Flavour is sweet and medium bitter. Medium bodied, sticky texture, average carbonation. Finish is very crispy. Solid IPA.

Pours gold with a white head. Aroma is citrus, florals and pine. Taste is bittersweet with a crisp clean finish. Medium bodied, alcohol well hidden and to easy to drink. What an IPA is supposed to be, a classic that still impresses.

2nd May 2015The Black Swan, Copenhagen. Keg. With Colin and Reubs. Bottle - big thanks to Theydon_Bois for buying this! Hazy gold beer, good pale cream colour head. Palate is smooth and semi dry, good fine carbonation. Decent malt base lets the hops shine - Floral pine, minty pine, mild marmalade and a little hop spice. Light crisp finish. Hugely drinkable and tastes pretty fresh.
Pours gold, good head and lacing. Smells of tree fruit and citrus. Flavor is granular, citrus and bitter. Good smooth mouth feel with out to much else to speak of. Good one!
From tap at CBC 2015. Hazy orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, malt, caramel, citrus, peach and grapefruit.

Pours light amber with medium white frothy head. Pretty good lacing, head mostly diminishing. Aroma is medium malty with cookie and cereal. Heavy hopping with pine, lemon, grapefruit, orange and papaya. Light yeast aromas. Moderate sweetness, moderate bitter, long finish, very balanced, not in your face. Not super fruity. Palate is creamy, carbonation is average. Nice.

31st May 2015: bomber shared with the wife in the sun on our daughters patio, Laguna Niguel. Most likely the best American IPA I have had so far, not over the top in hop bitterness but no slouch either. Hazy dull orange pour with a good head that leaves lacing as the beer level falls in the glass. This beer highlights what is good about Southern Californian IPAs without blowing your socks off with hoppiness, like some breweries seem to try and do. Flavoursome, aromatic and very, very drinkable. A truly great beer.

Ive purchased this brew several times and yet have never reviewed yet. Possibly one of the best-balanced IPAs out there. Amber-bronze pour, citrus-heavy nose with underlying musk/woody-pine. Flavor is simply juicy atop a biting pine resin. Finish is not too heavy, dryer than most, getting you impatient for the next sip. A subtle linger on the roof of the mouth. Simple, enjoyable, certainly a staple for IPA lovers.

Tap at brewery in San Diego. Light copper with white head. Smells piney and crisp. Very long hold on the nice hop flavor before it shifts to drying bitterness.  One of the longest lasting best finishing ipas Ive had.   Excellent.

Served on tap at alesmith. Golden color with a white head. Very hoppy aroma. Hoppy flavor with citrus and a clean finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

wow. seldom does a single IPA offer so much complexity. The hops are really well balanced and dont show overwhelmingly on either the citrus or evergreen side. the only thing not perfect on this is the aroma. If it had a stronger nose it would be ideal.
Citrus pine aromas. Mostly clear tan color, nice frothy head. Smooth the bitter parts are there but the remain in control. Dry lasting mild bitterness left behind.

Pure perfect hops. Smells pines and hops. A medium body and good carbonation. Strong and lasting bitter palate. Tastes hops and pines with a little fruity finish. A complete IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle to snifter, Aroma is citrus and lemon grass, taste is similar, very good and very well balanced

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Smells wonderful, pine, grapefruits, orange.. Dark blonde, copper appearance with a thin creamy head. Tastes is exquisite, nice malt backbone with a pine finish that lingers. One of the best IPAs Ive tasted.

Alesmith IPA purchased at Jungle Jims in Fairfield Ohio. This is a hazy apricot golden beer with a firm head of small white bubbles. Carbonation is lively. Nose is a good amount of sharp evergreen hops. Taste is initially quite dry with a bit of pine needle and a large amount of grapefruit citrus on the back end. body is just a bit lively. finishes clean with just a smidge of bitters. a very very nice IPA

Bottle from Saveur Bière from Dec 2014 and I suspect it has lost a bit of its carbonation. Grapefruit & pineapple aroma. Thick foamy head with a clear amber appearance. Extremely bitter with a sour and bitter after taste of grapefruit & lemongrass.
Bitter aromas, lots of grapefruit/citrus. Pours clear orange with a white head. Lots of well balanced flavor, sweet and bitter and so tasty!
Aroma of sweet citrus and caramel. Thick mouth feel. Taste of more bitter caramel. Not so much pine and citrus. Some floral earthiness. Tad unbalanced leaning towards the bitter side.

@red cbc 2015
fruity, grass, citrus, medium sweet, light bitter. a tiny bit unbalanced

Pours clean with mild foamy head; coloration is light copper-golden hue. Aroma of citrus, pine, sorta earthy... maybe some spice? Very well-balanced, complex taste of multiple hops plus a mild fruity sweetness before subsiding to the hoppy, bitter pine. Very solid, and I enjoyed it, but nothing in the bouquet or taste deserving of the scores I have seen thus far for it.

Bottle. Appearance is golden with nice white head. Aroma is citrus, tropical fruit, and pine. Taste is similar to the aroma with citrus, tropical fruit, some malty sweetness, and a nice crisp bitter finish. Decent body, nice carb. This is a really great regular IPA, lots of juicy citrus and tropical fruit flavour balanced with a nice amount of bitterness. Man, alesmith makes me happy.
Tap @CBC15. Clear golden, frothy white head. Aroma has peachy citrus. Flavour has fruity, fresh citrus with ok malt backing.

Draught @ CBC 2015. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, caramel grass, fruity hops. Flavor is light malty, light caramel, hops, tropical fruit, peach, citrus, grapefruit. Medium body, average carbonation, light bitter finish. Nice, but not that fresh. 020515

Bottle poured a hazy orange hue w/ long lasting white foamy head and thick sticky lacing. Big citrusy aroma. Initial flavor is moderate sweet w/ a bold bitter finish. Tastes are tangerine, grapefruit, mango, pineapple, straw, tea, and pine. Full bodied.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
sample at cbc. Pours a clear golden, aroma is nice and hoppy. Malt balancing. Taste is very hoppy, roastiness f ommalts balancing.
At CBC. Poured clear deep golden with an off white head. Aroma of sweet citrus and floral hops. Medium body, flavour of tropical fruit, mango, pinepalle, moderately bitter.

Pours clear golden, white head. Fresh hoppy citrus, grapefruit, pine aroma. Crisp and balanced. A very good IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cult classic IPA here. As the description states IPA means Its Pretty Awesome. This beer along with Stone IPA really paved the path for what we are seeing today. This beer pours a golden amber color with a beautiful fluffy white head. Aroma is huge floral and citrus bouquet. Taste is sweet pine and tropical fruit notes with a nice even bitterness and malt backbone that compliments it. Top notch San Diego Classic.

Bottle. Actually the description on the bottle, which is pretty much the description on RB nails it completely. Thats really what its like. Not sure Ive ever seen / agreed with one quite so much. Very tasty stuff. I was expecting it to be decent but this was better than hoped. Quintessential US IPA. Will be seeking out more of this.

Aromas of grapefruit and tangerine lead into an abundance of fresh pine and tropical fruit notes followed by a crisp, resinous bitterness. The complex hop profile is supported by a firm malt presence to create an incredibly flavorful and well-balanced IPA
Perfect San Diego style IPA. Big pine and grass notes in nose and flavor. Very ver mild malts with hop flavor and bitterness balance at perfection.
Thin white head, floral and piney smelling. Very solid. Might have been over-hyped for me, but its really good.
Aromas of citrus and citrus peel. Huge white head with lots of lacing. Sweet candy taste with a bitter pine finish. Balanced well but Id like to see more hop flavour ... maybe lemon drop.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2016 Pours deep amber with thin white head. Nose is hoppy. Aromas are toasted malts, tropical fruits, citrus and resinous pine, with a salty note. Fizzy carbonation, oily texture. Medium bitter finish mainly resinous. Well-balanced, refreshing and pleasant IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From notes on 3/7/15

Wow, One of the best IPAs Ive ever had. Not sure why Ive always passed up on this one. Excellent example of what an IPA should be.

Deep golden amber pour. Huge floral aroma. Very flowery beer. Sharp resin bitter taste, followed by hints of floral notes and strong fruity citrus notes.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2016 Quite fruity and flowery hoppy smell. The color is yellow to orange. The taste is fruity bitter, but a little bit more hops and carbonation would have been beneficial. Solid aftertaste with a certain dryness. Great beer, but not my favorite IPA out there.

6 oz, teku tasting glass. Bottled since 3 weeks, fresh, THANKS BOB! Pours a quite abundant, slighlty off-white head; brass golden to dark orange clear colour. The nose its superlative: mango, tropical, floral, juicy; theres that unmistakable sweet fruity, aromatic hoppiness that just come with this kind of top notch ales.
Tastes fruits( melon, peach), top malty, orange peel, piny; the balance its the 2nd superlative thing bout this IPA: medium and perfect sweetness, which slowly fades away(not fast as most IPAs,)  leaving space to a medium bitterness which again slowly develops; veery nice juicy hops. Bitter and sweet notes are both very distinguishable, and such perfectly mixed at the same time. Right average carbonation, medium body, silky texture. Maltiness its quite perfect, crisp and such refined; not overdone like in many ipas, most of times to cover the strong hoppiness. Aroma and balance just take this brew to the highest level. Could be best IPA Ive ever tasted
From bottle. Wow, what a nice brew, very well balanced with pleasant hop aroma, bit dry taste and bitter aftertaste.

Quite a benchmark IPA. Lovely appearance with nice white lacing. Intense hop kick never losing balance with just enough maltiness. Mostly citrus bouquet with some tropical boost.
Stand out grapefruit, peach. Light pine. Moderate sweet with moderate bitterness. Superbly well balanced and highly enjoyable brew.

Bottle as an aniversary gift from Pix. Pours clear amber with a good thick cream froth. Lovely sweet grapefruit aroma. Instant hit of big swet pine and citrus flavour followed by a nice bitter lingering finish. The alcohol comes through. Very drinkable. Great beer.

Cloudy orange pour, all pine and sweet malts on the nose, powerful hop punch on the palate. Tangerine, plums, tropical fruits, grapefruit vie for top honours with a solid malt base. Top notch IPA. San Diego classic
From bottle. Pours gold with white head. Aroma caramel, citrus, grapefruit. Taste grass, resin, hay, fruits. Low carbonation, smooth.
17.2.2015. Either wasnt in a good condition or I dont understand the rating. Hops, fruits, grass, decent bitterness. Nothing too special.

Everyone takes of the sculpin and stone beers. This is the IPA all should strive for. Killer hop aromas of grass, mango and pine. Flavor is so hoppy throughout not just punch in face hops. Not super bitter just wonderful fresh hops!

Looks really good in the glass with a foamy white head. Aroma is of citrus and pine. Medium bodied with a slight alcohol warming effect. Absolutely gorgeous lacing. This IPA is well balanced and will be my IPA going forward as its easy to get and reasonable priced.
UPDATED: AUG 23, 2015 Bottle at home. Clear golden/amber, foamy, medium head good lacing. Flavor is pine resin, grapefruit, ,and light malt. Very lingering bitter taste. Very Nice ipa!

Enjoyed this greatly during a recent beer tasting. It was the highest rated IPA by the whole group, praised for its balance. It has all of the IPA notes that we love but somehow magically puts them all together in an easy to drink form where nothing sticks out.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2015 This bottle is already a year old. Still, let?s see. Had this once before. Hazy orange color with inch thick white head. Aroma of pines, grapefruit, caramel. Taste is soothingly refreshing and full at the same time, more pines and grapefruits, bitter finish, but extremely pleasant. Very toasty body with hints of honey. Pleasant aftertaste as well. Whoa. I expect no less from Alesmith, but for such an old bottle... Amazing! IPAs don?t get much better than this.

Had on tap and a few younger bottles in the meantime. I stand by it: Best IPA Ive ever had.
Great taste, even greater smell. Really complex but easy and interesting to drink. You dont want to drink it fast because its so complex.
Damn fine straight forward IPA. Citrus, pine, and floral hops get ya up front and take you through a nice smooth ride of deliciousness.

Bottle - old gold colour with nice frothy white head prone to lacing. Big aroma of citrus hops, pine, fruit. Same in the taste, plus good malty backbone, some caramel, nice oily, medium mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. Excellent IPA

Excellent floral hop aroma, dry and resinsy. Quite dry and flavorful and light bodied. Clear golden in color with decent white head. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Couleur dorée completement translucide avec un col blanc assez résistant. Aromes de fruits tropicaux comme les agrumes, la papaye, les peches avec un peu de résines, caramel. Bien équilibrée. Une IPA bien raffraichissante mais un peu surévalué selon moi!

Bomber bought at Pizza Press. I just shot a load into my paper underwear after the aroma was unleashed by tearing away the cap from its previous mate. Huge aroma. tropical, mango, pineapple, orange, pine and mint, caramel. The pour was also fantastic leaving behind a sizeable off white cap that hung around for quite a while. Big flavours of pine, sweet orange, caramel, berries, rrgf and yea - the cherries on the finish in the description. Bonus for the subdued finish and it being notably different than the majority of the flavourful qualities. Very dry finish. As this warmed the flavour variation became a blur and it subdued itself into almost a single entity and joined the legions of similar high end ipas. Still had a piny bitter finish. This sure beat doing anything else tonight. Goes great with Strung Out.

Balanserad humlighet i doft. Mycket humle. Samma i smak fin balanserad humle, även kåda & karamell. Grapefruit.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Golden with a white head - Good hop aroma with citrus - Good malt body with a lot of good hops with a citrus / grapefruit flavour - Lasting hop finish with grapefruit - This was good

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2017 Smells hoppy with both citrus and pine hops and a good amount of sweet malt but not too much. The hops are still the star in the aroma. Appearance is a hazy orange color with a pillowy white head of foam. Good amount of lacing. The taste is absolutely spot on. Reminiscent of Bells Two Hearted Ale but with a slightly stronger malt backbone. Hoppy but not ridiculously so. Has a spice note in the background which I enjoyed. Good, but not the #1 IPA in the world. Hate to disagree with RB on this one, but Ive had better.
Spectacular IPa. This one is well balanced and very tasty. Not too much of anything. Enjoy!

2015/02/25 - Pours a clear orange-amber colour with a thick, foamy, off white head that slowly reduces and leaves moderate lacing. Aroma is grapefruit, orange, pine, biscuit, earthy tones, mango and pineapple. Taste is grapefruit and orange up front, followed by mango, mild pineapple and biscuit and finishing with pine and earthy hops. Mouthfeel is medium with average carbonation and a juicy, bitter finish. Very enjoyable. I would definitely revisit.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,65 l bottle from Bierkompass, bottled on 2/9/2014. Clear, golden orange with a huge, frothy, stable, white to tan head. Very fruity aroma of passion fruit, mango, grapefruit, orange and tangerine with hints of pepper and biscuits in the background. Unbelievably good! Medium bitter, fruity taste dominated by grapefruit, enriched with flavours of passion fruit, orange, tangerine and mango. Quite long and rather bitter finish with a slightly alcoholic and peppery touch, similar compared to their YuleSmith (Summer) but fortunately muted. Medium to full body, very solid malty backbone, creamy and foaming mouthfeel, average carbonation. Very good IPA: Rich and tasty, very refreshing and fully satisfying. Liked it even better than the mentioned YuleSmith!

Tap at BrewDog Nottingham. Pour is clear gold with a thin frothy head, aroma is fruity, alcohol, caramel, sweetness. Taste is fruity, sweet, some caramel, lingering toffee, gentle bitterness, extremely well-concealed ABV, drinks almost like a Session IPA. Good, but I was expecting a bit more

On tap @ City beer store, San Francisco - CA. Color: clear blond beer with small whit foam. Smell: nice hoppy smell with grassy and fruity note. Really well balanced. Taste: nice hoppy taste and grassy notes. Fruity finish. Aftertaste: wet bitterness. Great beer and easy drinkable.

Bottle pours a deep golden-amber color. Big fluffy off-white head lingers the entire drink. Aromas of pine, earth, fresh cut flowers, light citrusy zest and sweet bread. Taste is a nice crisp floral hop balance...bouquet of flowers...dank pine...light peach and mango...firm malt body never lets the hops get too bitter. Crisp dry finish. A classic!
Shared bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours light amber, hazy, with offwhite head. Aroma of pine needles, hints of caramel. Some sweetness. Bitter finish with a long lasting aftertaste.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2015 650 ml bottle, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 7.25%. Golden colour, only slightly hazy. Large white head. Pleasant hoppy aroma, notes of pine, caramel and grapefruit. Lovely and well balanced hoppy flavour, pine needles and grapefruit again, not extreme - just very well made. .

Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 09.02.15. Golden. White head. Superbly refreshing aroma of American hops, citrus and tropical fruits. Similarly fine taste. Fresh fruit and moderate bitterness in aftertaste. Very interesting, complex and quaffable.
Bottle, mostly citrus aroma... well balanced hops and malt taste... a real nice ipa!!!

Sample, draught, during the Great American Beer Festival (Denver), savoured on October 2 2014; eye: amber, clear, no effervescence, tiny ring of off-white head, no lacing; nose: light Cointreau, alcohol, light pine, grapefruit, citrusy hops; mouth: light Cointreau, alcohol, light pine, grapefruit, citrusy hops, dryness, dry finale in Cointreau with presence of grapefruit, full body, good carbonation, quite bitter, slightly sweet, lightly harsh texture; overall: quite goode

FRANÇAIS

Échantillon, en fût, lors du Great American Beer Festival (Denver), savourée le 2 octobre 2014; il : ambrée, limpide, pas deffervescence, petit anneau de mousse blanc cassé, pas de dentelle; nez : léger Cointreau, alcool, léger pin, pamplemousse, houblon citrique; bouche : léger Cointreau, alcool, léger pin, pamplemousse, houblon citrique, sècheresse, finale sèche en Cointreau avec présence de pamplemousse, corsée, bonne carbonatation, pas mal amère, très légèrement sucrée, texture légèrement râpeuse; en résumé : très bon

Grapefruit rises from the glass. Resin but not overpowering. Citrus sweetness on taste but not a palate wrecker. Has a lasting bitterness that is superb. Well put together. Good head and beading. 1pint, 6oz, 7.25%, 3.7std drks. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

02/04/15 from 20 oz bomber. Great piney hops aroma. Tart hoppy taste without much maltiness or alcohol. One finger head on a light yellow amber base. Aftertaste is a bit too bitter for my taste but aroma is great and very drinkable IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle shared @Bir&Fud Bottega (Rome). Golden/amber appearance, with a medium white head. Aroma is apple, tropical fruits, grapefruit, some malt. Flavour is medium bitter, hops is balanced with malt. Low carbonation, medium body. Unfortunately it was not so fresh... so so...

Bomber poured to a tulip. Bottled 1/16/15. Beautiful pour on this beer, crystal clear copper with a white head. Nice lacing. Aroma is sweet tropical fruits and grapefruit. Pine, resin, caramel. Taste is bitter pine, resin, grapefruit, all sorts of tropical fruits. Dry mouthfeel. just a wonderful IPA. Cheers!

65cl. Bottle. Bottled on 2014-09-02
Pours clear yellow/orange with white head. 
Aroma the air is already filled with hops after opening the bottle :). Pine, resin, citrus, grapefruit, toffee, mango, peach. 
Taste really great citrus pine bitter, caramel sweets. 
Mouthfeel oily, dry. 
Awesome IPA!

Bottle at home from brewdog3months old.hazy pale amber with beige-white lacing. Fruity orange pith and toffee on the nose. Fairly sweet, citrus juice, big burst of mango rind, pithy bitterness, full bodied, moderate carbonation, plenty of pithy, grapefruit and mango.

Bottle at home. Clear golden ale, big white creamy head which is beautifully stable. Clean hoppy nose, citrus fruity and piny. Nicely crisp and bitter hops that keep building up (!) in the aftertaste: piny, grassy, citrusy, orange zest tones. Good malty backbone, not too present but nicely soft and sweet, giving this ale a firm body and delivers the hoppiness. Dry, even a bit tard finish with beautiful hop tones: one of the best aftertastes Ive had. Medium carbonation, oily mouthfeel.

Clear, golden colour, big white head. Sweet, malty aroma with tons of fruits, especially citrus fruits. Taste is different. Its dry with some sweet notes. Also floral and fruity notes. Medium, short bitterness.
bottle. Golden with two finger head. Light/Medium body with excellent hops. Well balanced with quite a bit of hop flavors. Medium bitterness.

Light orange colour, 2 fingers white head. Aroma of mango, peach, pineapple, caramel, bread, honey, flowers. Taste is medium bitter, light sweet. Pineapple flavour. Medium body, slick texture, average carbonation. Probably the best IPA I have had.

Good american IPA. Superbe texture, odeur alléchante. Goût pile dans le style, pas super fruité, amertume moyenne. Belle longueur en bouche en douceur. 
Bonne IPA de tous les jours.

Beautiful clear amber colour with excellent long lasting fluffy off-white head. Heady and inviting aromas of pine, resin, citrus and sweet malts. The taste is nicely balanced between sweet and bitter. The citrus is apparent upfront and then the pine and resin really kick in leading to a very enjoyable lengthy dry finish. Clean and crisp. This is a very special IPA and Im not normally a big IPA drinker.

When the Ale Smith IPA rushes into your glass, you are assailed with a lush citrus aroma that tantalises, with only a hint of the strength of the ale. The head, once settled is a smooth foam of ivory clouds resting serenely on the surface of what is a very impressive ale. The first taste if this valiant effort by Ale Smith may result in you rushing back to the shop to buy more, as it's rich flavour of citrus, hops and acidic resin wraps your tastebuds like a velvet glove. Try it today.

Frangimus

Keg at Brewdog Sheps Bush. Crystal clear golden coloured pour with a lasting frothy white head. Aroma is lovely orange cirrus, tropical fruit, mango, lychee, tangerine. Flavour is really Clean base malts, punchy orange tangerine hop, grassy tropical hop. Uber smooth and drinkable. Palate is medium light, slightly sticky resinous on the tongue. Assertive clean citrus bitterness.

Very well balanced. Not too bitter, not too sweet. An everyday UP A from a great brewery. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Full bodied golden IPA, with grapefruit citrus. SOLID would be the best one word to describe this beer.

Ill let the ratings speak for themselves but in my opinion this is a great beer and one of the best values out there. Any time I see it on the shelf I pick up 6 to 8 of these. Really solid IPA and recommend to all my friends.

Pours dark amber in color with a decent head. Smell is hoppy and malty. Taste is much the same. When I think of IPAs this is the beer I think of, is it the best IPA I dont know. However, if I had to tell someone what an IPA style should taste like this is the beer I would direct them to. I very nice beer.
Had from a bottle.

Pours hazy gold with a large head.
Nose shows pine, resinous hops and a fair whack of sweet clean malt.
More pine and resinous notes as flavours along with some grapefruit and sweet clean malt. Finishes with an assertive, lasting bitterness.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2017 WYGLĄD: Barwa złota, przygaszona.  Piana obfita, drobno-pęcherzykowa, zwarta, cudownie oblepia szkło (lacing). AROMAT: Bogactwo aromatów: tropikalne owoce (ananas, papaja, mango, marakuja, liczi), herbaciane (Earl Grey), ziołowość (cukierki ślazowe), przyjemne cytrusy (pomelo, mandarynka), w tle przyjemny leśny aromat. SMAK: goryczka średnia do wysokiej, zalegająca, świetnie ukryty alkohol, smak cytrusowo-herbaciany, z nutami ziołowymi, bardzo pijalne.
10*4*10*4*19

AKTUALIZACJA
Butelka z datą : puszka 0.33, 10/05/16 (puszkowanie)
AROMAT : Intensywny, chmielowy. Jak to cudownie pachnie! Cytrusy (pomelo, mandarynka, grejpfrut), cukierki ślazowe (karmelowo-ziołowe), owoce tropikalne (melon, mango, arbuz) - tu jest niemal wszystko, pomimo, że piwo nie jest już pierwszej świeżości.
SMAK : Wytrawne. Cytrusowe. Charakterystyczny posmak cukierków ślazowych oraz ciasteczek. Goryczka wysoka, krótka.
WYGLĄD : Barwa złota, zamglone. Piana drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, średniej wysokości, nieśmiało i gdzieniegdzie oblepia szkło.   
OGÓLNIE : Piękne wspomnienia powróciły. IPA na światowym poziomie. TOP50 w pełni zasłużone. I kiedy znajomi pytają mnie: "która IPA wyrywa z butów?", to zawsze pierwsza na myśl przychodzi mi IPA z AleSmith. Tylko nie pytaj o cenę - dodaję.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2016 Aromat: wspaniały!, bardzo mocno żywiczny, ogromna ilość owoców, czuć liczi, marakuję, papaję, mango, mocno zaznaczone cytrusy, do tego lekki karmel i ziołowość. 
Wygląd: klarowne złoto z ładnie oblepiającą ścianki szklanki piany
Smak: mocno owocowe, to pierwsze czym dostajemy po kubkach smakowych, czuć mango, ananasa, mandarynkę, limonkę, kontra jest mocno żywiczna, sosnowa, sporo jest trawiastych aromatów, do tego leciutki karmel i spora grejfrutowa goryczka. W tle szlachetny alkohol, grzejący w przełyk. Niesamowicie złożone piwo.
Very fragrant! Serious bitterness in the taste, eat fruits and some sweets. Excellent IPA. One of the best.

Bomber. Clear golden copper with a thick, foamy, beige head that lasts and laces. Aromas of tangerine, grapefruit, pine, spice, biscuit, and caramel. Flavor is pine resin, grapefruit, biscuit, and light caramel. Medium bodied, smooth with a dry, bitter end. Lingering pine.
Bottle at home. Pours clear amber, nose is grapefruit, floral, sweet toffee, taste is similar, dry, chewy.

Bottle, 0.65l. Clear amber color with large soapy off-white head, great lacing and sparkling appearance. Aroma of grapefruit, peach, pungent pine and biscuit malt. Taste starts with moderate sweet caramel malt, following is fruity and resinous with spicy, alcoholic and warming mouthfeel and heavy bitter finish. Medium to full body, oily texture and average carbonation in palate. Nice one, but I see that you must not serve it too cold. Drinking it at 8°C gives away only alcohol, while at 12°C plenty of more complex fruity flavors develop...
Outstanding IPA. Great aroma, awesome taste, great balance. One of the best IPAs Ive ever tried!

22oz Pours a clear filtered amber with some carbonation and small white head, looks like Yuengling. Smells of piney resin hoos as well as fruity ones like grapefruit and mango. Body is light with small bubbled carbonation that makes a good mouth-feel. Taste of fresh hops, plenty of flavors but the fruity grapefruit and resin stand out the most. Taste a lot like other wet hop IPAs Ive had but extremely well balanced and well done. Cheers!

Limes, lemons & grass on the nose. Pine & grapefruit on the tongue. A full bodied & well balanced ale with a light amber colour & thick white head. This is pure bitter nectar.

Rated by BrewTom

650ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. almost clear pale golden color with white head. Hoppy aroma, pine, floral and fruity, malty. Heavy bitter and light sweet taste. Almost medium body oily with soft carbonation and long bitter aftertaste.

On draft, Golden Crust, Red Lion, PA. From notes. 5oz flight glass. Pours clear golden/amber, nice off white head, nice lacing and retention. Aroma of grapefruit, lemon and herbs. Taste is bitter with just enough malt sweetness to balance. Medium body. medium carbonation, silky resin mouth feel. Finishes dry and bitter with notes of grapefruit, currants, black cherry and herbs. An excellent example of a west coast IPA! Outstanding !

Bottle from BD ShepBush, drank at home. Clear rich gold, off-white head fades to skin then ring/patches. Nose of orange, grapefruit, dank resin, hay, light caramel malt. Tastes lightish sweet cereal and a touch of toffee, pretty big clean bitterness, bitter orange, grapefruit, resin, floral, some slight green dank notes, finishing dry and bitter. Medium oily body, medium carbonation, slightly sharp. Really good.
650ml bottle, pours golden brown, copper with white head and light haze. Aroma has been piney hop, grapefruit and mango citrussy notes, over caramel malt with a big bitter finish. Lovely

Crisp, clean pour, finger white head, Notes of peaches, Caramel apples, pears, even gummy bears, climbing bitterness that finishes clean and crisp yet lingers a little, very fresh bottle. Slight bitter tank-like resinous mouth feel ,so whatever happened to irie pirate ale??

This is the way all IPAs should taste. Heavy hops, pine and fruit, bitter and refreshing. High quality and the strength I look for in taste,palate, and aroma.

Bomber bottle in socal.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Z butelki aromat mocno dojrzałych lub wręcz przejrzałych grejpfrutów, pomarańczy, słodkich owoców tropikalnych (żółtych), po przelaniu do szklanki wyczuwalne lychee, marakuja, mango, po ogrzaniu minimalnie karmel. Barwa jasnobursztynowa, klarowne. Duże wysycenie. Piana wysoka, średnio i drobno pęcherzykowa, długa i pięknie zdobiąca szkło. W smaku uderzenie lychee i cukierków prawoślazowych. Goryczka średnia, przyjemna.
Bottle at BrewDog Birmingham; clear sparkling amber pour with a frothy white head, assertive pine hop aroma, taste has fresh pine, mango, grapefruit, prickly nettles, some sweet malts.

Bottle; shared with Reakt at the Moncada brewery; Saturday 20th December 2014. A really nice head and benchmark IPA image on the colour. The beer is well-carbonated and aroma is of hey and tropical fruits and good yeasty doughness. 

The taste is oxidised but still the banging fruity notes you want from a West Coast IPA. Unfortunately it was a bit cheesy and very bready on the texture. A nice dry and long finish which was fruity. Very drinkable and I enjoyed this one.
Just two months old from its bottling date, loads of west coast hops, and that sherbet hint that the best IPA s give. More of a malt backbone than some IPAs, but still a lovely dry finish.

On tap at Mission Dolores, Brooklyn. Pours a clear honey golden color with a big frothy beige head. Aroma is grapefruit, orange, very floral, resin. Very fresh smelling beer. Amazing. Flavor is hop forward, lots of grapefruit, and orange. Decent biscuit malt backbone thats noticeable. Good balance. Nice carbonation. One of the best IPAs Ive had.

22oz bottle into tulip. 

Excellent aroma - citrus and pine. taste is bitter, especially in the finish. Overall, this beer is really nice. A little more piney and bitter than I would prefer.

Poured a big three finger, creek foam-like head. Very clear, light amber-copper color and big thick lacing. Aroma is very citrusy, some pine, hop resin and grapefruit. Right down the road medium body and smooth for an ipa with a little quick bite at the end. Piney, lime, citrus, grapefruit and resiny hops fill the palate. Pale malts, mellow sweet malts and caramel accented malts round it out. Very solid!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Large off-white head, lasting. Lot of lacing. Hazy orange. Piney & citrusy. Classic american hops profile. Light malt base. Very balanced. Nice bitter aftertaste. Not feeling the 7.25 ABV.

Belle couleur orange, grosse mousse mais qui redescend vite. Bon lacing.
Nez avec des touches de pin-agrumes plutôt citrique. Bonne sensation en bouche lamertume est agréable. Le goût reste longtemps en bouche.
Lalcool ne se fait pas trop sentir. Bonne atténuation avec un final assez sec. Bien équilibrée tout de même. Peu darômes des malts.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer & Beyond shop. Hazy yellow orange with a nice creamy head. Strong hoppy aroma of mango, peach, pears, pine needles, onion and spices. Sweet with a good balance of fruity and malty flavors slightly "green", mango, piney, dry finish, long bitter aftertaste. Medium-bodied, creamy texture. Great IPA.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer & Beyond, Tel Aviv. A bit hazy golden with small off-white head. Quite hoppy aroma, onion, fruity, citrus, piney, a bit grassy, some mango and lemon, floral, light sweetness. Very hoppy flavor, light sweetness, some maltiness, light bitterness, onion notes, very balanced. Creamy texture, light carbonation, medium-bodied. Excellent.

bottle thanks to Peter. Aroma: citrus, grapefruit, caramel, floral. App: clear golden with medium frothy head. Taste and Palate: medium body, creamy, medium carbonation, light sweetness, dry with light-medium well balanced bitter finish. Overall: Awesome! This beer is so smooth. Really enjoy a smooth IPA like this one. Perfectly balanced.

Bottle from Geers @ home. Apperance is orange, blonde. Aroma: not impressive, lemon, fruit, hoppy. Taste: very very dry. Totally not what I was expecting. Mixe of Orval and some generic IPA. Maybe I drank it too old.
fuera de serie, una auténtica joya, de las mejores cervezas que tomé en toda mi vida

On tap at ABV Pub in Hillsboro, OR. Clear orange yellow with a small white head that sticks around and coats the entire sides of the glass with sticky lacing all the way down. Nice citrus aroma and flavor. Taste is bitter with a nice sweetness behind. Bitter finish.
UPDATED: NOV 27, 2014 Very nice beer with balanced taste. Slight bitter aftertaste but not bad. Crisp, refreshing, clean flavor that is we?ll deserved of high marks.

En bouteille, 6.99$ au Winooski Beverage Warehouse. Une bière parfaite, odeur de pin, résine, mais doux au nez. Goût fruité, agrumes sucré en début puis plus amère, pamplemousse, en fin mais avec un goût résiduel résineux, beaucoup de fraicheur mais encore une fois léquilibre idéale, ça reste doux en bouche. Corps moyen, amertume moyenne également. Extrêmement rafraichissante! Faites attention à 7,25 apv cest dangereux!

On tap at their tasting room. Pours a golden yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is citrus and some pine. Flavor is slightly malty some biscuit some grapefruit. Really nice. Finishes clean. Really nice beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2016 750ml bottle served in a pint glass. A: Dark orange color. Pretty cloudy. Forms a big fluffy soapy yellow head. Great retention and tons of lacings formed and left in the glass. S: Toffee, caramel malts, piney hops and bready yeasts. Herby and spicy. Tropical fruits, notes of mango and passion fruit. Notes of orange and orange zest. Perfect. T: Slightly sweet upfront. Toffee and caramel malts. Strong notes of pine and tropical fruits. Mango, passion fruity and some notes of grapefruit. In overall, a dry and balanced bitter taste. M: Medium body. Medium bitterness. Extremely smooth texture which is an Alesmith trademark. Pine and tropical fruits in the aftertaste. O: Excellent drinkability. Very close to my perfect IPA.

Bottle. Pretty close to my favourite beer. Pours deep golden colour with a white head that disappears quickly. Caramel aroma and burnt caramel flavour backed up nicely with bitterness. Get it in and around you!!

It pours a golden, but a little dark. It leaves healthy lacing on the class with an off white head. It has a citrus aroma with piney and caramel aromas as well. There is a strong caramel taste with piney flavors and citrus flavors that are well blended. It has a bold, bitter bite to the palate.

Very well made IPA from Alesmith. Bottle drank last Xmas procured from Biernavigatie online beer shop. Aroma has plenty going on, piney, yeasty, herbal. Taste for me is resin bitter, freshly baked bread, bit of spice. Nice, but Ive had better I think.

A very impressive and well-balanced IPA. Pours a rich golden with a thick frothy head. Easily one of the imperial IPAs out there. Nice maltiness and bittersweet hoppiness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2015 Bomber to a pint glass while watching game 5 World Series 2014... Hazy golden color ... 2 finger tan head with good retention. Citrus and resiny aroma balanced with mildly sweet but ample malt bill. Smooth dry slightly bitter warming finish ... The IPA standard... Absolutely delicious !!!
