I really liked this beer, but was expecting more. I had a bottle less than two months old. I wouldnt describe this at all as sticky, maybe medium resinous, a little juicy for my taste. I guess Im comparing the two because I feel there are some similarities, but I prefer a Sculpin IPA. I also had a bottle six months old and the malt was more prevelant and the beer seemed more complex. Its not the first IPA I liked a little less fresh but it is unique in how much I feel the taste changed

On tap at the brewery. It poured a slightly hazy golden light amber color with a small head. The aroma was of caramel malts, some light citrus, fruits and pine. The taste was of fruit sweetness with a good malt background. It had a light to medium in body with a lingering fruity sweetness. Awesome.

A almost perfect ipa in the classic ipa format. Pour is golden to light amber with a thick tall cream colored head that lingers. Aroma is earthy,citrus and floral. A creamy ipa that coats the inside of your mouth and lingers. Tons of hops with a refreshing lack of bitterness but not flavor.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2017 still in denial that this is not an imperial...almost as strong as Ruination abv-wise...super hoppy in the nose and flavor (which is nice) but what makes it really stand out is the tremendous maltiness as well. great beer...maybe not as drinkable as Stone or Marin, but super-flavorful!!! Alesmith has earned its rep."
12/16 - had the mosaic dry hopped version at its just about equal on the fantastic meter.  Fantastic nose!

Non amo le IPA, specie le super amare americane.ma questa è di gran lunga la migliore bevuta. Bella già dallaspetto. La mia è quasi arancio ramato, purtroppo ha 8 mesi di vita e la cosa non la rende ideale. Ma al naso è ancora pimpante, pini e resina, sciroppo dacero, biscotti, ma anche tanti pompelmi e scorza di limone. In bocca non delude , con imbocco allo sciroppo dacero, poi aghi di pino, qualcosa di simile, caramelle mou centralmente ed un finale secco al pompelmo. A tratti anche toffee. Il retrogusto è ai frutti tropicali tipo ribes. Veramente ripulente e lungo, molto apprezzata.
jai pas envie de commenter, je mange une pizza avec un jolie fille et si je la perds du regard jai bien peur quelle aille voir ailleurs si la bière est meillleurs!! Cheers

Floral & citrus aroma. The appearance is perfect: light amber/golden with a tall foamy white head. Great lacing on the glass. Moderate bitterness with pine, spruce, mixed citrus, orange and tangerine sweetness. Medium-bodied and drinkable. Just the right amount of resin hops in the finish.

Big bottle 6 bucks. Clear golden color with medium head. Huge citrus hop aroma. Medium bitterness. Citrusy pine notes. Bitter finish. This is very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

7.25% a clear light copper gold with a dank resinous hoppy bouquet. A nice medium-full body with a fairly smooth mouthfeel. The taste is a bitting bitterness with earthy/woodsy bitting bitterness that mostly has fruity pine notes, sweetly balanced.

Transfer from BA review on 12-8-13-

 Poured from bottle into a pint glass

 Appearance  The beer pours an amber-orange color with a thick looking three finger white colored head. The head has a great level of retention, slowly fading over time to leave a fantastic level of foamy lace on the sides of the glass. 

 Smell  The aroma is heaviest of a tropical fruit smell with tons of tangerine as well as aromas of pineapple, mango and papaya. Along with these fruity smells is a good showing of hops. The hop aroma is heaviest of a grapefruit smell, but is accompanied by aromas of pine and a little bit of earth. A little bit of a bready aroma there is there as well, mixing with the rest to produce a quite delicious smell overall.

 Taste  The taste begins with a slightly doughy and bready taste combined with a lighter tangerine and other tropical fruit flavor. Right from the start the hops can be tasted, with the beginning having a moderate showing of a grapefruit hop flavor. As the flavor advances from the start, the grapefruit gets a bit stronger in taste all while the sweeter flavors dwindle. At the same time the doughier flavor vanished from the tongue being replaced by a drier biscuit like taste. Nearer to the end, a pine hop taste starts working its way onto the tongue. While it starts out lower in intensity, it soon takes over the grapefruit hop flavor, with the total of flavors leaving a rather dry, bready and biscuit, resinously hopped flavor to be left on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the averages to slightly thicker side in terms of thickness and creaminess with a carbonation level that is average. The thicker body really amps up the resinous hop flavors of the brew nicely allowing them to coat the mouth, all the while the average carbonation keeps it a little bit crisper and helps with the drier tastes of the brew. 

 Overall  A quite tasty IPA with a nice blend of grapefruit and pine hop. A rather enjoyable drink I must say.

Flaska från Akkurat delad med @msbrindbergs. Dimmig bärnstensfärgad vätska med stort gräddigt skum . Doftar smörkola, tallbarr och honungsmelon. I smaken är der mest smörkolan och tallen som dominerar. Bra IPA.

Flaska på Akkurat. 
Med tanke på att man var väldigt laddad för den här så var det så klart en besvikelse, men med lite eftertanke så är det en galet bra öl. 
Dimmig bärnsten med ett sjukt tjockt skum. 
Doftar bra av granskog och smörkola. 
Smakar smörkola med en fruktig ton, typ honungsmelon. 
Ingen monsterbeska, men va fan för det!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2017 slightly cloudy orange colour, huge, stable, yellowish head; aroma of floral-resiny-tropical fruity-moderately citrusy notes, honey, maybe some vanilla; taste of perfectly balanced hoppy bitterness and malty sweetness with honey-tropical fruity-resiny notes and bitter-dominant aftertaste; amazing IPA! definitely the best of mine so far!

Clear golden amber colour with medium whey head. Classic strong pine and grapefruit aroma with a little caramel in the background. Thin to medium body with crisp carbonation. Slightly crisp biscuity taste with an assertive bitterness. Finish is clean with a bit of bite. Exemplary.
bottle. picked up at random. pretty good beer - enjoyed it on the beach in OBX

650mL bottle Bottled on 03/21/14
Presents a sizeable, firm white head atop a slightly hazy pale gold body.
Intense hop nose; pine, grapefruit, cedar, dried leafy herbs, unripe melon & stonefruit, with a measure of lightly toasted & golden syrup malt in support.
Moderate carbonation, body is full but certainly doesnt give away its substantial strength, long on the palate, clean, a touch of malt chewiness.
Ever present hops continue their tirade on the palate - plenty of grapefruit rind, melon pith, pine sap, bay leaf sort of character going on, packs a lot in there. A welcome touch of sweetness delivered by a toasted malt character, but ultimately hops win out with a final killer blow of strong bitterness and lingering spice. 
Very well made IPA - this brewery scarcely sets a foot wrong!
Amazing smell. Ultra well balanced. Generally I gravitate to the darker beers and skip IPAs. But this is an absolutely delicious IPA.

Draft pour at Special Brews. Pours a copper color. Big piney hop aroma. Had this a couple times before, and it really got me into the world of IPAs. Near perfect balanced beer with a really nice bitter hop finish. All around a standout IPA. Great beer.

Smell is very potent. Pine and a floral orange blossom dominate. Thick white foam holds strong on top of the hazy apricot beer below. I can't get over how good this beer smells. Bitter grapefruit, sharp pine and a resiny finish. One of the best west coast IPA's I've had.
IPA perfection. Wonderrful nose citrus grapefruit, pine, Excellent carbonation. Dry finish and perfect hop character.

Draft at Moriartys. Clear orange amber with a frothy off-white head. Battlements of lace. Great complex mix of earthy, floral, citrus, resiny hop notes. Honey tangerines. Bitter blonde caramels. Woody oak and pine. Lemongrass. Agave. Pineapple cores. Buttered toast. Wildflower honeycombs. Pink pepper. Amber fruit. Thorny vines. Really good stuff. Not one wrong note in a symphony of fantastic flavors!
Grassy, piney, honey, bready, orange marmalade, mild grapefruit rind. Oily, slick mouthfeel.

From a 650ml bottle on 22/8/2014. Pours a cloudy dar apricot with a big white head. Has a sublime powerful nose featuring resin, pine, caramel and citrus fruit (mandarin, tangerine). In the mouth, you get a strong caramel malt backbone, lots of sweet citrus and stone fruit (more tangerine and apricot), honey and peel, with just a touch of spice. The bitterness is big - very resiny rather than grapefruity, lingering subtly long after you swallow. The palate is sensational, dense and creamy with average carbonation. Theres nothing new here but its a wonderfully balanced IPA which is very hard to fault. An amazing beer.
Clear amber body with a slightly beige head. Aroma is hoppy, citrus, peach, caramel. Medium sweet, long bitter finish. Lovely IPA.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2014 Pours a nice copper color with a lingering white head.  Aroma of a lot of hops, pine, and citrus.  flavor heavy on grapefruit, with some pine and orange notes as well. is actually pretty smooth and drinkable.  overall, this is a wonderful IPA and belongs among the top three IPAs in the world.

Screwed the pooch on this one, but still a great beer. Left it in a overly cold fridge and iced it a little. Still....Hazy y orange pour with nice off white head. Aroma is malty resins, pine, grapefruit rind and pineapple. Taste falls a little short, but still very good.

Tap at Belmont Stattion. Large grapefruitty nose, tropical fruit, caramel. Pretty, dark amber color, dreamy slow carb rising, good lace. Tropical fruit, mango, caramel is thick and chewy. Medium heavy, with hops as a texture. This is edging toward double IPA characteristics. One big tasty IPA.

Bottle at home, thx to Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: hoppy, grains, lemon.
TASTE: hoppy, little bitter.
simply amazing. tangerine/orange rind dominate this roller coaster of an IPA. One of the best I have ever had.
Pours a hazy dark golden color. Aroma and taste are citrus pines and a bitter finish.

651 ml. bottle. Pours a medium, well retained, ivory head, with heavy lacing, over a clear medium amber (SRM 12) body.....nose is pine, resin, grapefruit from the hops, slight sweetness, toasted malts, with toast, biscuit, balance to the hops....taste is moderately sweet to start, with slight hints of toffee/caramel, moderate hop tones, with pine, resin, citrus (tangerine) notes, finishing with a moderate bitterness......mouth feel, medium body, sticky, moderate alcohol warmth, medium acid, carbonation adds creaminess. This is without a doubt an American IPA. What is interesting is that it is rather middle of the road in all aspects. This does not make it bad, it is just how much the rest of craft  and home brewing has evolved. BJCP 8/3/16/5/7

Bottle from Beermoth, Manchester. Hazy gold. Decent, lasting, sticky, off white head. Chewy, caramel malt. Minty toffee. Pine resin. Ginger spice. Taste is thick sweet. Some spicy dryness. Heavy bitterness. Plenty of chew and oiliness. Finishes much the same. Not what youd call vibrant, but I do like a fusty, dank big IPA.
Bitter with an interesting aftertaste. Aroma is as interesting as the taste. Another winner from Alesmith.
Grumbler to pint glass. Pours a clear orange color with medium white head. Nose is pine, citrus, caramel; flavor is pine and citrus, with a bitter finish. Nice, simple, good.
goldenly, foamy, lacey, citrusy, piney, bubbly, hoppy, yummy. Definitely a very good IPA from a really good brewery.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2015 Hazy orange color with rich white medium lasting head. Bottle conditioned, maybe a little over carbonated. Aroma is piney, with strong pineapple characters, citrus and some malts on the background. Medium-bodied, with strong fruity taste. Again, pineapple, pine and citrus are predominant. Aftertaste is smooth and slightly bitter.
Red and golden big, thick head. Resiny aromas with a nice caramel malt and grapefruit/pine flavor at the end

Bue en bouteille de 66.6cl, couleur ambrée trouble, belle effervescence, mousse onctueuse et prégnante au nez attaque sur les fruits exotiques, en bouche grosse attaque sur le litchi puis le fruit exotique marque de grenade et de mandarine assez longue en bouche ça se termine sur une amertume intense et un côté résineux, excellente !

Hazy copper orange pour. Thick white head. Grapefruit, mango, pine hop aromas. Mild biscuity aroma. Flavor is boozy and hoppy. Grapefruit and more malt character than most west coast IPAs. 

---Rated via iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2015 650 ml bottled 02/25/15 from Ammersin 5, Vienna.
Amber, slightly hazy body, with a big, stable, frothy, strongly lacing, white head.
Aroma of distinctive pine needles, resin, grapefruit, candy.
Taste is strong resiny, piney and dry, also with grapefruit, grass, earth, subtle tea, balanced by sweet, honey and biscuit like malts.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes bitter, dry and slightly alcohol warming, with pine, resin and grapefruit.

Tasty. Great example of a piney, resinous IPA. Even after half a year of bottling still with a really distinctive hop profile. Greatly balanced between piney hops and complex malt notes. Overall not among my absolute favourite IPAs, but world class for sure.

Bottle. Over carbonated! Lost some really good drops.
Pours hazy dark orange, foamy beige one finger thick head. Aroma is fresh pine, sweet fruits and grape. Hints of malt and caramel. Taste is medium sweet and resin-like. Smooth mouth and long bitter dry and minty on the tounge.
Bottle. Light copper color. This is what I imagine a perfectly done IPA. The malt profile isnt too strong, but enough to compliment the beautiful hops. A+
Bottle from San Francisco. Nice sweet aroma with a touch of citrus. Looks like a good ipa should, nice moutfeel with good bitterness and carbonation. A fantastic ipa.

Bottle from Dranken Geers. Orange/amber colour, white foam. Medium carbonation. Very complex nose of tropical fruit, grapefruit and bitter hops. Light sweet with bitter finish. Easy drinkable. This is a winner!

Near perfect IPA. Im liking the California style. Soft, smooth mellow hoppiness, slippery body, creamy mouthfeel. Light amber with small silky head. Soft citrus. pine nose, taste is more pine, but not astringent. Goes down smooth, with some lingering bitterness. Wonderful!

Thanks to Rian for sharing! Bottled 17.2.2014. Very smooth and hoppy beginning. Fresh resin and pine at the beginning. Not too sweet. Easy to drink for 7,25%. Very floral in the nose, fresh hoppy and smooth. On the tongue remains a fresh hoppy aroma with a slight sweetness. Very nice! 12/12/13/13
hay, grass, herbs, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, full body, thin feel, average carbonation, long finish

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2014 Purchased in Europe so a bit long in tooth, bottle five months before tasting. Pours a bright orange/yellow with an of white head. The smell is malt, caramel, fruit. The is herbal, caramel, fruit, tart with some citrus. Light/medium body with nice carbonation.

Bouteille. Saveur bière. Robe orange clair, belle mousse écru. Nez fruité sur la mangue, notes de malt et de pin. Bouche de malt caramel et de fruits exotiques avec une note résineuse dominante. Finale sèche, épicée, notes de piments séchés et d'alcool. Une american ipa de caractère, bien résineuse.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

650ml bottle. Pours a hazy deep golden amber, with a medium off-white head, which lasts well and leaves very good lacing. Fresh spruce, citrus peel and morello cherry hops notes sit over a caramel malt base to create the aroma. Prickling pine and Seville orange hops up front fade gently into caramel malt and the merest hint of vanilla in the mid-palate. Softer, fruity hops notes of plum and black cherry add interest to the finish. This really is an exemplary IPA. Much more subtle than others in the American style, it offers great depth of hops flavour, giving it much more character than the raft of IPAs that rely on nothing but straight bitterness. One of the best beers I have had in a long while.

7/13/14. Bomber. Pours slightly hazy golden with a great big sticky head. Milder floral piney nose than I might have expected (old bottle?). Nicely balanced mouth with prominent hops without blowing the palate out or overdoing it on the booze. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Butelka 650ml.
OCZY : piwo jest przejrzyste o kolorze miedzi i pomarańczy. Piana jest średniej wielkości, trwała o kolorze białym. 

NOS : bardzo intensywne aromaty tarty, pompelo, krwiste pomarańcze, mango, jałowiec, pieprz. Jest również mocny aromat alkoholu i żywicy. 

USTA : piwo jest średnio nasycone o konsystencji tłustego mleka. 
Piwo jest intensywne pod każdym względem. Mocno słodowe o typowej nucie tarty. Do tego wanilia. Zanim uderzą cytrusowe nuty amerykańskich chmieli, żywica i alkohol wychodzi na wierzch. Za raz po mamy do czynienia z typowymi owocowymi i jałowcowymi nutami chmieli o dosyć wyraźnej gorzkości przypominającej pestki cytrusów. Piwo piecze w ustach i gardle. Posmak przypomina o żywicy. Alkohol przypomina o sobie kilka łyków później. 

ODCZUCIA : piwo jest bardzo intensywne. Przypomina bardziej DIPA niż IPA. Miałem okazje podjadać sobie ostre skrzydełka do tego piwa i muszę przyznać, że to jest prawdziwe objawienie. Polecam. 

OCENA : 
smak : 8/10
pijaln ość : 6/10
styl : +1

Gift from a friend, very nice. Pours a nice golden color, slight head foam, great nose and first taste, good aftertaste. A very good IPA with nice hop flavor and a highish ABV

Increible Ipa, creo que es de lo mejor dentro del estilo. Impresionante, Equilibrada.

22 oz bottle. Pours hazy orange with tall, long lasting, fluffy white head and nice lacing. Aroma is of citrusy hops, tropical fruit and caramel malt. Body is full and tangy. Citrusy and piney hops, alcohol, caramel and bready malt and ripe fruit fill the mouth. Finish is long, dry, and grapefruity. Excellent brew.

Pours a light golden yellow with thick, white, frothy head. Aroma is strong citrus, with some grass and piney, bitter hops. Flavor is very hoppy, bitter, fruity, lots of citrus, some grass. Bitter finish. Very, very good.
UPDATED: OCT 13, 2016 Botella de 650 cl, en tienda XXXII. Color dorado oscuro. Sabor a lupulo, citrico, ligeramente afrutado, a malta. Una IPA espectacular.
cereal, spruce, citrus, dark golden color, hazy, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, very bitter, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish,

Clear amber, off white head. Aroma is lots of sweet tropical fruits and citrus on a sweet malty base. Taste is sweet malts and fruit again followed by citrus and strong resinous hoppy notes. Perfect long lasting bitter dry finish. Excellent IPA.

Clear nutty brown with big frothy white head. Aroma of cinnamon, green plums, butter. Very dry on the palate with flavours of nuts, leather, coffee. Long finish, very dry. Delicious but a but overpowering with the high alcohol.

Perfect IPA- aromatic, rich flavored and has enough body to be spiied not drinked. Pours pale amber with some orange notes, thick, rich lasing top. Aroma is so complex and intense - malty sweetness backboned it just allows you to be seduced by citrus, pine, resin, sweet fruity hops dance on your nose. Taste is medium sweet and very nice balanced by medium+ hops bitter, leaving resiny, piney aftertaste. Medium+ body, thick-oily texture, soft carbonation, long, pleasant, mild resiny finish. Complex, flavorfull, enjoyable.

Bomber poured into a pint glass. A nice hazy orange/amber color with a frothy white head. An aroma of resiny hops and floral notes with a distinct malt sweetness. One of the most solid and true west coast IPAs I have had. Pick one up!

650 ml bottle at The Local Pub. Orange copper color, slightly hazy, with an off-white head. Aromas of pine, grass with some citrusy notes. Taste of caramel, pine, grass, lemon, orange, tangerine, pretty nice. Btter aftertaste, long and dry. Medium body with low carbonation.

Pours cloudy pale yellow fading to orange with lots of carbonation and a large foamy white head. A bit of wet lacing. Powerful aroma of sweet tropical fruits like tangerine and a touch of pine. Taste starts sweet with tangerine citrus that flips quickly to grapefruit and then a rich resonated piney hop bitterness that lingers. Mildly bitter aftertaste with an echo of citrus. Well-balanced with a subtle caramel malt backbone and a solid relatively dry mouthfeel that is neither overly carbonated nor cloying. This is a no-nonsense, straight-up outstanding AIPA.

Bottle to glass. Pours a slightly hazy golden light amber color. Aroma is caramel malts, light citrus, fleshy fruit, pine. Flavor is fleshy fruit sweetness with a good malt background. Light to medium in body with a lingering fruity sweetness. Delicious. Theres a reason this beer tops the list.

Color anaranjado y abundante y persistente espuma. El aroma es impresionante, pura ipa americana. Fruta dulce, madura, uva y algo de resina. Todavía mejor el sabor, con un equilibrio perfecto entre el comienzo dulce a caramelo y el final amargo. Cuando se atempera sube en intensidad el caramelo, parece casi una red ale.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2014 Nice hazy orange color with a two finger head. Aroma is pine, citrus, grapefruits and slight caramel. Taste is piney and citrus. A balanced beer with a nice bitter finish. Just a great balanced beer. Just a great IPA. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Reddish golden with a big, thick head. Resiny aromas with a nice caramel malt and grapefruit/pine flavor.

I finally found my notes on this tasting session shared with the one and only Jimthechap. There isnt much more for me to say of this great beer. This was a great looking darkish gold ale, not coppery though, but nice and turbid. Creamy white head. A whole bowl of lychees and the most exotic asian fruits on the aroma, but on top theres guava and the best: passion fruit. Pine and grapefruits on the flavours, never too bitter, resinous, almost sticky. Perfection...almost.

Golden-yellow color with a nice white frothy head. Aroma is incredibly floral and fruity (grapefruit, orange) with a strong sweet malty backbone. The taste is fruity grapefruits and a dominant hoppy bitterness all the way through. Accompanied by the sweetness of the malts. Perfect balance! Very smooth and hop forward at the same time! Medium carbonation. One of the best IPAs I ever had.

A world class IPA, and one that deserves the big hype around it. It is perfectly balanced, big hop character, grapefruit, citrus. Has a decent malt base without getting viscous or bready. Taste is mostly dry.

Excellent, excellent exemplar of the style.

Ruby golden color with fine off white head. Light aroma of trip al fruits, apricot and grapefruit and caramel malt aroma. Palette is malty sweet feel with very nice hop balance. Delicious bitter finish that builds as the beer warms up.

Pours copper color with off white head. Sweet citrus grapefruit aroma. Caramel malt start followed by citrus fruitiness. Finish is grapefruit zest and resiny pine. Some lingering bitterness. A solid IPA.
A clean finish very nice balance of hops and malts.  Could be a little bit hoppier for my taste, but overall very solid iPA

Poured from 22oz bottle. I have drank this beer dozens of times...just realized tonight that I had not rated it before. Its funny...Alesmith gets all the press for Speedway Stout...this beer is an underrated winner. Aroma is a dank dank hop bomb. Taste is some grapefruit, pine and some nice sweetness. Always love this one.
Drank recently at Mikkelar at Mason Street in San Fran and at Pizza Port Solana Beach - awesome smooth IPA that tastes as though its not nitro - no lemon or oak s=distractions - a truly bar setter.
Bottle. Hazy amber pour with white head. Aroma is surprisingly malty. Taste is very balanced. Lots of complex notes. Lovely

On tap at Ridgewood (Raleigh). 

Pours a pretty semi-clear amber with white head. Nice hoppy aroma. Taste is a touch bitter (not bad) with the hops coming through powerfully at first, but then fading sharply. Aftertaste remains, but this beer somehow seems empty. Very odd. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours beautifully with a large head. Leans toward amber in color. Pine and resin dominates both the nose and taste. Very little citrus flavors if at all. Nice dry finish.

Keg at the Alesmith tasting room, 18/04/14.
Clear golden with a moderate off white covering.
Nose is bitter hops, mango, grapefruit, pine, straw.
Taste comprises grapefruit, pine resin, bitter hops, orange pith, caramel malt.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi aggressive hop bitterness in the close.
Decent well made IPA with a good balance.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: From bomber to glass. Citrus, resin and pine marry well in the aroma with bread and cracker malts. Pours clear gold with white head. Taste is balanced in the same manner as the aroma, with an overt bitterness that works well. Well made in all respects.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2014 Bomber from Yankee Spirits in Sturbridge, MA.  Pour is a mostly clear golden amber with a fluffy white head.  Aroma is dank and spicy hops mixed with sweet citrus.  Notes of ripe orange, pineapple, grapefruit.  Taste is near perfection. Lots of sweetness and spicy bitterness throughout, with the hops slowly escalating into a smooth bitterness that is held in check with a bready fruity sweetness.  Mild bitterness and orange linger between sips.  Can't find anything wrong with this beer that comes to mind.
Not the hopmonster that many West Coast IPAs aspire to being. Its malty at first and INCREDIBLY well-balanced. Its at once different and great.

On tap at Pizza Port Ocean Beach. Am I tasting the same beer? At best a competent IPA that, whilst clearly well made, is rather safe and subdued, and bereft od standout character. Sensible hop levels and really quite dry. 100pts?

Bottle from Total Wine. Pours hazy gold with off with head. Smells of grapefruit and pine. Taste does not match, which makes it really interesting. Tastes of malt first then long, subtle hop finish with a little pineapple worked in. Very good and very, very interesting.

One of my favorite ipa. Aroma somewhat lacking but mouthfeel and taste very good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

When I saw that I had given this a total score of 4.4 I thought "That cant be right". Because I made a detour after purchasing this bomber, I drank it at a slightly warmer temperature than recommended. That just seemed to intensify the aroma and flavor. I could not come up with a reason to lower my score. Well done!!
Clear golden color, 2 finger white head. Citrus, piney hops. Big hop taste, citrus and pine again. Finishes bitter. One of the best!
On draft. Aroma of hazelnuts. Dense lacing. Rich copper color. Malts are forward, with some hop-driven flavors of licorice and grapefruit. Chewy nuttiness on the finish. Eastern-style.

Bottle pour. Really clean orange in glass. A moderate head. Aroma of grapefruit, honey and pine. Really draws you in. Taste is orange sherbet with pine nut bitterness. Bright. Some pepper on the back end. Graham cracker maltiness is layered in throughout. Amazing mouth feel. Lively, but also somewhat creamy. Highly enjoyed.

Thanks to Cantabrian, generous to a fault.
It was hyperactive in the glass with a volunimous head, a faintly hazy orange-gold body. It was a fragrant critter: mango, gooseberry, grapefruit, lime, oranges, papaya, guava, lychee... imagine a tropical fruit and list it, it was all-encompassing.
It was riotously bitter with a medium body and extreme bitterness. It was clean and tangy and then mellowed but retained its intense juicy, lime peel character.
Rewarding and luscious.
UPDATED: APR 28, 2014 Great beer! Poured a bomber into a goblet. Had a nice head and a great hoppy aroma. Tasted the piney citrus flavor right away and finished clean

Bottle from a trade. Shared with Edgar in small snifters. Pours a beautiful golden amber with a thick white fluffy head. Head lasted and lacing took place. The aroma is pine, resin, light citrus and malty notes to balance. Also some light spices. The taste was incredible balance between piney hops and somewhat sweet malts. The texture was smooth and medium bodied. The finish was pine, slight bitterness, fresh cut grass and sweet malts. Great IPA.
22 oz draft pours an orange color with a nude white head. Aromas of pine, citrus, light malt. So smooth, incredibly balanced, just an incredible ipa
Clear orange pour, crisp white head and insane lacing. Aroma of citrus, mango, onion, and pine. Taste is crisp citrus, earthy pine, and juicy fruit notes. Fanfuckingtastic.

From a bomber. Color is light amber. Aroma is some malt and some hop dankness. Taste is extremely well balanced. Malt sweetness and citrus and floral hops seem to intertwine, though the hops come out on top, but not by a lot. An excellent IPA.

Bottle from City Beer. Pours light amber. A little bit of white head. Pine, hop, citrus and grapefruit nose. Medium bitterness. Medium to thick body. Medium to high carbonation. Hop, grass, peach, resin, pine, some grapefruit, citrus. Very good!

Bomber. A few months old, but holding up well. Need to try fresh. Pours orange gold with a clingy off white head. Aromas of grapefruit, flowers. Slightly caramel backbone with a touch of nut behind plenty of tangerine, grapefruit hop. Finish is grapefruit peel and pine.
Bottle. One of the best! Pours a clear yellow with nice white head. Nose is orange and tangerine Nice lacing. The taste is medium bitter with some sweetness. Dry finish.
After a long hiatus I started out with this - its aggressive and full of flavour
Solid ipa, citrus, almost a creamy orange hit up front, with bitterness right behind. Good stuff!
On tap. Orange pour. Hoppy aroma. Crisp citrus flavor with a little bitter at the end. Very good single IPA.

Ruby hued liquid sprouts soapy white bubbles and decent lace. Smells dankly hoppy, a touch caramely. Not the freshest of hops, but I see what's going on. Hop bitterness backs against the caramel malts, finishes a tad bitter and piney. Solid.
Orange pour, big foamy head. Beautiful. Aroma of citrus and resin. Bitter and crisp flavor. Lots of grapefruit and some grassy notes.

22 oz bottle, bottled on 1/6/14. Pours clear light copper with a big frothy off white head that retains well and laces the glass some.

The aroma is sweet caramel malt, tropical fruit and dank piney hops.

The flavor is sweet bready caramel malts with tropical fruits and a lot of dank resiny hops. The mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with slightly spritzy carbonation.

Overall, a very solid IPA.

Bottle, 7.25%. Fat grapefruit hop aroma with a little bread. Hazy amber colour. Good stable whitish head. The flavour starts off quite bitter, clean grapefruit. Also has a good fruity hoppiness. Flavourful and well-balanced.

Bottle. Pours very slightly hazy amber with stable off-white head. Intense, hoppy flavour, with subtle notes of grass. Bitter, very hoppy flavour, with notes of grass and pronounced citric touches. Lingering, hoppy aftertaste. Very good, but just mainstream.. Still, good.

Bottled 01/14. Very nice hoppy bouquet of white fruits, pine, and flora. Partly cloudy orange body with fair white foam. Typical West Coast flavors. Mix of bitterness, citrus and pine. The finish is better than average though. Dry, smooth with some residual sweetness.

Great beer al around. Nice hoppy start, really clean and crisp that finishes very smoothly. Great bronze color with a nice head and even carbonation. This will be a new standard in the cellar.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap @ Roberta's. Super dank pine hop aroma, citrus. Pretty bitter taste, piney, orange zest, malt backbone, well balanced, sweet and pine aftertaste. Very solid IPA. Medium to full mouthfeel
mangoes,melons, peaches, dragon-fruit, kiwi, pears....this is the best single IPA Ive ever tasted. smells and looks amazing. But the taste on this world class beer is incredible. wow. PERFECT.

Poured from 22oz bottle at Mister A's is San Diego, CA. Really nice version of a west coast IPA. Smooth piney opening with a bit of citrus, good mouthfeel, and a nice hoppy finish b

--you've been Dubbed.
Trade with Boltz7555. a very well balanced ipa aromas of citrus and taste is well balanced with hints of citrus and pine. it has a feel closer to a dipa but still goes down smooth, damn solid ipa:

On tap at Alesmith. Pours burnt orange. Pine and citrus, some herbs and complexity, bitter finish. Alcohol just the way I like. However, this seems a little overrated compared to the other amazing IPAs coming up in San Diego. It was our least impressive place/IPA from the 5 or 6 we visited. A few years ago, it might have been different...

Finally got a chance to try this beer after reading about Alesmith for the past several years. Poured from a bottle. The pour is light copper, almost deep golden, very clear, and a thick raucous head. Theres a lot of pleasant aromas coming out of the glass, yes theres grapefruit, pine, and a very delicate floral note; ester-like, but not really. Also clearly evident is a deep dank herby hop. There is also a tangible sweetness in the aroma, but it is not caramel. Theres a lot going on here in flavor, you get a resiny hop flavor but at the same time theres a clean malt that is just slightly sweet. The finish is dry and the bitterness lingers. I am glad I tried it.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a nice clear golden color with white head. Incredible citrus aroma. Lot of grapefruit and some lemon. Hints of pine in the aroma. Taste follows the nose with big citrus hop flavor with a well balanced sweet malt backbone. Medium bodied with a smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Very drinkable. Goes down very smoothly and quickly. Just an incredible IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours an almost amber color. Beautiful nose of citrus. pine and resin. Super hop forward with a bitter, bitter finish. Very little malt comes through. Quintessential west coast IPA. Damn good beer.

pours orange gold with a thick and very persistent white head. aroma is strong citrus and floral. Taste is bright and hoppy. Some citrus comes through on the palate. Great moderately bitter finish with nice citrus and floral lingering in the sinuses. Wow! Awesome beer!

Beautiful IPA, one of the best out there!
Great aroma, taste, body...!

Pours dark orange with a very nice piney aroma. A lot of citrus in the body that finishes with a sweet touch of caramel.

Intenso aroma a frutas tropicales y cítricas es lo primero que uno percibe. Color ámbar y espuma consistente. Su amargor se ve perfectamente balanceada con el dulce de la malta, una verdadera explosión de sensaciones en boca. Cuerpo ligero, fácil de beber, alcohol imperceptible. Muy refrescante, una cerveza para beberla todo el día.

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2015 Pours a golden orange color with a fluffy white head. Hop, citrus, caramel, floral and malt aroma. Hop, citrus, dank, floral, pine, caramel, biscuit and malt flavors. Medium body and carbonation. Bitter but well balanced malt backbone. Hoppy finish.
More pine then citrus hop profile. Its a bright IPA but has some dank in the finish. Missing the palate and balance of a Sculpin. Very, very good, however, Im not sure it is the best IPA out there.
22oz bottle pours an amber color without much head. Lots of hops, and yet so mild and well balanced. Noticeable maltiness. More complex range of flavors than other IPA's.

Bomber into a tall Weihenstephan glass. Pours a thin looking orange caramel, lots of clarity in the tone and color, also a nice bronzed shade omits when held to the light. Head is large, beige, and frothy leavins ample lacing on the glass. Aroma is wonderful-> hoppy, fresh orange, grapefruit amongst citrus waves, pine and more hops. Smells exactly how I would want my ipa to smell. Taste is just as perfect as the aroma. a crisp and fullfilling hop blast at front, followed by a noticeable but not too extreme malt balance. Orange, pine, tangerince, peach and some distant cedar are joyfully bouncing around. Drinkability is again, perfect. Such an easy and enjoyable drinker while holding all the distictions an ipa should have. Abv is an added bouns, being on the higer side, as it is barely noticeable. All Im thinking about while drinking this is how wonderfully this beer is balanced. This is a top notch ipa.

22 oz bomber poured into IPA glass. Pours slightly dark golden with a huge frothy dirtwhite head. Aroma is loads of grape, pine, grass and orangepeel. Taste is nicely balanced with tropical fruits, medium bitterness and breadcrumbs. Dont know how old it was but lacked a bit of the "hoppy punch" to score it higher. Either way a solid IPA.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein orangegoldenes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch intensiv malzig, fruchtig herb. Geschmack sehr mild fruchtig bitter nach exotischen Früchten.

22oz bomber- nice lemon aroma. Vanilla, citrus and a touch of pine flavor. Nice juicy pomelo on the finish, definitely a nice balance to the bitterness. Very good.

A very sweet candy flavor with a nice malt quality. The backbone of this is definitely hoppy. A great beer.

Pours a crystal clear orange gold with a Rocky white head. Aroma is fresh citrus and pine hops. Taste starts off citrus mellows in the middle which fades to reveal pine and a dry lingering bitterness in the finish.

Tap at Alesmith. Pours a hazy gold with billowing white head. Lots of grapefruit and pine on the nose and tongue, very weak malt profile. Smooth and crisp, no lingering or off-putting flavors.

In my kegarator. It smells like an IPA, but not too strong. Golden copperish and clear. Tastes nearly perfect. Reminds me of a Smutty IPA only missing the grapefruit. Been drinking a lot of this and it is consistently better in my kegarator than the other cali ipas Ive tried in it (Racer 5, Stone, Lil Sumpthin). This is a perfect house beer.
UPDATED: FEB 24, 2014 Bottle. Transparent amber with white head. Aroma if hops. Taste of hops and citrus. Bitter hops aftertaste. Fantastic beer.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2015 On tap poured into a 4oz shaker. Sweet smells of toffee with undertones of orange, tangerine, and peaches accompanied by floral notes and some resin. It pours a clear yellow topped by a fluffy white head. The head recedes, but it leaves a nice lacing down the glass. The taste is that of a medium bitter balanced with a medium sweetness. This medium bodied beer has an oily texture with foamy carbonation. Its mostly a toffee flavor on the mouth with citrus, pine, and light resin, but finishes smooth, dry, and clean with resin and bread crust and a light citrus rind aftertaste.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2014 22 oz Bomber. The beer pours to a dark golden/ amber color with a very large head. The aroma has pine, resin, stone fruit & some grapefruit. The taste has a strong citrus pine flavor with a nice malt backbone giving it a very well balance flavor. Overall a very well rounding IPA with great flavor & aroma.

Pours light amber with a frothy, white head. Nose is honeyed hop. Taste is bitter with heavy fruity notes. Big grapefruit in the nose, while sipping. Medium body, lively carbonation, astringent finish. Very nice IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Purchased at Woodmans in Kenosha, WI; enjoyed with a friend prior to playing a show in Milwaukee, WI. This stuff is awesome, happy that I shared it. Appearance is a nice slightly cloudy gold with a rich white head. Aroma of pine and citrus hops. Taste is smooth for an IPA with a great piney bitterness. Definitely a high caliber brew for the style, I can see why it's so highly rated. A+ brew.
Nice hops, plenty of malt. Citrus, tropical, floral. Malt overpowers the hops. Pretty good though...

Deep golden, and a nice head. Nice malty sweetness, then fades to a dry finish with a lingering hoppiness. Strong piney-citrusy character, with vanilla in the background. Lives up to its expectations even though the one i had was about 8 months old.
22 oz bomber poured into a tumbler..nice golden color..really good citrus, hop aroma..tastes same with dry finish..very good IPA.

Bottle. Pours a crystal clear amber color with a moderate light tan head on it. Nose has some great hop elements up front, with some floral notes that quickly descend into a bold grapefruit tone. Taste is actually a little crisp. It starts off rather dry and bitter, with just a hint of sweetness in the aftertaste. Very pleasant drink...

Translucent amber with thin white head and big chunky, bubbly, sticky legs. Aroma is faint, honey and grapefruit/lemon, some yeasty hop and pepper and tiny bit of malt in the background. Taste is sweet for a second and then becomes bitter, spicy and dry with a long clean sharp finish. Wish there were more malt to the taste. A little watery. Body is medium, crisp with a touch of oiliness. Not bad - definitely improves as it warms up - but not exciting. I was expecting more from the > 4.0 rating!

Clear golden pour, thin head, minimal lacing. Citrus peel and honey aroma. Bitter piney taste to start, honey, citrus. Decent palate. Bitter finish. May have set my expectations too high - solid IPA but not too exciting.

Aroma: intensive hops, citrus, tropical fruits, pine. Appearance: golden orange, large head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: medium sweets continue, hoppy bitterness appearing, dry long finish.Overall: amazing IPA - lives up to its reputation. Bottle at Cask Pub and Kitchen, London.

Altogether a good IPA . Maltier than sculpin and not quite a complex hopeise

Bomber shared by my bro. Orange-amber with a thin white head. Quite dank, lots of caramel, pine, burnt sugar, a little cat pee. Medium body, very limp carbonation. Flavour us similar to the nose, too dank for me; dry with pretty good bitterness and a burnt sugar and dank finish.

Bottle. Pours Amber with white head that lingers. Nice hop aroma with light carbonation. Nice complexity in a grapefruit and resin ipa.

Poured from a bomber bottled on 10/3/2013 into a duvel glass. 

Strong orange zest aroma. 

Well balanced between hops and malt backbone. Not as tropical dankness as I like, might be because the bottle is 4 months old. 

Very good beer, just not my ideal IPA. Maybe due to the age of the bottle.

Poured from a bomber. Smallish white head, golden brown color. Lemon and pine aroma and taste. Perfect carbonation and balanced bitterness round out this wonderful IPA. Big hop taste!

22 oz. bottled two months ago, clear golden orange with bright white sticky head. Bright, clean aroma of fresh hops with floral notes. Flavors are less sweet and syrupy than most IPAs, the beer has a crisp, tingly fresh carbonated aspect that competes with its bitter, almost salty hop dimension. A very fresh-tasting, clean IPA. A standout among standard IPAs for sure.

Bomber into snifter glass, almost 2.5 months on it. Golden color with amberish hue, white head. Aroma of strong fruity citrus hops (grapefruit, orange), slight pine and a hint of caramel malt. Taste adds notes of strong tropical fruit (pineapple, mango, some berries), resin, somewhat herbal/dank quality balanced nicely with an almost honey-like sweetness. Light body, low carbonation, sticky with dry sweet bitter finish. Strong yet balanced, taste lingers long after finish. Very good IPA.

Really good IPA. Very straight fwd. If looking to intro a buddy to the style this is a great place to start.... Thats not to say this is a beginners IPA....it IS very classic and well made. RECOMMEND

22oz. Bottle. Smells awesome. Grapefruit citrus and pine. Pours clear amber with a thick white head with good lacing. Taste follows nose-citrus, pine, with great malt presence. Resinous bitter hops make for a long dry finish. Outstanding.

22oz Bottle, thanks <pinkzambia> Sligtkly hazy light orange/golden with a small off-white head. Nice forward fresh hop aroma and flavors. Mostly of the citrusy type. Straight forward and tasty.
Bottle: Clear gold with a solid white head. Great aroma of grapefruit rind, juniper and citrus. Solid IPA with bitter hops flavors as well as grass. It has a nice rubbery, dry aftertaste.
Good beer, but the bitterness is not balanced by other flavors. It finishes clean so some people will really like this ipa.

Thick creamy head clear amber body. Sweet hoppy aroma not too strong. Flavor is full balance hops and malt with pine aftertaste not strong bitterness. Mouthfeel is super smooth with moderate carbonation. I can see why this is the highest rated ipa.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2016 Just bringing this one back to reality.  From a bottle, 3 months old.  No faults to speak of, and really balanced.  A resinous, classic IPA no doubt - but not quite a perfect aroma or appearance.   Slight stale sweetness creeping in at 3 months old.  Buy it fresh or on tap.
Growler from Casanova, 24 hours after fill.  Really solid IPA.  Oozes the juicy dankness similar to the excellent Pseudo Sue, but with more of a balanced IPA approach to it.  Nothing extreme, just tasty all around.  This is a quintessential IPA in my book.  Juicy, dank, perfect bitterness in the end, well-carbonated into a nice retronasal.  +2 overall.  10+5+9+4+18=4.6
Pours a clear rusty orange with fluffy white head that lasts and leaves great lacing. Aroma is well balanced with floral hops, citrus, pine, and sweet caramel as it goes down the glass. Taste is dank citrus, pine, with an ideal malt/hop, sweet/bitter balance in the aftertaste. Palate is smooth and goes down easy. Right in the center of the IPA balance spectrum, with Sculpin on the left and Furious on the right. Balanced rather than extreme, and therefore probably the best IPA to introduce someone to the style. 10+5+9+4+16=4.4
Super solid. Poured from bomber deep orange, yet clear. Plenty of off white foam. Very good example of a proper IPA.
Quality stuff. Aromas of pine and some interesting fruitiness. Tastes flavors are resinous and pee. Shine fruit too. Excellent.

Belle couleur ambrée. Au nez, on sent subtilement le houblon. En bouche, l'amertume est présente mais non envahissante ce qui laisse la place au houblon pour s'exprimer. La finale vient un peu trop vite a mon goût. Donc bonne bière, mais pas exceptionnelle selon moi

I really liked this beer. Light golden hue, good head, and best of all great lacing. That translates to wonderful creaminess. A great beer for a child late night.

Flowery aroma with a golden color. Some malt character with a hop bite at the end. Some lingering aftertaste.

Pours a clear amber colour with a frothy off-white head. Aroma is malt, pine, grapefruit, citrus and hops. Taste is medium sweet leading to a beautifully balanced, hoppy and lightly fruity finish. Flat out, just a bloody well made IPA. Pure and simple!

Incredible balanced tropical fruit and piney resin smell. Lingering hop resin flavor that lasts for miles. This is the best ipa I have ever tried. Its got almost a champagne like dryness, and full glory while it sits on the tongue

Malt first then the hops - balanced and potent - good herbal hop load - very satisfying.

Looks like Im ushering this beer into the Beers of Fame list with the 1000th review! Welcome to the club!

Bottled: unk

Pours honey with an etched surface and soapy white rim. Notes of grapefruit, honey, biscuit, resin, peach and a bit of grass; relatively malt forward for a CA IPA. Flavor is sweet and honey like. Not particularly bitter, plenty of lemon and tangerine, but nothing particularly assertive. I think the malts are overpowering in this example, and the bitterness needs a bit of help queuing up. Medium bodied with nice, slightly hi and sharp carb and an off dry finish. Decent beer, and Id suggest it to an IPA newcomer. I wouldnt suggest it to a tried hop-head. Too much malty sweetness is similar to the 90min IPA.

Serving type: bottle

09-06-2012

Bomber pour..ultra fresh for the east coast..bottled 11/12/13..cool date indeed for this impressive ipa..medium ipa color that starts with 2 finger frothy head that manages to last a bit and ultimately leaves ring around..aroma is as bottle states grapefruit..tangerine..getting some apricot.peach.mango action also..mouthfeel is sublime.very smooth.hop profile is nailed perfectly and seems like layers of hops build upon each other and leave a hop resin but without wrecking the palate or even coming close..bitterness is perfect and as stated on bottle the malt bill is done well also to round things out..clearly one of the better IPAs around..great match for cabot clothbound cheddar..awesome stuff..
Bomber bottle in IPA glass. White, think head. Smell has pine, citrus, fruit aroma. Balanced hoppy taste with citrus, pine and sweet malty aftertaste. Medium carb.
Bärnstensfärgad med mellanstort ljust skum som stannar kvar! Humlig doft med tropiska frukter och malt! Samma i smaken och lite bitter! Grym öl!
Pour from a growler last weekend. Clear amber in color, nice white head. Lots of citrus and hops. Quite nice.
Bottle. Copper color with an off white head. All I got was floral pine in the nose. Nice sticky pine and light citrus flavor. I havent had this since I started rating and forgot how good it is.

belle couleur ambre clair, le nez est un peu fermé malheureusement (le voyage lui a surement fait un peu de mal) mais on sent déjà apparaître les fruits exotiques, le pamplemousse, et un côté très résineux. La bouche est par contre magnifique, sur la mangue, lananas, le litchi, le pamplemousse, la résine. La texture est très agréable, jamais trop sèche, la puissance parfaitement maîtrisé. Très bonne longueur, le fruit reste jusquau bout.

32 day old bomber into a pint glass. Good up front, but I didnt like the finish - metallic and dusty. Also, in the description - trademark attorneys send C&D letters about trademark infringements, not patent attorneys...

From a bottle. Pours almost clear copper gold with a thick off white head and minimal lacing. Tastes hoppy, like pine, citrus, musk, malt. Bitter and slightly sweet. Medium body and low/medium carbonation. Smells like sweet malt, orange, and pine.

Bottle. Pours by extremely clear, bright amber with thick, frothy off-white head. Aroma is grassy, floral, and dank hops, biscuit and cereal malts, pine resin, and light citrus fruit. Flavor is a great balance of dry malt base, grassy and pine hops, light citrus esters, and faint caramel sweetness; dry finish with just a touch of bitterness. Medium body and low carbonation.

Bottle shared with sonnycheeba and snoworsummer. Pours transparent darker gold with a thick layer of off white head. Aroma of very floral hops. Taste of bitterness with citrus throughout and nice carbonation.

Resinous, pine tar syrup aroma. Hazy orange look. High level bitterness, funky malt sweetness, medical mid-palate experience. Smooth in its own way, still too much bite to be a bar session ale. I was not blown away by this and wouldnt call it the equal of, say Sierra Nevadas best IPAs, which is half their range.

22 oz bottled on 10/2 purchased at Tipsys. Gold and clear with a lasting white head and light lacing. Fresh grapefruit, citrus and tropical fruit aroma with pine and bitter, resinous hops. Medium body with a dry finish. Very good, would love to try a super fresh one.
Amber with a faint white crown. Aroma of caramel, citrus, pine and mild floral notes. Taste of citrus, caramel, light fruit and faint pine with a medium bitter ending.
Kinezete a nagy atlag. Viszont az ize es az illata rendkivul kiegyrnsulyozott. Klasszis.

Bomber in La Jolla. Pours deep orange with little to no head. Tropical nose that is surprisingly over-powered by some interesting resinous notes. Taste is pleasantly bitter with relatively clean finish. A darn good beer.
Bottle Pours a copper color with white head. Citra, orange, grapefruit, fruity hop aromas. Grapefruit, slight bitter, slight pale malt, citrusy flavors. Pretty damn good.

Bottle from BevMo Mira Mesa. pours orange with an inch of white foam. leaves a shitload of lacing in the glass. fairly citrusy on the nose. has some floral notes on the tongue. Has a fair amount of lacing. Its quaffable but I cant see this as the best IPA in the world.

Lune de mes IPA favorites. Parfums complexes et légère amertume, le tout très bien équilibré. Avec un peu de corps et un consistance légèrement huileuse qui donne de la longueur en bouche tout en restant très rafraîchissante. 
Tous les gens qui lont goûtée, même ceux qui ne sont pas fans dIPA, ont vraiment apprécié !

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2013 This is one of my favorite IPAs. Beautiful golden amber color with a flavorful aroma . Smooth hoppy flavor with a mild citrusy  aftertaste . This is one on my go to beers and with a 7.25% ABV it will give you a quick buzz in no time     ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden, clear, white foam, medium bitterness, medium body, long finish. Ive been in a bit of an IPA rut lately, trying new things, and this was a definite slump-buster, right in my wheelhouse. Definitely a keeper!

Re-rate. After having this as my top IPA years ago, I had a bottle in Portland earlier in the year and was underwhelmed. Now that its on the shelves in Colorado and I have a few more bottles under my belt, the verdict isnt good: A lot of pine sap / resin, caramel, orange oil and diacetyl levels ranging from medium to mild. One bottle was overrun with buttery solvent, another had only a hint. Ive noticed the same in the X and ESB. Its sweet, chewy and thick, bitter and a little pasty / vitamin-like. Given the flaws and undesirable hop and yeast flavors, AleSmith is now on my Do Not Purchase list given their inconsistency. Its a shame that people new to beer will continue to look at AleSmith as an example of well-made products when they make them so carelessly now.  But maybe the diacetyl threshold is low enough for most drinkers not to notice.
Amber color with a resilient head. Aroma is citrus & pine, flavor ads some mature stone fruit & spice. The aftertaste is slightly bitter, but all in all, thus is one fine IPA

I had wanted to rate this as my 100th IPA a threshold I crossed about 2 1/2 years ago... I decided Golden Nugget was worthy of that benchmark at the time. So 100 IPA rates later, Alesmith IPA gets to be my 200th

Pours a hazy golden with a big head and nice lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is hoppy, and with a nice multi dimensional hop character, its leafy, fruity, with light floral notes. Altogether juicy, pungent and inviting. 

The flavor is lost of fruit forward hoppiness, plenty of juicy character, good citrus & fruit rind. The bitterness is at a moderate level and is very satisfying. The beer is dry without being bone dry or without some light sticky maltiness in the background. The finish is nice and dry though.

Pretty nicely put together beer.

22oz bottle pours clear dark golden orange with big 2 finger head. Nose is fruity citrus, clementine, orange rind. Mouthfeel is smooth, some maltiness, medium bodied. Taste is orange, peach, pineapple, Juicy Fruit gum. Finish is a layer of tropical fruity notes over balanced mild grassy bitterness. Awesome.

A little hazy, dark gold color. Nice soapy head.

Sweet tropical aroma, beautiful mango and pineapple.

Decent amount of carbonation. Much mire bitter on the palate than the nose would suggest. Pretty dry with effervescence lingering. More vegetable hop qualities on the back end. Goes down easy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Amazing beer. Sharp, crisp first drink with slap yo mama hops and pine then smooth, refreshing finish. Malt? We dont need no stinking malt!! Amazingly light for an IPA. Definite must try.

The gold standard for IPA's. Very light and hoppy. It is my go to IPA for people looking to branch out. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Botella 65 cl. en el Lúpulo Feroz. Agradable olor a malta y cítricos. Cerveza de color ambar con una espuma muy persistente, densidad media. Sabor duradero a lúpulo y cítricos frescos.
UPDATED: OCT 27, 2013 Botella 65cl. en el Lupulo Feroz. Increible olor a lúpulo y gran sabor aunque un poco mas suave de lo esperado, es una de mis IPAs preferidas. Casi un 10

Bottle. Pours clear pale orange with a rocky to creamy head that leaves fantastic lacing. Aroma is grapefruit, grass, caramel. Medium sweet, lightly bitter, hop forward with solidly aromatic fruitiness. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation with a clean bitter and sweet finish. Beautifully balanced. Yummy!

Bomber pours a clear copper with a huge off-white head. Aroma of citrus, slight resin, hop spice, caramel malt, and yes a hint of vanilla. Taste is an up front mild bitterness with citrus and pine, caramel malt bread in the middle and finishing bitter and dry. A very nice well rounded IPA! Even better at the price.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2014 Pours hazy golden with a two fingers of whiteish brown head. Head is stickey and laces glass. 

Smells of malt, hops, carmel and pine. 

Sweet and then bitter taste. Mouthfeel is smooth with low carbonation. 

Very very balanced ipa. Not to malty not overly hoppy. Roasts malt and carmel hits up front then a bitter floral hop, grapefruit taste after. 

This one is pretty unique for how balancd and complex it is

Pours a very clear medium gold with a nice off-white head that collapses with large bubbles. Very piney hop aroma but not biting like some very hoppy aromas. Smooth, crisp and clean in the mouth. Nice hope flavor without being over the top. Seems pretty balanced despite seeming to have one overwhelming flavor - fresh and delicious hops. Very good beer and very easy to drink.
Bomber. Bright orange with large head. Malty and hoppy but not much citrus at all. Very very smooth. Dangerously easy to drink.
Bomber thanks to RespertFTW. Bright orange with a beige head. Smooth malt and mild hop aromas. Super clean and balanced.

Poured three fingers of head on a hazy, light straw colored body. 
The aroma is a basket full of mango, orange, lemon, honey and pine needles.
The taste is a sharp pine bitterness to start, a dry lemon bitter in the middle and finishes with the mildest touch of honey sweetness.
The texture is crisp with moderate carbonation.
Excellent aroma and flavor profile.

Poured from bottle to pint glass. Light golden with creamy white head. Aroma is citrus, pine, light sugars. Medium-light bodied with nice carbonation give this beer a really nice mouthfeel. A bit sweet initially with a well balanced bitterness that rounds everything out through the finish. Overall, Im very happy with this brew.

Bottle. Pours deep yellow with white head. Smells very fresh, floral, malty. Tastes very unusual for an IPA, bready, toast, malty, creamy, floral, hoppy finish. A nice sweeter style of IPA. Really good.

Gold/orange, fruchtig citrus/orange im aroma, süsslich fruchtig im antrunk, folgend von bittere, nachklang bitter

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice pine and citrus nose. Flavor follows suit. Really just a classic ipa.

Aroma is of hops and malt. Mostly a piney resinous hop aroma. Some floral, not much of the citrus fruity hops. Taste is full flavored fairly well balanced, but dominant hop flavor is piney and resinous. Enjoyable traditional west coast ipa, but I prefer some more of the virus and floral hops to balance. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A nice, dry, hoppy IPA with a lot of malt. Nothing really unique on the palate- some grapefruit and hay, mildly bitter finish. Not a lot of tropical flavors or interesting pine resin... Good but not exciting.

Great IPA but not the best. The aroma is strong with lots of deep orange peel. The flavor is better as it warms, but still it is somewhat less than the aroma would lead one to believe. There is something missing in the depths of the flavor profile here--think about it, and youll agree. The finish is very bitter with a slightly smooth characteristic on the final note. Overall, its a good,even great song...but there are better...
The instant I tasted this beer I was overwhelmed by the flavor of pineapple. Very tasty and easy to drink IPA. Not overly hoppy.

Fantastic citrus and sweet malty aromas. A nice medium-full body. Medium-low bitterness with plenty of bright, citrus sweetness. It's got a lingering hoppy finish. I recommend drinking in a frosty mug, inhaling nasally while sipping because the nose on this ale is phenomenal. Great American IPA.

Drank at a friends. Strongly hopped and sweet, maybe a bit too sweet. Taste is similar to Arrogant Bastard.

On tap @ Alesmith. Pours deep golden yellow with a good eggshell white head. Aroma is fresh grapefruit, floral, pine, and citrus. Taste is fresh grapefruit juice, citrus, pine and bitter sweet malt finish. Very balanced medium bodied IPA. Refreshing and one of my favorite local IPAs.

Bottle from cervezalandia. Dark golden and medium white head. Carbonation is soft and body is medium/thin. Taste is high bitter. Aroma is hoppy and lovely fruited. I would say its not over 4, but its a very very nice IPA.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2017 Pours a hazy rust orange with white head. Aroma of caramel malts and citrus and floral hops. A strong caramel malt, citrus hop, floral and pine taste. A refreshing medium body with a bitter hoo and sweet malt afteraste.
66cl at delirium cafe. Hazy yellow with a big white head. Very well balanced aroma and flavor. Moderate to heavy fruity, sweet, malty.

Good. Very bitter in-your-face IPA. Malt and hops have big presence here. Pine and ctirus hops. Well-balanced and tangy on finish as well. Average carbonation. Pours amber with good head and lacing. Bottle from Premier Gourmet.

Sweet piney citrusy aroma accompanies this light copper clear beer with a bit of white head. The taste is sweet and malty with a sweet aftertaste of cherries. The bitterness is there but not overwhelming. Its a smooth drinking Brew but not the ipa i was ecpecting. But good overall

650 mL bottle. It doesnt look like anything special, although it laces nicely. It smells pretty good, but the aroma doesnt knock you over or anything - citrus and a little spice. But the flavour is outstanding, and changes three or four times. The best part is this sweet citrus you get right before the end, which is then balanced by a perfect amount of bitterness in the finish. Great beer.

22oz bomber. Filtered orange-tan body. Foamy, steady, glass-lacing, white head. Nice and delicate mouthfeel, could be called medium bodied despite the relatively big ABV. Pretty much a classic West Coast IPA all the way, with quite an abundance of hop character, from rich piny grapefruit to soft peach-tangerine tones. Clean no frills golden malt, biscuity backdrop for the hops to shine in.  Pleasant pink grapefruit lingers in the aftertaste. Straightforward, reminds me of having my first few West Coast IPAs.
Pours an awesome golden haze. Solid across the board. Great palate, aroma and taste. Very nice balance of hops, citrus and pine. Super solid IPA.

Bottle dated April 2013. Although it is 4+ months old it still had a nice grapefruit nose although it was a bit malty. Taste was malty but had some nice grapefruit and tropical fruit tones. Slightly sweet but that could be due to the age. I bet this is a solid IPA when fresh.

Bomber bottle. Aroma has good hop smell with great floral aroma. Appearance is a little golden with some haze. Taste is a good hoppy dank flavor. Palate is bitter. Overall, a great ipa. Will buy again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ SlackerMads. Pours hazy orange with a diminishing and good lacing frothy white medium head. Aroma is pine, resin, biscuit, orange, grain, Grapefruit, papaya, lychee and Taste is moderate sweet and bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is moderate. Finishes dry and with a lingering bitterness.

The beer had a golden to dark golden hue with very little carbonation which made the beer very smooth going down. The am taste was pretty good and smooth but could have used a little more hop flavor to give it that extra kick 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Reviewed 9-7-10.

This is my 1st Alesmith product and I got it in a trade from MaxStout. Thank you!

A friend was supposed to join me tonight to split this, but plans fell through. I wish he could have made it. Dont get me wrong - it will be no problem for me to finish this bomber on my own (the ABV is not that high), but its much more fun to share a legendary brew like this with someone who knows the beer culture, and has fun (like I do) interpreting the brewers intentions.

I now have a bunch of these Alesmith products, so I guess I need to get used to the wax surrounded cap/neck huh?

Ap: Cloudy golden (almost amber-ish) color with a generous amount of carbonation and 1/2 inch head. Very standard for the style, yet still gorgeous. I love the foaminess - and there is plenty!

Ar: Grapefruit, caramel, pine, and with a malty orange-like backbone.

T: Surprisingly, not that bitter (ala Stone "Ruination"), and Ive got to admit that on my very first sip, I was a bit let down. Subsequent sips (actually gulps) there is tons of taste, the carbonation level is great, and the malt is definitely there (despite what others have stated on previous reviews). This beverage reminds me a bit of Founders Dry-Hopped Pale Ale (only I know its not dry hopped) only this is more extreme. Very balanced.

P: Although Im sure many will disagree, but I actually think this resembles an English IPA in its lack of upfront bitterness and its "malt before tongue-bruising" way. I respect that.

Overall: Does it deserve a place in the top 100? Its totally a flawless beer, but I still think ones such as Bells Two-Hearted, FFF Dreadnaught, and a few others more memorable. I think it still does....but I might have put it a bit lower in the rankings....my two cents.

NOTE AFTER SAMPLING FOR A BIT: Is this thing unfiltered? The foam never stopped throughout my entire session and the glass now looks like it went through a car wash on max setting. Maybe thats part of its charm.

Excellent. Great aroma of pine orange tangerine. Very crisp clean and crystal clear. Sounds strange to say balanced IPA as they are usually over top on hops, but it is certainly balanced. Bought at Sproudts Vista. 3.99 twenty two ounce bottle
Best IPA so far. Full simcoe aroma. Proper hop level for IPA. Cant point out any flaws.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2014 Bomber - poured like sunshine with frothy white head that lasted entire glass and had great lacing. Aroma - amazing grapefruit/ citrus scent with this pungent hop aroma in the background. Taste is thick caramel mixed with grapefruit and pungent sour hops!! Mouthfeel is medium and texture is creamy and goes down smooth and has bitter pungent bite at finish. Overall I was blown away by this beer. I don?t know if it was this good because it is super fresh(bottled 3 weeks before I drank) or this is the best IPA I have ever had!!! Thumbsup to Alesmith for another great beer!! Im adding to my rating because of how great this beer is. Had on tap and was pure heaven. The perfect balance of grainy malt and smooth sticky hops is amazing. My favorite IPA!!

Bomber. Pour is a beautiful deep golden color with a pillowy white head. Strong retention and lacing. Aroma is of grapefruit, pine, dank and some slightly sweet malt. Taste is crisp and somewhat dry. Piney hops, tropical fruit, and citrus notes abound. Very smooth and drinkable for the ABV. Incredibly solid IPA.
user_location: Menasha Red Light District, Wisconsin, USA

text: Bottle, Hotel Sofia. Pours golden with an off white head. Aroma of peach, floral and tropical fruits, some pine and malt. Flavor is sweet make and tropical fruits with some bitterness. Medium body, average carbonation.
Bottle. Pours orange with a white head. Aroma is citrus, pine, sweet malt. Flavor is citrus, floral, pine, caramel malt . Very nice.
Lys dunkel farve med lyst skum. Mye kraftig lukt av god humle. Smak av malt, karamell, sitrus og frukt. Vinmonopolet.
God duft av citrus og humle. Lite skum. Fin gulbrun gyllen farge. Nydelig smak av citrus og humle. Et øl å anbefale.

Bottle. Nice white head, orange-y color, very aromatic and citrus aroma, medium bodied, a little abrasive, stronger bitters up front with a lighter bitter finish. Great beer strong IPA a little over rated in my opinion but one cannot deny its a solid IPA.

2 weeks old. Welcome to Wisconsin! Amber pour with white frothy head and good lacing. Nose is dank grapefruit meat, citrus, caramel malt and mild pine. Flavor is leafy pine hop bitterness with bitter grapefruit rind, some citrus and a nicely present caramel malt backing. Mild alcohol/hop combo bite to the finish. Big coating mouthfeel between the hops and malt backbone.

Bold, golden color with a bright white head. The aroma is sweet and hoppy with pine and caramel. Well-balanced. Its interestingly sweet and well-hopped with flavor-forward hops. Overall, its a wonderful IPA in the fact that it really offers some great hop flavors, just enough sweetness to support those hops, and some seriously low bitterness. Its clean, fresh, an beautiful. Its so easy going down wow! Nice.

From draft. Color is amber with a nice head. Aroma is sweet and piney. Taste is great must drink

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a darkened gold, or light amber, depending on how you look at it. Pillowy and frothy, off-white head. Strong retention and tons of sticky lace. Light pine and lemon aroma. Resiny pine, lemon oil, and mild floral flavor notes. Solid body....grains are not very evident but round out this brew nicely. Very crisp, clean, and enticing. Finishes dry and mildly bitter. Solid Westy.

Bomber from Belmont Station. Cloudy bright amber with white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, and raisin. Nice sweet malt in the flavour with fruity hops, leading to pine flavours and a bitter finish. Thick and smooth mouthfeel. Great IPA!
Hazy deep gold. Very seducive blend of hops. Fruity, dry and herbal. White pepper, peaches and resin. Not extreme, just an exellent allround refreshment.

Draft at Beer Authority. Pours clear amber, nice white frothy head. Aroma pine, caramel, some urine. Taste - everything an IPA should be. Bitterness is assertive, but not harsh. Malt underpinning is just enough to support the featured hops, but without being too sweet. Average carbonation, medium body, smooth texture. Overall: one hell of a fine IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance was clear orange gold with diminishing white 2 finger creamy head, rings of lacing. Aromas are citrus, tropical sweet pale, crystal malts, no alcohol present. Taste are sweet malt upfront that gives way to hints of lemon, pine, orange, melon, grapefruits. Alcohol is masked well. Palate was soft smooth creamy CO2 with medium body, then lasting balanced hoppy malty finish. A wonderful balanced IPA, great drinkable brew.
Amazing IPA. The way that all IPAs should taste. Very fresh, hopy and super floral. Balanced bitterness. For sure one of the best I ever had.
his is complimented by a smooth citrusy grapefruit taste with a dry bitter finish.
Fantastic IPA. One of the most complex beers around.Excellent taste. Great body an consistent

Bottle to tulip
Citrus, pine, turnip, roasted malt and a light coconut. A touch hazy amber with a creamy beige head with good retention. Taste is hoppy, but not overbearing, a touch of caramel and crackers. Medium bodied, silky with a nice alcohol warmness.
I thought it was a good quality ipa. But I think I went into it with really high hopes as it was rated best ipa and I think I just was let down with the hype. Ill definitely try it again soon.

Draft - Earthy hops with a well balanced malt sweetness. Clear copper with a decent head. Pine and resin with a nice balanced malt profile. Bitterness is appropriate and body is light. An easy drinking IPA.

Well, I had never had this one, and being out of town, I was able to pick up some of this at the local store. It is IPA Day, so Im drinking it in my hotel room. Poured a vibrant, wonderful clear copper color with a nice, fluffy slightly off-white head. Aroma is powerful pine notes, resin. Flavor is a floral boquet, with hoppy pine notes. Juicy mangoes. Very very good. This may be the quintessential west coast IPA.

Brilliant orange copper with a small, foamy, white head. The aroma is very strong, with lots of grapefruit, resin, orange, and floral hops. Hint of caramel in the background. The flavor doesnt quite match. There is some baseline sweetness, followed by resinous bitterness and vanilla. Finishes dry and fairly bitter, but not over the top. Slightly boozy but not bad.
Has an amazing citrusy pine aroma. This is complimented by a smooth citrusy grapefruit taste with a dry bitter finish. Amazing beer
Amber in color, clear with a thin head. Nice IPA flavor and nice malt build. Is this perfect No but it was good.
This is truly an amazing IPA, one of the best I have ever had. Amazing aroma, balanced bitterness with a lot of grapefruit. Can drink this all night one of the best!

Ive had my fair share of IPAs, this one is excellent. Super balanced, extremely interesting aroma of floral, grass, resin, hops. Barely bitter, boozey flavors come out as it warms. A really, really great IPA.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2013 Bottle. Pours a dark, clean dark orange with lovey white fluffy head. Aromas of grapefruit, tangerine and orange with some pine and tropical fruit notes there too. Taste is much the same as the aroma, with tropical fruit and grapefruit dominating up front leading to a piney bitterness. Its like literally chewing through a juicy grapefruit. I love that!! Great beer, probably lives up to the hype. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled on 5/14/13

Pour a clear light amber with a couple of lazy bubbles floating up to the top. Fat bone white head that fell slowly leaving all kinds of lace to look at. Thick cap and ring. Nose is citrus, orange and grapefruit. Some tropical notes and it suggests pineapple while it never actually realizes any pineapple. Light pine, earthy. Sweet sugary malt and light bread. Floral. Taste is awesome grapefruit. Tongue drying, mouth watering, thirst quenching grapefruit. Gosh I can hardly imagine that a month ago this would have been even better. Slight bite from carbonation. Floral with a tiny bit of dank. Piney in the aftertaste. Finishes dry with a graceful bitter that did not overpower. Light bread gives a smooth and substantial body to the tart and dominant citrus. Malt sweetness is gentle honey. 

 Alesmith rarely disappoints. Their malts are smooth and tuned to the body of the beer. This was a terrific IPA that can stand on its own and be counted among the best IPAs. Not complex but a grapefruit lovers dream.
Deuce, pours a clear golden orange, sudsy white head. Big hoppy citrus scent. Taste is citrus hops with some pine and grass, balanced out with some light malt, slightly bitter. Clean finish.
Had this at brewery in 2007, but this review is by bottle. Translucent gold, thick white cap, excellent lacing. Aroma of biscuit, pine, toffee, grapefruit. Taste is very much the same.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2014 Golden orange. Medium frothy white head, lasting with lace. Aroma just beams with hops and at the same time it is delicate and nuanced, very juicy hops, fruity, tropical, citrus, grapefruit, pine, caramel to back it up. Flavor matches. Medium body. Sweet with a very pleasant resinous bitter finish. Soft and juicy. Smooth with great balance. Extremely drinkable. Really good; something special... UPDATE: "double dry hopped IPA" draft at brewpub. Amazingly fresh. Garden fresh. Forever drinkable..just disappears. Amazing.

aroma- pine, citrus, hoppy, refreshing.
tastes pretty hoppy, but not really too bitter. citrus, a little something sweet. a little dry at the end, but again not too bad. very well balanced.

Bottle to glass. Hazy yellow orange pour with a thick foamy white head. Smells fruity, huge pine and citrus in the nose. Taste is similar to the nose but gets a bit malty and sweet with a near tart hoppy finish. Really crisp. Nice.

Leuchtendes Bernstein, minimal trüb mit mittelprächtigem Schaum. Ein absolut tropisches Fruchtaroma. Neben Grapefruit und Zitrone noch reife Ananas und Papaya. Startet schön fruchtig und wird nur durch den Aromahopfen unterbrochen, der zwar gut dosiert, aber nie zu bitter wird. Ein IPA für die einsame Insel!

Bottle shared with Californian brother-in-law! Pours clear gold with a good off-white head. Big fruit aromas, some sweet malts. Mango, grapefruit. Very rich. Full bodied. Very bitter. Enjoyed it, but wouldnt want more than one!

Pours a deep golden with a two-finger off-white head. Nice retention and lacing. Nice fruity aroma with sweet malt and grass. Strong hop flavors on the front of the tongue balanced by a strong malt backbone. Finishes dry with a lingering hoppy bitterness. Medium bodied with light carbonation. Overall an extremely well crafted and perfectly balanced west-coast IPA. Very quaffable!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2014 Color cobrizo con espuma densa, melosa y persistente. Aromas lupulados y de frutas tropicales muy intensos. Appearance: Hazy golden color with a frothy white head that leaves a fine lacing.Aroma: Mild rich hoppy. And fine balanced fruity.Palate: Medium + body. Moderate sweet and a fine bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: Well balanced and rich grape hoppy and fruity.Overall impression: Overrated? Nah. Lovely and tasty IPA. Just as it should be.Personal stats: Bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika in Oslo, Norway

On tap at Whole Foods Chandlers Watering Hole. Pours a clear straw color with a classic one-finger white head. Very grassy, hopped-up nose - boatloads of alfalfa tones - with the slightest sweet citrus note. Grass and pine hit first on the taste, followed by a sweet caramel malt balance. The sweetness (primarily mango and orange tones) grows toward the end. Based on the maltiness, the beer drinks more like an English-style IPA while still retaining the sharp, hop aroma so beloved by West Coast hopheads.

22 oz. bottle shared with the neighbor. Poured amber color with a large white head. The flavors explode right away with floral, pine and citrus notes. Very complex and balanced and the finish is long and hoppy. This is as close to perfection as you can get.

Bomber bottle. Bright gold color, slight foggy, big puffy white head. Loads of citrus fruit, lemony citrus peel on the nose, hints pine needle. Flavor is same with long lemony citrus flavors into a gentle lingering grapefruit peel finish. Taste evolves. Very well put together and doesnt overwhelm the palate with resiny dryness.

Pours a cloudy amber. Strong notes of fresh citrus and hops. Good balance but a little light on the finish. Little bite up front, nice hoppy flavor
