Citrus aroma, lemon, with herbal hops. Pretty standard.
Appearance is hazy gold blond with particles. Thick creamy and dense head with a very nice lacing. 
Taste: Resinous hops, pine, conifer with lemon accent. Lemon is sticking out from the lot. Smooth bitterness with a dry earthy finish. Pretty standard IPA with a restricted flavor palette. A bit deceived.

Just amazing beer! I forgot this to my fridge for couple of months (shame on me), so I believe that the hops could have been even more rich than they were now, anyhow this was one of the best beers I have ever tasted.

Clear golden orange in color... Aroma of citrus and piney hops... Flavor is perfectly balanced, not terribly dry, but with just the right amount of sweetness, strong grapefruit notes and citrus hops on the palate... Delicious ipa

Yellow hazy beautifull beer with a nice white head. Great aromas of hops shine through. Stone fruits, citrus, some resin. Balanced sweetness, breadiness with a very bitter aftertaste. Really great IPA. Fortunate to have found it...

Appearance: Golden brown with robust lacy white head

Aroma: Fresh grapefruit, pine, alcohol, spice

Taste: Herbal bitterness, earthy, bittersweet fruit

Palate: Medium/light body, lively mouthfeel, bitterness mid-palate. Citrusy, bitter aftertaste that lingers a long time.

Overall: Solid IPA with some unique characteristics. Earthy, herbal flavor adds a dimension, and it finishes quite dry.Very good.

655 ml bottle from Vika, shared with friends. Hazy orange with a lasting gelatinous off-white head. Good lacing. Citrus, gooseberries on the nose. Mellow hop juice. Bitter, fruity and well balanced. Full bodied.

Bomber: Served in Chouffe glass:
Medium sized, vast, sticky slowly changing beautiful creamy snowy white foamy head on top of a light cloudy yellow to orange colored beer.
Aroma is a subtle and not to overhopped mix of hop fruits, flowers, peach, apricot, herbs, spices, floral and a touch of honey. Regarding the flavour I see I am just in time and this tastes (still) delicious: hops, hop fruit, apricot, peach, citrus, light hint of grapefruit, cream, hop flowers, spices, herbal, floral, some nettle and plants, bitters and light malts with a sprinkle of honey.
Aftertaste is a smooth mix of hops and hop fruits, hop flowers, floral well balanced and even after 4 months very crisp.
Low carbo, soft creamy mouthfeel, medium to lightly lightly fuller body and a creamy thicker light sticky ish oily ish texture.
Very nice IPA: its not too overhopped and strong which makes it a subtle and smooth but still full flavoured delicious IPA.

text: Pours hazy orange colour with off white, tight head. Aroma is grapefruit, pine, resinous, fruity, sweetness. Taste is bitter, sweet malt backbone. Medium body, soft carbonation. Finish is dry, bitter.

ivory white head that disappears with structured lacing. dark blond slight orange clear colour. aroma of hop resin, passion fruit and a sulphur note in the background. taste is like the aroma with a long bitter and slight spicy/tobacco finish. medium carbonation and body. its a good beer, but i dont understand the hype .. just a decent american ipa, like many others.  bottle 75 cl
Aroma is citrus and earthy, appeArance is golden yellow, taste is a little milder than expected with grapefruit flavors, palate leaves a wonderful citrus flavor. Overall a+
Smells great, grapefruit and hops. Semi clear with lots of tiny bubbles. Smooth, not overly hoppy. Overall a great IPA.
Great pour. Excellent on the nose big grapefruit aromas. Does down easy, very well balanced, lingering bitterness, enjoyed this more as it warmed up a tad.

Bottle from Whole Foods in NYC. I was quite excited about trying this one. For an IPA, quite a yellowy gold colour, bubbly head, some initial carbonation. Hoppy aroma, pine and woody, maybe oak, some slight hint of a quality furniture shop (in a good way). Taste is quite bitter, medium finish. Its very nice, but I didnt seem to get the depth or complexity of hop aromas one might expect from a 100 rated beer. Maybe I should try this sometime blind, or on tap, or not look at ratings here before trying! Very good, just dont get the very high score.

[US West Coast Trip 2013]  Slap me in the face and call me.... Ja ja hur som helst. Aroman, ja? Omänskligt bra, fruktig, humlig, frisk. Smaken är också den underbar. Mycket bra balanserad och den rinner ned genom strupen som flytande bebis rumpa ! Det här är bra !

Flaske fra polet: hva mer kan man forlange av en APA? Denne har alt - en flott skumkorne som holder på smaken helt til bunns, aroma som frister og frister (Må bare ta en slurk til), smaksfylde som har alt man kan ønske seg av citrus, bær, tropiske lekkersaker, raffinert bitterhet, fast kontrollert av en lett karamellaktig maltsødme, og en ettersmak som varte til lenge etter at jeg var ferdig med dagens korrespondanse.

AleSmith is light golden orange in color. Citrus and pine nose. Low bitterness. Pairs with aged cheese very well! Smooth and well balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at beertemple. Pours clear golden.  Aroma of pine and citrus. Taste is smooth grapefruit and citrus.  Very refreshing. Awesome

Bottle at unibaren, 15 / 6 2013. Clear orange, small white head. Beautiful aroma of hops and sweet malts, fruity piney grapefruit. Taste, well balanced, grapefruit piney, malty, just lovely. Great mouth feel. One of the best IPAs Ive ever had.
A must have IPA, most certainly one of the best I have ever had. I will stock up on this one
UPDATED: JUL 30, 2013 Tasting with Eric Teusink and Westmeister. Pours liquid gold with a nice eggshell white head. Aroma of mango hoppy resin. Tastes of spicy mango hops. bites hard. too good.

Bottle shared at EricTeusinks - Pours clear yellow.  Big citrus bite, fruity, a tad piney and clean/crisp maltiness.  The was certainly a top tier IPA.  The balance was nice, it was bright and it damn drinkable.
Classical hop driven american IPA, full of "C hops" with a percistent two finger foam. Long finish. Buy it!

Pours hazy gold with white head and some lacing.  Aroma of citrus and pine hops with some Carmel.  The different aromas blend perfectly.  Taste is light to medium fruits like strawberries, peaches, and plums.  Dominated by citrus hops and a strong malty backbone.  I could drink this all day...well not really, bit you know what I mean.
Simply the best regular IPA I have ever had.  Aroma is great! Great mouthfeel.  Only negative is I can not get it in Colorado.

Nose honey, Taste pine orange ginger, Alcohol sizzle, Bitterness not overwhelming. A fine IPA all around


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
orange, hazy, minimal head, roasty, citrus, leather, ginger, light sweetness, very bitter, full body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter,
amber, clear, white foam, resin, grass, citrus, full body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter, medium sweetness, very bitter,

Clear golden colour, white head, floating pieces of hops. Aroma of hops, citrus, pineapple, pine, passion fruit and honey. Very fruity. Bitter flavour, hops, fruits, light malts. Light to medium body. Bitter finish, fruity hops, light almond.
(From 66cL bottle @ post-Rammstein tasting, Nijmegen. Thanks for sharing, Tim!!)

if youre looking for a big San Diego IPA, youve come to the right place.  Big huge piney nose, bitter hops throughout.  oily, semi thick, resinous, bold but balanced.  only moderate sweetness, no stickiness to this one.  theres a reason this one is rated so highly.  find it fresh and have yourself a world class IPA

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2013 1/VI/13 - 1Pt. 6Fl. Oz. bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ post-FortaRock tasting - BB: n/a - bottled: II/21/13 (2013-521) 
Clear light orange beer, small irregular yellow head, pretty stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: lots of citrus, grapefruit, some exotic fruits, pineapple, bit piny. MF: lots of carbon, medium body. Taste: citric start, grassy bitter hops, grapefruit, very bitter, passion fruit. Aftertaste: piny resinous hops, citrus, bit cheesy, grassy, very bitter, almonds.
The aroma is nice but not as good as everyone says. Im getting tangerine & pine. Strong bitters and alcohol. Long, smooth finish. Really yummy, not worlds best.

Solid traditional, bitter-forward West Coast IPA. Strong citrus aroma after a prototypical pour. Pine and citrus in flavor (more former than latter), with a huge amount of bitter. There's nothing unique or unusual about this IPA; it could easily serve as the standard for the style. Everything about it is A grade. If you've ever rubbed fresh hops in your hands ... this is like drinking the same. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Golden colour. Citrus hoppy aroma and taste. A nicely done IPA.

bottle shared by mathieuc, thanks mate! pours clear golden with a decent white head, some retention and lacing. doughy malts, hint of toastiness, grapefruits, spicy leafiness, orange blossom, tea, jasmine tea, soft pine needles, bitter herbs, peaches, tropical and vinous notes. soft carbonation, light to medium body, short to medium long grapefruity finish. very good balance. awesome brew!

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 Old rating rerated 29.05.2013, 0,65l bottle (3 months old) @ home:
Medium creamy longlasting head. Aroma is hops, wet leafs, caramel, pine needles, grass, light malts, some dried fruits and soil. Taste is very unbalanced and harsh, bark, soil, lots of hops, harsh grass, wet leafs, caramel, pine needles, minerals. Longlasting harsh bitterness. Yet another highly overrated American beer. The worlds best IPA? Not even close!! Give me a Ægir IPA, Nøgne Ø IPA or Kinn Vestkyst anytime before this one...

Bottle. Pours gold with a pillowy off white head. Nose piney and resinous hops. Taste is citrusy and piney. Light tropical fruit notes. Prominent slightly sweet malt backbone. Palate is crisp, dry and refreshing. Strong carb. Really well put together. Classic and tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
0,5 bottle Kvadrat.Aroma is fruity, caramelly, flowery and hoppy. Flavour is nice grassy, fruity, soil and flowers. A really nice Balanced IPA

A slightly orange colour, a head is quite big, cloudy and blond. Aroma of tropical fruits, mangos, papaiyas, grapefruits, piney and nice sweetness of fructose. The great and smoothly balanced aroma. Taste of tropical fruits, mangos, sourness of grapefruits and pine. After fruits in the beginning, the medium bitterness is greatly balanced with only hint of caramelly maltyness, grapefruits and pine in the aftertaste. Medium+ bodied, smooth and medium carbonation, the great and almost velvety palate. Extremely smooth and tastefull IPA, all nuancees are greatly balanced.

1 pint bottle from Alko Arkadia, Helsinki. Wow, nice smell of hops and some fruitiness. Colour is light orange with a big head. Taste has a nice mixture of citrus fruits with dry hops. So tasty, you forget how much alcohol it contains.

Bottle @ home shared with Dutchdrebus and Ansjelaah. Clear orange color, medium sized, fair lacing, white to off-white head. Smell malts, hops, blossom, flowers. Taste malts, hops, bitter, fruityness. Medium body and carbonation. Very nice, clean and crisp IPA.
Bottle @ benzai. Clear orange with a full white head. Smells fruity, fresh, hoppy, grapefruit, some pine. Tastes hops, bitter, fresh, fruity, slightly soapy. Medium body, lovely fitting carbo.
Fles dankzij benzai, bruin/oranje van kleur, witte schuimkraag, ruikt en smaakt hoppig, fris, bomen/grassig, bitter, citroen

Pours a light golden with a small head that leaves minimal lacing. Aroma is full of grapefruit and pine, really nice and almost hypnotizing. Taste is amazingly balanced with a solid malt backbone and a medium-high level of bitterness. The malt comes out a bit like honey and is not cloying at all. Flavors of citrus abound. Mouthfeel is smoooooth with a lower level of carbonation (just right). An excellent beer, I can see why it would be the top of its range!

Appearance, deep copper color, a slight haze. Head is small, but lingering foam around the glass circumference. Aroma is lemon zest, highly hoppy, citrus. Taste is bitter and highly hoppy. Palate is hop, lemon, slight orange. Glass is covered in lace.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 22 oz bottle.  Pours light orangish amber with very thick fluffy head. Aroma is fresh juicy grapefruit hops. Hints of sweetness and pine. Taste is smooth creamy mild caramel malt with those sweet citrusy hops on the finish. Incredibly restrained bitterness, almost separate from the hops, but comes on at the finish and lingers well. Easily among the smoothest, best balanced IPAs Ive ever had - simply no harsh notes. 

7/2/13: on nitro @ the brewery. Super creamy mouthfeel, as expected. Hop notes seem a bit more punchy - maybe they just stand out more when paired with the smoother body?  Still outstanding, amazing to get this much flavor without the alcohol or sweetness of a DIPA.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2013 NYC Trip Beer #7.  Needed a good spot near the Upright Citizens Brigade Theater in NYC.  Stumbled upon the Guilty Goose, which proved fortuitous.  I was excited to see this beer on the menu, as it would be my first opportunity to taste it.  Poured the color of an aged orange peel with a lighter head than I expected.  Flavors of citrus.  Liked it, didnt love it.   Flavor was a touch on the grassy side for me.   Bottle - Guilty Goose - New York, NY

***Revised Upwards After Second Tasting***

Bomber from consumers beverages in Niagara Falls ny. Pours light orange with a big off white head. Looks perfect. Nice hoppy nose but it could be bigger and punchier. The flavour is solid, lots of hop flavour, lingering bitterness, dry finish. Not the freshest bottle but still highly enjoyable. Would love to try it fresher.

Bottle from Brewdog.com Online Shop (650ml, £7.55):
Fruity with tonnes of tropical fruits on the nose to begin with, there is also a touch of spice and a solid, juicy aroma along with some nice, lighter pine hops and some bitterness.There mango and citrus along with some sweet malts, caramel, mango and some grapefruit.

Dark golden colour with a great, two finger sized and foamy white head on top that looks to hold pretty well initially. There is some lacing left on the sides of that glass and the beer is a clear looking one.

Sweet malts and caramel upfront with some pine hops and grapefruit giving a sweet, medium strength bitter taste. The beer is a great one with plenty of tropical flavours coming through that includes some mango, orange and tonnes of hops yet the bitterness levels are not too strong.

Medium bodied and very smooth with an almost creamy mouthfeel and good, strong carbonation. There is some sweetness and a medium bitter finish.

Probably the best beer Ive ever had, this one is as close as Ive come to perfection in a beer. Starting with a great tropical fruits and pine hop aroma that matches the taste. The pine hops taste is amazing, coupled with the fact that the beer isnt overly bitter makes this truly outstanding.

Bottle pour clear yellow with orange hues.  Nose of tropical fruit, pine and resin.  Taste grapefruit bitterness, floral and rein hops, then huge bitterness.  Balanced by sweet malt mid palate, and butt resinous finish. Great west coast IPA.

Pours transparent golden orange with a thick orange white head. The nose is a perfect balance of grapefruit, orange, pine and tropical fruit. The taste is high bitter and medium high sweet damn near perfect balance. The texture is crisp and clean, body is medium and finish is long. Bomber for less than $5 makes this the best you can get. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle through trade, nice pale orange color with a bit of white head. Aroma of citrus/grapefruit, resin and some light caramel. Taste is very earthy and resinous hops, some light sweetness in the finish, super smooth bitter finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Should be enjoyed at correct temperature. Color is a little cloudy copper with good lacing and foaminess. Outstanding nose of sweet earthy grapefruit. Taste a little flat at first  due to improper serving temperature. Although serving temperature range is tight, excellent when correct.
UPDATED: AUG 25, 2014 Pours a hazy orange-straw color with a nice thick head. Mild but hoppy aroma, with a lot of citrus and floral notes. One of the best IPAs in the market.
Resiny, hoppy, citrusy, a touch of sweet. Really unique hop flavor. This one was a treat.

Bottle - good size foamy head, medium god color, nice citrus hop aroma and flavor, mild malt backbone, very good overall

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

My first offering from Alesmith (finally!) and maan lemmie tell ya. If this is any clue of the quality of their other beers then holy moley! Poured from a 22oz into a Heretic pint glass. First glance: golden light, mostly clear maybe a tad bit of hop haze..Aroma: Tropical fruit galore, Apricot, Peach..a lil grassy note..Taste: Dank! wow..everything you dreamed an IPA should be. Very drinkable. San Diego here I come!!

Cuivrée et limpide, ayant une mousse immaculée qui persiste et se colle aux parois en se résorbant, décorant celles-ci dune timide dentelle. Le nez est de houblon résineux et de fruits tropicaux variés. Son goût se rapproche des conifères, de la gomme de pin en particulier, dagrumes et plus spécifiquement de pamplemousse blanc. Lamertume est ici, particulière. Cest-à-dire quelle est tranchante et volatile, ne dure pas longtemps en bouche, sauf que, cest comme si des couches saccumulent au fil des gorgées, amplifiant celle-ci. Merci Louis! (552-030113)
Not sure why I havent rated this. Nothing great here. I never order it and it is always available. Taste is way too malty and always seems old.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: (65 cl bottle from Høkeren; No visible BBD) Pours a beautifully clear amber with medium, white head. Good retention and lace. Aroma is hoppy with fruity notes remniscient of the Amager Kåååd. Oily texture, medium body, lively carbonation and a dry finish. Flavour has more earthy, sprucy notes than in the aroma. Very crisp and drinkable for the ABV.
With the exception of the smell this is about as good as I have had in the ipa department.  Much hoppier tasting than smelling, extremely well balanced nice !!
I just plain enjoyed this beer.  Poured golden with a white head - good retention.  Notable citrus aroma, hoppy but not bitter.  Balanced, delicious

Pour is a clear copper with a small white head.  Aroma is piney fresh hops with a nice resiny sweetness.  Flavor is again all things bitter fresh hops.  A nice fruityness with more of that dank hop resin.  After all these ratings it still ranks as 100.  Well worth it to get your hands on this.

22oz bomber. Pours a slightly hazy orange color with a dense foamy white head. Aroma of resinous hops, lots of grapefruit, mango, peaches and pine. Taste follows the nose nicely with a ton of huge hoppy resins and bitterness. Nice tropical fruit flavors mixed in with the citrus and pine.

Boy this is a beauty! Pours orange with gold at the edges through light. Initial foamy head dissipates and lots of lacing. Nose is fruity, maybe a hint of vanilla. Aromas star with a fruity hop, then some light sweetness in the background. Long bitter dry finish. Very juicy. Tastes are light sweet, big bitterness throughout. Medium body with lively carbonation. Tremendous beer.

Cold bottle.  Orange pour.  Cm head doesnt endure for long.  Quite a low level of carbonation. Malty and sweet start, some citrus and a little resin with a moderately bitter grapefruity finish.  Currently Ratebeers number 1 IPA.  Not sure about that, but its a good American IPA.

Had on draft at two separate locations, one of them being the brewery. Noted caramel/crystal malts, floral, citrusy, and diacetyl. The diacetyl ruined this beer, the hop character was slight at best. I was looking forward to this since it is not available in my area. I will have to try it again when I get a chance.

Bottle.  Clear dark yellow pour with a big white head. Fantastic pine and citrus aromas. Great body, mouthfeel, and balance.  This ale captures the Cali take on an IPA. Great pine and citrusy hop notes that give way to a sweet caramel malt finish. I would really like to revisit this on tap in SoCal..

Poured from a 22oz bottle that I found online at Bine n Vine courtesy of ratebeer.com!  This deserves the ratings it gets - I definately would put this up next to any of my other favorite IPAs.  Clear, orange pour with medium foamy white head.  Delicious citrus, fruity, flora, piney, taste, and aroma is about the same.  Perfect amount of hops.  Cant really say anything other than this is about perfect overall.
Bottle at Treffipub, Helsinki. Originally rated 25062012. Colour is golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, citrus, hops and some malt.

Appearance: Dark Gold-Orange with moderate off-white head.
Aroma: Huge pine resin with just a bit of citrus.
Flavor:  Hop forward with delicious resiny flavors and a solid backdrop of malt.
Palate: Medium to full bodied with good carbonation.
Overall: Amazing hops and it handled in such a way that the bitterness does not have a death grip on your taste buds.
Bottle.Pours unclear golden with a small white head. Aroma is fruity hoppy, citrus and pine cones. Taste is fruity hops, crisp and juicy, grapefruit and citrus. Overall a very good IPA.
Drank this from a bottle while eating In and out burger.  Huge pine, resin, citrus hop aroma with the same bitter taste.  Nice west coast style IPA.

Pours a slightly hazy burnt copper/gold with a bubbly white head. Lots of piney/floral hop bitterness and that fresh cut grass smell, some mango/peach notes, some lemon and a little bit of a breadiness. On the taste, theres a strong piney and grapefruity hop bitterness up front, some lemon and citrusy notes, some malt, little bit of orange. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Delicious, well balanced IPA with a great piney bitterness.

Pours a clear, pale golden color with a soapy antique white head. The head is rather stubborn, which contributes to the sustained attractiveness of the beer. Sticky suds lace the glass as the beer is being drunk. The bouquet consists of pine, grass and lemon zest, with occasional notes of burning peat. It has a soft, wet mouthfeel that yields to a gentle carbonation scrub. A lot of pine flavor from start to finish. Less prominent grapefruit flavor, but the bitterness unique to grapefruit is present. It is well-balanced by the grain, and, thankfully, not overpowered by it. The pleasant mouthfeel rounds out the experience. Nothing to get terribly excited about, but a good IPA.

Un liquide doré avec un col mousseux et une dentelle éparpillé.Au nez,les houblons,les fruits de la passions et les malts biscuités.En bouches,une bonne effervescence,le liquide est plutôt huileux avec une amertume juste à point,pas trop dominante et une fin sec qui nous fait lever notre verre au plus vite pour répéter cette expérience unique à léquilibre parfait. WOW, WOW ,WOW. elle nest pas classé numéro 1 au monde selon notre site pour rien ! Si vous avez la chance de vous la procurer ,ne la rater pas ,vous ne le regretterai pas .
65cl bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika enjoyed at home. I totaly agree with the commercial description on this one. I might like my ipas a bit more fruity than this one, but it is a good one.

Un grand verre qui me laisse voir une robe bien dorée et traversée par un million de fins sédiments.  Une belle mousse qui sinstalle pour léternité.  Une dentelle éparse décore mon verre.  Un nez qui me fait plier les genoux.  Je ferme les yeux et je pense à une salade mielleuse de fruits tropicaux.  Je mimagine être sur la côte pacifique de lAmérique du Nord : il y a une forêt de conifères dans mes narines.  Sur ma langue, cest un tour de force exotique.  Des saveurs fondantes de pamplemousse et de mangue.  Des aiguilles de pin plantées sur mes papilles.  Un profil amérisant qui frôle le génie ou la folie, cest selon.  En bouche, un liquide merveilleusement représenté.  Un corps riche et bien aéré.  Une texture finement huileuse, voire même soyeuse.  Une finale équilibrée entre une amertume très parfumée et des malts touchés par une juste valeur sucrée.  Merci à Ben pour cette unique expérience.  Je suis toujours disponible pour dautres bouteilles aussi fraîches!

Appearance, deep copper color, a slight haze. Head is small, but lingering foam around the glass circumference. Aroma is lemon zest, highly hoppy, citrus. Taste is bitter and highly hoppy. Palate is hop, lemon, slight orange. Glass is covered in lace.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Incredible hoppy aroma and active dark yellow pour with a balanced taste and mild mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2014 Golden peach. Aroma is grapefruit. Taste is almost no fruit - sharp yet clean acidic bitterness. Crisp resiny bite. Palate is a clean, dry finish with a big chunk of bitterness. Good IPA - almost no sweetness.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika, enjoyed february 16th 2013. Finally got to taste the ipa everyones talking about. Out it comes with a clear golden body, much clearer than most ipas, and a big white foamy head. Aroma is hoppy, pine, grass, dust, light caramel. Taste is good balanced between the same grassy / piney hop flavors anf malt. Good, but not breathtaking in my opinion, in fact I find both the aroma and taste a bit onedimensional. Its got a very robust bitterness, lasting long through the finish which leaves a malty and grassy aftertaste. Absolutely a good beer, but actually Im a bit dissappointed as I like my ipas more fruity than this one.

650 ml bottle from Premier Gourmet.  Pours a lightly hazy golden colour with tight, nearly white head that leaves nice lacing.  Aroma really bursts out of the glass with citrusy and piney hops and some other fruitiness.  Flavour is big and hoppy with grapefruit rind, mango, pine and resin as well as some gentle caramel.  Sticky mouthfeel.  Excellent IPA.

Fires on all cylinders... Great hop aroma...taste... Smooth...nice all around...reminds me of a rich mans red racer ipa from central city brewing out of bc... Great beer! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I havent had many AleSmith beers, but this is a good way to introduce myself to the brewery. I am a BIG fan of hops, and pretty much every brewery in San Diego is using hops more than they should. AleSmiths IPA is well balanced take on a fruity citrus-forward IPA that leaves a nice, long aftertaste. The burp is really nice, too. I just burped... thats how I know! We have a few more beers on the 1001 Bottles list from AleSmith, and I hope they are all as good as this.

I can honestly say this is one of the worst IPAs I have ever had.  I was excited to give it a try when I saw that it had such a high rating.  After tasting it I was severely disappointed.  I enjoy imperial IPAs, but this one was lacking.  It didnt have a full hoppy flavor like a Stone Ruination, or a Dogfish Head 90 Minute, and the bitter aftertaste really ruined it for me.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy orange-straw color with a nice thick head.  Mild but hoppy aroma, with a lot of citrus and floral notes.  The flavor is quite bitter and hop-driven.  Orange, pine, and floral character, with a bit of caramel malts to balance.  A solid IPA.

22oz bottle from my local New Seasons. Bottle dated from 2-21-13

A: Lovely shade of orange and copper. Dense head with a bog of bubbles. Has good carbonation rising through the glass.

N: Resonant grapefruit in the nose. Pineapple and pine are layered underneath. Citrus forward with a bitter base to prop it upright.

T: Tangerine, conifer, and a hint of caramel malt. Some pineapple and grapefruit. Layers of bitterness and sweet dough. Has the type of biting bitterness complemented by just a touch of sweetness and a perfect amount of the tropical.

M: Sticky and biting with lively carbonation.

O: This is extremely satisfying. A perfect afternoon sipper. I think Im going to finish the entire bottle myself and crave more.
One of the best IPAs I have had. Strong fruity aroma with strong notes of pine and grapefruit. Similar flavors with a very hoppy bitterness nicely balanced with a bit of malt. Exceptional.

Aroma is pleasant but not memorable-appearance  is golden and bordering on amber-clean piny and citrus hop up front not much malt sweetness-medium palate followed nicely by lingering bitter finish-very good IPA?
yes--the best? I think not

Cloudy golden orange with a 1/2 finger head. Intense aroma of pine and grape fruit. Taste matches aroma. Great IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great, classic west-coast style IPA. Clear golden w/ a nice bubbly head. Loaded w/ bitter grapefruit, pine, some tropical fruits. Solid, but not overpowering malt backbone. Dry finish. Damn good!

Definitly think this is one of the best IPAs out there.  After pouring the Speedway Stout for a friend during an important football event, which we found very disappointing, I poured this beer.  As my friend said this is a game changer and lifts the mood.  I agree I think it is a excellent well balanced IPA of above average quality.

Very appealing bottle. The pour is even more appealing. A full head lingers in the glass as lacing sticks down the sides. The aroma is of pine and citrusy hops. I cant wait to take a sip. Not a whole lot of flavor but this is a very smooth IPA. It drinks down easy and that can get dangerous with 7.25% abv. Smooth, almost buttery mouthfeel like the Speedway. Good stuff.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2013 Very full fruitness, some citrus but sweet at the same time. Very little head, almost clear yellow colour. ?It?s pretty awesome?  yes indeed! Scent has citrus fruits, grapefruit and hops. Leaves beautiful lacing to the glass after drinking. Really smooth texture, not that aggressive IPA, leaves some sweetness to your mouth, I was expecting more bitterness. Personally this is is great IPA, from the middle of basic IPA and imperials, at the end, awesome!
Assertive hops up-front and then a minimally pleasant aftertaste,  crisp,  clean drink,  a really nice IPA overall

On tap at WOB Tempe, clear golden pour with a white head.  A nice and crisp hoppy aroma and a nice citrus and earthy hop character in the flavor.  Tasty goodness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

De botella. Aroma a malta tostada, un toque a lúpulo pero poco aromático. Recuerda a las IPAs inglesas. Sabor seco y ligeramente afrutado, astringente.
Es el canon de las IPAs, aunque para mi gusto poco cítrica / afrutada.
Es una cerveza que hay que probar.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2013 approx 2-3 week old bottle. AleSmith finally in IL! Couldnt be happier, now just to get HotD here...

A: Pours a slighty hazy bright orange with a foamy white head. 

S: Best smelling non-imperial IPA Ive come across. Big west coast notes of pine, bitter and sugared grapefruit peel - dryness. Huge dank skunky pineapple and mango astringent notes pound through. Fantastic stuff

T: Great balance between crisp, refreshing, dry bitterness from the pine and grapefruit, and the dank sweet tropical fruit flavors. Will load up come summer

P: Feels like a refreshing IPA. Light to medium body, active carbonation and dry. My preferences lean towards a bigger body and more of a resinous gloss-lingering affect on the mouth, but nothing wrong with this. Great for summer

O: This is a game changer. I have been drifting away from non-imperial IPAs but this brings me right back - big (relatively), complex and refreshing.
Vertikalprovning 6 månader mot färsk. Inte så stora skillnader som jag hade trott. Frisk grape i den färska. Underbart välgjord ipa. Balanserad

Bottle from Davis Beer Shoppe, thin disappearing head, very well balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 oz bottle. Served in a snifter.  Pours a deep honey color with a two-finger head.  Floral and citrus aromas upfront.  In regards to taste, the surprise here is the balance.  To call an IPA "smooth" may be odd, but its the most accurate descriptor I can think of in this case.  The hop presence is there, but it isnt overbearing and doesnt linger.  Floral finish.  This IPA would accompany many foods well, as I imagine it would bring out flavors, not dominate them.

22 oz bottle: Pours orange with small CO2 bubbles. Aroma is piney, citrus and resinous. Taste is complex but resin hops win out. Fun to drink, multiple flavors going on. REally good with it were more fresh and with sweeter hop flavor.
Stor flaske fra vinmonopolet vika. Drukket i heimen. Kobberfarget med beige boblende skum. Smaker humle,sitrus,frukt,furunål,gress. Medium bitter. Veldig god og lettdrikkelig

A bit bitter very sweet.  Good mouthfeel.  Sweet with a hop bite.  Nice  aroma.  Balanced with bite

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very good. West coast, of course. Wish it came in six-packs. Very fresh, nice hop presence, cant wait to taste other Alesmiths
Antall outstanding IPA from Alesmith. Had av bottle for myself, and kept getting better for each sip. Golden color with white bubbly head.
Bottle pours an amber brew with a large, lacing, off white top. Scent is fresh cut pine, citrus and sweet malts. Taste is pine, caramel for a second, citrus, and pine. Great!

translucent copper with a creamy beige head. silky medium-full body with a touch or resinous stickiness and a very smooth medium carbonation. perfect texture.

aroma: lots of tropical citrusy hops, and bits of toffee and silage and alcohol .

taste: clean hop bitterness, piney citrusy hops, a slight herbal/vegetal hop note, sweet pale crystal malt, and a bit of breadiness from possibly munich-type malt. has the pale malt, light crystal, and light kiln-malt profile that i really like in an ipa or dipa.
Orange coppery color, medium head. Fruity hops, fresh both on aroma and taste. Long lasting bitter aftertaste. Overall very good and tasty, highly recommended. Wish Id have more than a bottle.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2013 Bottle from Vika enjoyed at home
Finally, the famous Alesmith IPA. It pours copper hazy with a big beige head. Smells of citrus zests, alot of pine, dust, malts and spices. Medium sweet, nice malt body, fruity and very woody. Heavy bitter, quite resiny accompanied with citrus zests, pine and hints of herbal tea. A very pleasent IPA, extremely drinkable, nice pine domination in aroma and flavor. Mui bien

65 cl bottle @Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo. Herbal and citrus aromas. Pours bright gold, a bit hazy, with correct white head, persistent, some lacing. Medium body, crispy texture, average carbonation. Taste is citrus, smooth, quite bitter, some spicy, Nice and enjoyable one.

Clear light orange with white foam. Big hoppy citrus aroma. Kind of mouth watering. Taste is all hops. Light, fruity with minimal malt. Finish is mildly bitter. Moderate carbonation. Great beer. Easy to drink with big flavor.

Bottle shared @ Animal. Golden colour with a white head with good duration and nice lacing. Aroma is strong hoppy, notes of citrus, grapes, peaches and resins. Flavor is strong bittery with a long duration, fresh, citrus hops. Strong and long bitterness final.

The brew has chunnks! Im impressed. big citrus hoppy aroma witha resinous quality and a slight pale malt aroma. Huge pine cone flavours and juicy citrus. It has a woodsy or bitter bark appeal to the flavours as well as a very long finish. This is one tasty and aggressive brew!!

660ml bottle. Cloudy, dark orange. Medium and long lasting white head. Aroma: Lots of pine and grapefruit. Taste: Fresh hops, grassy, citrus and pinetree. Full and smooth body. Really fizzy and pleasant texture. Long hoppy finish. Great to have this in finland!

1pt 16 fl oz bottle. Slightly hazy golden orange amber colour, foam off-white head that diminishes leaving alittle lacing and tropical fruit, caramel, vanilla & citrus aroma. Taste is sweetish caramel malt, with floral, resiny pine, orange & grapefruit citrus notes. Wonderful balance and warming hoppy bitterness. Smooth mouth feel, medium body & carbonation, with a lingering dry bitter finish. Very drinkable.

Serving: 22 oz. bottle via trade with Cliff.  Thanks Cliff!  It pours a nice orange color with a solid white head.  The nose is lighter than I was expecting with light pine and citrus notes.  The flavor has good balance with a nice dose of pine with orange undertones and a solid malt backbone.  It has a medium finish.  I was rather surprised to see this wasnt an overhopped, super dry west coast IPA.  Pretty tasty.

Big bottle, 6-8 months after purchase. Aroma heavy of malt, caramel and orange. Not a lot of hops in the nose. Taste is round and malty, lots of caramel. Bitterness is fairly high but not dominating, a perfect level for me. Great beer

from Erzbierschof - hazy dark blond beer under a creamy and solid white foam; flowery and grassy hoppiness, gently sticky and with a good malt backbone; pretty bitter; very dry and with long hoppy flowery tones and hints of caramel - frank and pleasant

This is an awesome IPA. Taste of citrus and pine. Nice hop aroma. Very drinkable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Vigorous pour yields nice white head on this light gold beer.  Lots of citrus notes in the nose.  The palate is sweet with bitterness up front followed by more of that citrus at the back.  Good tasting IPA.

Pours a deep orange color with minimal head. Aroma has deep, citrusy pine notes. Taste is suprisingly smooth with slightly sweet tang with a hope bite. Highly drinkable. Great ipa and worth its rating.

poured from a bomber into a tulip glass. Nice dark orange color with a good soapy white head.  Its a great looking beer.  It smells very malty with some piney hops. I dont really get any citrus in the nose.  It smells like a malt heavy double ipa.  It tastes the same, a lot of malt.  Some piney bitterness, that cuts through the sweetness a little bit.  This isnt my preferred  style of IPA

From bottle.  Pours lighter gold with little head.  Strong aroma of pine and a bit of citrus that make for an appealing combination.   Taste is just a mild bitter and has a very smooth finish.  One of the greats.

Could smell the pine and citrus as soon as the cap hissed off.  Honey gold with creamy white head, the bottom of which sticks around a while.  Malt backbone is just firm enough to balance out the piney, fruity, and floral hoppiness.  Lovely.  Quintessential.  As well done as Two-Hearted.  Glad I have this bomber to myself...
Clean, crisp, refreshing hop characteristics.  Good finish, almost sweet like a 2x ipa.  World class flavor one of the best ipas ever tasted!!

My favorite single IPA on the planet. So many similarities to Pliny the Elder. Pours rich gold with a minimal head that sticks around throughout consumption. Piney, citrus, hops with malty sweetness thats only there to balance the hoppiness but doesnt overwhelm the palate or nose. Finishes dry, and doesnt stick to the palate like some IPAs. One of the best beers coming out of San Diego

650ml bottle. Pours a very clear amber with some chunks. Nearly white head. Lots of tropical fruit and spruce on the nose with a solid caramel backbone. Grapefruit, spruce and caramel on the palate. Finish is smoothly bitter and lasts for days.

I really like this beer. Pours orange-toned gold with nice, long lasting head. Beautiful and clear. Love the weight on the tongue and the taste is about as good as it gets. Very nice balance between hops and malt, favoring the malt, slightly. My only complaint about this beer is aroma - really not much there. Once youre drinking it, though, youre in sublime territory. Maybe this is an older bottle?

22 ounce bottle.  Thanks Peter and GT.  Pours a nice orange/gold with a great fluffy white head.  Excellent lacing.  Aroma of citrus, pine, tropical fruits, and malt.  Taste is grapefruit, pineapple, oranges, pine, and caramel malt.  Very drinkable and very well balanced.  A delight.
Bread, citrus, and grassy hops in the aroma.  Flavor starts sweet and fruity, with citrus and pine bitterness and a little fruit sweetness in the finish.  Nice base beer with a great hop finish.

From notes - Sample pour of speckled/hazed deep gold with light white head.  Nose is citrus and heavy... Orange, hops, dank.. straw and fresh cut grass.  Really nice.  Flavor is crisp hop with citrus and a nice bitterness.  Orange and grapefruit throughout.  Light to medium body and quite drinkable.

Nice golden color. The hop aroma hits you before the cap reaches the table. A smooth hop aroma and a subdued bittering. As most, hell - all, beers from Alesmith this beer is well balanced showcasing both hops and malt. A little bigger than Alesmith X without being to big in either alcohol or malt.
Pours cloudy dark yellow,  whiote head,m   super strong grapefruit aroma, ridiculas smooth IPA,  may be one of the better ive had in a while,  LOVEIT

Bottle picked up at Consumers Beverages Niagara Falls New York. Pored into a Southern Tier tulip. Colour is clear true copper with about a finger of true white head a a bunch of lace. Nose is tropical citrus hop, a touch of caramel malt. Tastes bitter, but smoothes out to this sweet citrus hop and a touch of pininess too. Amazing first sampling from this brewery.
Bomber - pours slightly cloudy gold. Nose and taste are earthy hops. Medium mouthfeel and a dry finish that is not overdone. Very refreshing!
Quite possibly the best regular IPA out there.  Had this on draft and out if the bottle.  Both are fantastic.
Damn good ipa. Nose was subtle compared to the hops that were on the palate. But it was such a great flavor burst of hops. Very crisp that led to a quick finish.
Bottled. Pours copper with a big white head. Smells creamy grassy hoppy, green elders, lemon grass. Tastes bitter, creamy hoppy, lemon grass, citrus, woody with a similar finish.

Yellowish gold,not completly clear,short frothy head,lacing.
Nice hoppy nose dank,fruit/floral,spicy,very nice.Herbal as it warms.
Taste is hoppy,pretty clean but mildly malty with light sweetness,has somestrong herbal hop flavor as well as the others in aroma. Kindof a dry buiscuit/toastiness,and its a bit dry and crisp maybe a litle more than I like it to be.The  strong dry crisp  finish with tart with the strong citrus finish makes it seem a bit astringent almost. Still a very good ipa.I would get this again sooner than later.I really like the hop character in this one.

650ml bottle at home. Bb 9/2014. Little hazy dark golden color with medium white head. Fantastic hoppy aroma with leafs, iron, fruits, citrus. Smooth mouthfeel, hops, fresh, fruits. Long dry hoppy finish.

Welcome to Illinois!!!  Orange yellow pour with a white head. As I cracked open the cap, the fruity hop aroma wafted up to me. Nice fruity aroma-citrusy. Great hop flavor, nothing over bearing. Nice malt backboe. Sticky and tasty. Great lacing.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2013 Pours a beautiful hazy, sunset orange color with a finger length off white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a thick lacing around the glass. Nice carbonation which tells me this will be a refreshing ipa. Smells of resinous fruits like grapefruit, tangerine, mango, and pineapple. Also get some pine and like a bubblegum smell from the sweet malts. Taste is very much like it smells. starts with the resinous fruits such as pineapple and tangerine. Then in the middle there is a great balance of malt: get bready flavors as well as a creamy carmel sweetness. Then the finish is an incredible blend of the sweet, carmely malts and the resinous hop qualities. Get a prominent bubblegum flavor, as well as hints of pineapple, pine, grapefruit, and lemon. The bitterness gets more astringent as it goes through the flavor profile; however, the sweet and bready malts also get more prominent on the finish, so there is a nice balance at the end. A nice dry, crisp, clean finish. Medium body with a creamy and crisp mouthfeel. Wish I could get this more often. Just an incredible IPA.
Botella. Aromes cítrics i de pin, i sabors que duren fins a lúltim glop. Gran cervesa en el seu estil. Molt bona.

Orange beer with a fruity sweet and fresh aroma. Pretty balanced beer without over powering hops. Only some bitter grape fruit with some fruity sweetness. Body could be more full. This is a really enjoyable and refreshing beer but suffers a bit from a lack of hops. Total score 3.5

edit: Tasting this again and thinking that this particular bottle has more bitterness than the one I had before. Im raising the points a bit.

On tap at Gingerman in NYC on 8/6/12, served in a tulip.

Pour: Light amber, slightly orange with a finger and a have cream/white head. Leaves excellent lacing.

Smell: Pine, orange, grapefruits. Some caramel sweetness in there too,

Taste: Lots of the same from the nose, with pine resin, grapefruit being the main hop show. Really substantial caramel sweetness, that balances well.

Mouthfeel: Pretty drinkable, and not overly bitter or sweet.

Overall: Pretty solid IPA, but not one Id make my go to.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2012 Drank from 22 oz bottle in small pilsner glass. Aroma- very pleasant hoppy and citrus notes. Appearance- dark auburn color with light carbonation. Taste-strong hops. One of the best! So smooth but great hoppiness. Palate- clean hoppy aftertaste. Overall- rivals sculpin. Love it. Top 2 ipas for me

Bomber. Golden. Pleasant aroma. Small lacey head. Taste is grapefruit, citrus, pine, with a perfect malt backbone. Extremely well balanced. Clean. No resinous mouthcoating yet hopped near perfection. Truly outstanding. One of the best, if not the best IPA I have ever had. Having trouble finding fault with this one. This is on my short list. Will be ordering lots more of this one. Well done!

Fresh bomber courtesy of pellegjr - youre the man, Joey! Pours hazy orange with medium sized fluffy white head that goes the distance - plenty of lacing. Aroma is brilliant: loads of pine (resin and needles), plenty of grapefruit, notes of sweet tangerine, some light notes of a deeper darker fruitiness, and slightly sweet malt. Taste explodes onto the palate with a rush of pine/grapefruit/blood orange, some sweet vanilla ice cream, and then an understated mix of pale and light caramel malt. What a fantastic hop hit - so so fresh - feels like youre being dragged through a pine forest. Mouthfeel is medium/full with a wonderful lingering resinous/citric bitterness. Love that the finish is nice and dry; shows that you can incorporate a sweet-ish malt backbone to a hop-driven beer without producing a sickly sweet caramalt finish. This is pure class, truly one of the very best IPAs Ive had - looking forward to the next bottle whenever that might be.

poco se puede decir sobre esta birra... espectacular, muy compleja, con muchos matices, pero sorprendentemente facil de beber, bomba de lupulo, sobre todo frutas tropicales, etc, pero tambien se nota ligeramente la base maltosa de fondo, dando soporte al amargor, lo que la atenua. interesantisima

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2014 Pretty sizable, fluffy head with a ton of lacing.  Orange-gold.  Aroma of grapefruit, orange, and pineapple, along with a floral bouquet.  Taste is all of the aforementioned along with a great malt backbone and hoppy finish.  Ridiculously smooth and easy to drink.  This is simply extraordinary - love these beers that have been living up to the hype.  Move over, Founders Centennial (despite its greater availability) - this is the best-balanced IPA Ive ever had, although Ballast Point Sculpin IPA is technically a little tastier.

Bottle.  Deep gold color, a bit cloudy, with a fine head. Huge resin and citrus hop nose, some tropical fruits,  caramel and chocolate. Flavor of resins and pine, citrus,  bitter and earthy, light caramel. Soft, fine carbonation.  Good old school IPA.  Comparing to Larry I just had a few days ago.  Larry had a much bigger aroma of floral hops and pine.  AleSmith had the smoother tasting IPA.
An IPA that is the standard for all other IPAs.  The citrus and piney aromas and flavors last until the very last gulp.  Best in class for a West Coast IPA, bar none.
Bottle. Clear amber colour with a large white head. Aroma of hops, flowers, citrus. Flavour of hops, citrus, fruit. Smooth with a lot of bitterness in the finish.

Pours a deep golden yellow with a small white head and ring. Aroma is grapefruit and a small amount of pine hop with a small sweetness. Taste is a nice warming pine and grapefruit hop bitterness and flavouring. Resiny and residual sweetness of the malts. Great beer.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2013 Pours clear golden orange with medium head. Smells like grapefruit, pine, fresh cut grass. Takes your breath away. Flavor is nicely floral and citrus. Slick mouthfeel that falls slightly flat, unfortunately. The flavor is still there and excellent but something is off on the palate. Very good brew overall, though.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 ounce bottle

I cant believe it has taken this long to rate this gem but I guess when you assume you can just pick up a bottle that happens. The price is a little higher than it was a few years ago. Regardless this comes in about the same as a four pack of Headhunter, White Rajah, or other local Ohio IPAs worth sampling.

Aroma / Appearance - The active carbonation bubbles like a transparent cauldron. Caramel bronze with a thin crust of white head present the balanced appearance of a robust IPA.

Flavor / Palate - Citrus and grapefruit bubble across the tongue. Flowing freely behind is a torrent of honeydew melon and floral hops. This is refreshing with a finish that hangs in the air like cigarette smoke. Had I known about this sooner I would definitely have had more than just the one bomber.

Pours a deep golden color with a thin white head.  Aroma of flowery citrus and slight malt.  Taste is amazingly balanced, excellent hop flavors without being overly bittered, crisp and full bodied.  One well built American IPA.

Outstanding aroma ... hops are present but floral as well. Slightly cloudy body with a thin bubbly suds. Light and airy on the palate. Hops are subtle in this one. For an ipa this is one that is not overly bitter but enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Caley Sample Rooms. Grapefruit and clementine on the nose, also some alcohol and a a distinct sweetness. Pours orange amber with small white head. Taste is grapefruit, hay and some salty caramel. Well balanced, but the alcohol is apparent. Nice beer.
65 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear amber with a white head that leaves quite a bit of lacing. Aroma is citrus, grapefruit, pine, and some caramel. Flavour is much like the aroma.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2013 Re-Rate:  ALESMITH COMES TO WISCONSIN!!!  Cannot beat a hoppy bitter fresh (7/24/13 date is less than 3 weeks old!!) IPA!!! Thanks Alesmith!!Original rating: Bomber from Bottleworks from my PASS trip shared with ck1. Pours a pale orange with a white head great lacing - very nice look. Aroma has pine, citrus, resin - some tropical fruit further down in the glass. Taste is of resin, pine, bitter citrus, some fruit for sweetness; more and more bitter thru the glass. Smooth and bitter. Finishes bittersweet. Really, really good. Smooth and tasty. ck1 says 16/17.

Bottle from Halftime Poughkeepsie NY. Nice golden color with a medium creamy head.  Well balanced and smooth IPA.  A must try.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Wow,this is good. Bought a bottle(6 fl.oz) at" De Molen Beer Shop" payed
18 euro for it, best money ever spent.

Bottle at 16 Tons, Eugene. This IPA is seriously approaching perfection. Pours a deep amber/orange color, slight head, medium lacing. Aroma is very resinous, with a little bit of citrus cropping up as well. Medium body, incredibly smooth, well-balanced finish that lacks neither hops nor malt. What IPA should be, seriously.

(Bottle).  Imported from the People's Republic of Massachusetts by  QuezXLV aka Stoutragious.  Pours a hazy golden-amber complexion.    Excellent head retention and lots of lacing.   A mild and well-balanced IPA with low IBU.  Flavors of hops and pine but with a subtle malt backbone.  One of the better IPAs I've tasted.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2013 2012-07-11. AROMA 7/10   APPEARANCE 3/5   TASTE 7/10   PALATE 3/5   OVERALL 17/20 = 3.7 Clear golden with white head. Aroma has raisin, grass, roses, citrus and biscuits. Light/medium body. Starts off fresh and crisp as a hoppy citrusy flavor builds up leaving a dry resinous aftertaste. Notes of biscuit and grapefruit too.


Re-rate 2013-08-30, a couple of months old, I think. Hazy light orange with a medium sized nicely lacing white head. Delicious hoppy nose, citrus, resin, some biscuit as well. Lots of things unfolds at the first sip, but hard to dissect the flavour. Pineapple, mango, lychee, light caramel. Very easy to drink, light dry and bitter finish, soft carbonation. Hits the spot.
8-4-8-4-17

Pour clear amber, with a small white head.
Aroma of pine, apricot, mango (plenty of them tropical fruits going on), slight grass, spruce... Sure is delicious, and reminds me of what a textbook "west-coast" is like. 
The taste has some faint sweet notes upfront, with a heavy and long bitter, and slightly dry aftertaste. 
Average bodied, with an semi-fizzy/lively carbonation. Sure is a nice way to end this evening, think Ill be going to bed shortly after this SOB...

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2012 Pours a golden colour with a creamy white head that stays forever. Heavy smell! Can smell the aroma 2 meter from the glass. It consists of peach, citric and maybe a tiny note of licorice actually. Flavour has a good balance between the mention aromas, also some wood and floral notes. Almost a full bodied Ipa this. Very bitter aftertaste. A very good IPA, top 3 of what Ive tried.
Piney hop resin on the nose, a little biscuit. Orange rind, pine, spice, and alcohol on the taste. Balanced bitterness. Good ipa but not in my top 5.
Aroma is pine, citrus, biscuit malts and a hint of sweetness.  The flavor is citrus, biscuit malts, grapefruit, fruit/berries, a hint of pulp in the texture and a tangy/bitter finish.
golden, light head. bottled. very hopped! smells Like marihuana, medium bitter. great beer

Pours lil reddish amber with a white beautiful head. Just from the bottle the heavy smell of hops sprays out. The aroma got lots of pine and some fruity stuff.. Pear i think. The taste is really hoppy, bitter and fruity. Pretty full bodied with medium to low carbonation. Really good stuff! Thanks to RasmusOtt.

Thanks to Quez..bomber poured into Lagunitas mason jar, billowing fluffy off white head, cloudy golden orange color with moderate carbonation, notes of barnyard, hay, marmalade, black pepper, pine, resin and Elmer's Glue. Extremely well balanced IPA, alcohol profile just right, bottle conditioning resulting in silky smooth drink, outstanding.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber from Pint Defiance. Clear gold pour with a short, persistent off-white head leaving heavy lace. Nose is mango, peach, fresh-cut grass, ganja and pine  all the hops aromas I love! Medium-light body with moderate carbonation. Pine, ganja, some tropical fruit, light caramel and toast. Finish is more hops, but without excessive bitterness, however the body lightens up a bit and washes out. A solid IPA, but Id expect a lower ABV (and therefore more sessionability) for the body and balance.

22 oz. bottle served in a Firestone Walker tulip. Big thanks again to mfavoino (Matt) for sending this my way.

A: Pours a clear golden orange color with a thick white head forming on the pour. It recedes slowly leaving behind sticky sheets of lace.

S: Pale malt sweetness, dried grass, little bursts of citrus fruit and a little pine on the back end as well.

T: More piney bitterness than the nose, but the same pale malt sweetness comes through. Grassy and little less citrus as well.

M: Light bodied with a nice, medium carbonation level with a sweet malt finish.

O: A little maltier than I would have liked, but this was easily drinkable and the flavors blended nicely together.

Serving type: bottle

22 ounce bottle. Pours a hazy amber, orange color with a large rocky beige head. Citrusy, piney hop aroma. Sweet malt flavor reminds me of a cough drop. Sure enough, the resiny grapefruit hops come through and take command. Good balance and smoothness. Complex, yet not overwhelming. Nice dry pepery bitter hop finish.

0.65l bottle shared with The Tasting Crew. Finally its my turn to try this! A honey-golden one, lots of small particles and a big heavy lacing just off-white head. The aroma is really fruity indeed. Lots of citrus, peaches, grapes and something reminding of licorice. Smells nice, but not extreme. Good bitterness in the taste. Not as fruity here as I perhaps could have hoped for, but its definitely really really balanced. Caramel and quite on the grassy side. Almost on the border of pungent? Thats a bit strange. Carrot-sweetness, some zesty things also, and a hint of dry yeast in the finish. Tasty, but I probably had hyped this a bit to much.. 27.07.2012

(Bottle, Stockholm Beer Festival, 29 Sep 2012) Amber colour with frothy, off-white head. Fruity, hoppy nose with citrus, grapefruit, pine needles and a touch of resin. Fruity, hoppy taste with notes of citrus, grapefruit, resin, hints of grainy malt and a solid citric/piney bitterness in the finish. More than medium body, with a certain sweetness. Very nice IPA with an impressive hop character.

Finally, a fresh bottle of Alesmith IPA. Ive been wanting to sit down with a bomber of this for years. 

The beer is hazy and light orange in color, with a half inch of head that leaves some sticky lacing on the pint glass. 

The aroma brings grapefruit, pine, sweet candied fruit, and malt. The scent is a notch above the flavor, gaining in intensity as the beer gradually warms. 

The flavor is hop forward, but definitely brings a healthy dose of malt along for the ride. I believe this is what many brewers try to achieve when brewing "balanced" IPAs. Sweetness is present throughout, with some sticky pine resin clinging to the palate. Of course, personal preference plays a role in my rating, but I would like to see the malt bill toned down a bit, giving way to the grapefruit and other citrus flavors. This brew is a little too sweet for my liking, though I certainly dont find it cloying.

The feel is sticky and sweet, with a noticeable pine presence throughout. Alcohol presence is there, though subtle and unobtrusive. The body is medium, with a light bitterness in the finish. Unfortunately, the hop bitterness is somewhat cancelled out by the malty sweetness.

Overall, a good brew and worth a try. Not in the same league as the Alpine Nelson I had last night. Still, tasty and enjoyable.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 08-23-2011

Pours amber with no real head. Aroma is perfect grapefruit and grass. Flavor is thinner than I hoped, but still fantastic. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bomber.  Deep gold color, white head.  Medium body, lots of hop flavor to accompany the bitterness.  Sharp finish that lingers a bit, but not too long.  Very good flavorful ipa.

Alesmith IPA

A-Pours slightly hazy golden color with very minimal bubbles. Chunky two finger off white head.

S-Aromas of sticky pine, citrus, and sweet tropical fruit.

T-Bunch of  hop bitterness throughout with some citrus rind bitterness. Waiting for the fruit notes but never quite make it on the palate. There's something missing. Too hop forward, there's just not a sweet note in it.

Overall- it's okay. I got it in a trade. If I saw it on a shelf I wouldn't buy it.
Just waiting for that extra something at the end that doesn't happen.


-

nice hop aroma, mix of pine and citrus and apple, slightly musty. flavor is quite bitter; crisp with a bit of malt in the back. long bitter finish. its very good but lacking something -- may not have been a very fresh bottle but i dont see a date.

A masterpiece of balance. Packed in here there is huskiness, some silk, a hint of almost buttery maltiness, long tight penetrating bitterness, medical gauze and marmalade yet these elements make a truly beautiful whole. Robust but not in your face, this is just gorgeous.

Somewhat hazy orange beer with a white sticky head. Smells wonderful, grapefruit, pine, resin, cannabis and citrus. Nice sweet malt flavour with much bitterness, very good balance. Medium carbonation.
One of the best india pale ales ive tried so far.

Pours a lovely crystal clear honey amber with a luscious white head.  Smells like heaven with a big bouquet of grassy, citrussy hops.  Crisp, medium light body with predominant flavors of resinous lime peel hops, slight pineapple, and a nice caramel sweet backbone that sits in the background.  Finish is smooth with a slight citrus linger.  This would go perfect with sharp cheddar.

Nice lacing in perfect pint glass.The smell is an explosion of citric and floral aromas. Alcohol content gives a nice warming sensation. well balanced with maltiness. good mouthfeel with nice amount of carbonation to make it refreshing even considering the alcohol. content. Hard to find this beer in my area but will go find more.

English pint at the local peasant, Sherman oaks, CA. Light orange hazy pour. Half inch white head disappeared after a few minutes. Creamy grapefruit scent. Tons of citrus hop flavor like grapefruit, very hop-forward but so so smooth. Finish is very light and watery, disappears almost completely

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 65 cl. Poured hazy orange in colour with a frothy whitish head. Citrus, grapefruit, bitter hops in aroma. Flavour quite similar as the aroma. Bitter finish.

Beautiful color, nice head.  Great hop nose with a great blend of pine and citrus hops. Has a bit of an alcohol bite to add the malty background. Overall, well balanced and a great brew. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Piny grassy citrus with hoppy finish.  Easy drinking for 7.25 ABV. Light mouthfeel could be more balanced but true to style and enjoyable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From a 22 oz bottle purchased at BevMo in pasadena. Pours a clear light amber with a fine white head. Intense citrus hop aroma. Grapefruit, cut grass, with a buttery bitter finish

UPDATED: APR 4, 2013 Grapefruit, orange, citrus, mild grass, and mild caramel aroma. Golden-orange, frothy white head, and mild carbonation. Flavor like aroma; full bodied and balanced. Medium bitter finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: The smell is an explosion of citric and floral aromas, grape-fruit, lime, orange. Pine needles and cones, dried and fresh flowers in a midsummer meadow.Appearance: A clouded orange amber beer, an off-white head that leaves lots of lacing.Taste: The taste has some brown sugar and fresh rye bread, grape-fruit juice and peel, and bitter lemon seeds.Palate: Low carbonation, a smooth and oily complexity followed by a warm dry feeling.Overall: A beer that is so packed with aroma and taste that it really needs good time to indulge. But worth every minute of it. Possibly a bit too much hops compared to the malt.Note: Bottle, 650 ml.. Reviewed 2010-05-21.

Pours golden with beautiful head that lingers throughout. Nice lacing in perfect pint glass. Aroma is sweet, hoppy and piney with some citrus character.  Alcohol content gives a nice warming sensation. well balanced with maltiness.  good mouthfeel with nice amount of carbonation to make it refreshing even considering the alcohol. content. Hard to find this beer in my area but will go find more. Hopefully it will be there tomorrow.

Big, fresh bottle split with the missus. Bright copper-orange with a subsiding white foam freckling with lace. Aroma: heady, floral, slightly sweaty....peach, honey and lemon Lockets, Turkish Delight, pledged pine, breakfast juice, tomato vine, Cointreau-soaked sponge (trifle), liquorice and cinder toffee hints. A fair bit going on; a sniffer leaning into Belgian territory. In the mouth, ripe tangerine and blackcurrant wine gum, bittering grapefruit, florid peachiness, honey and lemon throatsweets. Shower gel finish with liquorice afters; some cinder toffee again. Just not a fan of these big, flowery, malt-heavy coppery IPAs.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2012 Excellent deep piney hops.  Yet not overpowering.  Beer becomes richer yet more mellow as it warms.   The finish is remarkable and must be experienced to be believed, as it is so smooth and sudden. Thick rich head that maintains throughout.  Very well done.    This is the best bottled IPA Ive had, along with Founders Harvest Ale.

Clear, medium orange with a thin white head.  An oily, smoky aroma with hints of pine prepare you for a thick, resiny, bitter beer.  Except that the thick, resiny part never happens.   But the bitter sure does.   Spicy, tongue-scrapping bitterness with a piney, citrus peel flavor and some pineapple in the back.   The alcohol seems more than the 7.25% ABV listed, but its probably the bitterness that makes it so.   Theres just enough caramel malt sweetness to keep this from spiraling out of control and the balance is great for a West Coast IPA.   Finishes with a light sweetness, a touch of smoke and tongue numbing bitterness.   Strong, bitter, delicious.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2012 Fresh Cali IPA number 3.  Pours orange/gold with a thin head.  Nose is pretty light orange candy and herbal hops.  Mouth is great, very focused herbal hops upfront that evolve into more orange peel to the finish.  A light citrus sweetness on the end.  Very tight, very nice, balances a tight bitter herbal hop expression with soft citrus sweetness very nicely.

Amazing. 660ml bottle from BrewDog Manchester. Pours a beautiful orange colour with a white head. Strong hop aroma with sweet fruits, orange, grapefruit and possibly mango. Taste is similar but better, fabulously balanced with a malt backbone. A long, bitter finish follows. Great mouthfeel, medium bodied and moderately carbonated. Best IPA I have had.

Winter 2011 - The Double Dry Hopped IPA must have been short-lived, because Ratebeer didnt have an entry for it. Thats especially strange when you consider the number of highly dedicated beer drinkers who flow in and out of the tasting room on a daily basis. It pours a leathery brown color, and the bouquet develops into a nice pine aroma, with lots of resin and dark sweets. The palate is a little flat (not unlike my perpetually under loved bike tires) and savory, but not too intense either. It has that fresh pine crispiness of the dry hops, and thats really what defines it; its a singular ode to the dry hop process, showing off how it tastes different than a regular IPA. I like it, and think it demonstrates how AleSmith can cover the gamut of beer styles, from dark oozy stouts to beers made for the hopheads.

Not sure how fresh this bottle was, couldnt find a proper best before date. Orange clear colour. A thin head stays for a long time, slightly off white. Aroma promised a bit more than the taste delivered. Best part is the long dry hoppy finish but is balanced by a slight sweetness when u take another sip. Very good beer, would like to try it fresh.

Perfect, almost.  I wouldnt change to a thing.  The soft hops involved are awesome and artfully hopped, dry hopped and finished. Arom is amazing bouqet of rose, grapes and citra floral scents.  Appearance is filtered clean amber gold color tiny white head. Taste is carpet, orange/lemon almonds caramel bread with beatiful spruce wood.  Palate is nice,  floral sweets. Overall - try it for yourself true craftsmanship.

POurs a cloudy orange with a white fluffy head. Pretty good head retention. I got some floaties in there so I guess I should have kept it upright in the fridge... Aroma is very nice and hoppy. I get alot of tropical fruits in this one, ananas, passion fruit, mango, almost a floral smell to is. Alot of citrus aswell. Also smells like honey. Taste has a very nice fresh hoppy flavour. Tropical fruits, citrus, a little malt sweetness in the back. I also get a little pine. Bitterness is medium with a nice lingering finish. All in all a very solid and drinkable IPA!
Bottle at Olympen. Clear amber, solid head. Fruity and spicy hop nose. Complex spicy notes, quite bitter, grassy. Dry aftertaste. Original.
Great IPA. Definitely a good kick of alcohol, nice hoppiness balance. Good fall style.

Didnt enjoy this one as much as I expected to given the reputation.  Nice orang copper color with a creamy foamy white head.  Aroma of citrus and pine, flavor is mild - not as citrusy or hoppy as I expected.  There is a nice balance, but as a result the taste didnt have the distinctive character that I expected.  Ill give it a second chance some time - found it to be a decent beer but it didnt live up to expectations the first time around.

Bottle. Pours a dark gold/copper pour with straw head. Aroma has unfortunately faded, caramel and piney hops, some oxidized notes, nothing telling me this bottle is fresh. Taste is malty, lots of caramel toffee with only traces of bitter hops. Palate is dry, medium carbonation and medium body. Unfortunate, hopefully will get to rerate a fresh bottle. Date your stuff Alesmith!

Good medium strong aroma has citrus, pine, sweet caramel, nuts, dark bread malting. Clear amber, medium long head. Bitter sweet, creamy soft feel, dry and bitter long finish, medium to full body. Lots of flavor, nuances, good balance, good beer.

Orange-gold with good, foamy, white head / Mild, bright flavors of orange, grapefruit, cream, and cut pine / Medium body, some sweetness, smooth but with some biting hops, excellent balance and bitter finish / Lovely, mellow flavors of orange, grapefruit, bubblegum, cream, clover honey, and cut pine / A stylish, restrained and balanced ipa.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2017 Update 26/01/2013: 
Bottle from Brewdog shop. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, grapefruit, pine, caramel and floral hops. Nicely balanced body. Dry bitter finish with fruits and resin. Magnificent IPA that doesnt leave much room for improvement.

Bottle from Alko. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, grapefruit, caramel, pine and floral hops. Fruity bitter finish. Excellent IPA.

Delicate florals, roses, citrus, honey and mild caramel notes dominate the nose and palate. Simply beautiful... And it gets better.. The palate is silky, smooth, with fine carbonation. A beer more about finesse and balance, then power and concentration. A great IPA. Overall, a delicate, beautiful interpretation of an IPA. A must try!!!

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

New Beer Distributors, NY 22oz ($6): Pours a light copper with a white head. Aroma is citrus hops with a hefty dose of very well put together malts. There be plenty of resin. Body is comparatively light. Flavour is comparatively heavy.  There is a good dose of pine. Plenty of citrus. Mellow aftertaste. Malt backbone really makes this one the legit example of an IPA. I was expecting something more hoppy, but was pleasantly surprised to find something a whole deal lighter and more subdued. An excellent IPA, but I am not sure if this ranks amongst my favourites.

75cl bottle at CPK, London. It pours a slightly hazy orange colour with an off-white head. The aroma is a bit sweet and grassy with hops and some caramel and hay. Flavour is fruity and hoppy with a bit of malt and a touch of alcohol. A slick mouthfeel, and a medium bitterness. A bit too sweet to me.

Clear dark copper with a persistent white head. Excellent fresh hoppy nose. Loads of pine wafting from the glass. Medium to lighter bodied IPA with a pleasantly balanced palate. It begins with some honeyed grapefruit before transitioning seamlessly to a peppery, hoppy finish.

pours a clear amber with a small white head and good lacing.

smell is of citrus, caramel, malt, a touch floral, some nuts in back, and hops.

taste is creamy, pine, nice long lasting bitterness, caramel, touch of grapefruit, and malt.  ends smooth with a nice bite.
22oz bottle into pint glass. Pours a light amber with off white head. Aroma is strong citrus and pine. Taste is delicious with balanced hoppiness. Overall an excellent beer.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2012 Great beer. Bottle to Tulip (Thanks Systembolaget to bring it in- at least temporarly). Pours almost a light orange with a decent head. Perfect balance between malt and hops and fruit (citrus). I like !

Blind tasting with Descender and Earth Thirst. Pours lightest of the three, clear yellow with two fingers head. Smell amazingly floral and tropical fruit, peach and grapefruit. Taste light citrus and tropical fruit. Very light bodied and super easy drinking. Hands down the best of the three.
UPDATED: MAR 7, 2014 Perfection, color amber, head very pillowy frothy, citrus, orange, fvery juicy, malty, and very hoppy!

Slightly hazy golden pour, light foam. Beautifully subdued citrus and floral hop aroma. Light grain body with a very pleasing blend of resin and citrus hop flavor, again wonderfully subdued. Consistent bitterness throughout. This beer is not going for the over the top hoppiness that is popular now, rather it is content to just be an extremely tasty brew. Do not pass up!

Bomber at City Beer. Deep gold color, a bit cloudy, with a fine head. Huge resin and citrus hop nose, some tropical fruits, cherry, caramel and chocolate. Flavor of resins and pine, citrus, some mango, very bitter and earthy, light caramel. Soft, fine carbonation. A bit too much pine. Good old school IPA.

SLightly hazy amber pour, thumbs worth of white head.  Grapefruit, Pine, Sweet malt in the aroma and a great balance of them.  BItter Grapefruit, Pine needle, Orange rind ,plum, toasted caramel malt,  Resiny mouthfeel, medium body.  One of the better balanced IPAs Ive had.    More please!

Rate 900!! Thanks for sharing Ben! Bottle. Pours hazy Yellow Amber. Nice aroma, nice flavour. The hop profile isnt exactly bold. Thats the only reason I can think of for this being so unanimously adored. Lack of offense caused. Its obviously delicious but I do find it a little surprising quite how highly this scores. The balance is wonderful betweent the malty sweetness, the deftly measured hops and the exquisite bitter ending. The hops dont jut out in any one direction. A little flowery, a little citrusy, a little piney, a tiny bit tropical. Comparable to Stone IPA or even a less floral Goose Island. I liked this a lot but it was never going to match my expectations.

A-- Poured a cloudy honey yellow color. Bright white half finger head that was quite slow in dying down. Left thick soap like lacing on the sides of the glass. On swirling got two finger head. Lots of small bubbles in the head and very well put together. 

S-- Candied orange, candied grapefruit, passion fruit, and pineapple. Really nice smell and a larger candied grapefruit smell once it warms up. 

T-- Bitter grapefruit taste with touches of bitter orange. Not a lot of pine though. Mostly about fruit and more fruit. Slightly pungent tasting. 

M-- Medium carbonation and nearly heavy feel. Lots of pungent, bitter grapefruit and bitter grapefruit and just touches of syrupy Carmel malt. Mouth is more about bitter fruits as the nose is more about crisp fruits. Like the differences in this. 

O-- Solid and more solid. IPAs make me miss the beer scene in the US most. A beer you can have 2 of and seriously enjoy it.

Pours a gorgeous hazy golden-orange topped off with a large foamy white head. Massive grapefruit aroma followed by a nice malt backbone. Very juicy and piney. The taste is massively bitter and citrusy, loads of grapefruit and pineapple. Lots of sweet malts in the finish. Medium bodied and very dry. An amazing IPA!!!

Bottle pours a dark orange nice fizz fad a head.  Tastes smells of citrus peaches lemon orange pine a small bit of malt and caramel. Not much wrong with it at all. Crisp dry finish semi bitter solid ipa. Would I say tops no but its up there.
Bottle shared by Tom and Ben in PSBH 9th August 2012.  Lovely example of an IPA, this is sweet and hoppy bitterness balanced perfectly, good one, reminded me Lovibonds 69 / Flying Dog Raging Bitch

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2012 Pours a deep gold with a thick, frothy off-white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, citrus, biscuits. Full bodied with a nice balance of citrus, tropical fruits, pine and caramel. A bit of sweetness comes out mid palate and finishes long and bitter. Quite tasty.

Caramel hued and relatively clear.
Mellow aroma of caramel with hints of citrus. Taste of malty caramel with grapefruit and citrus in the back. Very well balanced. Medium body and carbonation

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2015 Pours a clear medium orange color with a big foamy head that lingers a bit. Aroma is mostly pine and citrus with some caramel malt. Taste is only slightly hoppy and pretty malty. More malt than the usual ipa. Good amount of caramel malt backbone. A good ipa but nowhere near my favorite.  Re-rate 2/24/13 - Holy cow, Im guessing the first bottle I bought of this was a bit old.  Just had it again tonight and love it.  Love the appearance now, big foamy head but it fades quickly leaving a great lacing.  Aroma is packed with pine, spruce, flowers, and citrus.  Taste is a bomb of pine and spruce hops, moderate bitterness calms it a bit.  Malt comes through in the finish but still remains very hoppy.  Delicious stuff.  Another re-rate 11/4/15 - My tastes have changed for sure.  This is still a very good IPA but not in my top 10 anymore.  I prefer a little more sweetness and complexity.
Clear, golden yellow beer with white head. Aroma of pines, sweet malt and fruits. Flavour is bitter with the above mentioned. Good beer but not the best IPA ever.

A decent brew. Yellow with a little orange tinge. Head in nice yellow tinted color. Aroma is mostly grassy and pine with some summer fruit behind it. With the taste the orange comes out along with a little chalk and mango. Bitterness strikes through at end of palate. Medium body, easy to knock back in light of the abv. Must get to San Diego some day.

Mostly clear golden and small off-white head.  Nice aroma of grassy-herbal hops and a fruity background.  Medium body, bit of carbonation, not really any alcohol.  Flavor is citrus hops with good bitterness.  Slight touch of sweetness, some malt balance but stays mostly on the bitter side.  Very good, only the fact that it seems a little light overall prevented me from giving it an even higher score.

From: Wallys Wine and Spirits, Los Angeles, CA
Date: None listed
Glass: Tulip

Pours a 2cm head of fairly clean, white foam, made up of small, dense bubbles. This fades to a 0.5cm cap atop the beer throughout the drinking session, leaving substantial lacing while doing so. Body is golden orange in color, transparent, with plenty of active carbonation.

Aroma of peaches, lemon rind, grapefruit rind, apricots, with a mix of malts as well. Pleasant, upfront, and substantial, this is enjoyable and worth repeat exposure.

Tasting opens with darker-than-pale malt flavors that quickly transitions to pine resin and grapefruit bitterness. Mid-palate continues malt body, combined with grapefruit bitterness, citrus-like fruit, and pine resin. Nice flash of tart bitterness in back of palate, leading to a lingering bitterness in close, with hints of apricot, peach, and grapefruit.
