Beer is medium-bodied with just enough carbonation to foam this up pleasantly on the palate, leading to a smooth, creamy mouthfeel. Finish is expectedly dry.

Bottle 22oz.
Pours clear golden with very low white head. Some lacing. Aroma is of citrus, pine/resin, malt. Taste is of citrus, fruits, malt, bitterness, alcohol. Good mouthfeel. Bitter finish. Overall: Nice balance.
In its defense i had it after a blind pig. But it was so bland afterwards. Slighly bitter, with a what seemed to be muddled malt backing.

Transparent yellow-gold with fizzy, white head.  Aroma is grassy floral pine with some lemon-orange and just a little bit of zesty/spice hop character intermingling with some light nectar malt sweetness.  This zestiness seems to come out more in the flavor, with a bit less citrus/pine.  Moderate-to-heavy bitterness.  Just a hint of metallic component, perhaps from being such a naked flavor profile.  The body is incredibly light and drinkable, especially compared to other 4.0+ rated IPAs which may be more intense.  Nonetheless, this particular bottle isnt delicious enough in flavor to merit such a rating.

Cloudy medium to light amber with a creamy off white head. Big mix of aromas of fruity/light on the pine/light on the herbal, and candied caramel. The flavors are lighter than the nose gives off. Flavors of apricot, light pine, citrus, hints of peach, and a tad bit of caramel maltyness for the balence. Medium bitterness, medium sweetness, a small bitter aftertaste, and a light dry finish. 
This is a solid and great ipa, and I have to keep reminding myself its not a dipa. Probably one of the best ipas this palate fancies. It is a joy to have a wonderful nose from every sip and have it overpowered by the hop perfume. The flavors dont seem to be over the top or to special, but all around its a great experience. I am thankful for the talent, time and product  that goes into this and other products. Quite a blessing.

Pours clear golden-orange with tiny quickly diminishing white head. Aroma and flavour: citra hops, citrus, malt, resinous, alcohol, floral. Taste: Excellent balance of mild bitterness and malty sweetness. Good carbonation, dry finish. Overall, this IPAis right on style, but has its own special touch.

Bottle (22 oz). Thanks to Reynolds314 for this one! Clear pale orange with a small white head and fair lacing. Aroma if floral/herbal hops with pine (resinous), citrus and malt. Taste of floral/herbal hops, pine, citrus, fruits, malt and alcohol. Medium but long lasting bitterness. Dry and chalky palate. Good IPA, great balance.

Very nice and balanced IPA.  Looks perfect.  Smells like the resiny-pine IPA it is.  Citrus does come through more on the taste which was mellow.  Too mellow?  Perhaps this IPA was a bit old when tasted.  Still quite good.

Draught at Neighborhood, San Diego. Almost clear, golden liquid with firm, medium off-white head. Aroma of blackberries (simcoe), tangerine, citrus, weed, grass and very light biscuit. Delicious aroma. Taste is dry or very light sweet with medium bitterness and notes of simcoe, tangerine and weed. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Very balanced and totally awesome.

Bärnstensfärgad med vitt skum. Doft av ananas, stjärnfrukt och citrus. I smaken så balanseras den fruktiga beskan bra med en härlig karamell från malten. En mycket drickvänlig IPA som ändå inte saknar bett.

Great balanced IPA while still maintaining the great hop bite that I love about the style. Pours light gold - very light for an IPA. Citrus, pine and faint sweet malts on the nose. Some citrus flavor and nice bite. Not much malt presence which I like.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber: (shared with jarad200p) Pours deep golden to light amber color, and a nice beige head with good retention. Strong piney-citrus character with vanilla in the background ,medium body, average carbonation, long finish.

Pour from the bomber.  Light amber with a cream colored head.  Aroma is mild spruce hops and citrus notes.  Flavor is caramel malt with floral and herbal hops.  Medium bodied with light astringency.  Overall a very good IPA.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2012 On bottle at Amundsen.
Golden color, good foam.
hoppy grapefruit aromas & some lemon, good fruityness.
Medium/full body and complexity.
Solid bitterness, lingering aftertaste.
Very well balanced
Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber, one of my favorite ipas.  Pours golden with a little haziness, good head.  Aroma is citrus and pine, hops are bold, however, not overpowering.  Nice dry malty finish.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle to pint. Looks good; a darker IPA with nice carbonation and sticky lacing. Smells good; nice and golly. Tastes solid; bitter. Mouthful is good. Good beer!
Good hoppiness, crispy finish. Thoroughly enjoyed this IPA on a hot summer day. Good find.

Bomber. Pours hazy cantaloupe with a large off-white lacy head with great retention. Aroma is grapefruit citrusy and a bit resinous with some faint bready malt lingering in the background. Taste starts out sweet before becoming bitter. Solid IPA, but Im not sure why its the #1 IPA on here.
Beautiful lemon colour with fluffy white head. Refreshing aroma. Lively palate. Nice grapefruit taste.
Thanks to northropfrye for this one. Piney and citrus aroma. Nice orange copper colour. Wonderful bitter hoppy and citrus taste. A great IPA.

22 oz. bottle, unfortunately no date, so lets hope its fresh- Pours semi hazy golden with a fluffy white two finger head and good lacing. The aroma is resinous hops, spicy and citrusy, this is all about the hops thank god. The taste is piney and resinous with some citrusy hops, followed by a wallop of bitterness, big bold and in your face hops, it has a nice sweet malt base too. Body is medium, mouthfeel is sticky and resinous, carbonation is moderately high, finish is bitter and lingers long after the swallow. Overall I think it was a solid IPA,  a hop heads delight, but I am not swooning over it or anything, I have had better.
Bomber. Dark copper color. Smells like dank hops. Citrus hop character. Wonderfully bitter. A fine example of what an IPA should be.

65 cl bottle @ home, no BBE info
Aroma is sweet with exotic fruits, biscuits and caramel. Flavour is somewhat sweet with hops, exotic fruits, some caramel, resin and a slight feeling of alcohol in the background. Dry finish with sweet fruitiness. Very fruity stuff, but not as nice as I remembered.

65 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20100219.(7+3+7+3+15)
Pours hazy amber color with medium white head. Aroma of pine needles, floral notes, lots of hops and exotic fruits. Some caramel and citrus fruits also. Flavor of fruits, hops, grassy notes, some toffee notes and hints of vanilla. Medium carbonation, slick and a bit oily palate. Lingering bitter fruity finish. Quite hoppy and fruity, well balanced. Definitely in better shape than the previous I had.
5515
650ml Bottle - Amber with a small head. Grapefruit, pine, toffee and apricot in the aroma. Hoppy and tangy taste with a good malt backbone and notes of peach, grapefruit, toffee and passion fruit.

Pours a translucent chestnut with a thick, rocky head. Beautiful lacing. Intense musty nose, with overtones of bubblegum and citrus. Heavy spicy taste, accompanied by toffee and caramel. Extremely weak mouthfeel and saccharine finish.

A big deep honey colored brew. Big frothy white head. Huge grapefruit-pine and floral aromas. Flavor is deep and sweet with lots of bitter grapefruit skin notes. Some pine. Long bready-bitter finish. Medium to heavy body. Lingering puckering bitterness. Not the best IPA Ive had, but definately in the top tier.

650ml bottle. Clear deep golden colour with average to huge firm frothy to creamy lacing white head. Wonderful hoppy aroma with a vanilla undertone, some piney and fruity notes. Taste is initially dry hoppy with an incoming citrus note, resin; later malt sweetness gains weight, though a constant hoppy dryness remains; slightly sweet liquorice and vanilla notes in the finish. An IPA relatively mild in character, that has its strength in subtle notes.
Pours golden yellow with a formidable white head and excellent lacing. Strong citrus aroma tempered with flowers - and hops, lots of hops. Good flavor with a light body and pleasant finish.

A premium IPA. Light clear pour. Broken head and no lacing. Weak aroma. Heavily hopped, bitter taste. A great refreshing beer but not as good as I expected. Will certainly drink it again though.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle shared.  Pours clear amber with a small off white head.  Aroma is hoppy, caramel, pine and malt.  Flavour is medium bitter, light sweet.  Medium bodied with soft to moderate carbonation.

Pours clear light amber with persistent white head and lots of lace. Aroma citrus (orange was my first thought then seemed to go away on me) pine, hops. Taste citrus, some sweetness, bitterness, dry finish. Very good session IPA. (If your OK with the high alcohol, but who isnt?)

Pours a golden, hazy color; reminds me of HOTD Blue Dot. Aroma is nice, floral and citrus. Taste is dry, and very much hop forward. Not complex. Bitterness is not overly aggressive, but it does get close to it, for my preferences. Finishes dry, moderate lingering bitterness. This is a balanced IPA, for sure, and I do not find anything to gripe about. However, there is nothing particularly outstanding here, to my tastes. I think this IPA is in a very crowed field of very similar tasting IPAs, and so it fails to really standout. A 3.1 rating from me seems just about right. Not something need to try again.
Very lovely creamy, delicious ,classic, cascade citrus hoppy India pale ale.
Pours slightly cloudy golden with a low head. Aroma is malts and fruits. Flavor is malts, fruits and fruity, well balanced hops. Quite good.
Pours golden with reddish twist. Medium white head. Aroma is hops, hand cream, malts and citrus fruits. Flavor is well balanced bitter and hopsy. Some malts. Citrus fruits and pine. Decent.

Pours a light orange amber with a fairly low frothy white head. Semi-clear. Aroma is citrus, pine, maybe some tropical fruits. I regret reading AleSmiths description beforehand because I can strongly feel the vanilla... Would have been interesting to see if it was as present without knowing it should be there. Still, smells wonderful, very balanced and not too extreme. Taste is an explosion of excellent pungent hoppy bitterness. Loads of resin, citrus and grapefruit. Brilliant. Body is medium but almost feels light given the incredibly rich taste. Carbonation is medium, perfect for the style. Finish is long and lingering with a nice, subtle bitterness remaining in the mouth forever. The best "ordinary" IPA Ive had (although its anything but ordinary).

650ml bottle.
Pours a deep straw, white head.
Hoppy, floral aroma, spruce, malt, resin, caramel, malt, grapefruit, yeast.
Dry, medium bodied, high bitterness, creamy CO2.
Very hoppy, yet balanced, taste, spruce, citrus peel, malt, apricot, caramel, resin, spicy yeast notes.
Long, balanced finish. Goodness. (2012-06-02)

Bottld. Pours hazy and deep amber with a frothy white head and with a nice lacing. Nose of citrus and floral hops with some caramel maltiness. Flavor is citrus and pine, vanilla with again a nice caramel backbone. Ends up more dry, fruity and with a decent bitterness. A great IPA.

4 finger beige head that sinks to 5 mm and leaves a lot of lacing on the glass, amber head. Nose: Gooseberries, spruce, the slightest hint of white pepper, hay, butterscotch and apricot. Aroma: Butterscotch, pineapple, apricot, spruce, gooseberries, oranges, the slightest hint of white pepper, hay and grass. Very balanced. Long semi-bitter ending.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks kerenmk. Pours orange to yellow slightly hazy with a nice head, aroma of lime, cheese, apricot and onion, dry with flavors of malt, nut bitterness, grapefruit, onion, nice sweetness, medium to full bodied, nice

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours a bit cloudy golden with a minimal white head. Aroma is fresh hops, citrus pine, grapefruit, notes of bread, caramel. a very smooth bitter backbone with sweet fruitiness up front. Finishes dry with grapefruit and pines. Medium body and carbonation, quite lively mouthfeel.

Bomber courtesy of rlgk. Pours clear golden except for some yesty sediment with a frothy offwhite head that leaves some thick lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is subtle yet sweet and hoppy fresh with caramel, freshly cut grass, lemon zest, dried flowers, grapefruit juice, resinous wood, Earthy tobacco, toffee, pine and orange peal. Taste is sweet and bitter with caramel, oily pine, freshly cut grass, orange peal, lemon balm, grapefruit juice, bread, lemon zest, wet tobacco, lemon hard candy, grapes and hints of alcohol. Mouthfeel is round, oily bitter and medium bodied. Finish is slightly sweet and bitter with bread, caramel, oily pine, fresh grass and orange peal. Sadly felt a bit old and tired but still very good.

Bottle. Golden beer, some particles, lasting off-white head. Hoppy grassy aroma, metal, hay, fruity, some vegetables, malty, some caramel. Hoppy flavor, grassy, metal, perfume notes. Subtile, balanced and not extreme in any way. Bitter finish with fruity notes.

Big bottle at home in Skövde. Nice amber, a bit bubbly clear beer with a big offwhite lacy head. Aroma is hoppy, fruity and a bit malty beer with caramell notes. Hoppy flavour with some malty and grassy notes. A nice summerbeer :-)

Pours a hazy amber with a minimal head that dissipates quickly. Aromas of grapefruit, yeast, and some caramel. Taste pretty much sums up the aromas but this beer is superbly balanced. Nothing offensive in the realm of bitterness. Perhaps one of the best IPAs ever. This beer is a rarity from where Im from so this is a breath of fresh air to have something like this fall into my lap. CHEERS!

Bottle from Ølbutikken, Copenhagen, shared with Foffern and Inbreak. At last: the fabled AleSmith IPA - the search has been long and finally we were rewarded with a bounty of this top ranking beer at Ølbutikken! Been looking forward to this for a very long time. Aroma is grassy syrupy DIPA-ish hop tones, hints of nougat and honey melon. A bit faint; I had expected a more pronounced nose on this one. Taste is dry grassy hay tones, crispy leaves, hints of melon, grapefruit, wood and hazelnuts. Smooth, velvety and pretty compact mouthfeel; this beer feels heavier than it is and overall Id put it more in the DIPA landscape than at least the classic American IPAs. Nice, but no. 1 in the world? Very far from it, as far as Im concerned.

Bottle. Pours a hazy brownish amber with a foamy white head that diminishes fairly rapidly. Fruity, hoppy aroma has notes of grapefruit, mango, passionfruit, lime and caramel. Flavour is hoppy and fruity like the aroma but has a stronger malt profile, balancing the powerful hops with a little caramel sweetness, and has more piney, grassy notes as well. Slick, oily mouthfeel with soft carbonation and a long bitter finish. This really is a great IPA, strikes an almost perfect balance between the sweetness and bitterness, its big but not too aggressive and quite delicious also.

Bottle shared with (and courtasy of) ClubGonzo and Inbreak. Has a golden slightly hazy orange colour with an off-white head. The aroma is a bit sweet and grassy with hops and some caramel, nougatt, hay and cat piss. More fruity is the flavour with also more herbal hops with a bit of cat piss, berries, wood and a touch of alcohol. A slick mouthfeel, and a medium bitterness. The beer has an okay richness and a good balance between malt and hops.

Bottle to chalice poured a light amber with orange hues, a magnificent white cloud head and significant lacing.  Aroma inludes clementine, pine, caramel, and hints of tea leaves.  First sip is a perfect balance of grapefruit and piney hops followed by a surprising flavor of genmai cha (roasted brown rice tea).  The citrus and hops linger in the mouth and play with the palate.  Smoothest, most well-balanced, flavorful IPA that I have had to date.

Pours golden with frizzy medium head. 
Aromas are... Wow! Explodingly hoppy aromas of grapefruit, tropical fruits and caramel malts. This is the perfect aroma!
Taste has citrus, breadyness, caramel, some apricot/peachy tones as well. 
Palate is really good. Starts out quite hitty with some frizzyness, mover over sweet and end very bitter.
This is a really great IPA!

Bottle 650ml @ home
Pours clear deep golden with a long lasting off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel pine, citrus, orange and grape. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long smooth light malty, bitter and dry finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Pretty awesome west coast style ipa.  Always a favorite to have around. A must try if you haven't already. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a golden orange color with a paper thin head yet remains highly carbonated. Aroma of biting citric hops and a mild malt attempt to balance. Not as powerful as some ipas but easy drinking and very tasty. Mouthfeel is so smooth and keeps you coming back for more!

UPDATED: APR 4, 2015 Pours clear with a yellowish amber color. The head is very defined, thick, and laces my glass. The aroma is of tropical fruit, spicy grapefruit notes, and some pine. In tasting I picked up on a good sweet malt profile, mild bitterness, and a mild citrus flavor. This beverage balances out very well. The finish has a mixture of crisp malts, sweetness, bitterness, and booze. In the end it was kinds to my palate and it was very drinkable. The body was perfect too, not too thin but not too rich and full. This is a must try for any beer lover.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2012 En mycket väl balanserad IPA. Smak och doft av humle, tropisk frukt, citrus, örter, en aning vanilj, karamellsötma med en trevlig grapebeska som avslut. Jag gillar den lätta kolsyran med de små bubblorna som smeker insidan av gommen med all arom.

pours with a clear amber hue with a small white head that is mostly diminishing
aroma of tropical fruits, hops and yeast
flavor is malty and hoppy
med mouthfeel with light carbonation

Very good IPA and very balanced but not extreme in any. This could be an IPA that I could drink every day.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle big thanks to watson1977. Pours clear bright amber with a nice sudsy off white head that slowly settles to a sudsy film and lacing. Aroma is big citrus grapefruit/pine and resinous with a subtle sweetness. Taste is more the same big bitter/resinous piny hops and citrus fruit (grapefruit) and malt which shows light caramel. Palate is dry and sticky. Really well put together IPA. Awesome stuff! Ill take more of this whenever!
Lots of citrus in aroma. Colour is  amber and appearance is  hazy. Nice amount of bitterness with just the right amount of body. Good balance between hops and body. Long finish. Fantastic IPA.
Pours clear golden with a small hraf. Aroma American hops, grass. Light bitter taste with slight vegetables. Medium body. Not Bad.

A wonderful hoppy aroma. A lighter colored beer. Taste is extremely hoppy and bitter but delicious.  Not much citrus or sweet flavors that usually come with an IPA....Still very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

65cl bottle @Viisi Penniä, Helsinki. Light hazy golden with a white head. Inviting, grapfruity hoppy aroma, slightly sweet. Flavor has pine, tropical fruits, sweet malt and decent bitterness in the finish Toffee notes as well in finish. Solid IPA.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2015 Bottle. Golden, hazy, average to large and mostly diminishing head. Moderate, malty andlightly sweetish aroma, some floral - tropical fruitiness and light caramel, lots of piney - some citrus hoppyness. Body medium to full, malty and lightly sweetish flavor, light caramel, some floral - tropical fruitiness, piney - some citrus hoppyness. Finish is average to long, malty and dryish with light fruitiness,faint caramel and lots of piney - some citrus hoppyness. Really nice dryish and well hopped IPA.
Une explosion dagrumes du début à la fin, spécialement le pamplemousse blanc. Le corps est assez volatile et souple mais avec un profil malté assez étoffé. Buvabilité morbide.
Flowery smell, golden colour. Very fresh, aroma of herbs, hops and a long aftertaste

Bottked. Light orange ambeer clear pour.  Soft pillowish head that leaves a trail. Strong floral aromatics, light malt and caramewl - nice hops bite but super dry finish.  Really well crafted and delicate for a powerfully good example of the style

Bottle shared at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks to the parents-in-law who brought one of the awesomest beers Ive drank lately. Hazy, amber colour with a frothy white head. Papaya, lime and hemp aroma, Extreme, bitter, green taste. Medium body, soft carbonation, nice bitter finish.

Bottle. Pours a lightly cloudy light amber color with a minimal quickly dissipating head. Powerful aroma dominated by citrus/grapefruit and floral hops. Flavor mimics aroma with strong citrus/grapefruit and floral notes, bitterness from start to finish. Excellent IPA and a must-try on any list.

Great hazy Orangeish/Gold color. Almost hefesque. Aroma is a nice strong hops finish with subtle Floral finish and a tad bit of pine/grapefruit. Nice blend with the malt which creates a medium/medium strong bitter ipa. Amazing beer. Once a weeker for me.

Nice golden yellow hazy pour with a wispy white head. Aroma more floral than citrusy, even somewhat like rose petals. Taste is hoppy and bitter, slight 
citrus but not overwhelming. Finish is bitter with medium duration. Quaff Score 7 / 10

Pours a hazy golden orange with a white head and hoppy aroma of pine and grass. Taste is sweet, of hops, pine, grapefruit, and grass with a heavy bitter finish. Great IPA, well balanced and nice bittersweet tastes throughout.

Hazy amber/gold color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of nice floral/pine hops, citrus, & some caramel malt; Flavor of slight sweet malt, caramel/toffee, pine hops, citrus (notably grapefruit), some fruit, and spice; Finish dry and bitter; Very nicely balanced; Excellent IPA - lives up to the hype.

bottle, pours clear golden orange. Aroma: herbal, tea-like, malty caramel, has that characteristic Alesmith aroma, grains, sweet orange, tangerine, peach, grapefruit, pine, Taste: quite dry, nice bitterness, peach, tangerine, orange peel, grapefruit,  pine, grains. very balanced.

Bottle and draught tonight.  Bit better from the bottle, maybe.  My last beer / desert island beer basically.  Incredibly round sweet floral and tropical fruits with hints of vanilla, grain, and pine. Taste is a bit sweet and grainy... not so in your face grapefruit though plenty of pine. It rides out with mouthwatering washes of hop bitterness.  Mouthfeel is multidimensional fresh bodied ale, prickly carbonation, and cooling sensations.  For a beer that looks so plainly colored and clear, though with exceptionally lasting thin head and good lace, you would never guess this was one of the best beers you can buy.
Light amber in color with a foamy off white head. Very smooth, hoppy, but with a hint of citrus zest and pine. A touch of sweetness. A very good IPA.

Great aroma and flavor. Might be my favorite ipa. Piney and citrus aroma. Enough of a sweet maltyness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle received from fatboyjim1 (BA) in a trade awhile back. Thanks!

Pours a cloudy dark gold with a good-sized white head on top. Retention was good, and it left some lacing webs on the glass. Smells of deep pine and citrus zest. Very sharp and resiny. 

The mouth was a bit thinner than I expected. Could use a bit more carbonation play. This was a pretty bitter IPA. Plenty of citrus hop bitterness, but not as balanced out with malt sweetness as I would have liked. Finishes tart and perky. This is a good IPA, and Im glad I traded for a few of these. Thanks again, Jim.
Pours a clear  amber/copper color with a small off-white head. Decent lacing. Aroma is of floral hops. Taste of grassy, floral and piny hops with a malty backbone. Finishes smooth.
Pours a hazy dark amber color with a  white head and nice lacing. Aroma of citrus and floral hops. Taste is sweet caramel, citrus and pine in a perfect combination. Medium mouthfeel.
Bottle. Nice orange color with an off white head. Aroma is piney hops, citrus, and malt. Taste is the same with some resinous flavor. Medium body. Very nice.

22oz bottle I picked up at Big Z Beverage.  Reminds me so much of Pliny the Elder.  Pours a clear, bright orange with a frothy, lacing white head.  Seductive aroma, hop resin, pine, earthy, dried leaves, lemon zest, scallions, a little honey, flower pollen, floral, grassy.  Flavor is sweet, zesty, lemons, orange zest, hop pellets, light malt, lightly sweet, pine.  Medium bodied, refreshing, zesty finish.  Worthy of all the praise.

Served on-tap at Als of Hampden.

A - Pours hazy orange with a nice one finger tall white head leaving light rings of lace down the glass.

S - Smells of pungent citric hops, tropical fruits and some light caramel sweetness. The hops are nice and bright, just how I like my IPAs to smell. Awesome stuff.

T - Starts off with plenty of citric hop bitterness slowly giving way to hints of mango, grapefruit and some light sweetness. This one is very fresh and tastes exceptional. Finish has plenty of hop bitterness, lingering on the pallet long after consumption.

M - Smooth body with lots of hoppy flavors and moderate carbonation. Very nice feel to this one with plenty of hop bitterness, lingering long after the finish.

O - My first time having this one on-tap and I really enjoyed it. From the bottle it was just decent but this one was much better. I will get my fill while I can for sure.
Pours a mostly clear orange body with a thin, lasting white head. Oranges, peaches, grapefruit, and a mild caramel. Delicious, smooth and refreshing. Among the best IPAs out there.

Pours a dark orange color with a white head that disappears quickly and leaves nice lacing on the glass. Aroma is fruity, citrus and sweet.   Taste is initially sweet and quickly transforms into a refreshing, hoppy bitterness that lingers.
Bottle. Pours golden with a white head. Hoppy aroma of tropical fruits, citrus, pine with some malt. Hoppy, bitter and fruity. Very well balanced and very nice. Dry and bitter finish.

From the Bottle. Very piney on the nose with an earthy forest floor aroma. Exceptionally clean tasting, with pine,grass and citrus bite.Light malt backbone, One of the best West Coast IPAs Ive tried.

Stunningly well-balanced peiece of craftmanship. Cannot emphasize enough how amazing the banana-esteurs develop as one works through the bottle. Bitterness very mild and tempting like girls on bikes in the Copenhagen springtime...
Bottle with Nate. Citrus, pine, grass, hops, caramel, almost earthy fresh. Finishes dry with fruity notes.

Smells of pine. Pours a murky gold. Love the bottle conditioning which makes for a nice mouthfeel. Taste is very well balanced with a upfront sweetness and a sharp bitterness to finish but not too overwhelming for this non iPa fan

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2015 From bottle. Pours golden with white head that fades away. Resinous hop aroma, touch floral and a touch citrus. Similar taste, alcohol comes through a bit, some caramel malt. Nice mouthfeel with a bitter finish. A good ipa, not sure about best in the world, although I suspect this wasnt the freshest of bottles. I had this a while back and remember it being more hoppy I drank this again and it was fucking delicious.

Bottle Thanks to Boltz7555 for getting this to me.   Certainly lives up to its billing.   Thin head with lots of lacing.   Tons of pine and citrus hops aroma.   Taste is deliciously bitter with more pine and a dry slightly fruity finish.   Glad I have one more bottle.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2012 I have been looking for this for a while, finally saw it and snagged a few bombers.  Great pour and aroma, fruity.  Taste is strong and bitter, very bitter and fruity on the back end, also has a very dry quality to it, nothing really stands in as a backbone in the malt department, but because the hops are so good it serves it well.  Definitely top tier IPA.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2013 Amazing ipa, tons and tons of lacing. Medium to small head. Grapefruit, pineapple, juicy and tang hops. Fruit punch aftertaste. Other small notes of honey, caramel, and candy. Tons of vanilla in the finish. Re-rate, at teresas one of the best examples I have had of the beer, so much more onion and melon, almost nelson like. Moved it up a notch.
Orange color with a thin white layer of foam. It smells strongly of grapefruit, lemon, and oranges. Starts of piney and is followed by some sweet malt and a touch of caramel. Full bodied.

Clear golden color with a thick white head. Aroma is piney hops, nice fresh grassy smell as well. Flavor is strong piney hops, without being too sticky. Finish is surprisingly clean with a nice malt backbone. Overall, excellent, powerful but extremely well balanced IPA. This would be on my regular rotation if I could get it more often.
Bomber. Outstanding India Pale Ale. Big grapefruit and other citrus flavors. Malty background. Great bitter finish. crisp, clean and way to easy to drink.. Tasty.

Pour is a light clear orange with a small white head, which quickly turns to small ring around the glass. Nose is of sweet hops and light fruits. Taste is very much the same, with a little bit of malt in there for added character and sweetness, which helps to cut the bitter bite at the back out. Great beer overall.

Perfect, perfect, perfect, perfect, perfect, perfect, perfect, perfect, perfect, perfect. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A nicely balanced clean IPA which is not overly aggressive with the hops.  Pours a lovely rich golden colour, but for me lacks a certain something to make it interesting.  Lacks a bit of mongrel to make it memorable.

22oz thanks to csteele2144, thanks Chris!  Pours a clear dark golden with a thin white head, the aroma has a ton of fruit and citrus on the nose, the flavor is of wet dank hops with a nice balance of malt in the finish, I wanted a little bit more out of the flavor, it really didnt jump out at me at all, the 7% is very hidden, good stuff for sure but I feel we have better IPAs right out of the midwest that I can get at any time.  Huge thanks to Chris for sending this one my way!

A nice looking amber, slightly hazy with a creamy lasting head that clings to the glass and caps the beer throughout. A surprisingly malty aroma of bread and yeast with some caramel along with a hint of pine and citrus. The hops show up in the taste with a big peppery, pine and citrus hit in front of the sweet malt. The finish is dry and refreshing. Very nice.
UPDATED: JUN 26, 2012 Wow. This is a damn near perfect ipa. Has a nice citrus grapfruit aroma. Taste is amazing. Nice balance of sweet fruitness with the hops!

UPDATED: APR 6, 2012 A pours cloudy orange amber with high white head. Strong lacing. S - very fruity hops up front. Tropical fruit, apricot, grapefruit. Grassiness and pine abound. Caramel malts. M - nice creamy mf with high carb, malts up front and hops at the back of the mouth. Lingering hoppy ending. T - grassy bitter hops up front. Some caramel malts and pine on the palate. Lingering grapefruit and bitter hops. O - very good straight ipa. Simple on the hoppy side. 8+

22oz bottle poured into a tulip.   Pours a golden amber with a small medium white head.   Aroma is floral,  pine,  grapefruit.   Taste is more grapefruit and citrus,  very well balanced before delivering some bitterness at the end.   Excellent.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2012 Would have to be at the top of the IPA list. One of the most complex aromas on any IPA I have ever had, with floral and citrus, and then the taste is smooth and not malty. You have to try this beer.

Revised on 9/23/2012

I first had this IPA in southern California, and it was the same trip I had Pliny an Sculpin. Ive been able to drink it again and have some revisions. Pours a beautiful clear, light amber color. Aroma is wonderful: hops and grapefruit, citrus, pines. Taste changes as the beer warns up. At first (say below 40 degrees), the pine and hops at dominant. As it warns up, some malts come through. Has a bitter, hoppy finish. Still a great IPA, though not as high as I rated it first time.

Poured from the bottle, cannot believe Ive stumbled upon the number one ipa!  the color isa reddish orange copper color. Nice head. Aroma is like fresh hops right off the vine! Flavour is also really good! Nice bitterness, balanced palate not too sticky not to watery. This really is a amazing ipa!

Bottle shared at RBWG 2012. Pours a cloudy orange with frothy off white head. The aroma is grapefruit and pine. Medium moutjfeel with a strong hop and light citrus with nice smooth finish. Easy to drink a very impressive IPA from Alesmith.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2012 Rerating.  I believe my first bottle was not as fresh as needed to be fair. Bomber.  Pours a hazy copper with a puffy white head, significant lacing.  The aroma is pretty astringent with some deep pine and citrus notes.  The taste is fairly bitter but a strong sweetness from the malt balances this out.  This is a top three IPA.. hard to decide whether this is better than Sculpin.. but they are such different brews.

22 oz bomber poured into pint glass

A: hazy golden hue, slim head with good retention, nice bubbling carbonation

S: citrus and pine, light malt

T: piney and citrus hop flavor have bite. Light caramelized malt provides a decent backbone. Bitterness is stong and slightly prickly.

M&d: light bodied, dry finish. Sometimes I think the mouthfell is a bit watery but that also makes me think it is more drinkable beacuse of this.

Overall, a decent ipa, but I think it is a tad overhyped.

From notes.  First reviewed 10/11/2010.  Poured from a 22 oz. bottle into a tulip. 

Alesmith IPA pours an amber copper color, with a full, creamy, off-white head. Great retention, and sticky lacing all over the side of the glass.

Great, full hop aroma. The smooth citrus notes are well balanced with some tingly pine. Grapefruit and orange rind provide the fullest part of the aroma.

The full hop flavor is in control the whole time, but it does allow the malt to provide a good foil up front. Caramel bready malt provides a sweet base for the juicy hops to explode on the palette. Grapefruit and orange provide the most pop, and the pine notes add another level of complexity.

Nearly silky smooth, there is a slight graininess, but nothing that takes away from each sip. The generous hop flavors and full malt bill contribute to a fuller than average body. Bigger than a regular IPA, smaller than a DIPA. 

This is a well-balanced, full IPA with a great hop bill. I wish I had access to this more often.
Bottle at brewdog bar nottingham. WELL tasty. Many subtle favours and a great texture. Laverly.

Copper-orange hue and a little haze. Has incredible head retention. Smells very citrusy and pine-ey with an almost balanced barley malt base, allowing the hops to dominate the nose. Flavors are sweet of malt and hop flavored all at once. A joy to drink.

Had super high expectations for this, and its difficulty to get my hands on it only added to the hype.pours a cloudy gold, nice head, lively, everything looked promising. Taste is hoppy yet smooth, a little watery. A good brew for sure, but not the 4+ I was expecting.

Pours hazy amber color with a nice 2 finger white head with very good retention that reduces to a lacing cap that leaves nice lacing. Aromas of caramel, citrus, grapefruit, floral, and pine. Taste of strong grapefruit, with caramel, spice, and pine. Finishes off with a nice clean bitterness and lingering citrus and fruit flavor. Very smooth drinking. A little bit of alcohol warming on the finish.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2012 Bomber courtesy of Peacehammer. Poured a golden orange with a bright white two finger head. I am picking up smells of citrus, pine, grapefruit, and a little caramel at the end. Hops are heavy right off the bat. Great citrus taste with a wonderful bitter finish. This is just what I expect from a West Coast IPA, strong hop profile and a high level of bitterness. Definitely worth the buy and I will most certainly seek this out again.

Crystal clear amber color with large white foamy head.  Potent citrusy grapefruit pine hop aroma.  Taste - Grapefruit hops balanced by a strong sweet caramel malt backbone.  Caramel malt is prominent.  Some fruity esters on the finish.  Texture is fairly creamy.  This is damn good but I dont think its the best.

Bottle.  Pours golden with a large white head.  Great hop aroma of floral and citrus with a hint of pine.  Hoppy flavor with citrus and fruit with some florals mixed in.  Mild, slightly sweet but unobtrusive malt backbone.  Very smooth and creamy mouthfeel with a nice bitter hop finish.

Great IPA. Pours a golden brown with a big off white head. Nose and taste are of citric and earthy hops, nicely balanced brew. I would love to have this be a regular offering around here. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Well for being #1 IPa, I guess I was expecting more, but its still a tasty Smooth drinking ipa.

22oz bottle. Pours bright clear orange with a nice white head. Good lacing and head doesnt fully dissipate. Aroma is crazy good. Floral hops, and tropical citrus. Just a touch of pine. Wish i could get an air freshener with this scent. Flavor is all citrus notes of mango, peach, and florals balanced by just enough malt in the backbone. Light  body and a nice finish. Similar to Ballast Point Sculpin but superior in each category in this guys opinion.

A piney and floral aroma with a bubbly white head that stays for a while amid leaves some lacing. The flavor is citrus and resin at first (slightly spicy/sweet) with a malty middle and a long, hoppy finish and a nice mouthfeel.

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2016 RE-RATE:
Meh. Now that my palate is dialed in, this is a mediocre IPA. Not next level shit. 
Acquired via trade w/ peacehammer.  Pours a clear burnt orange with a nice pillowy off white head that sticks around for a while.  Aroma is brilliant... Citrusy hops, Im getting a lot of grapefruit and mango. The taste keeps pace with the promise of the aroma... Sticky, bitter bliss with a nice malty backbone to hold it all together. This is a beautiful beer.  No wonder it is the #1 IPA.  Im so glad I go t to try this one...
hazy golden color, citrus pine aroma, flavor is citrus pine with a malty balance and doughy yeast finish, one of my favorite IPAs

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2012 Bottle pours hazy orange with a medium white head. Aroma is grassy hops with lots of underlying notes of pineapple and citrus rinds. Flavor is sweet candied pineapple and juicy hops ending on the pine side, oily consistency with lots of lingering bitter pine.

Poured from a draft into a pint glass at Vine Cottage in La Mesa, Calif. Color was honey pale, kind of light. Light head once I got it, maybe ½ inches. Light bubbly lacing on the top. Circular white film on the sides. 

Smelled citrus hops up front. Fairly hoppy. Main citrus notes were orange and tangerines. 

Didnt taste too much like the nose. Very bitter in the beginning. Grainy and earthy. 

Medium body. Thick grainy texture. Average-to-above average (lively) carbonation.  Bitter finish.

Not a bad beer, but a bit disappointing considering the look and smell. I thought about going higher on the sight, which may have led me to give it an overall rating of a 3.5.

Pours a clear red-orange with a thick, fluffy just off-white head. Aroma is caramel, citrus, fruit, pine, bubblegum. Taste is strong, citrus and alcohol up front. This fades into a warm almost sweetness; then a strong bitter, fruit rind finish. Laces like crazy. Mouth feel is warm and chewy. Overall, a fine IPA.

This is amazing.  Period.  Perfect hoppy, citrusy, and every so slightly sweet taste, with a long, hoppy, piney, bitter finish.  Only thing that could be improved is the aroma, maybe a slightly fresher bottle would have earned this a 5.

Got this in a trade with Daknole.

For a standard IPA this is fantastic, one of the best.  Strong solid hop flavor.  Very piney taste to it. A bit of spruce and herb.  Very smooth.  This was a really tasty beer.  Wish it was more available.  Awsome.

Earthy malt base, like soil. Pine oil. Secondary orange peel. Amber orange color. Nice lacing. Grassy flavor, earthy malts for balance. Fragrant floral hops, perfumey.  Sandpapery feel. Resin, bubblegum, just outstanding.

I love American IPAs and this stuff rocks! Bottle shared at some mad Roman feast Alex took us to on MesandSims stag do. Obvious hop aroma, with some spice, hint of malts. Flavour has huge hoppage, some citrus. A little thin but very nice.
Everything you want in a nice, smooth IPA.  Citrus, pine and malt tastes.  Smooth finish.  Very nice.

Bottle into tulip. Nose is big pine/grapefruit with some hose water/grassy notes. Very nice aroma. Pour is light orange with a white head. Excellent retention on the lacing. Taste was nice and hoppy with plenty of citrus and pine to please the palate. Just the right amount of bitterness to make this one very drinkable. Balanced and enjoyable. Great beer.

Pours a nice dark yellow, looks a lot like apple juice Id say. Smells pleasant and hoppy, lots of pine with some citrus and honey in the mix. While tasting bitter, the fruitiness of this IPA was outstanding! Perfectly balanced and strong as well, and is probably the best damn IPA Ive ever had. A big thanks to OmegaX for sharing this gem of a beer.

A piney and floral aroma with a bubbly white head that stays for a while amid leaves some lacing. The flavor is citrus and resin at first (slightly spicy/sweet) with a malty middle and a long, hoppy finish and a nice mouthfeel.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2015 Refrigerated bottle less than six weeks old poured into a snifer.  Pours clear light orange, with huge (two or three inches) off-white head.  Some lacing, medium body, medium carbonation, and beautiful pine & grapefruit aroma.  Taste is grapefruit, pine, and bitter finish.

Pours a clear, deep copper. Very inviting.  Nice hop aroma with citrus (grapefruit, orange) dominating.  Sweet up front with a nice crisp, bitterness on the palate.  Dry-ish (which is nice).  More grapefruit and grassy hop flavors.  A very, very nice, IPA!
22oz bottle, no bottle date.  Copper pour with a couple fingers a head.  Huge pine and citrus aromas, great finish.  Fantastic IPA

Poured from a bomber into a snifter. Appearance is a orange to copper with a dense head of white foam that persists to the end of the beer and leaving nice rings of lacing down the glass. Aroma is floral, citrus, and piney. In the taste I get a sweet, bitter, juicy beer with a nice bready malt backbone that comes into effect at the end of the swallow. Very good IPA.

Bought a bomber at a local store.  No idea how fresh it is.  Slightly cloudy orange hue, good lacing.  Decent hoppy citrus aroma.  Taste is extremely subdued - I am seriously wondering if my palate is diminished today for some reason.  Moderate IPA bitterness but few flavors otherwise.  Not very impressed with this bottle.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2015 22oz bottle, shared. Clear yellow color, really nice, thin, foamy and persisting white head. Great reaches of lace. This is one of those fantastic hoppy brews with enough strength in the dry aroma for it to wash over you upon the first sip, enveloping you and your tastebuds in a hoppy blanket. Great, light crisp carbonation, awesome fruity hop aroma. Grapefruit, pineapple, mango. Awesome bitterness that isnt so harsh, retains some sweetness to mellow things out and keep me gulping away. Probably a bit of salt taste in this brew, to bring all of this awesomeness out, no doubt. Excellent, overall... Im actually trying to rate this objectively from all the hype Ive heard, I fear I might be under-rating this. This one deserves its accolades 8/4/8/5/17 Update rate, 11/22/15: 12oz bottle, from Dutchs. Up front, a bit of a yeasty flavor, kind of papery cracker-like bready malt. Great, big citrusy spicy hop washes over the palate in a quick crest. Bigger bitter taste, lighter-plus sweet, just a mild bit of alcohol. Mostly clear orange color, with an off-white head with good retention. Leaves great ridges of lace. Medium to bigger body. Kind of crisp, lighter carbonation. More dry finish. A fantastic IPA, still.
Bottle: pours golden amber with a thin white head, aroma of floral hops, mildly hoppy taste with a malty finish. Good!

Huge nose on this beer which is a good thing. Great initial intake of the scents. Color is good. The taste is excellent. Enjoyable beer for sipping or for drinking casually. Goes very good with grilled burgers and hot dogs too.
Golden yellow color in the glass. Huge aroma erupts of pine and citrus. Taste has big hops but a crisp taste. Grapefruit and grass dominate. Smooth finish.

Nice Fluffy head, very light orange color.  I can see how this IPA gets its ratings.  Considering that it traveled from the brewery in SanDiego, to Whole Foods Market in Portland, Oregon, and then stuck in a gym sock in a suitcase for the long flight home to the east coast with baggage handlers tossing it this way and that, it tastes pretty damn good! Perfect west coast IPA - the hops are way out front where they should be, lots of oily resin, great grassy citrus flavor.  Between Stone, Green Flash and Ale Smith, (not to mention the frickin weather) Im ready to move to San Diego!  Why cant good weather cities in Florida produce IPAs like this?  At least this brew helps me through another long Pennsylvania winter night.

Hazy orange with a huge fluffy white head, lots of lacing. Hop aroma of grass and citrus. Flavor is caramel malt with a lot of citrus and grass. Finish is dry, very hoppy but not overly bitter. A lively carbonation that brings out the citrus. Wonderful.

Pours very pale gold with medium white head.  Aroma is fruity, citrus hops and sweet malt.  Taste is delicious citrus hops with a light sweet malt finish and solid hop bitterness.  This is an elite IPA.

Den här ölen är skrämmande bra, härlig doft, underbar smak och välbalanserad som igen annan öl är. Den fruktiga smaken smeker ens smaklökar till klimax.... nej men allvarligt så är det här en grymt bra öl och den lämnar ingen besviken.

Thanks to GatorGuy92 for sharing this one.  Pours a hazy yellow with a white head.  Nose is light malt, big pine, and some grapefruit.  Flavor is similar with a light malt backbone powering the hop assault.  Light to medium in body and enjoyingly flavorful.  Awesome off-kilter hop presence that still bring the malt forward for support.  Interesting beer.

Aroma is earthy, piney, fruity, bread/malty. Appearance is a darkened amber with a medium foam head. Taste is a spectacular hoppy bitterness with a citrus/spice filled finish. Finish is a pleasing malty, hoppy border-line heavy body. Overall, lots of complex flavoring. Perfect balanace of malts, hops, citrus, and yeast.. This is a big beer, lot of flavor, tons of hoppy bitterness and nice light fruity/citrus undertones. Id give this an A+ rating
Bottle from Johns Marketplace.  Thin white head, floral and piney smelling.  Very solid.  Might have been over-hyped for me, but its really good.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2016 Bottle.  Transparent gold pour.  Aroma is of pine, citrus, and sweet malts.  Taste is well balanced and includes flavors of fresh citrus, pine and sweet malts.  Smooth mouthfeel.  An excellent beer.
Revisit on 1/16/16
Bottle.  Same gold colored pour.  Aroma is pine up front followed by white sugar, light citrus and sweet papaya.  Flavor is tangerine, sugar, pine, papaya and pith.  Level of carbonation is medium.  I still feel this is a good beer, but if I rated it today I would probably give it a 4.  However, I will let my original rating stand.
Very hoppy, flowery aroma. Perfect body for an IPA, has the nice biting hops that west coast IPAs tend to have, but still remains very drinkeable.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2017 Bottles from BrewDog Edinburgh & Glasgow. Can from BrewDog OnLine. Light flowery hoppy aroma. Amber brown colour, reasonable head. Sweet flowery hoppy flavour, Smooth with bitter sweet aftertaste. Good one.

Bottle @ home, courtesy of daknole. Thanks! Hazy, golden orange appearance with a creamy, white head. Potent grapefruity, citrusy, mild piney hoppy aroma with a sweet maltiness and some dryness. Creamy mouth feel. Grapefruit, creamy, lightly piney hoppy, slightly tangy, sweet malty flavor with a lingering dry finish. Above average IPA.

GABF 2011. Clear brilliant gold, smooth small white head. Brilliant citrus hop aroma, with some pine resin and caramalt. Nice hoppy flavor, but a little "green". Imbalances toward bitter with pine and grassy floral tones, not much sweetness.

Pour orange with a thin white head good lace. Aroma sweet, caramel, cereal, pine, citrus hops, not overly abrasive, smells outstanding. Taste bitter, citrus, pine, caramel, cereal, sweet malts, grapefruit, very balanced. MF medium body nice light carb. Scary balance not a hop bomb but just extremely well brewed, this beer is crushable and delicious if this was readily available it would be my regular drinking beer.

Bottle shared with ma dad.. Pours amber with an off white head. Aroma is piney hops, floral notes, citrus, orange, grapefruit, yeasty notes, hay and mandarin. Taste is straight forward hoppy with notes of citrus, lemon peel, grapefruit, pine, yeast, floral, lime and some malts in the background. Long and bitter duration. West Coast classic.
Gli americani sono maestri in questo. Hanno cambiato il modo di concepire le IPA, e questa è la loro versione più alta.

Drank a bomber from San Diego friends.  Nice lacing white head and good aroma of pine resin and citrus with some malt.  Taste was a little disappointing for there was more malt than expected, although a very balanced beer!  Id love to try it on tap though.
@ Alesmith. amber pour with slight head. Bitter hop aroma. Flavor is piney hops with nice malt presence. Very balanced and drinkable.

Bottle. Hoppy aroma of fresh citrus and pine. Opaque orange w small white head. Taste of hops: citrus, pine and a long bitter finish. Medium body, oily texture and soft carbonation. Its good but not as good as I had expected. Maybe I kept the bottle too long before I had it? (Well I didnt want to drink all my treasures that I brought home from CA all at once, ok?)
Strong hops with a slight pine flavor, medium bodied, smooth lingering finish. Excellent IPA!

Draft at Alesmith tasting room with Andrew, Brendan and the big boy daddy dad Bachelor, Dallas. Pours an amber gold body with thin foamy lacing. Aroma is fresh pine hop. Mouthfeel is fresh and bitter pine hops. Nice IPA.

On tap at Alesmith with Andy, James and Dallas for Dallas bachelor weekend. Dark amber/copper pour with a thick and lasting head. Aroma and taste are of delicious hoppiness. Extremely well balanced and drinkable with very little aftertaste. Crisp and awesome. One of the best IPAs I have had.

Great fragrance, fresh tone of pine, citrus and sweet fruity and flowery hops. Large hops aromatic taste with hints of fruit and flowers. Long slightly spicy finish, with great bitterness. A fantastic beer!

Pretty much lives up to the hype. Has the aroma and taste of Ruination but without the over the top mouth feel.  Really the standard for a single IPA hands down. In the end taste is everything and this one has it in spades.

Bomber courtesy of tomme50.  Pours a nice, hazy, orange with some copper highlights. Subtle, yet nice aroma on this one.  Orange, sweet caramel malt, pineapple, bit of toffee and other assorted citrus make up the aroma.  Both the aroma and body are "hoppy" without being too extreme.  Malt driven in the flavor, hops definitely not at the forefront, but a intertwined.  Citrus, sweet malt, and a hair of pine make up the flavor with a slightly creamy body, and a short not so bitter finish.  I dig it, but its no Two Hearted thats for sure!

Bottle shared by mtjoseph.  As of today this will complete the top 10 ipas for me.  Thanks bud!  Slightly hazy copper in color, maybe some golden highlights, and a small white collar of foam.  Nice fruity aroma with some pineapple and orange.  A good dose of sweet caramel is present too.  Taste is a bit more malt forward.  Caramel, pine, and grapefruit.  Balanced to say the least.  Small snap of bitterness right at the finish, but it fades almost as fast as it comes leaving a fairly short finish.  Nice, medium body and very easy to drink for an ipa.  I would have liked a little longer of a finish, and maybe a bit more citrus character coming forward both the aroma and taste of this.

En perfekt välbanserad IPA. Fantastiska humlearomer. Grape, gräs, tallbarr, tropisk frukt, liten sötma, mycket humlesmak, och precis så mycket beska som behövs. Alltihop i total harmoni. Provad en månad senare idag, redan lite mer fadd, mer jäst och massor av skum som knappt vill lägga sig. Ska drickas så färsk som möjligt.

22oz bottle.
Deep amber color with a good amount of white head that left lots of lacing on the glass.  Smells like citrus and pine hops with some honey sweetness and caramel.  Flavor is a hop head dream with sticky, resiny hops and a killer malt backbone.  Dynamite west coast IPA.

Bottle 65 cl, Skjold Burne Århus. Pours cloudy light amber with a nice off white head. Aroma is vey fruity, piny, sweet, grapefruit and spicy.  Flavor is very hoppy,s weet...all tat American IPAs are expected to be. Finishes with a longlived fruity sweet and very bitter aftertaste. Really good, indeed.

Ive had this beer a few times and was surprised to see Id still never gotten round to rating it! Pours out a most attractive deep golden colour with just a tiny hint of haze, but all in all its pretty clear. Aroma is tropical sweet and delicious. Loads of honey and cereal, light toffee and caramel. Behind that you have touches of ripe mango, pineapple, pine, resin and a slight hop-glue effect which I love. Flavour is very well balanced, hits you up front with good bitterness, fresh citrus and herbs with a refreshing lightness, but this belies the subtle richness and creamy body of the beer. Lovely caramel and runny honey, good sweetness that balances the awesome hoppiness, but yet the hops never get too much. Mids show  slight graininess with citrus. Finish is not massively long but is nicely drying and you get a slight return to sweetness with a kiss of pungent tropical hops. All in all this brew truly deserves its accolades as being one of the best IPAs around.

Bottle. Looks fantastic. A pale copper with (initially) a huge white head. Quickly dies down to become a firm, fluffy one finger width white head. Loads of lacing left around the glass. A little let down by the aroma although it isnt to shabby. Tangy orange and lemon are the main protagonists. Not a great deal else. Loads of citrus in the taste. Slight grapefruit and pine coming through. Not enough there for me. Light in body but lingers for a decent amount of time. Solid but didnt live up to the hype

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2012 Bottle @ Pannuhuone, Kuopio. Originally rated on 19.2.2010. Excellent IPA with almost a perfect balance. Fruity hop bomb with a nice aroma. 9-4-8-4-16 = 4.1


Re-rated on 18.12.2012. 660ml bottle from Alko Arkadia (with the new label, importers label BBE 9/2014, so less than 3 months old?). Pours dark orange with a small head. Nice aroma of exotic fruits, grassy hops, pine, citrus, lemon, resin, toffee and malts. Taste of fresh hops, lots of exotic fruits, grass, pine, citrus and hints of malts. Finish is hoppy and bitter with a lot of fruity notes. Overall an extremely well balanced and excellent IPA, and this new batch seems even better (probably more fresh bottle?) than the previous ones Ive had.

Pours nice light amber with citrus fruit notes that drive into a nicely hopped ipa.  The notes show off more citrus with a very nice blend of a malt backbone.  The finish gives a dry and crisp twist that makes this a great beer.

Bottle. Split with Tom and Vinnie.. 22 oz. Pours an orange copper with a thin white swirly head. Aroma of pure pineapple, lemon zest, grapefruit, honey, tangerine, and soft, bready malts in the back. Medium bodied, dead even keeled and perfectly palatable; sly, juicy, and ultimately softly drying. Finishes with a smooth, clean, insanely soft flourish, Fantastic IPA from Alesmith.

Bomber. Light amber with a generous white head that disappears to pretty much nothing. Hops, floral, citrus with grapefruit the most prominent; medium bodied, well carbonated, bitter with an underlying sweetness, well balanced with a nice hoppy ending that is dry and crisp. Very good IPA.

Pretty sure I rated this before, but I guess it didnt save.  

So I think this one was a victim of hype...its great, but didnt blow me away, and I dont think it was better than stone or Ballast Point.  Having said that, delicious beer!  Light and drinkable yet very refreshing and complex hop variety.  Personally, had no notice of the alcohol.  Satisfied my palate without pulverizing it.  Could have had a little more kick, but no real complaints; great beer.

Aroma: very aromatic hops
Appearance: deep amber
Taste: complew, balanced IPA, hops and caramel
Palate: great body
Overall: 20/20

Bottle at a cookout in Italy, thanks to Alex. Pours a slightly hazy gold with a large, off-white head. Huge tropical fruit nose, plenty of pine. Sweet flavor, deep and characterful, some light toast, strong but tasteful bitterness, plenty of resinous pine, grapefruit, and the rest. Medium to full in body with average carbonation. Slightly warming finish, thick hoppiness, balanced with sweet, soft bread and honey malts. Excellent beer.
(Bottle 26/5-2011) IMO just the right amount ABV for an IPA, smooth well hopped American IPA.

pours hazy orange from a bigger bottle...tremendous amount of head. aroma full of tropical fruits, grapefruit, and florals...flavor is more resinous than expected, but still holds the heavy tropical aspect of the nose...good stuff
Very nice clean IPA.  Nose of citrus and spruce.  Not my favorite of the style but very close to it.  Taste Is much like the aroma with strong spruce and citrus with a light sweetness.  Quite good.

22 oz bottle.  Foams up a bit on opening, then pours a hazy pale amber with a large white head.  Very strong orange and grapefruit citrus aroma, floral and pine aromas.  Flavor has a strong, dry bitterness, not as juicy as the aroma suggests, with pine and floral notes more in the lead.  Grapefruit and orange are still definitely in there, though, with some grassy notes, some iced tea, some caramel, and a little biscuit and pineapple all working their way in somehow.  Gets really good as it warms more (and as I drink more...).   Didnt quite taste it at the first sip, but this is an amazing IPA.

22 oz bottle.  Pours alight golden color with a verybthin, white head.  Aromas of citrus and pine.  Tastes of bitter grapefruit and pine, with a malty middle, but light middle.  The finish is very dry, and alcohol is very warming on the back end.  Palate is medium body with average carbonation.  Overall, a good West Coast IPA, but not a typical one.

Pours a hazy wheat orange with a layer of well-retaining head at the top of the glass. Beautiful aroma; freshly sliced mango is the first thing I get, along with a touch of pine, vanilla bean and even a little truffle. First sip: Im in heaven. Delicate stone fruit and citrus flavours, followed by pine resin, fresh bread and honeycomb. Bitterness intensifies towards the finish but never reaches 2IPA levels. Perfect carbonation that complements the bitterness in the finish. Creamy mouthfeel without the sticky palate sweetness of some American IPAs. This is fantastic.
Hazy golden pour with small white head. Light lacing.  Citrus hops and toast malt nose. Resiny hops throughout. Lingering Bitter finish. Nice

Split bomber with sherm1016.....thanks!  Pours amber with light tan head....quickly dissipates.  Nice hoppy citrus nose and corresponding hoppy / malty taste....excellent...wish it was easier to get more of this...

22oz bottle in trade with Dankbeer619, split with dwm1034.  Pours a golden yellow color with a white head.  Aroma is citrus, grapefruit, hoppy. Medium on the palate with average carbonation.  Flavor is malty sweet up front, with a nice bitter hoppy finish.  An excellent IPA.

Fruchtiger Geruch, in dem der Hopfen sanft rüberkommt. Im Antrunk meldet sich der Hopfen ebenfalls weitestgehend mit übermäigen Grasnoten sowie einer grapefruitartigen Fruchtigkeit. Im weiteren Verlauf schwächen diese Aromen ab, verlieren aber nicht gänzlich an Intensität, der Hopfen ist mild aber dennoch in Teilen rauh. Im weiteren Verlauf wird der Hopfen keineswegs stärker, festigt sich aber. Zum Ende nochmal aromatisch hopfig mit deutlichen holzigen und grasigen Komponenten, die nur leichte Bitterkeit erfreut und macht das Bier sehr süffig. Gelungenes IPA. 12/12/11/11/11/11

22oz bottle received in trade from TexIndy, thanks again for the opportunity.
Pours a couple of shades darker than lager with a 4 inch thick bubbly white head that persists forever. Loads of citrus and pine fill my nostrils, slightly spicy/earthy as well. Taste is mostly pine and citrus maybe some bread or caramel if I strain really really hard, but this one really is all about the hops. Long lingering hop bitterness in the finish. Carbonation is high, mouthfeel is sticky/resinous, body is medium. Im torn, I really wanted to love this one, but I just dont. I find it over carbonated, one dimensional and a little boring. Maybe one day I can revisit this one on tap.

Bomber.
Nice cirusy,piney nose.
Light amber color with a decent head that stays and laces the glass.
Medium maltyness,medium bitterness.
Body is round and oily but not overly, average carbonation.
bitter finish that is well balanced by the malt.
This is a prime example of the best that the west coast has to offer.
This IPA is assertive but not over the top.
One of the best ihave ever had.

Bottle at BrewDog Edinburgh. Hazy amber with a moderate white head. Nose is light citrus, fruity but not overpowering. Honeyed, fruity taste. Creamy mouthfeel, dry but malty and rich with a beautifully balanced bitter finish. A really good example of a modern IPA.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2011 Hoppy and Malty, not as hoppy as I though it would be> very interesting balance to this beer. Huge fan.

Rerated sober this time.
Excellent hop profile,  Tons of citrus, especially oranges on the nose. Palate has a good variety of bittering and flavor hops. Malts are present and not overwhelmed. I wish this was around more often.
I dont like IPAs. This is probably my favorite one. Not super hoppy. Very citrusy, mostly grapefruit.

On tap at Stone Bistro, from a very fresh keg.  An exceptional IPA, a deserving representative of the IPA capital of the world (San Diego county).  Pours absolutely beautiful amber, and the head retains very well.  Wonderful balance of citrus hops with deeper spicy resin hops playing nicely together.  Sweet undertones.  Refreshingly dry and bitter, if you dont like this beer then you dont like IPAs.  Easily belongs in my top 3 favorites.

Same bottle as picture, sadly I was hoping for more. but this one wasnt a bad one. It just seemed too bitter for the mix of malts. It wasnt a smooth flowing beer. it was good but I thought it might be amazing. The aroma was a nice one. The only taste was the hops and bitterness. It was a pine smell but also citrusy too.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2014 Bottle. Amber with a large white head that settles to an inch. Low bead. Laces well. Big but not brash aroma of kumquats and other citrus fruits, pine, light honey, some dark berries. Smells fantastic. Creamy mouthfeel. Moderate sweetness in the taste with some light malts and quite a lot of berries. Then bitterness creeps in with pine and citrus. Lingering bitter finish gets just a bit window-cleanerish. Plenty of bitterness but its not unsupported by the malt side. Excellent. [4.0] More honey this time along with the berries, gradually giving way to lingering pine. Bitterness creeps up. Almost certainly lost a little in the zesty citrus overtones, but very lovely.

Pours pale gild to light orange. Nose is citrus, fruity, and mildly herbal. Taste is again hop forward but surprisingly balanced and drinkable. Malts are rich and smooth. Medium full bodied mouthfeel. Lace is good. Beer is good. Nice IPA bit not sure why its number 1.

Bottle. Poured into a tulip. Golden brown tan color. Inch thick head that slowly fades. Smells of lemon, grass and hops. Taste is the same with some bread, yeast and herbs. Not as overly citrus or hoppy as other west coast IPAs. Very well balanced and good. Probably up there as the standard for all IPAs. Wish they distributed this more in NYC.

into plastic taster at alesmith.  very golden look with slightly off-white head.  smellsof citrus and hops.  first taste is splendid light pale malt with great citrus hops.  soon becomes a good addition of biting bitterness and more citrus.  Great west coast IPA, not over the top but a very solid bitter delicious ipa.  also great lacing.  8.5 of 10.

Bottle from Brew Dog.com.  Poured a vivid gold with a healthily lingering off-white head and some nice lacing. Superbly enticing nose with citrus fruits and hops to burn. Cracking balance to the flavour with biscuity malts riding in tandem with resinous hops and juicy fruit aplenty. Lingering bitter finish. Pretty much all a quality IPA should be. Lovely stuff.

Out of the bottle, poured into a tulip glass. Pours a deep orange golden color  with thick, off-white head. Amazingly hoppy fragrance! One of the most aromatic IPAs Ive ever had the privilege of holding up to my nose. Aroma is citrusy, piney, grassy, and floral with a hint of chamomile. Flavor has a beautiful malty sweetness on the forefront and a crisp hop profile throughout the mid-palate, and a  clean bitterness in the finish. Very creamy mouthfeel; exactly the way an IPA should be. In fact, this is one of the landmark IPAs Ill be comparing every other IPA to. Seriously, this is right up there with Pliny for me! Might need to make my way down to San Diego for a few more of these. Overall, in the words of Charlie Sheen, AleSmith: winning!

Rating #531, bottle from Vinspecialisten Islands Brygge  

I saw this beer on my local watchlist and had to go to Vinspecialisten the day after to get it. First of all, that was a great surprise as I had never been to Vinspecialisten before and their selection was way better than expected. Especially their BeerHere and Mikkeller selection was great, and there were a lot of belgian brews I hadnt noticed anywere else, though not any infamous specials of any kind.   Well, back to this specific beer. Its an amber coloured beer with a very good head, and as it gets to stand a little the head gets a more dense whipped cream-like look. Great hoppy nose, flowery and spicy with a delicate touch of "tutti frutti". Taste is bitter right from the start and has a lot of spicy hops and the special tutti frutti taste as well together with some raspberry and citrus. Sturdy and sweet, dry IPA-taste. Finish is strongly bitter and has a bit of alcohol. Palate is magnificent - soft, thick, and perfect for this IPA. All in all a really great brew, but not with any extraordinary elements that makes me go nuts over this IPA compared to other high end IPAs. Ive tried more complex ones, but its definately still a great brew.

Orange golden with beige head. Very aromatic fragrance of orange, lemon, pine, grass and sweet plumy malts. Very clean taste with a unique successful hop profile. Long dry, mouthcleansing bitterness. Like drinking a sunny green spot in a new sprung wood.

Bottle shared with dbarnold. Thanks Dave!  Pours an orange coper cloud. Aroma is not overbearing, light citrus and hop.  Taste is mildly bitter, long aftertaste.  I enjoyed this beer, but not as much as I had hoped from AleSmith(which means high expectations for me). We did not know the age of the beer, but got it at only one of the few places in DC where we can find it.

I Poured the bottle into a Imp pint glass and was greeted with a two finger cream colored heat that laced out well. The body of the brew was a hazy orange in color. The aromas of fresh oranges and grapefruits filled my head.
Flavor wise the brew leans more towards the hops than Malts which is what I expect from a Ca. IPA, but there was some malts so it was not what I consider a hop bomb. It was a good IPA. I dont know what the hype was all about. I had a rather fresh bottle and shipped in the winter so I would think it was a good one. Dont get me wrong I would drink it again I went down great but it was a rather average IPA to me

Serving type: bottle

Pours blurry golden with a medium head that lasts.
Very sweet hop aroma with some spices. Taste is quite hoppy with some taste of chocolate/coffee.
Very sweet lingering hop aftertaste.great beer.

Orange coloured, a good sized white head that holds nice and sticks good. Smell is good hoppy, citrus. A bit sweet. Very pleasant. Taste is bitter citrussy hops, lightly some nice sweetness gets slightly trough. Good hoppy biterness that holds a good time.

Golden beer, white head.

Very pretty scent of citrus and flowers.  Almost honey-ish and pine too.  Sweet and tangy.

Taste is tangy too.  Piney and dry with juicy citrus moments too.  The pine, dryness, and juiciness are all blended well together.  Its tangy and rich and delicious.  An excellent ipa.  A standout for sure.  The hops are somewhat muted but they pack incredibly rich and full flavor.  

Absolutely great.
65cl, American brew, thx to MadsNP!, complex bitter brew, yet easy to drink, very balanced, hazy, rocky head, very good brew, yet expensive!

Bottle shared at a Damico beer tasting.  Pours an amber color with a white foam head.  Has an aroma of apricots, grapefruit, caramel, and pine.  Sweet citrus taste with a nice hop hit.  Smooth and creamy.  Loving it.

Pours a clear light golden brown with little lacing and head which settles after a few minuntes The nose is amazing fon an IPA with hoppy and malty aromas. Tangerine and cumquat are present. The first sip is amaingly balanced. Bready slightly yeasty flavors with roasted maltyiness followed by lingering biterness. The finish is clean and delicious. The bitternes is great.

Hazy golden body, big white head. Aroma of caramel, pines, yeasty fruits. Flavour has roasted candy, lots of fruits - peaches and apricot. Soft bitterness, well carbonated. But the best of all - cant imagine better mouthfeel. This is just awesome. And it means so much in beer.

Poured from a 22 ounce bottle without a freshness date into a goblet. Beer is yellow and hazy, forms a thick white head of large bubbles and carbonation is moderate. Very little lacing left on the glass.

Aroma is dominated by hops. Strong pine present, overall the aroma is weaker than I expected. Still smells like an IPA. Not much malt or sweetness in the aroma.

Beer is full bodied. Good beer, feels like you are chewing through the hops. Fills my mouth. There is nice palate connectivity. Overall a great experience. Second drink, beer is a little dry. The hop resin completely coats your mouth. Lots of sweet hop flavor and nice back of the mouth bitterness. No real aftertaste. Drinkability high, great mouthfeel, overall a great IPA experience.

Serving type: bottle

pours a golden honey color...very clear...lively looking with a medium white head...nice lacing but retention needs work.  awesome aroma has floral hoppiness...grapefruit, spruce, spice...also light, bready malt backing and very faint alcohol.  flavor is very piney and grapefruity...hint of spice towards the end.  mouthfeel is not as lively as expected...maybe a tad bit thin...but by no means flat either.  finish is very dry and lingers with very piney/spicey notes.

It pours a medium cloudy gold with a huge chunky white head, tons of carbonation with lots of yeasy floaties. The carbonation is very active going a mile a minute. Retention and lacing are both very good. 

The aroma is pretty light with hops and citrus, but both are subtle.

The taste is very smooth nothing overpowering. There is missing a nice hard bitter bite. The hops are present just not overwhelming which hurt on the taste but make this a very crushable ipa.

From the Jug at the GABF, Colorado Convention Center Denver 16/09/2010
Big hop aroma. Golden coloured hoppy and fruity with a pine flavour. A hint of dryness in a bitter and slightly creamy malt finish.
Pours a wonderful golden body with a pillowy, immensely sticky, merange head.  Aroma of alcohol and pineapple.  Flavor is much the same.  Spicy bite on the finish.

Nose is fresh hops, piney, then balanced bitterness
Feel is broad and warm
Carb is medium
Taste is heavy hops, no sour cream (yay), then bland malts and finish of bitter simcoe.

650 ml bottle. From København, Denmark.
Murky brown colour with big fluffy off-white head.
Fruity and piney hoppy aroma with some yeastiness. 
Flavour is pleasantly hoppy all over. Fruitiness, balancing sweetness, mild yeastiness and... well, this is quite perfectly balanced. I could (or at least try to) drink this rest of my life. Thank you AleSmith!

Aroma is wonderful and full of citrus and piney notes The appearance is a very light golden color. The taste is very similar to the nose with citrus and pine and hop resin favors being the first to hit the tongue followed by a sweetness and finishes with a lingering hop note. Wonderful beer, a little too sweet on the initial mouthful, otherwise my rating would be higher.

Bottle, Thanks to Phaleslu. Pours hazed gold with some chunks of sediment finding its way into my glass, thick beige head leaves nice lace. Aroma of pine, herb, malt, some oxidation. Taste is pretty malt forward with a resinous and herbal finish. This is not bad, but its old and definitely basementy. Why the hell does Alesmith not distribute to Washington state but instead ship across the country? Baffling. Regardless, this beer should be flying off of shelves fast enough to have good turnover. Looks like another case of flawed 3-tier system where price breaks are given for quantity case purchases, thus leading to old beer.

HOLY F&*$. What an IPA. The pour is bright orange with a two finger beige yellowish head. The aroma is amazing with a sweet caramel malt behind a thick and potent west coast hop. The taste is sweet and syrupy with a mildly sweet caramel malt in the middle with a slightly tropical fruity taste and a huge hop bomb on the finish. Fairly resinous and a huge grapefruity and citrus finish. Love this beer!

Hazy amber with an off-white head. Aroma is caramel and very hoppy - grapefruit, pine needles and citrus. Flavor is rather sweet and very bitter. Finish is very bitter and dry. Very well balanced. A brilliant IPA. 180610

this 22 was about 6 bucks.  ive seen the ratings before.. figured that a decent price for a 100 beer.  
Attempting to pour this into a large glass.  I got nothing but head.  Literally.  maybe a half inch of beer at the bottom.  Thats a shitty way to start this beer. huge white soapy head.  murky khaki color beer.  smell is smoky.  burnt prunes.  Not the citrus smell of many other ipas.  Something seriously wrong with this beer.  Carbonation is out of control... way too much.  I dont know if possibly this just sat in the store way too long.  tastes like a home brew i made once, too lazy to use any sanitation.  Bity and hot.  This is horrible.  I will rerate another time.

22oz bottle from City Beer 
Appearance: Clear golden with a big off-white head and good lacing 
Aroma: Floral and grassy 
Taste: Grapefruit, floral and citrus 
A very good IPA, easy to drink.

Bottle from Cavie.  Big 1400.  Orange pour with a nice white head.  Aroma is a little sap, light fruit, caramel, and a little bready.  Taste is lots of caramel, citrus, nice malts, and some baking spice.

Bottle courtesy of Sparky. Pours a hazy golden color with a bit of floating sediment. Aroma is very lovely. A nice balance of hops with citrus notes and pine sweetness. Flavor is sweet hops, gentle spice with a tingle of bitterness towards the end. This is very nice.
UPDATED: JUL 21, 2012 Cloudy yellow pour, good head.  Plenty of pine with a touch of malt in the aroma.  Lots of pine in the taste.  Very nice.

This beer lives up to the hype.  I tried quite a few IPA/DIPA/TIPA on Saturday and I feel this was the best overall beer and possibly the cheapest of the bunch. pours a deep golden with an orange tint.  The aroma is pure hops and citrus.  Smell is amazing.  The taste is hops and delicious orange. it has a sweet malt flavor on the back end finished with dry hops. Very balanced and delicious. Cant say enough about this one.
Donated by a friend in Bergen. A fantastic IPA with bout a balanced malt base and loads of citrus hops. Pours dark golden and moderate head. Relatively good masked alcohol and a great mouth feel.

Prefering Belgian Ales this is hoppy for my preference.  However, it is a superb IPA.  Excellent head clinging to my Sams glass while I file this rating. Although this may seem blasphemous I prefer Three Floyds Dreadnaughts balance to malt

Orange anwith a white head. Medium aroma with a lot of citrus and grape. The medium aroma goes along the same line and ends with a lasting bitterness. Its good, but not as good as expected, perhapps its somewhat old since I dont experience it as hoppy as many others.

Poured a crisp and clear slightly orangish yellow, looks very, very beautiful. Head is ample, finely foamy, and laces exquisitely. Aroma is a floral punch, with citrus notes of grapefruit and a twinge of mango. This guy was floral the moment I opened the bottle, and is really a treat to smell. Taste follows suit, but adds tons of pine, and a great bitter kick. Malt backbone is perfect - the hops never get out of control, and all the hop-associated flavors are allowed to come out smoothly with each sip. Mouthfeel is great, as the carbonation is there just enough to keep everything moving around, but not too much as to get in the way of any of the awesome flavors. Drinkability is also off the charts due to the balance from start to finish. At 6$ a bomber where I got this, this has to be one of the best deals I can think of.

Big fluffu head.
Nice golden color.
Nice hoppy aroma but a litle bit grassy.
Dry caramell taste with a litle to big bitterness that isnt balanced.
Warming and full of hop taste.

Poured into a pint glass.

4.5 A: Hazy medium orange color. Two fingers of whippy/creamy head with great retention and lots of lacing.

4.5 S: Piney, floral, and citrus hops. Grapefruit stands out the most, then lemon zest. Malts take a backseat to the hops, but theres a touch of crystal malt in the background.

4.5 T: Tons of pine and resin hops in the taste that translates to almost an oaky taste. Healthy bitterness that lingers long into the aftertaste. Hops also offer a bit of citrusy character mainly in the form of grapefruit. Malts are subdued again, but offer a good balance to the hops.

4.5 M: Fuller medium body. Creamy, with good carbonation.
