4.5 D: Great beer overall with no real flaws.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-08-2009 00:09:58

bottle pours hazy orange with a medium white head.  Aroma is grassy hops with lots of underlying notes of pineapple and citrus rinds.  Flavor is sweet candied pineapple and juicy hops ending on the pine side, oily consistency with lots of lingering bitter pine.  Good stuff.

Had a Sculpin and this in a sampler tray and both were strong and hoppy but wildly different.  I think I prefer the peppery and citrusy character of this one slightly over the Sculpin.  Poured a dark orange and is well balanced.

Bottle. Creamy white excellent fully lasting head. Amber colour. MOderate malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Fantastic many great notes of grass, herbs and flowers. Heavy bitter wonderfull flavor. Fantastic well balanced between hops and malt. Long fantastic complex finish. Creamy palate. Truly world class.
Dark orange-red, beige cover.  Aroma is juicy, citrusy, some spicy hops, caramel, toffee.  Taste is some bitter, fruity citrus, toffee, sweet, but some drying spicy hops.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2013 Pours a rich golden colour with a big frothy white head and slightly hazy. Aroma is of hops, pine and citrus fruits; orange, grapefruit, and lemon. Taste is fairly sweet throughout and also has a bitterness that consistently grows toward the finish. Medium body, average carbonation, slightly thick on the palate and fairly smooth. Overall amazing, the best IPA I have ever had. EDIT: Had this on tap recently and shined even more than in bottle.

22 oz. bottle, courtesy of and split with manuchampions, pours a hazy golden copper. Heavenly pine / citrus hops on the nose, with big grapefruits notes and sweet caramel. Flavour is heavy on the grapefruits, pine / citrus hops, cotton candy and sweet caramel malts. Very expertly balanced and a wonderful IPA.

Seriously people...this isnt the best IPA in the world.  Speedway Stout was amazing, but it seems AleSmiths ESB and IPA are a bit overhyped.

Bomber pours a glowing honey gold with an off-white cap of head.  Aroma is heavy on the pine resin with a little lemon and wet blanket for good measure.

Flavors seem quite mundane...hop resin and puckeringly sweet fruit.  Moderate carbonation, dry finish.  Meh.

Bomber - Dark golden appearance with off white head. Nice pineapple and mango on the nose. Mouthfeel is moderately oily with a slight lingering bitterness. Picking up a lot of the nose in the flavor - citrusy/floral notes with a slight bit of pine. Very nice.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2011 Growler in Hotel which was picked up from Alesmith. Really well balanced for the style and masterfully produced. Lots of tropical fruit and hints of pine. Toffee malt body is dry and balances the hop onslaught well. Alesmith beers are always so clean - perhaps its the water?? There are hoppier beers available, but this shows you can add balance to a WCIPA to produce a refined experience.

Hazy gold in the glass with a fair white head.  Aroma is dank bitter hops, resinous pine, minor citrus, and light sweet malt.  Dry feel in the mouth with tightly structured hops and pine (not much citrus or even malt  in the taste).  I can still vividly remember the first time I had this beer in 01 and how its hop-forward citrus aroma blew my mind.  Not quite as earth shattering now but this beer will always be a classic example of an excellent IPA for me.

Yep they said it perfectly in the description. Bottle pours deep gold with a beige head.  Aroma is full of sweet caramel, citrus, and dark stone fruit. Flavor is once again nailed by the description(amazingly), there is definate plum,black cherry, moderate pine, candied grapefruit, and a touch of vanilla.  Overall body is moderate and sticky with a nice balanced bitterness. Easily one of my favority IPAs.

750ml bottle from Brewdog Aberdeen. Pours light amber in with decent beige head. Nose; citrus fruits, resin, pine. Taste; very smooth, pine, oranges, lemons, some passion fruit, long-lasting bitter finish. Solid IPA.

Pine, citrus and resin aromas.  All the same in the taste with an added (and not unsubstantial) caramel and vanilla malt flavor.  A nice, medium bitter finish and a little warmth from the alcohol take this one out.  Another nice Alesmith brew.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2012 Rerate from SB cons 2012-09-22 Lysekil this was fresher new rating 4.2, new average 4,1 

Bottle from SB, cons 2010-12-04 Stenungsund
AR: pine, pinapple, apricot
AP: hazy honey dough, havey organic fluffy yellow/white head
F: pine, pinapple, apricot, great bitterness

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2013 Quick Re-Review.  Obtained a fairly fresh bottle (July 5, 2013, enjoyed August 20, 2013), from an online store.  Felt my first go-round may have been on the old side.  This does seem better, but not the best IPA Ive had.  Aroma is peaches, mango, pineapple, fruity hops, citrus, decent bit of pine, decent bit of caramel malt, whiff of alcohol.  Flavor is similar, fruity hops of peaches, pineapple, grapefruit, resinous hops, pine, mild to moderate caramel & bready malt in the middle, nice bitterness on the finish, mild sweetness, quite a bit of solvent alcohol.  Very good, glad to try again, but not the #1 IPA IMHO.  Alcohol is awfully prevalent for a 7% brew.

Original Review 11/28/10:
22oz bottle, unknown date.  Pours hazy orange/amber with a small bubbly white head that leaves some spots of lacing.  Aroma is some citrus (orange, grapefruit) and pine, some pineapple and tropical fruits, fair bit of caramel malt, a nice blend of sweet and citrus on the nose, good strength.  Flavor starts with pine and resinous hops, some delayed citrus of orange and grapefruit, caramel malt sweetness in the middle, moderate to good bitterness in the lingering finish.  Mouthfeel is medium-bodied and oily, medium carbonation.  I have a feeling this bottle may be a bit on the old side but I have absolutely no way of knowing since Alesmith doesnt provide a bottled on or best by date (or at least not one I could find).  My first time with Alesmith IPA so I cannot compare to other bottles of this since it isnt available here.  A good IPA, but would love to try a known fresh bottle someday.
Aroma 7, Appearance 3, Taste 7, Palate 3, Overall 15, Score 3.5

Drinking this one on thanksgiving in san diego with the little bro. Nice orange color to this beer with a long lasting off white head. At first, aroma is of pine trees and pine needles. Mmm. Moves to a citrusy orange like smell towards the end. Taste is fairly grapefruit like at first. Has some resin and pine tree like tastes mixed throughout with a bitter aftertaste. I like it
Poured medium orange with a thin white head. Aroma is a huge burst of grapefruit and piney hops. Perfect. Flavor was sweet, heavy bitterness but nice. Long finish but not dry. Extremely enjoyable!!

G: Poured into a Firestone Walker pint glass.

A: Medium copper with a large, foamy white head and loads of lacing. Loads of carbonation visible in the glass--I got an amazing carbonation tornado after the pour was complete.

S: Highly floral and citrusy in the hop department.

T: Floral and citrus, with a little bit of pine.

M: Medium-bodied with a good deal of carbonation. Very little alcohol presence.

D: Delicious IPA. Reminds me very much of Bells Two Hearted.

650ml bottle. From the second you open the bottle the piney citrus hop notes burst out and attack you. Deep golden orange like sunset over the water. Small beige head with some pineapple in the nose. Long on the palate with a dry finish. Exceptional.

Bottle: Pours a Nice clear medium golden color; very average off white head- creamy consistency with nice retention. Huge juicy orange, piney hops on the nose. While I notice that typical ipa bitterness, i also notice that this brew is as smooth as I can ever remember experiencing for the style. Its sublime... probably the juiciest ipa i can recall as well - Just an incredible perfect blend of grapefruit/oranges, piney hop bitterness, creamy smooth texture for the style - love. this. beer.
Draft. Pours golden with a white head. Flavor is creamy pine hops with grapefruit/orange notes with a nice sweet caramel malt. Very good.

Bomber.  My buddy said it best..."best pure IPA of the lot"...tasted with 5 other SD IPAs.  Exactly what an IPA should be...golden beige color, clean ever-so-slightly sweet finish.  Tremendous balance.   I want just a little more back palate/acid.  Terrific mid palate and nice floral aromas with perfect bitterness.  Awesome brew.

Experienced from a 22oz bomber in a whiskey snifter.  Obviously an over-aged sample, as all hop aroma, bitterness, and flavor had fallen out of the beer, leaving only a moderate residual sweetness and a fairly prevalent note of alcohol.  Clearly, this was not a representative example of the beer.

This is really one of the best IPAs Ive had as it is just so drinkable (in the top 10). Pours a beautiful golden/light orange hue, a nice (but not a dense) head indicating a lower carbonation level than some. Not a huge fresh hop aroma but it has travelled to Australia and may not be the freshest bottle. Aroma is still pleasant piny more than the fruits of usual fresh IPAs. Taste is medium bitterness, full bodied but like I said, low carbonation.

Orange gold pour neat head medium carbonation aromas pine citrus hop sweet malt nutty caramel flavour wow the the hop pine and citrus grapefruit the bitter has a fizzy note a velvet touch peach taste very pronounced flavours full on body the finish and aftertaste of strong influential tastes to dwell on peacefully
This is a truly solid IPA. Pours a beautiful gold with thick white head. Pungent and pleasant hop aroma. Good malt and hop balance and a clean finish. Received in a trade with Matt.

Vätskan är ganska mörk med tunt skum.
Doften är härlig välbalanserad humle, fina fruktiga toner med tydlig inslag av grape.

Smaken är frisk och bitter. Mycket humle och mogna gula frukter. Exemplaret jag fick värkar vara ganska färsk och ölen är en aning grov eller mörk. Eftersmaken är fin och sitter i ett tag.

650mL bottle.  Pours clear pale gold with a thin head that eventually disappears entirely, though it does lace the glass very finely.  Aromas of caramel, citrus, tropical fruit, a little alcohol.  Medium sweetness and bitterness, a lot of hop flavour.  Medium bodied, very soft carbonation, fairly smooth, nice lingering bittersweet finish with some bite from the hops.

Bottle courtesy of cbkschubert, thanks craig.  This is definitely a great IPA, but i think i may have over-hyped this beer.  I was expecting liquid gold and was a tad let down.  But a really good IPA isnt too far behind.  Im glad i finally got to try it.
Straw color, thick creamy head that sticks to the side of glass.  Good balance of bitterness and sweetness.  Nice floral hop finish.  Piney, citrusy.

Poured with a nice, large, cream colored, foamy, frothy head that lasts a while and lace. Color is a rich, medium amber with a few bubble trails. Aroma is big hop, pine, citrus, malt and a bit of old leather. Flavor is like nose and richer with just enough sweetness to balance the hops and carbonic acid. Body is very good and so is carbonation; both just right for this beer. Finish is like flavor, slowly tapering with good length and a little alcohol at the end.

Bottle. Pours a dark and cloudy orange/amber color with a hugemongus off white head. You really need to pour this one carefully. Aroma is filled with grapefruit, cirus, floral notes. I also get some pineapple, peach, pine, alcohol and a decent amount of sweet malt. Flavor is again grapefruit and citrus, along with the pineapple and an good portion of sweet malts, along with resin and a herbal hop character. The bitterness somewhat reminds me of a belgian type of beer, which is very strange. The body is medium with a dry mouthfeel, but is still silky smooth. Overall a fantastic IPA, that is very different from other west coast IPAs. Its unlike any IPA i have ever tasted, and i would love be able to get this IPA in Denmark!

Nice hoppy nose with a surprisingly malty finish.  I tend to like my IPAs on the bitter end, but this was about as well-balanced as any as I have ever tasted, which is something worth bragging about.  AleSmith rarely dissapoints.
Bottle: Pours a light pale amber with big foamy off-head.  Aroma of citrus and pine and sweetness.  Similar flavor.  Well balanced and medium bodied.  Dry pine finish.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2012 Bottle.
Amber to copper with an off-white head leaving small lacing.
Aroma: caramel, peach, pine, light resin.
Taste: toffee and some licorice in the base, nice but light hoppiness with peach, pineapple, pine, low bitterness.
Above medium-bodied. Nice and balanced.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2010 Tasted from bottle purchased at City Beer. Pours a hazy orange with a very thick white head that recedes quickly but leaves nice lace. Nose is a perfect blend of hops and malt with some florality, citrus, and caramel malt. The flavors are very similar with the hops, malt, and alcohol integrated very nicely. There is even a hint of tropical fruit on both the nose and palate. The body is medium with average carbonation and a long bitter but balanced finish.

650 ml bottle @ Olutravintola Pannuhuone. Rated @ 19.2.2009.
Clear orange colour with a medium white head. Nice lacing. Very rich IPA aroma of citrus, grapefruit, floral hops, syrup, pine and grass. The flavour is strongly hoppy and sweet with mainly floral hops and grass. Medium/full bodied, oily and warming mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Very smooth IPA.

22oz in shaker.  Clear deep gold, frothy lasting white head.  Bright, minty, basil neatoness dominates, but there is a squidge of a kinda peanut brittle thing in the nose.  Flavor is surprisingly warm and toasty, with medium-strong bitterness and no distinctive hop, just a muted wash.  Very spare finish for such a big beer.

650 ml bottle. Slightly hazy golden orange colour, medium-sized off-white head. Aroma of grapefruit, pine and some floral notes, also a whiff of sweet malts. The flavour is very nicely balanced between slightly caramel-sweet maltiness, citrus fruits and bitter, piney hops. A little alcohol warmth in the lingering hoppy finish. Smooth on the palate. Delicious and well balanced.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2011 Ive revisited this many times since my initial review and have found it to be lagging on multiple occasions. While still a fantastic brew, it has been inconsistent in the nose and taste and without any dating I cannot say for sure whether it is because of age.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2010 Consumed with Jeff in Phoenix. Nice golden pour with head around the edges. Sticks nicely to the sides of the glass. Pine and citrus with slight bitterness in the nose. Mild bitter base with good citrus flavor and moderate carbonation. Great aftertaste.
Nice golden color, hazy.  Liked the fruity hop aroma.  And the HEAD, it was nice!!!!  Good floral hop flavor, and the mouthfeel was like velvet.  Taste was also somewhat sweet!  A VERY GOOD BEER!!!

Tanks to Svensson in Olakademin.
It pours deep hazy orange. Has a small off-white head. Aroma is hopy. Has rasin and citrus. Flavor i also very hopy in a balanced way. It´s bitter. Apricot as well and is very smooth and warming.

There was nothing I did not like about this beer. It poured a nice brown and immediatly opened up with different scents. The taste is amazing, strong hops that went down smooth followed by a hit of citrus.

A: pint. slightly opaque. bright orange with yellow hues. nice off-white, yellow tinted, head. good retention and great ringlike lacing.

S: nice grapefruit hop aroma. pine notes as well.

T: great IPA. tons of grapefruit and citrus. moderate malt backbone, but the hops really shine through.

M: very bitter palate with some sweet malts balancing the tongue. mild carbonation. crisp and refreshing.

D: very drinkable brew, and a great example of style. amazingly fresh.

Poured from a bottle into a tulip.  Aroma is strongly of citrus hops, with a bit of floralness.  Taste is grapefruit all the way through, finishes clean, a little dry, and bitter.  Delicious and lives up to the hype!

22oz bottle in a tulip.  Pours bright golden with a thick, lingering, lacy head.  Aroma strong of hops, both floral and citrus, with some light malts in the background.  Flavor mainly of the sharp hops with some earthiness and a little caramel.  Nice thick texture with a long hoppy finish.  A pretty awesome IPA.

For a beer with such great reputation and excellent reviews I was ready for something specials. Now, after five bottles (three different batches) I cannot simply find that single sparkling thing that others find so special.
Its too one-dimensional and missing the important link between taste and flavour. Not my cup of tea, unfortunately. No offense to the brewery, keep up the good work!

Poured from 22oz bomber into Duvel tulip.

A - A dark gold/light brown color with a large frothy head which sticks to the sides of the glass as it slowly disipitates. 

S - Lots of floral and citrus notes on this one. Some sweet oranges along with grapefruits, specifically. A nice mix of both sweet and bitter which come together well.

T - A decent amount of hoppy bitterness, not much in the way of sweetness though. A nice bitter aftertaste, clean, and refreshing.

M - Light to medium in body, good carbonation, very "clean" and crisp.

D - Easily drinkable and very enjoyable, very good IPA.

Bottle. Hazy, opaque, almost luminescent orange colour with a medium white head. Aroma is very nice with a big, caramel-malt base, lots of floral, dry hops pineapple, lemon and a little mango. Taste is also nice with a moderate malt attack, allowing much sugary and spicy sweetness, followed by citrus-notes. The hops provide a perfect bitterness, while also being floral and fresh with mango and peach-notes. Big body, low-medium carbonation, long duration, slightly oily texture. Very recommendable!

22oz - Gift bottle from Ale.  Orange/brown liquid with one finger of white head.  Some particulate.  Flower hops, not room filling.  Creamy malt, not much power or structure.  Approachable but not a standout in a demanding style.

Review #1 (Im new to reviewing but not to consuming):  22oz bottle.  Light amber pour with most amazing foamy head.  Mild citrusy aroma compliments lingering taste of pine.  Bitterness not at all overwhelming, almost mild for an IPA, but creates a smooth taste that is very drinkable and very enjoyable.  Highly recommended.

Bottled, shared with Jaksmart. Hazy orange/light amber pour with an amazingly beautiful white head. I could write an essay about the head of this beer, its just really amazing. The nose is filled with the nicest west coast hops with mango, peaches, apple, pineapple and a near perfect caramalt backbone. Do I get hints of smoke in the nose of this one? Weird, but nice detail. Taste is packed with the same delicious and fruity hops backed up by an insanely precise amount of bitterness chained by a sharp amount of caramel and malt body. Velvety smooth carbonation. The best IPA Ive tasted this far.

Bottle, City Beer, SF. Yeasty and sharp, with a fine golden appearance. Caramel and hop flowers zip off the tongue, with sherbert and citrus also very upfront. Sharp, fresh and tangy, with a long, dry finish.

22oz bomber.  Pours a thick, foamy head that took several minutes to dissipate.  Aroma is citrus and hops.  I especially love the citrus in this one.  Its an incredibly tasty, crisp brew.  A very smooth IPA, without an overwhelming hoppiness or biting bitterness.  Dont misunderstand; its definitely hoppy and bitter.  But, damn, is it smooth!

Pours a hazy deep golden colour with a foamy off white head. Hops gathered along the bottom of the cup and floating through out the beverage. Aroma of citrus. Flavour of grapefruit, oranges, hops. Slightly bitter and a little tangy. I love a good IPA!!!

Bottle. Pours slight hazy golden colored with a nice lacing and lasting egg white head. Aromas of citrus, lemon zest, vitamin pills, spruce and bready malt. Very balanced and crisp flavor with notes of sweet malt and citrus flavored hops. Great IPA.
Bottle. Simply brilliant; aggressive hops, but not overpowering; cedary and a bit dank; dark orange hue.  Best head retention and lacing that Ive ever seen in a brew.  Wonderful West Coast IPA.

Bottle courtesy of tarheels86, thanks!  Amber/orange color, large white head, massive lacing.  Aroma of Christmas tree and citrus.  Taste is smooth, resiny, floral all at once - a lot going on here.  Terrific stuff.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2016 A: Dark golden/amber body with a huge fluffy off-white head.. great retention... thick lacing... inviting!

S: Mix of grapefruit/lemon citrus hops.. soft foresty pine hops... dash of sweet malt

T: Mirrors the nose... slightly bolder blast of grapefruit and lemon bitter hops... piney comes in towards the end... nice lingering piney bitterness... 

M: Smooth transitions between the different hop characteristics... as above the finish is lingering but crisp... nice!

This one covers all the bases with a citrusy, resiny, and perfumey aroma. This golden yellow pour is hazy and full of yeast chunks, no matter, because the malt notes are present, with some residual sweetness, plus the hop flavor and bitter finish are so nicely absurd. Blunt resiny finish, like theres lupilin bits floating in suspension.
Bottle, pours golden with a decent white head, aroma is piney with a hint of malt,taste is hoppy pine nicely balanced with malts, an excellent ipa but not as bitter as I expected.

22oz bottle.  A pretty orange-copper in color with a light head that disappears quickly.  A sweet-hoppy aroma and a taste thats sweet the instant it hits your tongue and quickly transforms into a refreshing, hoppy bitterness that lingers.  A great IPA.

Appearance- Gold color, nice white head and descent lacing

Smell- PINE, citrus(grapefruit)

Taste- Bitter hops and alcohol. Pine resin really comes through as well.

Mouthfeel- Medium body with medium carbonation

Overall- Great hoppy beer. For those that really enjoy hoppy theyll enjoy this one.
Bottle at The Grey Lodge. This is a great IPA, with a nice hop aroma, decent head and really smooth sessionable taste. Very well balanced malt and hop flavor. So glad Alesmith is in the Philly area.

Piney, grassy notes in the nose.  Pours a slightly hazy golden amber from the bottle conditioning.  Very well- balanced taste between the malts and hops.  Feels thick and creamy on the tongue.   Truly a great IPA.  Well done!

bread, hay, toast,floral, floral, grass, citrus, resin, 
pale, clear, rocky head, white foam, 
light sweetness, medium bitterness, 
medium body, oily feel, lively, astringent(a good bitter astringency), long finish, 
A great beer. Def. see why considered one of the best IPAs.

Pours a golden amber. Nice big citrus hop aroma. Has crisp smooth grapefruit hoppy taste. Perfectly balanced with a slightly sweet malt finish. Medium body with a good linger of bitter aftertaste. Almost a perfect IPA.

Light orange-copper colored, clear, with a foamy off-white head that leaves great lacing. Citrus and pine aroma. A touch of vanilla. Very nice mouthfeel, medium in body, just a touch of carbonation, rolls across the tongue with a long-lasting finish. Citrus hops dominate the flavor, but it is well-balanced with a good malt backbone, a little fruit, and a grassy finish. This is a unique IPA. Enjoyable!

A: Pours a hazy copper with a medium white head.

S: Quite subtle citrus flavors followed by a nice hop aroma.

T: This is where the beer gets its value: powerful citrus flavors dominate the palate with a crisp hop finish that doesnt linger too long.

P: Very smooth and well-carbonated.

Wow, one of the best IPAs Ive ever tried, possibly beaten out only by Sculpin in flavor profile while a hair smoother than Two-Hearted.

(22 oz bottle)  Pours dark yellow with huge off-white head.  Lots of bubbles.  Aroma of peach, mango, grapefruit.  Taste is bitter with sweetness emerging.  Finish has some resinous notes and bitterness is long.  This is a very good IPA

Big thanks to DosBeerigos for sharing this one. The more and more I taste IPAs the more Im attracted to them. This one is has everything that I look for in a good IPA, a good hoppy aroma with subtle hints of spice. It starts off nice and sweet and finishes bitter with a cool tingle on the lower part of the jaw.

Pours a pleasant golden straw-yellow with a good amount of foamy white head that stick around quite well leaving some lacing around the glass.

Aroma is quite nice with subtle floral and fruity notes with a hint of hoppyness.

The taste is similar but with some bitterness coming through in the finish - not too much, but just the right amount.

Well carbonated and  lively in your mouth, but overall just supremely balanced.

An excellent representation of the style and, surprisingly, not overly hoppy and bitter  like many west coast IPAs tend to be.

I will definitely be drinking this one again if I get the chance....

Bottle:Pours hazy orangey amber with a large and foamy head. Big orange peel aroma with notes of lychees and other tropical fruits. Very hoppy flavour. Notes of pine, resin, lychees. Really long aftertaste.

This is my second favorite IPA, I have ever had. The color and head retention of this beer are magnificent. I love how by the end of the bottle, my glass has been laced with the beers head. The citrus qualities in this beer is wonderful. I find that IPAs typically dont have that outstanding of an aroma or color, but this beer at least has the coloring that makes you want to drink it. The beer lingers on the tongue well within to your next beer. I cant say that if I could buy one beer from the closest liquor store, and I couldnt spend more than 10$, I would bring this home almost every night.

Pours a cloudy amber yellow. Big white fluffy head that slowly fades. Nice hop pine aroma with a bit of citrus. Flavor of hop citrus and fruit. Bitter dry finish with a noticeable sweet malt note. Medium body. Well rouded and smooth. A very good brew.

Deep golden pour pale with lightly off white head light lacing ... aroma of citrusy fruits and light piney hops with some sweet malts as well .... taste of resiny & citrus hops with very light sweet malts very mellow and fresh not a hop bomb .... finishes with a lightly fruity bitter hop bite .... this is an awesome IPA the flavors are fresh and defined

750cl bottle at mikkeller bar
cloudy orange, smooth white head.
aroma is simple. hoppy, flowery,  sweet caramelly, but so damn delicious you just wont believe it. very close to perfect.
flavor is yesty, coplex hopy sweetness and bitterness,  near perfect malty balance, perhaps a bit on the sweet side, but the very dry hopping almost takes it home. Did i say palate and mouthfeel is quenching and full at the same time?
Bottle. Dark golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is grapefruit, hop, pine. Flavour is grapefruit, hop, pine, malt, caramel. Very nice beer.
Its a brilliant brew, now question about it. Both aroma and taste are extremely nice. Does it live up to the excessive pricing? I would have to say no.

Got to try this gem thanks to DeadGirl.  Poured from a 22oz bomber into a pint glass.  Pours a cloudy golden color with a small head that will eventually leave some lace.  Aroma is fantastic and full of hops.  Funk, pine, resin, grapefruit.  They nailed the aroma.  Perfect carbonation makes this one drink really smooth.  Taste is similar to the aroma, resin, pine, citrus.  Leaves a nice smooth bitterness in the finish.  This was my first AleSmith brew and it certainly impressed.

Bomber purchased at DeCiccios in Ardsley NY.

Appearance: Almost iced tea like but not quite as dark brown with honey folds and a massive 3 finger off white crown that shows lots of retention and loads of lace.

Smell: A world of hops....floral, citric, grassy, herbal, etc over a caramel / toffee malt.

Taste: Same as nose.

Mouthfeel: Medium body. A touch sticky but not quite chewy. Enough carbonation. Nice bitter semi dry finish.

Drinkability: This one has big flavors and a decent abv but remains fairly drinkabile.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-20-2009

Bottle. Hazy orange, thick head. Sweet pineapple hops in the nose, grapefruit, pine and resin in the mouth, along with hints of malts. Excellent beer, less so value for money (SEK99 a bottle) - Id rather get three Hercules at the same price.
sample from crown-dark gold pour-off white head -aroma and taste of floral, citrus-sweet dry bitter finish
22 oz bottle.  Pours a light amber with a white head leaving lacing on the glass.  Smells of citrus hops and a bit of pine.  Tastes of citrus.  Medium body.  Smooth finish.  Very well balanced beer.

Bottle, 65cl - Hazy orange amber beer with a large head, lots of yeast sediment. Aroma is fruity with notes of vanilla, pecan ice cream, oranges, mandarin, simply fantastic. Flavor is fruity with notes of caramel, butter scotch, grapefruit candy, herbs, and peaches. Insanely balanced beer, no bite just pure good fruity hoppiness.

Aroma is elderberry, slight citrus and very floral hops. Taste is perfectly balanced between flowery freshness, tropical fruits - such as mango and pinaple - and bitterness that kicks in after a few seconds. Very long aftertaste with bitterness and butterflies. Stunning

Appearance: Big white head, ridiculous amounts of lacing, hazy golden/orange colour.
Aroma: Tropical fruits, pineapple, mango, passionfruit, hop juice!
Flavour: Resinous, pine, grapefruit, mango, passionfruit, big bite, some discrete alcohol.
Mouthfeel: Clean crisp sharp carbonation.
Total: Best IPA Ive had to date!

Pours dark, hazy orange with a cloud of floating sediment and a solid off-white head.  Aroma is pine and grapefruit with a touch of alcohol.  The flavor is a likable balance of hops and slightly sweet malt.  Lingering bitterness.  While definitely hoppy, this is quite different from some other west coast IPAs that focus 100% on hop flavors.
Bottle at MikkellerBar. Amber/golden body with off-white head. Flavour is malt, slightly sweet, citrus and hops.

22 oz bottle (thanks to a trade) into a Duvel tulip
Poured a yellowish copper with a large 3-finger off-white head with great retention. Likewise the lacing, which was fairly heavy for a DIPA. Nose was grapefruit, lemon and honey and some pine. Taste is citrus (esp. lemon, grapefruit, mango) that moves to a somewhat dry and bitter finish, even though the sweetness (almost with some honey) never completely leaves. Mouthfeel was medium and smooth. Good Carbonation apparent.
This brew has a little of everything, albeit leaning toward hoppy bitterness. This would be a great warm weather refreshment and I will seek it out again for sure.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Slightly hazy orange with a thick head.
Grassy, floral and citric in both aroma and flavour.
Thick and oily mouthfeel with a rather high bitterness.
Notes of salmiak.
Light orange with a thick white head. Aroma is very promising and "foresty". Taste is wonderfully balanced, hoppy, yet conforting and warm.  A very drinkable and a bit different american style ipa.

Bomber from Colonial Spirits. I had the bottle for about four months, so it was probably not as fresh as it could have been. Pours with a massive head that never dissipates. Moderately hoppy with citrus flavor. It was not overly hoppy. A very nice IPA.

Amber with nice head. Aroma hops, fruit, banana, apricot, grape, elderberry. Taste bitter hops, elderberry,grape,  some sweet fruit. Medium body and text. Carb average. Good balance of bitter and sweet. IPA is not my preference but this was alright.

Bottle. Pours out in a hazy pale orange colour with some dense yeast floaties. The white foam is rich, sticky and rocky. Bittersweet aroma of sweet pefrume, peaches, resin, mango and apricots. Not much citric fruits in here. Medium-to full-bodied with sweetish fruity notes of peaches, mango, cookies and mild resin. Quite sticky and dull mouthfeel.  Medium-bitter finish of grass and crackers but plenty of yellow fruits such peaches and apricots overshadows quickly. I guess this was not the freshest bottle of this highly rated IPA... Re-rate material when in San Diego someday.

Medium golden yellow in color with a medium white head that turned whispy after a few minutes.  Aromas of grapefruit and pine.  Flavor is all about the hops (Simcoe, Cacsade, Warrior and Chinook are my guesses).  Resiny, piney with heavy citrus flavors.  Not floral or gummy at all.  Reminds me of classic 3 Floyds Dreadnaught.  Excellent IPA!

Pine, lime, and orange peel with a touch of celantro in the nose. Amber in color with a persistant white creamy head. Searing hop dominance with apricot fruit and pine and a tinge of grapefruit. Frothy and smooth in the mouth. Simply a wonderful IPA..

A very nice IPA.  Pours a lovely translucent amber color with a soft, thin white head that dissipates and leaves some speckled, scattered lacing.  Has a wonderful aroma of fresh hops and pine.  Great palate to this beer: medium-bodied; a soft, almost velvety quality in some respects, but effervescent throughout.  The taste has a pretty powerful hop bitterness, but is quite interesting, as it also includes strong outdoorsy (almost medicinal, but pleasantly so) herbal flavors, and subtle citrus notes.  Definitely a good one.

Bottle thanks to funkybrewster.  Pours a lighter straw color.  Aroma is lovely, quite peachy piney and juicy with some creamy fullniess that might be a yeast character, fairly addicting and reminds me of something close to my heart =), cant wait to get a fresh one.  Flavor is much the same, very easy drinking, bright but balanced relatively.  I want a fresh one!

Bottle. Orange pour with some white head. This bottle must have been super fresh, best IPA Ive ever had. Tropical fruit, citrus some pine and even dark fruity characters. Alcohol content is non existent, flavor is satisfying and is wish I bought more than 1 bottle.

A- Pale cloudy light amber body with big fluffy white head that retains 3 fingers very well. While sipping head only fades to one finger and maintains that through all 22oz. Lots of lacing is left behind in the glass. Perfect appearance for an IPA. I love the look of a fine bottle conditioned ale.

S- Ahh. A fresh bouquet of hops hits the nose first. A good balance of floral, piny, citrus, and earthy. Subtle caramel malt backbone.

T- Mostly citrus and some piny hops upfront with a subtle caramel malt backbone. Citrus hops fade for the finish and piny and floral hops take over for a refreshing hop flavor kick. What lingers is a hop spiciness and sweet caramel malt. The whole flavor from start to finish has a bitter overtone. Lingering bitterness is medium.

P- Medium carbonation and body. Oily, smooth, and creamy. The hops and bottle conditioned yeast do their job well here.

O- This is a great IPA. Drinkable and good all around. Something I will have again. ABV is undetectable in this brew. Though the bitterness is definitely present it is kept in balance with the hop flavor-which is what this IPA is all about. I look forward to trying other offerings from AleSmith.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-11-2007 15:53:12

Bouteille de 22 oz partagée lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal chez Fred82. Arôme: Odeur de pamplemousse avec une pointe de miel. Apparence: La couleur est blonde orangée voilée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de pamplemousse avec une pointe de miel et de pins. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement huileuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût houblonné. (Rating #2998)

Great beer.  I didnt realize how highly rated this beer is when I tried it but I immediately thought that it exemplifies an IPA.  The color is very light and the crystal malt flavor is very slight.  The flavor and smell is all hops.  Its not complex enough to top out the ratings but its simple, pure, and delicious.

This was really a fine IPA, but it suffers from the affliction of many of its west coast brethren. The hops overpower the malt. For my taste, I prefer something balanced likes Bells Two-Hearted or DFHs 60 minute. This is an exceptional example of the west coast style for which San Diego is famous, but ultimately left me a bit disappointed for that very reason.
Bottle in San Francisco. Really amazing IPA, better than two hearted ale in my opinion.

(22oz bomber) clear deep orange pour with big fluffy oily lasting head. Excellent lacing. Nose of honey, biscuit, Honeydew, cane sugar, and big juicy citrus fruits. Taste of bitter arugula, biscuit, and grapefruity esters. Oily palate, medium bodied and slick with a nice sweet bitter finish. A great IPA.

Bottle (also had on tap from the brewery many times in my day, but it was a bottle last night).  Pours a wonderful orange color with a very frothy head which just sticks to the glass and doesnt want to let go.  Aromas of hops, citrus, pine, and a hint of malts.  Mouthfeel is fizzy and smooth.  Taste is a finely blended mix of hops, malts, and sweetness.  Finishes dry and hoppy with a great aftertaste.  A great, well-balanced IPA.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2015 The beer looks great, sticky head, perfect amber-gold color for an IPA. The aroma is very clean. Hops are citric, floral and piney. Caramel malt is present and well-articulated. The hop flavor is perfectly clean. There is some bitterness, but its extremely pleasant and doesnt scald in the least. The malt is strong enough to bring out the flavors of the hops, without being cloying. Its just extremely smooth. The citrus and floral hops balance very, very well with the malt. The mouthfeel is excellent, but there is a tiny bit of alcohol around the edges.

Bottle found in NYC. Huge soapy, foam hed. Huge heavy orange body, bold appearance. Awesome nose, best ever I think. Crisp floral hopping, perfectly tasty. Body is a touch foam/soap, a bit oily from the hopping? Full clean awesome floral-citrus flavor. Epicly good
Was able to have one time before a NASCAR race in Phoenix. Was an outstanding version of the style. Very nice hop aroma and flavor. Malt just balanced out the large doses of hops.

Bottled. Pours slightly cloudy orange to amber with a pillowy and lacy head. Massively hopped aroma has peaches, resiny pine needles, lemon and certain harbal grassy notes. Good malt body, fruitiness and ripe red berries. Some biscuity and nutty maltiness with a touch of caramelly sweetness. The flavor is bitter but very well in balance with slightly sweetish maltiness. Crisp, bitter finish. Medium bodied palate. Very smooth mouthfeel with low carbonation and lingering bitterness. A very good IPA with outstanding balance.
Bottle. Orange pour with a small frothy white head. Aroma is citrus and malt. Taste is citrus hop, followed by a malty backbone. Fades to a dry finish. Excellent!

Sampled on draft at The Taproom in San Diego earlier this week.   One of the best IPAs Ive ever had, with excellent balance, to my palate anyway.  Less malty than some brews, this is just the epitome of the style.  Not as floral as Green Flash West Coast IPA or Ithacas Flower Power, its hops balance is excellent anyway.    Alesmith beers seem to be impossible to find on the East Coast unfortunately.  After that sample I see why this IPA has gotten so highly rated on RB.

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2011 Tap at Fathers Office and in bottle form 18 months later in Flagstaff AZ. Pours yellow - light orange a nice, long lasting, big foam - off white cream. Excellent hop aroma big citrus and pine over a touch of light sweetness, grain and spice. Med-light body, generally big bitterness balanced by a chewy caramel malt presence. Finishes balanced, tad on the bitter end with a touch of light malt. Solid IPA.

Bottle. Poured a darker orange color with a two finger foam head. Left a lot of lacing on the side of the glass as it went. A very well balanced ipa. Very sweet and good. Citrus and pine hops. I love this IPA.

Great head, nose, and flavor. Very smooth. Medium bodied with a well hidden ABV. Take the best of Two Hearted Ale and Sculpin IPA and you got this winner. Alesmith is on point with their IPAs. Aroma is of cantaloupe, hops, peach, apricot, and grapefruit. Citrus taste folllowed by some sweet melon or cantaloupe flavors. Ends dry and hoppy. Pours deep gold with a foamy head that lasts if poured right. One of the best if not the best Ive had in its class. Cheers!

Shipped to me by my wife on a trip out west. Sampled from a 22 oz brown bottle this beer poured a hazy vibrant orange color with a huge yellow-white head that lingered. The aroma was sweet pine, grapefruit and orange. The flavor was strong sweet grapefruit, pine and orange with notes of nut and pepper underneath. The finish was long with fruity hops. Fairly full bodied. Well done.
Pours golden with a large white head. Aroma is malt, citrus, grapefruit, peach and light pine. Flavour is malt, nice hop balance, citrus, grapefruit, peach and pine.

Bottle. A hazy dark golden beer with a huge, creamy, lacing, fully lasting beige head. The aroma is strong with an average maltiness. Hugely hoppy. There are notes of grapefruit, pine needles, resin, tropical fruits, with monor notes of caramel and biscuits. The flavour is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, moderately bitter. Quite well balanced for the style, that said very hoppy. Medium body, lively carbonation, nice creamy mouthfeel, dry and very long finish with high bitterness, lightly abrasive (fortunately). One of the best IPAs Ive tasted so far.

Bottle from brewolf...thanks Michael! - Pours clear amber with a massive foamy white head. Aroma is malty sweetness colliding with some citrusy, grassy hops, a little licorice, and some light, mild spiciness. Taste is lightly sweet malt with some bitter, grassy hops that intensify all the way through the finish. Unfortunately, its just not my favorite hop profile. It has a wonderful mouthfeel, smooth and velvety in the mouth, with the bitter resin coating the cheeks. It just sits there, drying your mouth out pleasantly, but leaving behind a nasty aftertaste. I guess I liked the subtlety of the Anvil ESB better, but this was a decent IPA as well--just not as great as I was expecting.

This was my first truly religious beer experience. I cant believe you guys can just buy this every day in the San Diego area. Being able to experience this one a regular basis would be amazing. Its floral, hoppy but still balanced, and you can easily drink the whole bomber. Its complex, its cheap, its delicious, its refreshing. Alesmith rules.

exquisito aroma y sabor a lúpulos americanos, el lúpulo está bien presente con nota cítricas y retroaroma floral a herbáseo. de cuerpo moderado y espectacular color. muy rica cerveza.  fb: chiqui.velasquez (Argentina)

On draught from Local on 4th.. Pours a very familiar cloudy, hazy apricot with a touch of white head foaming at the top.. the smell of faint vanilla beans and that lovely pine infused hopiness that begs me for just another wiff, like a perfume pusher at the mall only this I must also taste...  The initial hit to the palate is of course dressed with some bitterness but very well overall with notes of floral hops, citrus and a nice touch of caramel or as crazy as this sounds almost a marshmallow taste on the back of the bite..  Drinks extremely smooth for an IPA and I cant believe Ive already asked for another...  Its a very well constructed IPA all the way around and one that will definitely make it into the rotation. I cant believe it took me this long to finally rate it..
Pours a light yellow. Aroma is of honey and grassy hops. Taste is pretty light, mostly of hops, but also hops. A little disappointing.

My sample had a very high CO2 content, almost Champagne like. At first I was worried that the beer was infected, but it tasted clean and fresh. The nose is ripe and busting with fruit and yeast aromas. The palate is medium in body with a crisp dryness that lingers with flavor hops through the finish. I would like to do a side by side with Two Hearted.
very hoppy,amber, clear, white foam, very bitter, full body, creamy, lively, bitter, long finish, a very good hoppy beer.

Rating 400! Bottle. Ours very hazy amber, with a big thick off-white head, nice lacing.  Nose is a fruit-splosion, grapefruit, pineapple, peach, apricot, orange, plus great rank, sticky hops. Nice pine and grass character coming through. Flavor is actually more intense than the nose, if thats possible. Soft yeast and good malt are steamrolled by the great rolling bitterness and fantastic rank hops again. Monster nose, fantastic in the mouth, great finish, Awesome IPA!

Bottle. Pours a light, hazy orange with a big, fluffy white head, spotted lacing. Nice. Aroma is terrific, loads of canned fruits, mango and pineapple, citrus and resin, with a hint of fruity and caramely sweetness underneath. Lovely! Huge flavour in this one, very juicy and fresh, starts off sweet for about a tenth of a second before a big, drying bitterness finishes it off and lingers. Its big, but not brutal. Well balanced. A slight alcohol note distracts a bit. Carbonation could have been a bit smoother and toned down a little, but this is without a doubt one of the finest IPAs Ive ever had, and one of the most enjoyable beers too. Splendid.

Beer #3 of IPA night in good old Lethbridge AB. This beauty thanks to Savvy1982.  Pours a golden colour with a fluffy white head. The aroma is down right rank with earthy funky goodness. The aroma has citrus, pine, grass, musty basement, soft fruit and grapefruit rind. The palate brings loads of grapefruit, grass, wet dirt and spice. There is a chewy, hairy bitterness that grows on your tongue like a crazy tasty fungus. I want more...

looks great hazy yellow with tall thick white head smells great excellent hoppy aroma. Lots of chinook hops. Mice flavour. Very hoppy. A very funky beer with a very funky hop to it. I really like it this is how IPA is supposed to be. Bitter and funky sticking to the inside of your mouth. 
Also noticing some grapefruit aroma as well!

Pours a golden color with a massive white spungy on the side yet creamy on top head.Got the aroma of pines and citrus fruit.The flavor is of citrus and a little sweetness.The finnish is a little bitter and dry.Overall very good beer.

Nice, big, bold, crisp, hoppy IPA, though it is perhaps a bit dry for my liking. I definitely needed a couple glasses of water to aid in finishing this bomber.  Pours a cloudy orange with a thick, white, deep head.  Drinks more like an Imperial/Double IPA.  Definitely a hop bomb.

650 mL bottle from Total Wine in Tucson, served in a snifter. Pours a hazy amber-orange with a rocky off-white head and medium-sized particles. Head diminishes, leaving slight lace. Grapefruit-pine hops are dominant aroma, along with moderate pale bready malts. Notes of vanilla, banana and doughy yeast. Light-medium in body with a dry texture and soft carbonation. Begins malty sweet, but gradually acquires peppery spice as dryness builds towards the end. Finish is long and dry, with a hint of grapefruit. Surprisingly dry, but in a pleasing sort of way. 2010-02-21

Citrus aroma  with a golden picture perfect body. Rootbeer float like massive head with an abundance of small frothy bubbles.  Stong hoppy taste masks the high abv. Delicious warm tasting IPA with a lingering sharpness on the tounge. Great IPA and great beer for the price ($3.99 for a bomber)

Bottle, thanks Vaiz! Slight hazy brownish orange pour, thick creamy head slowly dissipates and collapses. Aroma of pine, some fruit, hops and sour lychee. Nice.
Strong bitter flavour with hops, lychee and orange peel.

Bottle. Pours an almost clear orange color with a very thick, lasting white head that leaves lacing. Aroma of hop with orange, grass, citrus and some floral notes. Very bitter flavor, slightly tropical with a hint of lychee. and a very long bitter finish. Lots of carbonation. Great brew.

I had this after the Bistros DIPA fest and it still stood up to it. I love this beer and one of the best IPAs available, IMO. Drinking it in Triptych as part of the Alesmith event at City Beer Store for SF Beer Week, it stands out as one of the best beers of the week - fruity and floral, great body, smooth and just totally delicious. I had a bottle of this almost a year ago and loved that too. I just wish you could get more Alesmith in the UK!

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2012 Bomber. Pours a light coppery golden color with an inch of thick, fluffy white head . Aroma is floral hops, grapefruit rind and tangerine citrus. The taste begins with a strong dose of grapefruit and pine followed by some tropical fruit and resiny hops bitterness notes. The finish is dry and wickedly bitter with strong carbonation. Yet another exceptionally tasty and original San Diego style IPA.

Nice caramel body with a few floaties and huge creamy head.  Aroma has beautiful floral character.  Flavor is nicely bittered with some nice sweet crystal malts giving a nice background.  Burns a little on the finish.  Really well done.

A: Golden in color with a slight haze to it, tons of foam on this one (seems to happen a lot with the AleSmith brews).

S: Pine and grapefruit from the hops, not much malt on the nose.

T: Much like you would expect, lots of citrus and a great piney bitterness. Hardly any malt in the taste, either.

M: Great crispness to this beer, fairly light on the body.

D: A wonderful IPA from AleSmith, good balance and great bitterness.

22oz poured into a pint glass.  Color is a golden peach with minimal off white soapy head.  Aroma is floral with a bit of citrus as well.  Very tasty, just the right amount of citrus style hoppyness.  Finishes strong and tight, leaves an aftertaste that seems bitter at first but finishes sweet.  Ive lived in San Diego for 2 years and somehow never had the pleasure of sampling Ale Smiths IPA, only their Little Devil and Horny Devil.  That was a mistake.  This one is instantly pretty high on my list.

Poured from a 22oz bottle into three pint glasses to be shared among friends. The color was dark-orange, cloudy, and had a pillowy white head. The smell was a little citrus and kinda hard to define. The taste was a little fruity but no one flavor dominated. A very good IPA and the alcohol was well hidden. Id probably buy this on the regular if I could.

2nd bottle consumed may have been a little fresher. Notes of orange were in the aroma and pine needles and candy were in the flavor. Yummy stuff.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 03-12-2007 19:27:19

IPAs are usually too hoppy for me, but this one was enjoyable. Huge taste difference between bottle and chilled glass. Bitterness was lessened in glass and allowed for subtle sweetness and citrus note. Very strong, hoppy flavor nonetheless. Just a little too much carbonation for me. Overall a great beer.

Nice aroma of earth, pine and citrus hops, light fruit.  Slightly hazy, orange/gold appearance, fluffy white head.  The flavor is nice also, caramel, fruit, citrus.  The finish is some citrus, but mainly pine hops.  Noth earth shattering, but very solidly made.

Glass. Pours a hazy peach-amber color with an off-white, MONSTROUS 4 finger head. A frothy, and long lasting one too. Very nice lacing though. Nose is centennial hops, overwhelming mandarin, floral , grapefruit. Palate is light, oily, and smooth. Very satisfying. Taste is mildly hoppy, slight alcohol presence, mandarin undertones, i get some slight lemon notes, grapefruit, with a long hop, floral and citrus finish. Very, Very nice IPA.

Bottle. Pours a clear yellow beer with an offwhite head. The aroma is hops with citrus. The flavor follows the nose with an intense taste of american hops. The palate is bitter. Overall this beer is just fantastic, balanced and easy drinkable.

Pours a hazy, golden orange with a huge white head. The aroma is strong citrus and pine hops. The flavor is more of the same, without the bitterness you sometimes get in West Coast IPAs. Even without the bitterness, there is tons of hop flavor. Medium mouthfeel and carbonation.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2013 Bomber via trade, many thanks to phaleslu. Pours slightly hazy, peach-amber with a chunky 3-4 finger yellowish-off white head that has great retention and leaves nice lacing. Aroma is huge on citrus a little pine, wildflowers, mandarin, toasted white bread. Flavor is caramel, toast, bready yeast, some pine, underripe mullberries, crisp mineral notes and fairly bitter citrus hop/grapefruit finish. Palate is light to medium bodied with a strong, pillowy carbonation that is never too sharp but helps provide a velvety overall feel, before the slightly dry finish. Overall this is a great IPA, easily one of the best I have had.

Bottle. Poured gold with an amber hue and a thick white head that lasted throughout the beer. Aroma was full of citrus and pine notes with a sweet undertone. Flavor began with hops and resin with a nice citrus and floral finish.

Light amber pour with fizzy bubbles rising up into an enormous full pillowy white head that wont get the hell out of my way to get my lips in there.  Aroma is sweet citrusy hops with a really nice malty backcone with some light black cherry soda and some sweet vanilla.  The hopping is earthy, resinous with tangy orange and lemon notes as well.  Flavor is complex, earthy malts with vanilla, grass, and woody bark - Hops provide the perfect balance with sweet leafy and citrus spiciness.  Mouthfeel is creamy and smooth.  Warms the mouth with a touch of alcohol and some spiciness resides in the mouth for a minute or two after a sip.   Nice, but Id love to try some fresh, itd probably tack another point onto aroma and flavor.

oro ambrato scarico buona schiuma un po grossolana buona persistenza aderente naso luppolato citrico agruamto resinoso leggero erbaceo ma non troppo inteso anche note maltate in bocca secca amaro luppolato ma non esagerata buona persistenza

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2010 Truly a great IPA. Appearance is cloudy, and golden orange. Aroma of pine, resin, citrus, herbs. Deliciously hoppy, but not overwhelmingly so. The flavors are very well balanced here slight tones of sweet. Great finish. I highly recommend this beer to anyone. Even if youre not a hophead.

22 oz Bottle -- Pours bright cloudy orange with a thick rocky off-white head.  Very floral and citrus driven nose.  Flavor wise there is some mild caramel, tangerine, grapefruit, floral and resin hops, and yeast.  Pretty sweet upfront and medium bitterness on the back-end.
Pours clear copper with a big frothy head. Overwhelming hop smell of spruce, and a little floral scent. A very bitter beer. Definitely a must for the hopheads.

Location: On tap at the Brewery, 1/8/10 


Aroma: Lots of hops, pine, grass, earth, citrus, resin

Appearance: Pours a slightly cloudy golden-orange

Flavor: Big hop/bitter flavor, some sweetness, but mostly hops

Palate: Medium-full body, decently long duration, nice mouthfeel

Overall Impression: 
A really good IPA.  These guys make some seriously quality beers, and all their stuff is good, but their hoppy beers sure are great.  Good stuff.  Ive gotta say, I enjoyed this one a lot.  I wish AleSmith would sell their stuff in my neck of the woods, but maybe Im better off, because I could see me drinking entirely too much of this stuff if it was that easy to get.

Pours slightly cloudy golden orange color with golden yellowish hues when held to a light source and a frothy, soapy 2.5 finger head with excellent retention, only very slowly fading into a lasting cap that coats the glass with streaks of soapy lacing.

Very earthy hop aroma with a prominent citrus fruit character, subtle pine and faint malt backbone. Lots of lemon peel, mango and grapefruit in the nose as well as some biscuit Graham crackery malt.

Clean crisp medium body that is very hop forward with a good balance of sweet citrus and dry pine notes. Pretty bitter and dry at first but with a nice amount of lemon and orange peel, mango and grapefruit and a subtle Graham cracker malt backbone that doesnt interfere with the glorious hoppiness. Lingering dry finish. Delicious dank, oily chewy hopbomb! Highly recommended!

Bomber via darn darn1207s mother-in-law coming down from Ohio.  Why we cant get the good stuff in Tallahassee escapes me. Pours an attractive hazy light copper-orange with generous, pillowy head.  Aroma citrus pine needles.  First sip, damn good. Big citrus. Creamier mouthfeel than expected.  Kinda reminds me of a Dreamsicle (remember those?). Sub-medium carbonation.  Dry bitter finish.  Of the other IPAs Ive had, Im reminded of the Founders Centenial (sim citrus, more bitter) and the Sweetwater IPA.    Intensely h[oa]ppy, balanced with just enough malt.  As the bottle says, "Its pretty awesome".

Pours hazy orange with a nice white head and some lacing.  Excellent aroma of hops and sweet citrus fruit.  Pretty full body.  Citrus fruit overwhelms the taste.  Overall an excellent beer and a must buy if you havent tried it.

Wow, 1000th rating for this beer.  Ill do my best.  22 oz. bottle from Belmont Party Supply in Dayton.  Aroma of citrus (orange, lemon, and grapefruit), floral hops, caramel malts, pine resin, and vanilla.  Smells so fresh.  The flavor also has a lot of citrus and a cool floral hop bitterness, with a good amount of caramel, and notes of pine resin, spices, apricot, and mixed berries.  Lasting finish of citrus and bitter hops, with a lingering aftertaste of the same.  Medium bodied, without the bite of a lot of IPAs, partly because of the mild carbonation.  Nice balance for the complexity of this IPA.  Very, very good.
è una delle migliori IPA ke abbia mai bevuto!!!!! al naso è pazzesca!! sembra un esplosione di fiori e frutta!

Serving date: 2009-05-17. Served in snifter.

Amber colored, slightly hazy due to bottle conditioning. A 3 cm white head that leaves plenty of chunky lacings as it settles. Decent retention and great looking lacings.

The smell has a very pronounced citric hop character - lemon and grapefruit abound. Plenty of floral hops and hop resins as well. Some caramel and subdued malts. Slightly spicy. The hop aromas are really outstanding and so fresh they almost sting the nose.

A wonderful hop character in the taste as well. Grapefruit and lemon peel dominate. Faint notes of mango. The malty caramel flavor is quite big but still obviously plays second violin with the hops taking center stage. Some spices in the middle. The finish is rather bitter, but the bitterness is really integrated in the overall profile. It finishes with floral hops, pine-needles and again a slightly spicy sensation. The finish is long. No sign of the alcohol.

Medium body, not very crisp. The carbonation level in this one is close to perfect. Medium amount of small and rather calm bubbles - it really suits the beer well.

D: A great IPA. Perhaps not very complex, but very well balanced and with a beautiful hop character of lemon and grapefruit. It goes down really easy.

Serving type: bottle

(Copy of old Beer Advocate review)

650 ml bottle. Almost clear, dark golden body with a big foamy white head. Aroma is mainly malt, caramel and citric hops. Flavor  is sweet malt, caramel, grapefruit, peaches and pine. Balanced flavor, quite bitter and refreshing. A very nice IPA.

From Voldby, DK.
Bottled, 311209.
Amber with white head. Aroma of citrus, spruce and hay. Flavor with malt and grapefruit too

22 oz. bottle.  Pours an orange/amber color with a medium sized foamy off white head.  The aroma is sweet caramel, fruity, citrus, with a hints of pine and yeast.  The flavor is a near perfect blend of sweet malts, caramel, vanilla, and the citrus and resiny hops.  There is a background fruitiness throughout.  The bitterness lingers on the palate for some time.  Medium bodied and very smooth; this is a joy to drink.  The alcohol acts only to warm.  I am happy we have AleSmith distribution in Cincinnati.

Rating #995 for this beer.

Bottle courtesy of Smokepot23.  Poured a hazy light orange with a thin off-white head.  Nose is reinous with big citrus and pine notes.  Medium bodied with a smooth mouth feel and good carbonation.  Flavor is very clean, lots of piney citrus notes balanced well with caramel sweetness.  Smooth, hoppy, bitter finish.  Awesome beer.  Will I ever find an AS I dont like?  Probably not.

Cream color head.  Pours cloudy with sediment.  Complex, deep aroma, citrus and pine.  Bitter, light body.  Soft carbonation, almost watery.  Overall:  I dont like over-hopped beers, so this was very drinkable.

Bomber. Pours a glowing slightly hazy orange with much sediment and a thick rocky off white head. Aroma is very fresh and citric, nice hop oils, juicy fruits, mango, pineapple, grapefruit all well balanced with very sweet caramel. Flavor starts with a quick hop bite and stays zesty and hoppy throughout, very fresh tasting along with the excellent piney character that keeps the citric aspect in check. Excellent sweet character stays present throughout but in the background giving an amazing balance. Finishes pleasantly bitter, not too much, not too little. Medium body and a light but sharp carbonation. Awesome IPA, I love two hearted but this is awesome
Golden coloured and hazy. Aroma is very hoppy, pine, citrus, passion-fruit, and a bit of malt...perhaps. Flavor is heavy bitter. Dry texture. Lively carbonation.

Pours a cloudy orange with some sediment and a nice airy off-white head that flattens in about a minute.  Laces all the way to the bottom.  Aroma is pretty sweet like a hoppy bubblegum with a little pear.  Flavor is a bit watered down but has some nice bite at the very beginning with what would initially appear to be because of heavy carbonation but is just the bitterness of the hops with a dry pass over the palate at the finish.

Poured from a 22oz. bottle into a pint glass.

The color is a light, clear, gold color with about three fingers of white head with some nice lacing.

The smell is a real strong hop flavor. A pretty grassy hop flvor carries this beer from the start with a nice floral flavor.

The taste is, as expected, nice and hoppy with a real strong floral flavor. Some nice clove and citrus fruit flavors are set back after the first hits of hops has had their time on you taste buds.

The feel is pretty darn great. It has a light mouthfeel that goes down pretty darn easy and it just sweet to the taste buds. A great hop experience.

Hard to top this one. Wonderful pine and citrus aroma. Pours a slightly cloudy golden with nice head. Great citrus hop flavours, grapefruit, but predominated by a tart lemon. Balanced malt. A lingering hop, dry finish that sticks around. Easily one of the best IPAs you could have.

Bottle from Ølbutikken, Copenhagen. Pours a moisty golden with a majestic off white head - and it stays. Shoots off massive american hops blended with floral and citric notes. The taste is strong and bitter with the hoppy overall impression. First the fruity and hoppy notes overtaken by a funky bitterness as from grapefruits. Its quite nicely balanced and the dry-hopping is still fresh - what is hard to say about many IPAs shipped from the States. The mouthfeel is nice and sticky from the alcohol and somehow creamy. Nice

A: A nice peachy copper color with a big thunderous head upon the pour. There is wonderful thick lacing left behind as I slowly enjoy this brew.

S: Lots of hops. Huge aroma with Pine and Citrus in the forefront. There are nice malty undertones and a buttery aroma which help to make this a perfectly balanced brew.

T: The taste is where this beer shines. Lots of citrus... grapefruit, oranges, lemon, you name it its in there. There are tons of citrus hops in this one. There is also a nice caramel sweetness from the malt. The bitterness of the hops is well stated and really lingers. Quite possibly the best IPA I have ever had.

M: Medium bodied IPA with lots of fizz upon the pour. The oiliness of the hops hang around letting you enjoy the lingering effects of this beer.

Initially it  poured with a very large head. but when the bottle finally settled the head had a decent size to it.  The lacing and retention where superb.   Aroma had a good pine like note as well as hints of grapefruit and some malts.  Flavor certainly  had an aggressive pine-like hop presence to it but it did not predominate the flavors of the beer.  There was enough of a grapefruit note to balance it out. Finish was dry.

It is practically inconceivable this nearly perfect IPA could be surpassed in any way. The bottle conditioning smooths the carbonation on the tongue and creates a thick, dense head that lasts to the end. Aromas of grapefruit, bread, and butterscotch. Sublime flavors of robust hop buds, light malts, lemon, and faint spice. Finishes with a refreshing pucker. Any time I make it to CA, this is one of the first beers I look for.

Poured a deep gold with a huge chunky head, very inviting on this frigid night. Smell were sweet hops typical of you west coast IPA. Taste was better than I expected, the hops balance nicely with the malty finish. Thehigh ABV was masked bu the balance. This was a better than expected beer and would totaly pick this up again.

Still in Massachusetts, I had this beauty on the last evening.  I always like a beer that gives you flowers and then tries to get you drunk.  I really enjoyed this after a long wait to find it.  It has a little more pine than I normally like but the whole beer works.  A beast!

Bottle from a trade with daknole. Pours deep hazy golden color with white head. Aroma of citrus fruit, alot of lemon. Citrus is the dominant flavor with some malts and a lingering mild hop bitterness. Medium body with lively carbonation, a resinous mouthfeel and a dry finish. Good stuff. Thanks Dak.

From bottle (the bottom to be more specific, which im told must have had a profound impact on my tasting experience) shared with brother Eric and awiseman.  Aroma is sweet floral and citrus hops with an emphasis on the sweet.  Didnt get a good look at it in the light, but it look like semi-clear orange with a small rapidly disappearing head.  Could definitely taste the alchol as well as the hops, although to be honest, the hops were as strong as I expected.  It almost had a syrupy mouthfeel, which may have been contributed to by the sweetness.  Went down very smooth.  Not what I usually expect from IPAs, but a pleasant surprise.

Bottle courtesy of Jason: Pours a light amber with dense head that dissipates faster than expected... but laces nicely.  Nose is of grapefruit, dry hay and resin.  Something about this aroma is extremely pleasing.  Almost like right after a first spring rain.  The flavor is exceptional... but not at all what I was expecting.  The hops are subtle at first (very nasal driven) and the malt backbone is absolutely perfect.  Hints of plum and caramel are extremely inviting.  Body is light, with a nice dry and slightly lingering  finish.  This is by far, the best balanced IPA I have tried to date... and dare say, my new favorite.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2010 This is a beer Ive been wanting to try for a while. Its ranked as the nr 1 IPA at Ratebeer and our expectations where quite high. It had allot of fruity hops flavours but also some dried fruit. However I felt a bit like I wanted more everything from this beer. It did deliver but I think our expectations where a bit to high. I would love to try this again under better conditions though.
Edit: Tried it at home but actually lowered the score from 3,8 to 3,7.
Bottle at a tasting. Pours hazy amber with a medium head. Nose is fresh and citrusy hops. Very fruity and quite a lot of grapefruits. Taste is grapefruit, hoppy and quite bitter. quite fruity also.

This may well be the perfect IPA. Wild citrus nose, nice semi-transparent golden with a monster head for an IPA that leaves major tracks on the glass. Mouth is medium-bodied and slightly gritty, very nice. Taste is three-fold, hops up front, with a huge blast of grapefruit or something immediately following, with an aftertaste that is equal parts sweet, hoppy-bitter, and straight up refreshing dryness. Its been years since Ive had this, and I remembered it as one of the best IPAs Ive ever had, but Ive had many great ones since (including Ninkasi, Stone Cali-Belgique, Bells, etc) and this is still the king.

Bottle. Moderate caramel, roasted and soap for the malt and yeast, heavy pine and grapefruit for the hops, with background notes of date, pepper and berry. Head is small, frothy, off-white with fair lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is hazy, which eventually goes clear, golden orange. Flavor starts lightly sweet and moderately acidic, then finishes evenly sweet and acidic and moderately bitter. Palate is medium, oily with a lively carbonation and has a lightly dry and astringent finish. This is exactly how an American IPA is supposed to be. I like its unusual lack of harshness of any sort.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2013 Not sure what to say?  Very disappointed in this highly-regarded IPA.  Very small chance this was a bad bottle, but this doesnt appear to be the case.  Of course no date on the damn bottle to confirm if this was a problem.  As of now, I cant rate this as a top-notch IPA.  Bitter aftertaste lingers on the finish.Long Overdue Re-rate2.8.13.  Here we are, more than three years later and finally have Ale Smiths IPA in my possession again.  Much better this time around, especially in the aroma and taste department, but I still do not consider this one of the best in the world.  good brew, not great.  *Ale Smith, why no quality control date???  Come on, this is becoming standard, even in the craft-beer world!

Bomber from Byeager (Brian) from BeerAdvocated. Thanks man! Deep orange color with a rocky off white head. Great citrus aroma. mostly orange and grapefruit. Hop bitterness matches the aroma. There is also a perfume like hop taste. Slightly sweet malt backbone with some honey. Nice west coast IPA. Not totally what I was expecting. Not a hop bomb. Great IPA but not the greatest for me.

Bottle. Ap: Dark orange, hazy, creamy white head. Ar: Grape. Small sweetness. Fla: Fresh and fruity with a strange chemical bitterness. Really like the fruitiness of grape and oranges. Pal, Ov: Big bodied and balanced. Top class IPA!

Bottle from Ölbutikken.
Pours hazy golden with a big creamy head.

Lots of oranges, crisp citrus with a malty background. 
Bitter but balanced.

These absolute top rated beers within their style are often pretty standard but rock solid, this is no different. Nice orange look with a foamy white head. Citrus, pine and grape aroma with some nice toffee malts. Flavor is nice fresh and bitter with a fulfilling warming finish. Not spectacular but damn good.
This beer is beautiful. This beer is a massage on my tongue. This beer gets me drunk in my soul. This is maybe the best beer in the world.
Pours opaque golden orange with hop sediment suspended within it. Powerful hop flavor with plenty of bitterness and a great very strong aroma.

22-oz bottle NapaCabs - Aroma: grapefruit, citrus, floral, piney (hop); Flavor: sweet, salty, caramel, biscuit (malt), citrus, piney, bitter (hop); Appearance: hazy, yellow to orange color, off-white head; Mouthfeel: meduim bodied, medium carbonation with lacing along the glass; Overall: elegantly, balanced malt and intensely hopped, bitter strong ale.

Amazing aroma. Heavy on elegant hop.

Symphonic flavor. Surges, then calms in a dry finish, velvety.

 Palate is characterised mostly by the residual velvet on the tongue.

 Is not a noise-guitar on the tastebuds as many hop-heavy beers. Simple, but intense.

 Purchased in Ølbaren for 145dkr.
This beer is my all time favorite IPA, from the first one to my last one it never disappoints.

Pours orange and just a bit cloudy with a lovely creamy and persistent head. Aroma is wonderful orange cream. Flavor introduces some pine hops. Medium bodied and very smooth on the palate. All the flavors are in perfect balance here. Thank you to Star Market in Berkeley for getting a hold of this.

Shared a bottle with four other guys at Haket in Gothenburg in april 2009. 

Aroma was very inviting, a lot of tropical fruits, raisin, citrus and caramel sweetness. Very good beer, well balanced and nice in every way. Lovely  bitter ending.
This is my favrite IPA.  Alot of people think this is not an IPA. This is because its one of the most well balanced IPAs in the world. Its unbelievable.

Awesome hop aroma - pine, citrus, grapefruit. Pours a pale amber color with a big fluffy white head, great retention, nice lacing. Lots of floaties in this one. Taste is not as hoppy or bitter as I expected considering the aroma. Still, great grapefruit taste with a smooth easy finish. Alcohol is undetectable. Very drinkable and enjoyable.
Bottle.Dark yellow colour with white fluffy head.Powerful bitter aroma of citrus and well hoppy.Full body and strong flavor of pine and hops.
22oz bottle.  Strong citrus hop aroma apparent right away.  Hazy, almost brass in color.  Strong hoppy flavor with a hint of dark fruit.  Nice balance of hops and malt.
Tasting at GABF. Yellow gold- white head. huge hop sweet and grassy/floral aroma starts sweet ends easy long and bitter.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2009 On tap at Alesmith. Pours cloudy yellow/golden with huge foamy white head. Has a strong citrus, pine nose. Very refreshing taste with a huge citrus component and a little on the bitter side. Excellent!
Revisited (11/27/09) from a bomber. Pour is more orangish/amber golden. Still a wonderful citrus/pine flavor. Very crisp, clean taste, smooth and balanced. Top notch IPA!
Nice color and citrus hop smell..... hit the spot.  Not to much like a double but more than your typical IPA

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2009 This is very tasty. Nice lush mouthfeel - moreso than your average IPA. Pours orange hue with soft frothy head. Aroma is the expected pine, floral, citrus. Taste really flavorful blend of strong hops and malt for a solid IPA.

A solid, aggressive IPA.  Straw color in the glass, aromas ascend to reveal a pungent citrus, pine, hopcit aroma and a malt that isnt quite caramel and isnt quite oat, but occupies someplace in the middle.  Hops on the palate, too, and a bitter but rounded mouthfeel.  The hops here are mitigated by the alcohol and tamed a bit as you down the glass.  Respectable stuff made with great attention to detail.
Big piney citrus aromas with some peppery spice.  Pours golden with a white head.  Very earthy bitter hops with some resin flavors strong malt backbone with good mouthfeel.  Pretty solid IPA.

Bottled.  Auction won !  Oh sweet messiah you have come!.  Dark orange pour with jumbo sized head. Some sediment particles floated on top. (I drank them all) A fesh hop aroma that hand shakes it neighboring malt and sweetness. Great hop taste, piney good blend. 
Very good. Ale Smith rocks!

nose is very soapy with hints of yeasty rising bread and mixed citrus. pours thin and crisp clear at the top of the bottle, trasitioning to a murchy sediment filled hazyness by the last pour, very nice. i managed to get over 1" of head over the rim opf the glass without spilling over, then lingered there for a couple of minutes, perfect head and retention. flavor is just great, hops and a very, i mean very fruity citrus finish. the palate is very thick and velvety, great. had the nose been better this would have gotten a near perfect score.

Served cold from tap at the tasting room. Pours orange/amber with a medium-sized white head. Aroma fresh piney hops. Flavor includes citrus notes and malt to go along with the huge hop assault. Bitter finish.

Whoa. Very, very good. This review is missing the taste characteristics because its from memory, but this is likely the best IPA I have had. Wasnt around a computer at the time, though. Balanced perfectly, and utterly refreshing. I remember huge grapefruit and pine.

Bottle.  Hazy apricot colored pour, fresh piney hops and plenty of carbonation.  Flavor was tons of orange right off the bat, then some sour resiny hops and finished light, but still very bitter.  I can see why this one is rated so high.

Bottle. Pretty good. Pours a murky orange, not much aroma, but what there is is malt and pine, with a splash of citrus thrown in. Pours with a huge bready head. Flavors are of citrus( orange and lemon) and malt. It isnt as good as I thought it might be . finish is quite bitter, and pretty good.

The bottle says it all: "Its Awewome"! This is the best single IPA that I have ever had. Be prepared for a hoppy assualt on your palate. As my girlfriend said "Its like BAM"! Excellent pour with about 1 inch of creamy head. Taste was a piney hops with hints of citrus, wich is exactly what I like in an IPA. It had more lacing than a big girl in the dressing room of a lingerie store. I cant wait for my buddy Kevin to send more!

Pours hazy orange amber with a medium white head. Aroma is citrusy hops with a hint of malty sweetness. Flavor is just the right amount of tasty hops and sweet malts to balance things out. Lingers on the tongue really well. Very good.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2009 Bomber. Lightly hazy amber with a nice lasting  disc of  small foam. Aroma of citrus, resin and bread yeast. Flavor is mostly resin with some citrus. Light-medium body is a bit too frothy, dry and  fizzy.

AleSmith IPA is a fantastic American IPA. The color is a deep honey orange with a small off-white head. the Aroma is sweet with bitter hops, citrus and peach notes. The flavor mimics the aroma and the finish is filling and leaves the drinker wanting more.

This is a fantastic drink.

pretty copper pour with a great frothy head great retention.  Piny floral aromas are first evidenced, as well as a more subtle but persistent sugary malted presence.  A powerful flavor a tad on the thin side from what I like. Gets more rounded malty as the session goes on and evolves into a more nuanced and subtle brew.  Hops are prevalent but I almost took them for granted towards the end for some reason or another.  Easy to drink, almost dangerously so.  Great beer.

Pretty excited to finally get this beer for my 450th rating; been looking to get my hands on this for over a year. Pours a deep copper with a full, fluffy head, slides down the side of the glass slowly to reveal excellent lacing. Aroma is not aggressive, but incredibly big and complex; lots of grapefruit, pine, biscuit, and massive shots of resin that hit you, reload, and hit you again. Flavor is similarly excellent, with an initial stage full of candied sugar, caramel malt, sweet citrus, and a bit of honey. This slips into a much more bitter and piney hop character, that was thick almost like sap, then moved to an intensely dry, resinous finish. A welcome tinge of alcohol mixes with the dryness at the finish. Absolutely world class IPA.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2009 Dark copper with excellent white frothy white head that subsides into a tight sponge like texture and an excellent bit of lacing, Aroma is the proverbial works. Every hop facet is touched upon: an initial resin blast yields way to citrus, leaving a spruce forest in its wake.
