Flavor is an incredibly hard hitting but wholly quaffable arrangement of resinous spruce and pine with some citrus notes that are balanced nicely by a honed malt character containing biscuit, caramel, some burnt sugars, and vanilla. Palate is quite full for the style, leaving a sap like coating on the palate. A slight warming booziness sneaks in unexpectedly but is quite welcomed. My favorite of the style to date.

Opaque orange pour with a big, loose, white head.  Bright citrus aroma with some floralness to it and hints of melon and honey.  Loads of grapefruit, mango and melon flavor with a sweet toffee malt body.  The mouthfeel is medium, sticky and loaded with cleasnsing carbonation.

Source: Bottle from KnB

Glass: Bordeaux wine glass

Aroma: Get a lot more fruity esters than I do hops. Feels more like an ESB to me.

Appearance: Amber head, with soft looking white head.

Flavor: Very fruity flavor, and more sweet than I care for. Lacking the hop punch I was hoping for.

Palate: Really smooth and creamy.

Overall: Not a bad beer, but not what Im looking for in a San Diego IPA.

Apperance: AMber color with a creamy head and lots of sticky lacing. Nice!

Aroma: Hops, Citric notes, Pine, Caramel, Exotic fruit.

Flavor: Grass, Citric notes, Exotic fruit, Caramel, Hay, Pine.

Palate: Nice bitterness but where is the malt body to back it up. Medium carbonation.

This is a very high rated IPA and i cant understand why. Maybe this bottle is too old or something but for me this is just a mediocre brew.

WOW!  There is alot going on with beer.  Pours golden with a nice head.  Aromas of citrusy hops with a lemon/lime character.  Flavor is a hint of mango and peach with a note of caramel for balance.  Finishes with a very slight bitterness and a creamy texture.  Overall the IPA ROCKS!

22 oz bomber courtesy as an extra from LilBeerDoctor. Thanks a bunch! Pours a orange amber, good haze, lively carbonation with offwhite thick moderate head that laces pretty well, dies to a decent layer. Aromas are grapfruity hops and citrusy zest, a touch of soap, faint pine and good to balance caramel and toffee malts. Initial is very bitter, hoppy citrus and pine towards the finish, soap and acidic hoppy bitterness. Body has sufficient malt, but pours on the hops in copious amounts. Strong bitterness, pine takes a further role, citrusy grapefruit and florals come in strong as well. Caramel and toffee malt underneath, but this beer is all about the hops. Finish goes a bit sweet, toffee and bread with a touch of mellow vanilla (As the malt bill is much more mellow than expected.. and very much appreciated.. I hate a cloying caramel bomb), with more fruity notes. The front end and middle are hop heavy. Slanted towards the hops overall, very piney. The head stays around near its original pour level, really quite amazing, laces ok. Hops linger on the palate very well, nothing too sweet, as lingering bread and vanilla seem to be the maltiness. Top shelf IPA. Id put it in my top 3 so far. Cheers!

Pours a slightly hazy glowing light amber with a rocky beige head that leaves globs of lacing and doesnt fade. The nose is rife with bright grapefruit and pine with wafts of spice and vanilla. Its truely something to marvel at as each component of the aroma is so pronounced. The flavour is no let down, in fact its even better! Fresh grapefruit and floral hops, as well as some pine characterize the flavour with a light, bready, sweet malt backbone. I wouldnt even say its bitter. I just has so much flavour. The palate is thinner, but it comes across as "crisp" and has a long duration, finishing bone dry and as hoppy as a quality dipa.

Bottle thanks to zinister.  Pour is cloudy brown with a minimal whitish head.  Aroma is caramel malt, cinnamon, hops, and woody/brandy notes.  Flavor is malty, woody, distant hops, and a nice pine crisp finish.  I think I waited too long for this one. Went IPA crazy this spring/summer and kind of put this one away for a while. But, I like old IPAs most of the time so it was not a disappointment.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Øljunta Olympen Gathering. A small offwhite head upon a foggy, amber colored body. Loads of hops up front; tropical, apricot, citrus and grass. A faint whiff of dryish malts. Predominant hop flavors; fresh citrus, evergreen and straw/grass. Some quite sweet, caramellish malts in the background. Medium body. Strong, lingering bitterness in the finish. Very potent, very drinkable.

22 oz. bottle from Johns Marketplace in Portland, Oregon. I think this is going to be an Alesmith night. I have 3 Alesmith beers lined up. Anyways. Nice fluffy head that fades away slowly. Haze orange appearance. This beer looks pretty good. Fruity orange citrus. Holy jeez this is intense. I havent smelled a citrus orange/fruity aroma like this before. As the description says there is a slight pine backing to the aroma. Very pungent aroma that is not hard to smell. A nice citrus hop flavor. Not extremely bitter, which is good. This bitterness allows you to drink this in mass quantities without getting "hopped out". Smooth beer, with a taste that is awesome. I cant taste the alcohol, which is great, but can be dangerous for me.  I just cant get over the citrus. This beer is awesome. Fortunately, unlike drowland, I was able to drink the 22 oz. by myself. Extremely good stuff. This is a tough battle for the top IPA.

This is one fruity and floral IPA that is simply delicious. The aroma was so much on the fruity and floral side it was practically like esters were there from added candy sugar or something! Nuts! This is very delicious and quite balanced. However, I shared a bomber bottle with a friend, and we were both SEVERELY disappointed with the quantity. :-)

I really enjoyed this beer. Up to this past year I wasnt much of a Hoppy beer person, but thanks to repeated exposure by my friends and family it has forced its way into my beer rotation. 

This is one of the better IPAs that I have had, and it is something that I will purchase in the future.

22  The beer is very hoppy, complex, yet still needs a bit more Umh to top a bigger than expected alcohol bite.  It simply competes w/ the hops (Id think 7ish ABV). Dont get me wrong this IPA has it all (pine, grapefruit, orange, & all around sweet resin); it just exists in that weird spot of being stronger that yr reg. IPA but lacking the hops & alcohol? of the big boys. Also an $8 bomber. Still Its Pretty Awesome.
From a bottle poured a copper color with a fair amount of head.  Nice hoppy flavor with a quick bitter finish.
Bottle. Hazy golden with large white head. Nice aroma of hops and citrus.. Floral. Dry and minty aftertaste. Very well balanced.

Thanks Rencelas!  This beer pours a cloudy light caramel color with a large beige head that has great retention.  It leaves a soft sticky lacing.  Aroma is floral, pine, and caramel.  Lots of nice hops.  Flavor is so well balanced!  Sweet caramel is evened out by a delightful assortment of hops.  Nice spices.  It is a flawless beer that offers so much.  A wonderful IPA deserving of its 100% ranking.

Plain bottle, cloudy pour.  Sweet honey and floral hop aroma.  A dry, sharp IPA - astringent, with grapefruit pith hop flavor dominating.  A touch sour and bitter, but not irritating, and with some herbal notes.   Personally I like IPAs to be a little sweeter, but this is a very respectable slurp.  A little over-rated, in my opinion, like other things I have had from Alesmith.

Perhaps a little too carbonated.  It starts by overflowing the bottle when opened.  The pour is minimally 2/3 head to start.  Forms a solid dome of foam.  Leaves extensive, decorative lace all over the glass.  The liquid itself is hazy with a light gold color.

Interestingly, the initial pour gives off a pleasant pale ale malt aroma.  Letting the beer settle results in a strong floral (pine) hop smell.  

A smooth, high-hopped beer.  While it is spicy and bitter, there is a solid malt base, almost buttery.  Still, this is a story of the hop.  The swallow and the aftertaste is biting, like fresh ground pepper.  The alcohol is well-hidden and the body is neutral for the style.  A deceptively easy beer to drink.
Bottle, Opaque light orange pour with a thick foamy white head. Smells hoppy, floral, citrus and pine. Full mouthfeel. Very well balanced. bitter, floral with a sweet spicy finish. yum.
Citrus, grapefruit hop nose overwhelming in the best way. Deliciously balanced flavor profile with a sharp hop bite. Everything that you hope an IPA would be. Nice mouthfeel. A little soapy.

Thanks to Kegbear. Pours and orange hue with a huge frothy white head. Aroma full of citrus, pine and grassy hops. Nicely balanced with lively carbonation  Starts bitter and ends with a subtle sweetness. A+++
Murky, golden coloring with a great foam head.  I could smell honey, wheat & grapefruit.  The beer tasted sort of sweet with a hint of grass.  It made me think of almonds for some reason.
Moderate hop aroma. Clear orange color with a small white head. Hoppy with a mild bitterness in the beginning fading in the finish. Light palate.
I love this beer...much crisper and cleaner than I would have expected from a west coast IPA...hops are all over but never too much...balance is fantastic...a world class IPA....................

thanks to BoamR for sharing...my newest apprentice has some pretty good tastes for a newcomer to our world...pour had tremendous head, lacing held in the chimay goblet for half an hour...flavor was amazingly smooth...there was never that mouth shocking bitterness from all the hops...the thing that really got me was the the tail, and the fact that there an even smoothness to the aftertaste.  easily the best crafted and well balanced IPA i have ever had...thanks ryan
Bottle. Pours golden color with a nice white head. Smell of citrus and a little bit of a sweet smell. Taste of citrus. Waited for the bitter hop taste and it never came. This is a fantastic beer!
Bottle @ Ölbutikken. Golden color with white head. Very hoppy aroma citrus herbs some sweetness. Greaat taste with a lot of hops citrus peaches grapefruit well balanced. Perfect IPA

Bottle. Pours a deeper yellow. Dont know why but I just expected than orange color like other west coast IPAs. Great deep agressive hop nose. Taste doesnt disappoint either. Agressively hopped & extremely well balanced. Great IPA, big thanks to pbsmooth, from that other site we dont talk about

Small white head. Yellow body. Tropical fruit and strawy malty aroma. Dry-sweetish tropical fruit and chalk taste with citric notes. Mid-bodied. Smooth mouthfeel. Dry honey and resin aftertaste with wooden citric notes. Excellent drinkable IPA. (Oslo beer junta tasting. Need to rerate.)

Pours a deep yellow. Big pine, citrus and dank hops, sweet malt nose. Flavor is a very balanced and full bodied mixture of caramel malt, pine, grapefruit, resiny hop goodness and some lingering booze. Al around a super solid IPA. Wouldnt expect anything less.

A - Beautiful clear yellow with a slight orange hue and one finger of magnificently white creamy head.

S - Citrus, floral, grapefruit, malty... Definitely west coast, this smell so good.

T - Fresh clean grapefruit, resiny, floral hops up front that is followed by a really well backboned malty sweetness. The finish is crisp and clean making me want more. Wonderfully balanced IPA, this is the most balanced IPA Ive had, its absolutely delicious

M - Creamy, full bodies, medium carbonation... perfect.

D - Man this beer is delicious. This IPA is in my top 3. No way this is 7.25 ABV, Im going to session this one and well see what happens. :)

I have been wanting to try this one for awhile. Fresh bottle. Pours a clear golden yellow color with a good sized, foamy off white head that settles to a thin film. The aroma is very citrusy as I expected showing fresh oranges and grapefruits, bitter hops, and nice caramel malt base. The flavor follows suit with the fresh citrus hops, orange and grapefruit juice, and perfectly balanced by the sweet caramel malt backbone. A substantial mouthfeel that is very smooth with the right amount of carbonation leading to a citrusy bitter finish. This is a very tasty IPA, and I would expect nothing less from these guys.

22oz bottle. A nice hazy orange pour with a bubbly white head, decent lacing. Large orange citrus aroma with some pine. Flavor is big pine with grapefruit citrus undertones and some malt sweetness to balance it all out. This beer is greatly balanced and a real palate pleaser.

65 cl bottle at my garage-tasting May 8th. Dark golden color, fine white head. Aroma is every hophead´s dream; lovely citric and floral hops. Flavor is a lovely balance between hops and malty sweetness. Wow!

22 oz bottle. Dark orange with a very fluffy off white head, long lasting and leaves some lace as well. Big Northwest hop aroma of citrus, flowers, pine and a bit of caramel and bread. This beer has a great balance of sweet and bitter with a nice long bitter finish. Medium body and a slick mouth feel. This is one heck of an IPA, the best out there??? maybe not in my opinion but very good none the less.

bottle..deep amber pour,big thick white head ,excellent lacing.aroma is very floral with a touch of perfume.and grapefruit. upfront bitterness of pine and grapefruit. sweet malt backbone.finish is dry and bitter,medium body and carbonation .

Wow - this beer is very good!  Ive had mixed feelings about some of the Alesmith beers available here in OH (although I do love the Speedway Stout), but this one tastes exceptional, and is light enough for some sessionability (at least compared to the Wee Heavy and Grand Cru).  Pricey, but I will definitely be buying this again.

It poured a sort of dirty blond color in my glass with towering cumulus-cloud head (Duvel-like).  Aroma was a sweet citrus-y hoppiness with some other odd notes present that seemed to fade as the beer warmed and I drank some of it.  Flavor was a really nice IPA - lots of hop citrus and dry bitterness balanced by a significant malt framework.  Mouthfeel was dry and fairly crisp (versus cloying and sticky, which can be the case in some very citrus-y IPAs).  Very good.

I bought this bottle at Blacklick Liquor on Broad St in Columbus/Reynoldsburg/Blacklick.  I will likely be back for more!

Bomber from theisti. Deep, dark DIPA looking pour with a pretty fluffy head for the style. Aroma is a little odd at first (wife said "dirty diaper - but not in a really bad way") - but the mroe I smell, the more I like it. Hops, of course, but some mango/papaya that I think initially give it a weird funk. Taste is dynamite. The resiny hops really take over, but play nicely with some sweet/sour sauce taste and a solid caramel background. Well-balanced, better every sip. Thanks, Tim!
One of the best single IPAs ever, poured orange with lasting white head. Tasted of lots of floral and citrus hops and a perfect caramel malt finish with a lasting bitter taste.

Original review date 5/1/2009...

Man, I didnt get to try this in San Diego last summer so I was wicked happy to see it in a trade. Served up in a Portsmouth snifter...

Pours a golden...and I mean GOLDEN...honey color. Very pure and clean looking. First pour doesnt have much head to speak of but well see what happens. Not too much visible carbonation, but the color on this one alone is a treat.

Oh yeah...the Ruby Red grapefruit hop presence is excellent. Theres a moderate yet unobtrusive sweet honey malt backbone that balances this out quite nicely though...but does the collar match the cuff? Lets see...

Well, theres a slight sweet honey viscosity to this but its not heavy or overbearing. The citrus/grapefruit hops really stand out nicely without a bitter rind sensation. Just tangy, succulent grapefruit. Maybe not as oily as some hop bombs but it carries enough viscosity. This stuff is top-notch.

Even with a tad of viscosity and sweetness the finish is a little dry...and thats a good thing. Crisp and clean, no caffeine...maybe a little rind bitterness shows up on the finish but thats just fine with me. This wraps up in excellent fashion. A little bit of booziness is the door that hits you on the ass on the way out.

Tough to compare to something else. Maybe a Ruination with more of a purity of hop purpose. A little less balanced than Ruination but enjoyable as hell. The booziness emerges a little more with warmth but thats OK. This is a well-oiled machine.

Aroma of citrus and grapefruit. The appearance is yellow with a small head. The flavour is dry with hints of grapefruit, citrus and soil. A very good IPA but it was not a taste sensation as I had expected.

0.65 l bottle at PBF. Hazy copper-apricot color with creamy head. Sweetish aroma with juicy tropical fruity hops, mango, apricot, honey and grass. Bittersweet flavor with juicy tropical fruity hops, lemon, mango, pine and toffee. Fairly carbonated slightly astringent palate. Full bodied. Very tasty, there are better IPAs though.

22oz bottle. Pours a rich a amber color with a decent off white head. Super crazy grapefruit aroma. You can definitely tell what hops they used in those one. Flavor is all hops and just enough malt to hang said hops on. This is a west coast ipa at its finest. Citrus, peach, mango all over the place. Some light spice and  long moderately bitter finish. Non existant alcohol. Terrific.

Bottled at PBF.  Hazy pale amber, mid sized head. Intense shampoo-like grapefruit aroma. Dryish with slim winegum-like cookie malt. Very hoppy and very American beer tat gets in your face immediately. Lots of character and massive bitterness. Pretty awesome as far as Im concerned.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2009 A golden beer with a two finger head. Aroma is piney, fruity, citrus & great. Taste is a little bitter but not much with all the flavors the aroma has to offer. I can see why this is currently #1.

Pours a medium orange with a huge, out-of-control head. I can smell the hops from over a foot away. Aroma also has a little flora, slight perfume, grapefruit in abundance. Creamy aroma too. Yum, flavor is also very creamy for an IPA, thick malt base, a little sweet with light fruit, peaches. Finishes just a little bitter. Palate is medium, not too much carbonation.  Overall, very good.

Bottled. Golden colour, small beige head. Aroma is fruity, caramelly, flowery and a bit herbal as well. Flavour is nice grassy, fruity and earthy notes along with some flowery hops as well. Very balanced and pleasant IPA.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2010 In a chilled bottle at Rattle N Hum (Midtown, NYC): Pours a light, penny colour. The aroma gives off a flowery, jasmine feel. Tastes of flowers, cherries, banana, hops... essentially everything you could wish for in an Indian Pale Ale. Very smooth finish. I love this beer. #048 on 03072009, DG.

Bottled (PBF).
A bit hazy orange color, small steady creamy head, some lace. Grassy hoppy, a bit piney aroma. Grapefruity, fruity (mango) flavor with resiny notes. Nicely drinkable, not too hoppy. Pine, citrus...

Bottle.  Pours a clean clear orange with a heft dense beige head.  Pineapple and clean wet pine hit the nose just from taking the cap off the bomber.  Gorgeous.  Toasty malt behind the lovely hop aromas.  Medium bodied, lightly sweet.  Finishes a little bitter, with a nice long lingering grapefruit tone, and with what may be a slight metallic note, though that was only on the first sip, and didnt show up for the rest of the bomber.  Didnt live up to the aroma, but not a problem, as I could just sit here and sniff this all night instead of drinking it.  The little bit extra alcohol this has over most others goes by undetected.  Well hidden, and well done.  Very tasty.

Bomber as imaged split with CUJO @ Rattle n Hum.  Pours orange with lovely head but not much haziness.  Nose of unripen green pears.  Spice and herbal florals.  Taste is surprisingly mellow for an IPA and not overly agressively hopped.  Well balanced and medium to medium heavy with some acidity.  Very glad to have tried this on the east coast.  3.95
A faint nose of citrus and old shoes. Taste is of grape and elderflower. A solid IPA, but its not fantastic. I have to admit that I am a bit dissaponted. Maybe the bottle wasnt too fresh?
Orange colored goodness. Very aromatic intense hoppy aroma. Flavor is very nice hopped. Different hopflavors in a well balanced way with a good afterburner. Very nice one.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2012 660ml bottle (Pikkulintu, Helsinki) - shared by Mirjukka and Janne - thanks!
Fruity perfumed aroma. Mid orange, tiny scummy head. Very simple APA, weak watery body. Pleasant hoppy taste but absolutely no depth  or complexity at all. Fortunately, its incredible boringness is its only flaw. Predictably simple sweet hoppy finish.
Rerate: 660ml bottle (Viisi Pennia, Helsinki)  (6:3:6:4:12=3.1)
comes over as sweet and boozy. hops are nice. not ptressing my buttons. the beer has no rel flaws, Im going to keep the numerics above. This is just a mood thing, and its not doing it for me.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2013 (Bottle from Systembolaget) Poured deep golden and clear. Head was medium sized and white. Aroma contained citricness, tangerine, pine and malts. Palate was medium bodied and dry with quite high carbonation. Flavours were pine, citricness, malts, sweetness, pine, resin, hint of vanilla and medium bitterness. Aftertaste was mildly sweet, hoppy and bitter.

Re-rerate, a bottle with a new label. Here the hoppiness was very intense but still very balanced. Hence the update of the overall score from 15 to 17.

My olddest rating from a 1 dl sample: 8-3-8-3-13=3.5
Bottle. handsom head with tasty affordant duration. Aroma Rich of hops and flowers, with malt, citrus notes

22oz bottle: Apperance slightly hazy brown with slow fading white head, aroma of both citrus and florial hops, flavor is pretty hoppy again with both citrus and florial hops but also a decent malt backbone. A damn good IPA, price is steep but worth it.

Bomber, delivered from here: http://www.liquorama.net/index.asp?PageAction=VIEW   
Top 5 IPA I have ever had. Pours about a pinky width of head, smells wonderful. Hoppy, grassy, citrusy. Taste is just hoppy right out of the gate. Taste has a nice combo of citrus, grassy and piney flavor, with good resinous finish. 

A wonderful IPA I wish I could buy locally, as I would have it in my fridge permenantly.
Bottle. Nice head with excellent duration. Color is clear golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops and flowers, with malt, citrus notes and some pine.

(Bottled) Slightly hazy amber with a medium, cloudy head. Pine-hoppy, exotic-fruity nose with citrus and strawberry. Pine-woody-hoppy, very bitter flavor with lots of resiny bitterness in the finish. Long, mouthdrying aftertaste. Much smoother and slightly fruitier with yeast. Medium body, low-medium carbonation, quite refreshing. A nice, hoppy IPA with no cat-pee. Not mind-blowing, and maybe a bit straightforward, though.
A bottle 0.66L tasted at Pikkulintu. Soft sweet hoppy nose. Golden yellow colour. Pale thin head. Soft hoppy malty slightly bitter taste. More than average hoppiness. Alcohol well hidden.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Orange and grapefruit aroma. Light hazy, amber colour, beige head, good lace. Light sweet, light malty, fruity, floral, grapefruit. Sticky, full. Flavourful and easy going.

What an awesome IPA. From the pour to the last sip this is what an IPA should be. Pour a golden honey with a nice bright white head/ The head has nice lacing though out the drink. The aroma is spicy/hoppy. The taste is well blance between citrus, woodsy notes and bitterness/spiciness of the hops. The alcohol is well concealed by the flavor of the beer.

A little lighter in color than most IPAs, golden honey color with just a slight bit of amber, nice chunky off white head, very active and very good lacing. Huge citrus hops aroma, very fresh. Flavor is citrus dominated, very hoppy without being too bitter, nice resinous chewy hoppy mouthfeel, enough malt to stay very balanced and drinkable for an IPA, nice lingering dry hoppy finish. I could drink a whole bunch of these. Most beers this hyped seem to be a let down when finally consumed, but this is not. It isnt my favorite IPA, but it is very close.

golden brown with large white head.  moderate to high carbonation for the style.  strong hoppy nose with citrusy and spicy character.  flavor has some piney bitterness, not overwhelming, likely from Chinook, which morphs into a ton of citrusy, spicy, and floral hop flavor that is really complex and wonderful.  mild malt sweetness finishes and balances the beer, but the beer finishes very dry to clearly showcase the hops.  great hop nose and flavor in this one.  chinook isnt my favorite bittering hop, but this is a great IPA

Really drinkable. Good flavors and right amount of bitterness. I wish I could get this all the time. Has some fruit and juicyness to balance out the bitter hops. Crisp and refreshing. Malts aid in body and citrus adds to complexity.

Combine, price, complexity, availability..for me in CA... drinkability, goes with lots of food, subtle, and so aromatically complex this is a near perfect brew. One of the 1st craft beers to start my path down the real beers being brewed journey. Forgot about this beer and dismissed it for a year or 2, just rediscovered it again recently and have always kept at least 1 in the fridge ready at all times. Stunning!  Consistant notes from bottle, keg and smoother more mellow from cask.
aka "SIZE 48 FONT IPA"  .. . Clean! .. . poured a golden shimmer, with a good healthy medium head .. . thanks for the shoes .. . full yet damn delicious! .. . all its cracked up to be!! .. . .

My 1976th Rating!  Thanks to mashmaster.  22oz bottle of the No. 1 rated IPA.  Pours clear orange/golden color. Light beige colored foamy head,  sticky lacing on the glass.  Aroma of rich sweet malt, resiny hops, pine/citrus yumminess.  Distant cotton candy with citrus peel essence.  Oh so delicious.  Lots of citrus, very oily and chewy.  Sweet vanilla, caramel, and a bit of resin.  Finish is a bit fruity, some peaches and plums.  Damn it!  Why is a beer so far from my home have to be this Fn good. Its Pretty Awesome!!!

bottle.  And a bottle that I friggin love when it shows up in MA.
Pours a clear dark orange copper color, gentle pour yields a thick foamy inch of white head; visible active carbonation keeps the thick, pillowy head around.  Aroma is incredible... thick, heady bitter grapefruit and resin notes, some light sticky sweet tangerine and orange.  Little if any sweetness on the nose- all hops, and plenty of them.  Flavor starts with sharp, assertive bitterness.  Loads of sharp citrus notes- grapefruit, lime, oranges.  Hop profile rounded out with resin and some pine notes.  Huge, deep, solid hop character.  Palate is full and sharp, plenty of flavor without being heavy.  Light citrus finish.  Overall, absolutely superb.  Easily one of the best bottled IPAs Ive sampled.
Large bottle. A solid IPA if there ever was one. Excellent taste of pine and hops. Nice cloudy golden pour that leaves a nice lacing. Not too over the top alcohol content. This is good stuff.

Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow with an off-white head. Intense pine hop aroma with sweet candy notes in the background and an occasional whiff of pineapple. Flavour is hops; citrus and pine, as well as some malt. Same finish, but with a decent bitterness. Kind of one-dimensional and not very complex, but a well-made beer which hits the spot with me (and my love of hops). 07-06-09.
Clear golden with a medium white head. Aroma had plenty of hops andmalty notes. Flavour had plenty of hops, pine and grapefruit notes.finished seriously bitter.
Nice beer, thanx to Cass for bringing this one out  nose is nice citrus hops with a bit of malts in there. flavor is how a IPA should be nice alcohol great hops good balance of malt all good.

Big bottle on Haket, June 6, 2009. Shared with Egon and one more.Hazy golden color, big fluffy off-white head. Huge hoppy scent, green, grape, citrus, also caramel, very fresh! Big, sweet, bitter, grainy, citrus taste. Very well balanced taste! Smooth mouthfeel, medium high bitterness. Minty aftertaste, the candy licorice rolls with lemon stuff inside.

On tap at the AleSmith tap room in San Diego. Pours a clear, golden orange body with a white, rocky, slowly dissipating head that leaves some nice layered lacing. Aroma is big on the pine, but stays subtley sweet. Lots of juicy pineapple, grapefruits, and a resiny bitterness. Still has a nice caramel backing with the bold hop aromas. Flavor is more of the same. Big time hops, but big time balance. Lots of sweet pineapples and grapefruits, peaches, and just a touch of sour lemons in the finish. The hops are a moderate piney bitterness with a light resin. Finishes clean and slowly dries before a long aftertaste of sweet caramels and an even bitterness. Palate is medium bodied, oily, and has just a touch of carbonation. Overall, a truly solid IPA all-around. I do have others that I may prefer, but this definitely lives up to the hype.

pours clear golden with nice white head. aroma is pine, grapefruit, orange, pineapple, tangerine and a hint of malt. drinks very similar with fantastic balance throughout and leaves you wanting more. i sure do!

Bottle, 22oz, kindly shared by tarjei. It pours an almost clear, golden body under a dense, small, off-white head. Lovely nose with citrusy, slightly peachy hops. Some pine cones too, and with appropriate level of malts. That goes for the flavor too, the malts do their job in the background, providing sweetness and body fullness to cope with the citrusy, resiny and piney hops. Slightly warming too. Fine bitterness in the finish. A pretty awesome, well-balanced IPA. Wonderful. (090508)
Pale golden of color with a white foamy head. An aroma of hops, citrus, grapefruit and weak sweets. A flavor of sweet malt, hops, citrus, grapefruit and nice bitter finish.
Like being repeatedly smacked in the head with a tin of dole pineapple. Awesome.
The aroma is on point! Has all the characteristics of a big IPA that I like but there is something missing but I cant figure it out. Almost perfect.
Bomber. Pours orange with a white head. Lots of grapefruitty hops in the nose. Flavor is hoppy, malty and bitter to the end. Excellet IPA

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy orange color with a small white head. Has a malty hoppy bitter grapefruit aroma with some piney hints. Malty hoppy bitter grapefruit flavor. Has a long malty hoppy bitter finish with nice grapefruit in the aftertaste.

22 oz bottle.  Perfect pour -- orange-copper color, just-opaque, with a perfectly rolling head.  The aroma is also a winner -- equal parts good ol malt "beer smell" and glorious citrusy hops.  This drinks with an almost-thick resiny consistency, with a muscled hoppy character and sweet malt backdrop.  Very, very well put-together brew.  (#3554, 5/26/2009)

Bottle. Big piney hops in the aroma, along with biscuity malt and a hint of citrus. Tremendously full and mellow mouthfeel. Flavor has well balanced bitter and sweet flavors. Finishes with slew of citrus, pine and mild herbal flavors, long lingering bitterness and hop oils. Obviously very well made. The bold finish was unparalleled among ipas Ive tried. IMO not as much flavor in the middle as Two-Hearted ale.

22oz bomber of ale smith ipa. Poured into a tulip glass. Aroma is the best part of this beer. Smells of citrus and hops with a slight malt or breadiness. Large white head that slowly breaks down if at all. Strong grapefruit flavor with a bitter finish. One of my favorite IPAs.

Really enjoyed this even though I got raked over the coals to the tune of $15.00 for one 22oz. bottle.  Aroma and flavor were both dominated by strong grapefruit with hints of pine and orange blossom honey.  Mouthfeel was full for the style and very filling but with a crispness at the finish.  Well balanced and so far the best IPA Ive had.  A sliver more ingredients and this would be winter yulesmith.

Bottle (75 cl) at Café 3 små rum, Göteborg, Sweden. Shady golden, medium white head. Perfumy, piney, and floral hops, on a clean malt backbone, along with some tropical fruits. Medium bodied and smooth. Long bitter finish. Very delicious. Not priceworthy though.

22 oz bomber, poured into a tulip glass. Light clear amber, with small white head.  Aroma of resinous hops, grapefruit, pineapple, and sweet malt...just fantastic!  Taste is more sweet bready malt, grapefruit, pine, and some sweet fruits (peach, mango?).  Crisp medium mouthfeel.  Just a fantastic IPA, probably the best Ive had.  Top notch!!!

Bomber from the awesome Smokepot23.  Pours a glorious, clear dark gold with a lasting frothy off-white head.  Aroma of grapefruit and pine resin with biscuity malt in the background.  Tastes of pine, citrus and sweet malt.  Finishes with a lingering, but not overwhelming bitterness.  Great mouthfeel - substantial but not oily.  All told, one hell of an IPA.
This is probably my favorite ipa. Drank this bottle of goodness while watching the laker game. Smell of hops citrus. Taste of definite hops lil bit of grapefruit nice bitter finish. Love this beer

Bottle (in NZ). Pours a dark gold with a large creamy head - which carries all the way down the glass, along with some impressive lacing. Big aroma explodes upon simply opening the bottle. Plenty of hops - pine, citrus and a buttery sweetness - nearly enough to burn the nostrils. Also a hint of bitter chocolate in the malt.  The palate is both bitter and creamy, the hops dominate the tongue - perhaps too much. The finish is very dry, with clinging resiny hops. I prefer more malt character, but a quality IPA nevertheless.

Tasted 10/05/2009. Bomber from Beerstoer.co.nz. Mothers day lunch... Id go as far as saying this is (possibly maybe) better than Pliny the Elder. I dont know. Perceived hop flavour and bitterness is stronger but it doesnt quite have the malt to make it as sessionable as the Elder.  Debating the sessionability of these two beers is worth another box or two, I reckon.

Pours hazy orange with thick, creamy white head that leaves sexy lace as the pint goes down in the glass.

Nose is a pleasant metallic-citrus, grapefruit with maybe tangerine.

On the palate a huge, mouth savoring juicey-fruity flavor that makes your mouth pucker. Citrus is more towards grapefruits and orange, with some candied sweetness, and the hops also come through with some hop resin & pine sap. Overall, though the juicy fruit dominates, there is some sweetness to balance it out and make it extraordinarily drinkable for an IPA.

One of the best examples of an American IPA.
220z bottle. Pours cloudy golden amber in color with full foamy tan head. Aroma piney and citrus hops. Taste grapefruit and citrus hops with grapefruit bitter finish. A very outstanding IPA!!!!!

Pours a hazy lemon yellow with a solid head. Aroma is of pine nuts and piny hops. Flavor is of a vanilla and pine mixed with strong floral notes. Definite grapefruit undertones. Body is creamy with medium carbonation. A very well done IPA with a flavors incredibly balanced.

Pours a light copper color with a small head.
Smells of bright, im guessing cascade hops. I got this beer RIGHT after a run at the brewery, fresh as a could be.
Taste is bright with hops, reminiscent of a Russian River IPA, but a slightly stronger malt backdrop.

Bomber.  Where to start.  Amazing, and dare I say, better in the bottle (guess its that bottle conditioning thing!).  Peter and crew really know what they are doing up there at AleSmith.  Exceptional IPA, and a must try for any self-respecting Beer Geek.

Pours a hazy lemon yellow with a solid head. Aroma is of pine nuts and piny hops. Flavor is of a vanilla and pine mixed with strong floral notes. Definite grapefruit undertones. Body is creamy with medium carbonation. A very well done IPA with a flavors incredibly balanced.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy pale orange color. Flavor is mild malts followed by slightly thick chewy resinous hop flavors. Finish is dry with notes of ripe fruits. Nice candi sugar sweetness within this beer, which is to me the mark of excellent IPAs. Medium bodied. According to the ratings, this is the pinnacle of IPAs, Ill go with that. It is indeed a solid version of the style.

Pours rose gold with a fine white head and looks so drinkable. FIne notes of lemon and grapefruit, soft pine. Nose gentle and gorgeous. Bristely pine bitterness in the smouth followed by soft tastes of passionfruit and grapefruit. Lovely fine bubbles that spritz over yr tongue leaving you wanting another sip.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2012 22 oz. bottle ordered from Half Time Beverage (replaces my original review on April 30, 2009).  Pours dark orange with a frothy off-white head.  Aroma of piney and citrusy hops.  Beautifully integrated balance of bright and bitter hops with just the right amount of malt sweetness.  My original overall score has held up well and is this is still amongst my favorite IPAs (and possibly the best I have had).  Outstanding.
Another good alesmith. Poured amber with a white head. Aroma of pine and lemons. Lots of citrus flavor with some sweet malt. Make it in 6s/

Bottle at Ølbaren, 27-APR-d009.
Light with a little orange hue, and very little head.
Best hoppy IPA nose with loads of pine and citrus.
Textbook IPA - how can you make one better?
Very creamy and loooong aftertaste.
Fantastic IPA. Worlds best IPA according to Ratebeer. Not unlikeliy.

amber, spritzy white head. wonderful sharp grapefruit on the nose. resins, pine, loads of cirtus and maltiness. carbonation is rather high bu very soft. bitterness is about as high as it can get. yum yum yum!

650 ml bottle @ Haket, Göteborg, shared with four other nice guys! Pours an light amber color with a nice white head. Aroma is very inviting with tropical fruits, pineapple, resin, citrus, grapefruit and some caramel. Flavour is citrusy and hoppy, but overall well-balanced with wounderful tropical fruit flavours, citrus, grapefruit and some sweet caramel. Finish is bitter and nicely dry. Mediumbodied mouthfeel, quite smooth. Very nice beer and Im glad I had the chance to try it!

Slightly cloudy gold. Complex citrussy aroma, with hints of black pepper and toffee. Feels great in the mouth, filling and comforting like velvet. Flavour is great, with caramel, grapefruit, warming alcohol, and orange peel. Finishes drying and hoppy, but with a sweet mltyness lingering. Still looking for that "hint of vanilla" though.

Bottle...  Poured a clear amberish-orange with a huge white head.  Strong hoppy aroma with a nice caramel presence.  I big citrus fruit punch like grapefruit right up front while the floralness of the hops then took over.  The finish was nice candy-sweet malt balance.

Bottle. Simply one of the best IPAs Ive had. Robust hop profile with a wonderful balance of different and very complementary flavours. Malt is certainly present depsite a full on hop attack. But the taste doesnt numb the tongue like some IPAs, rather it massages it with a gentle but unrelenting bitterness that pleases greatly. Superb.

Bottled. Aroma has a lot of fruits (oranges, grapefruits), some caramel malts. Hazy, golden-orange coloured brew with an off-white, lasting head. The taste is bitter, slightly sweet, hoppy (loads of fruitiness there again, some pine). Slight malty touch. Wonderfull balance.

At the tasting session by Joes. A clear orange colored beer, with thick foamy white head. The aroma of a lot of hops, a little grassy and fruits like citrus. The taste of hops bitter, malts, fruits like citrus, grapes. A little alcohol. The aftertaste is bitter.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2013 Bottled. Clear golden amber color, short head. Aroma of soft fruity hops, pine, grapefruit, citrus, pineapple, some caramel malt only. Nice bitter taste, which lingers on and on. Perfectly balanced. Great stuff.

Bomber - big thanks to MrChopin for the bottle! Pours a bright orange, with a small-to-mid size fluffy head. Powerful citrus hops in the aroma - mandarin and grapefruit, with a touch of honey and an almost bubble-gum sweetness for the malt side of things. This is one smooth brew, given the bitterness of the flavor. Big resiny pine notes and a slightly stronger malt contingent. Full-bodied, but still very, very crisp. Dry, bitter finish. Really good stuff - but proves to me that Ive been jaded by palate bombs - its just not the same as a IIPA.
UPDATED: JUN 8, 2009 best. ipa. ever. so much flavor is packed into this beer while at the same time being smooth. looks orange-copper in color and smells of pine and citrus. absolutely delicious!

Pours a yellowish golden orange with a sudsy white head which thins quickly.  Aroma is grapefruit, honey, and floral hops.  Flavor is honey, grapefruit, resiny hops.  Nice and smooth at the finish, perfect bitterness.  Similar to hopslam with a touch less sweetness. Nice IPA
Bottle @ Skortila. Hazy amber colour, white lacing. Aroma is fruity, sweet hops, with orange. Flavour is pineapple, bitter hops and fruits. Bitter and dry finish. Amazing IPA.

Pours an orange gold with a medium white head.  Citrus hops straight to the nose, hints of pine, oranges, and caramel.  First few sips were wonderful, but I found it increasingly harder to drink as the glass emptied.  Overall a nice beer, but I think 12oz would be enough.

Quite good overall purchased at Bevmo San Diego the one near Fashion Valley,pretty good some orange notes,the hops are very remiscent of Sierra Nevada PA,nice full flavor, but also really drinkable which its what surprised me, great aroma : citrusy,plumish hoppy floral-like,great!!!!

Wow and wow again.  Hops strong on the nose.  Very very balanced.  The hops do not dominate the palate at all as I have come to expect and enjoy in a morbid way from west coast and mid west ipas.  In the flavor I get hops, citrus, pine but nothing doing more then anything else should with this beer.  I would have to say that this guy is my new favorite IPA.  Hats off to Alesmith.

Bottle. Poured a hazy golden color with a nice sized white head. Very hoppy aroma... grapefruit, citrus,  and pine. Flavor is very smooth, not overpowering. Sweet flavor initially gives way to a nice hoppy bitterness. I love it!

For sure, a top notch IPA. It pours golden orange with a dissapearing orange head. The aroma is balanced with sweet, spicy caramel and fresh bitter citrus and hints of tropical fruit.  Taste is very smooth and well balanced. Its almost honey like sweet followed by a fruity, spicy bitterness. Medium bodied and an relatively easy drinking summer beer.

Light amber with a nice head, good retention... Huge hops, citrus, grapefruit, this is what an ipa should smell like.... Easy drinking, good flavor, nice hoppy flavor with a touch of malt to calm it down... Dry finish, lingering hops... Wow, amazing IPA, just as good as two hearted, racer 5, and blind pig...

Bottled 650ml. Courtesy of badlizard. Great head retention. Most beautiful lacework. Deeply inviting nose, strong and reminiscent of Cascade with hints of mandarin, grapefruit, vanilla, nasturcium, pine needles, blue cheese, mustard and coconut. Extremely pleasant taste. Flawless an abundant with flavors. Undoubtably one of the best IPAs in the world. Far better than Bells Two Hearted Ale for example. Thanks a lot badlizard for this amazing beer!

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2010 22 oz thanks to Joey! Pours a clear, light amber with a one finger beige head. Moderate carbonation. God-like lacing. Big grapefruit aroma with sweet caramel, toffee, flowers, pineapple juice. Taste is very well balanced. Up front lots of pineapple juice and bubbles followed by fresh grapefruit juice, citrus hops, and some sweet caramel malt. Spicy, dry finish. Best IPA in the world? Pretty close but I might take Sierra Nevada Harvest over this one. But damn this is good.7/5/8/5/16=4.1Fresh bombers from AleSmith are quite possibly the superlative example of a rather ubiquitous and uninteresting style. This IPA reminds me of why I seek out the style in the first place. It pours with a massively rocky yellowish beige head that leaves sick lacing everywhere. Beautiful mango, pineapple, caramel in the nose. Taste is so rich in toffee, caramel, fresh West Coast hops that give this beer a thirst-quenching palate and massively smooth body that makes the entire pint disappear in about 1 minute. So beautiful. I have in my notes here: "IPA Perfection."

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2010 Fresh bomber served in a tulip. Pours an almost clear, polished copper in color with a large frothy off-white head. Aromatic spruce and pineapple hops with an underlying sweet vanilla, honeyed malt. Significant lacing. A touch of sweetness in front of a good bitter flavor that quickly bitters some more. Medium body and a smooth, creamy, and sticky texture. Earthy, warming, bittersweet finish of some length. Without question this is one of the best IPAs around.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2009 1 pint 6oz bottle from BevMo. Poured a pure copper color with a nice white head that fell very slowly, moderate carbonation. The smell is very floral, lots of citrus and hops. The taste is all citrus, a good amount of hops with a slightly bitter aftertaste but not overwhelming at all. Really good, close to perfect IPA. Just what I wanted.

Smell is of fresh hops.  Smells dry and it is.  Nice flavor of citrus and strong malts in the background.  Hops dominate here, and they are of the particularly sticky and resiny kind.  Spicy and finishes dry, and the hops keep kicking long after the beer is gone.  Great beer, and great IPA.
UPDATED: SEP 22, 2009 bottle from bevmo in la jolla.   I love IPAs, i love california beer, and maybe i was a little to pumped up for this one.  pine, grapefruit, cirusy hop notes.  will rerate.

Bottle. aroma filled with fresh hops, grass and flowers. Cloudy amber colour with medium beige head. Bittler flavour, but not overwhelming allowing the malt to express itself. Also spicy and some fresh fruits. Very well balanced. Moderate carbonation.

Thanks to WeeheavySD for this bottle.  So much bitterness and hoppy fruity goodness.  I still dont think that this is my favorite IPA (I maintain that two-hearted and masala mama are still better), its gotta be damn close.

Bottle bought at BevMo on my last trip to California. Orange/amber in colour with a reasonable head. Citrus taste and of course hop presence (hops were not too overpowering though). Very bitter, alcohol is surprisingly well hidden. Pretty good but I have had better American IPAs than this.

Golden pour with thick off-white head. Citrus hop head with a trace of malt. More citrus and well balanced malt in the taste, with a pretty bold bitter finish while still managing to be smooth. Wonderful mouthfeel on the palate, quite creamy. This is an excellent beer. On a given day it is as good as any other IPA.

Bottle 22 oz.:  Poured clear amber with a medium head that did not diminish.  Smells of citrus and resinous hops but not excessive.  Malty sweetness with citrusy grapefruit hops flavored bitterness with a dry finish.   Im torn on this one, because it was EXCELLENT, but I need to go back and try another Stone IPA, because I think this one is better, but I rated the Stone higher.  Maybe need to re-rate the Stone.  Overall impression.....tasty!

Bought this a couple months ago--top rated IPA on ratebeer--and anticipated drinking it. Aroma is strong--floral, fruity (including pineapple,)  light malt. Bright yellow orange with 1/2 inch head that holds a bit. a little thin and ordering on flattish in the mouth. an odd flavor upfront, like smoked grapefruit, and a keening edge to the overall flavor, malt cant stand up to it. noticeable warming. dry harsh finish. did i get a bad bottle?

22oz bomber thanks to Douglas88.  Pours orange with a nice creamy off white head.  Aromas of biscuity malts and some pineapple, other citrus from the hops.  Flavors very much the same, very hop forward with a nice malt backbone.  Tasty stuff, I wish it was available here.  Thanks again Douglas.

This does actually deserve its place as the top IPA in the world. It has the traditional American IPA profile done right, or, not just right, perfect! Extremely piney with a complex hop character, a good dose of caramell to back it up and a perfect, bitter finish. Drinkability is also just about right, fantastic.

After four years living in san diego while in the navy, im really pissed at myself for not knowing about this beer. had to order it from another dist. because Alesmith doesnt dist to CT. but its unbelievable, what else can i say that everyone else hasnt, for a fan of IPA, this is the zenith. well worth the trouble of ordering.

Most people will say that the best thing about living in San Diego (aka "Americas Finest City") is the weather.  While thats true, I also like to point to the fact that both Alesmith and Ballast Point breweries are on my drive between home and work.  That means its very easy to get growler-fuls of this amazing beverage which is truly one of the best things about living in this city.  Pours from growler a murky amber-orange with one finger of lingering white head.  The aroma is great -- fresh hops with notes of pine and citrus at just the right level, not overpowering.  From the nose the fresh citrus carries right across, mainly grapefruit with some orange.  The small amount of sweetness makes this a very well balanced IPA.  Goes down fresh and smooth with some lingering bitterness.  I could drink this all day, and with most of that growler let I think I might.

golden orange color with normal head.
nice hoppy aroma citrus pine pineapple maybe. taste is citrusy all the usual ipa flavors overall nice ipa little pricey against other comparable ipas

Bottle Pretty fresh from the brewery. Pours a deep gold with an orange glow. Beautiful thick cream white head and some quick moving smaller bubbles. Nose is full of fresh hops. Floral, sweet citrus, and a lite pine. The nose made my mouth salivate a bit. Flavors have a nice intense pine resin with some orange flavor. Nice sweet malt background. Hints of vanilla and fruit too. Mouth is on the upper side of medium a little warm. Excellent IPA, one of the best for sure! Super clean, crisp, refreshing, and smooth.

Beautiful beer, clear deep golden amber with white head and excellent lacing.  The aroma great, sweet malt, citrus, grapefruit rind, pine, dank hops, maybe some mango.  Flavor is quite nice, hops and malt are very balanced.  Theres a flavor story going on: first hop bitterness and piney grapefruit, followed by some malt sweetness, and finishing with bitter hop after taste.  Despite the bitterness, theres no harshness.  Mouthfeel is creamy, great, very nice carbonation level.  Overall, a great IPA, though sometimes it seems like its technically perfect, but less inspired than some other beers.

Bottle picked up at City Beer Store in San Fran. Pretty amber pour with a large and vibrant white head. Vivid orange and grapefruit nose with perhaps a hint of other fruits as well. Nice orange and malt biscuit flavor, extremely well-balanced and very tasty.

Bottle from South Bay. Pours dark golden with orange tint and bubbly white thin head. Reminds me of cask pour. Sweet citrusy nose with smooth resin and tropical fruits. Really tasty. Slick mouthfeel; not sticky at all. Easy to drink. I want more.

Bottle. Aroma of citrus oils, floral hops, some herbal spicy hops, lightly sweet malt, quite complex and interesting on the hop front. Flavor continues with the citrus oiliness, very resinous at first, transforming to juiciness at the end, with building bitterness at the finish. Incredibly smooth, the mouthfeel really puts to shame the endless amount of IPAs out there that boast varying levels of astringency and/or excessive sweetness. Really nice.

Bottle.  Pours a clear light orange with a thick foamy white head.  Aroma of tons of citrus, some lime, grapefruit, tropical fruit, and caramel malt.  Heavenly.  Flavor is nice and citrusy, sweet at first with a tinge of bitter hops in the finish.  Quite tasty!
9/4/8/4/15 (4.0/5)

Bottle shared with MatSciGuy
Pours a deep amber color, clear but some floaties from the residue on the bottom (no problem for me). Lasting whitish head with decent staying power. Aroma all hops, piney, resinousy, mild citrusand a touch of floral. Taste is a good balance of malt sweetness, great flavor from the hops that is a nice bitterness - not bracing but smooth.
Pours orange amber, floral, orange, malty, spicey, caramel, piney, little earthy, slighty yeasty.

[Bottle] brought back from S.F. Pours a nice orangey amber with a finger of sticky beige head. Aroma is grapefruity with some pine resin, and a touch of florals. Flavor is pulpy orange, some sweet malt backbone creates a rich mouthfeel, some spiciness, and a little bit of yeast character.

Thanks to my bro for hooking this one up!  Pours a rich coppery color with medium offwhite head with nice traces of lacing.  Aroma is of over ripe and slight acrid fruit.  Some tropical fruit and citrus come through.  Taste is citrus, earth, lemon and mild malt.  Full bodied and astringent, this beer is a let down.

tThanks to alexsdad06 for this!  Pours a copper color with a medium frothy white head which leaves lots of bubbly lacing.  Aroma is grapefruit, pine, and some floral characteristics.  Taste is some nice citrus hops, grapefruit........but there is a weird bitterness and some astringency.  Its just not too smooth.  Solid overall.

22oz bottle.  Semi-opaque copper pour with a big white head.  Aroma of floral and citrus hops with a malt balance that almost has a hint of creaminess.  Citrus hop flavor with a sweet malt balance and the bitterness lingers on your tongue.  Very well done.

Bottle from FlacoAlto, thanks! Orange blonde color. Grapefruit and melon in the slightly perfumed oily hoppy aroma. Very firm oily grassy hopbitter flavor with grapefruit and pineapple, lingering on in the long aftertaste. Some plastic in the finish. Well balanced ale.

Poured from a 22oz bomber and served in a shaker.  This IPA poured a slightly hazy amber with a creamy head of beige foam that left some decent lacing around the glass.  The aroma consisted of fresh tropical fruit, tangerines, peaches, and an underlying note of caramel.  The flavor was vibrant and full of fresh tropical fruits.  Grapefruit, tangerines, peaches, and some light mango.  Also a touch of light caramel/toffee.  The mouthfeel was medium-bodied and had a slight oiliness.  Lightly carbonated.  One of the most flavorful IPAs I have ever tasted.  Excellent!

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2010 Bottle. Thanks to Marsiblursi. Golden colour with a white head. Grape, pine, black currant, vanilla, tropical fruits, malty background, very hoppy but balanced. Dry finish. Very nice!

Bottle.  Alright, so this better be pretty damn good at $10 per bomber.  Lots of anticipation.  Aromas are sure aggressive and hitting me with sweet citrus as Im looking at the color from about three feet away.  Kind of a hazy orange/amber with a pretty decent head.  On closer inspection, aromas are thick with tangerine and pineapple with a little bit of floral hops as well.  A bit of a caramel malt presence is also detectable in the nose.  From smell, my fear is that this will be awfully sweet and thick.  NOPE.  Its dang good... a lovely mix of caramel malt and hops that balance it out nicely.  Too bad they dont make affordable beer out there at Alesmith (or too bad that my damn distributors are raking us all so nicely over here.)  This would be pretty hard to improve on.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Its funny because while outside of the fantastic citrus/fruit/sweet/resiny/piney nose and really all you could ask for appearance, there is nothing very distinguishing about this IPA, its just a solid drink.  Very tasty and drinkable, and I wish I could get more easily.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2016   Bottle that came courtesy of Reluctant Scooper and Beer Merchants following a competition I entered, consumed 10-02-09 Many thanks to Simon (Haddonsman) and Phil L  Pours warm gold with a white head. The aroma is sweet with honey and then the hops start to show, also a little yeast. Im not sure what the hops are but they taste of pine and also have a good citric bite. Really nice sweetness come flooding through, but those hops are also streaking around the mouth. This is a lovely beer, wonderful see -sawing of hoppiness and sweetness.   A7 A4 F8 P4 OV16  3.9  Had this again in   Bottle from Beer Gonzo shop, consumed at home Friday 19th August 2016 whilst cooking Chicken with Coriander Chutney Curry and Lol making a Dal.   Wonderfully soft and creamy mouthfeel, yolky to light amber with a haze and a white head. Wow this is a great beer, the bitterness hangs forever and a day, resin surges through but the tropical flavours win out, loving this. A7 A4 T9 P5 Ov17 4.2

Bottle pours a clear vibrant orange color with a quickly dissipating off white head. Strong aromas of hop, grass, and citrus. Taste is slightly sweet with hints of citrus mostly orange & grapefruit with a  tasteful bitter hoppy finish. A great IPA.

Bottle thanks to MrChopin, cheers Kevin!!  Aroma has notes of sweet citrus fruits, with caramel malts, and a littel catnip.  Very nice.  Light to medium clear amber hue with a large off-white head that mostly lasted and left some lace.  Flavor is sweet and fruity then turns moderately bitter.  Palate is medium bodied and watery soft.  Very drinkable IPA thats soft and fruity with a well balanced malt sweetness and hop bitterness.  So happy I finally got to try this.  Did not disappoint.

fruit fruit fruit! nose is an attack of sweet and savory fruits. not just lemon -- but everything in between. appearance is hazy orange. flavor is huge esthers and plenty of hops. bitterness is on point but not overwhelming -- nor should it be. palate is perfectly wet. far from sloppy but the flavor pleasantly lingers. overall not as good as two hearted, but better then stone IPA.

A- Off-white, creamy head with a hazy orange hue. Great retention and lacing throughout.

S- Nose is mostly of big citrus aromas (orange, grapefruit, lemon); subtle maltiness.

T- Wow! Sweet hoppiness up front followed by subtle caramel maltiness; the finish is long and citrusy, but not overly bitter; very nice balance, this taste is as close to a prototypical IPA as you can get.

M- Smooth and refreshing, light to medium body, light carbonation, creamy texture

D- Impressive drinkability characterized by smooth, citrusy taste and pleasingly bitter finish.

I was turned onto craft beer by the Stone line of ales while living in Arizona, but I think that Alesmith IPA has quickly become one of my personal favorites and my top-ranked IPA.

bomber from south bay drugs poured into a pint glass. pours a very pure, clear golden color with hints of amber and a bright white, bubbly head and great lacing. aroma was probably the single best IPA aroma ive come across. huge floral hops come bursting from the glass with scents of tulips and roses backed by grapefruit, apricot, big pine, and hints of spice and slight sweetness. flavor was a near perfect balance of big, citrusy hops and a great, slighlty sweet malty background. flavors of pine, fresh flowers, sweet peach, and some vanilla evolve as the beer opens up. palate was velvety smooth, medium bodied, and slightly chewy. this beer seemed to jump all over my tougue and was simply delicious. nearly a perfect IPA in my opinion, and the best ive tasted.

Bottle, from nbutler11. Pours golden orange with a thick and lasting beige head. Nice fruity sweet and piny hop aroma. The flavor is well balanced, with nice piny and floral notes, followed by a long bitter hop finish. Very good, though there are plenty of IPAs Id choose over this, Green Flash West Coast, Nugget Nectar, and Port Wipeout just to name a few. Still, very good and very drinkable. Definitely worthy of its high rating.
Bottle. Poured a dark and clear amber. Strong and delicious hop nose, followed by a well hopped and crisp beer. Has a little spice kick to with a good bitter finish.
Golden color with a thick head and floral hop aromas.  Floral hop flavors with fruity overtones.  Crisp and refreshing perfectly hopped.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2012 Re-rate 5/6/12: Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks kerenmk.  Clear deep golden. Pleasant hoppy aroma of tropical fruits and some flowers. Dry-ish flavor with a bit of malt, light sweetness, fruity hops and a pleasant bitter finish. Medium-bodied. A good IPA. 8/3/7/3/14=3.5

(11/11/08) Bottle at friends house in Philadelphia. Slightly hazy amber color with a big stable off-white head. Hoppy aroma with pine, resin, floral notes, grapefruit, some caramel and light cookie notes. Bitter hoppy flavor with grapefruit, some piney notes and some balancing malty, caramelly, sweetness. Medium-bodied and a nice smooth mouthfeel. A very good IPA. 7/4/7/4/15=3.7

bottle 75 cl. average creamy white head that mostly lasted. Cloudy golden color. Smooth chewy hoppy and malty notes. Apricot, caramel, grapefruit, floral. Full bodied with an average carbonation, dry texture. Moderated bitter and sweet flavor. Lingering bitter dry finish.
Slightly hazy golden with a big and lasting off-white head, leaving lace. Intense aroma of grapefruit, roses and a hint of grass. Dry with some grapefruit hop flavour and very aggressive bitterness.

22oz. bomber from the Dilly Deli in Cincinnati. I have had many steller IPAs and to put this one on top is not even close. There are so many great offerings out there that impress me and this one was just average. Maybe if I had a fresh one I would change my mind but it just didnt stack up. Nice floral nose but hops were subdued. This did have a nice sweetness with a smoothness to it that made it easy to drink but I have had better and rate this no more than average...

Bomber, from BevMo for $4.99.  Given my affection for IPAs, I was fittingly excited to get to try this one.  Pours orange and gold with a large white head.  Is it just me or do many of Alesmiths Pale Ales pour with similarly large head?  Palate was smooth, with light carbonation that showcases the hoppy character of this beer.  Flavor features grapefruit, resin, lemon, and tangerine.  Finish is deliciously long, bitter, and spicy.  There are a lot of good West Coast IPAs, but this one is certainly at or near the very top.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2010 The highest rated IPA in the galaxy - oh, my, I almost didnt dare open it! Well, off the cap went anyway revealing a... quite pale yellowish colour. It isnt for its glamourous looks it has got its reputation, I gathered. The aroma is however grand: full of citric hops and wet grass. The flavour is likewise nearly perfect with notes of pine and grape on a caramel oily background. The best of the best? I dont know, but its definately in the neighbourhood.

22oz. Bottle:  Aroma of hops, citrus, grapefruit, hop oil, slight dish soap, and lots of pine.  Poured amber/gold in color with a medium-sized, dense, off-white head that lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Full of tiny and small particles throughout.  Very good to excellent lacing.  Flavor is medium bitter and lightly sweet.  Tastes of hops, citrus, grapefruit, pine, slight bubblegum, slight dish soap, pale malts, resin, and some toasting.  Medium body.  Sticky texture.  Average carbonation.  Bitter, hoppy, slightly soapy, grapefruit and pine finish is lightly dry.

Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with a good creamy head and lacings. Mega fruity hoppy nose. Very nice with various combinations. Fruity and hoppy taste. Grapefruit and citrus. Very crisp and funky. Dry bitter lasting end. Nice

Uklar lys ravfarvet med et flot hvidt skum. Dufter af grapefrugt, citrus, sæbe, græs og noget ananas. Smager af lakrids, græs, citrus, peber og lidt gær. God lang eftersmag, vel humlet. En øl tæt på min personlighed. Lækker, spænstig og dejlig........

Flaske: Fantastisk duft af citrus. Ren og klar. Flot øl er det også. Smagen er super afbalanceret og jeg ville ønske jeg kunne smage denne øl helt frisk, så ville den virkelig ringe. Men stadig hypet øl hvor det er fuldt fortjent den er hypet.
Bottle: new year tasting in el flor with ramenen, one of the ipas i have tried, too bad it is not available in el Salvador. good way to start 2009.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2009 Bomber. Purs a nice golden color. Aroma is floral and fruity with lots of citrus and grape notes. Taste is fruity with some grape,pine,hops and som e apricot notes. Caramellmalt can be found, Nice and creamy mouthfeel. Great beer!

A very fine ipa. Colour is amber and the aroma is full of hops, citrus, pine and some sweet caramel notes. The flavour is quite balanced with the citrusy and piney hop flavours balanced by the caramel and alcohol.
Well done and smooth, but not really an eye opener.

Bottle. Light hazy golden colour with a long lasting white creamy head. Citric aroma with notes of mango and spicy hops. Very citric and fresh fruity flavour notes and mango, apricot and grape fruit is noticable. Long fruity and citric finish. Creamy highly carbonated body. Great IPA.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2009 Bottle shared with Plovmand. Golden body with a medium white head. Aroma is fruit, citrus (grape) and lots of hops. Taste is also fruit, citrus (again grape) and hops. The aftertaste is very bitter, i love it.
22oz bottle. Dark gold pour with a nice stiff white head. Nice piney aroma, very nice. Nice hop bite, very smooth and flavorful. Very good IPA.
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text:
UPDATED: JUL 3, 2009 Purchased at Whole Foods Market Pasadena, CA -Hastingsd.

Appearance: Dark, goldish yellow. Moderate amount of rising bubbles. A large off white, fluffy head sits atop.

Aroma: Orange juice, grapefruit juice, citrus rind, pineapple.

Taste: A mouthful of bitterness and citrus flavors mentioned in the aroma. After the bitterness gets acquainted with my palate, I then taste a good amount of crystal malts, that lends a bit of spicy sweetness to the large amount of hoppage.

Mouthfeel: A tad astringent, a little bit tongue curling. Then I notice the trademark smooth softness of Alesmith in the finish.

Overall: Much better than when I first had it. I was told the trick is to get it fresh. I can see how that can be true, as the killer bouquet of citrus aromas takes the beer to a whole nother level. In my little weird world, I would like to make this Summer Yulesmiths little brother.

Bottle. High creamy and lasting white head. Hazy orange body with a good deal of bubbles. Oranges lemon hops aroma in a very well balanced mixture. A bit of nuts and some spicy notes are added.l Flavor is very fruity and far from being as bitter as feared although the hops is quite distinct. Alcohol percentage is not noticed, or in other words seams just right. Nice dryness with low carbonation and a good and long aftertaste.

EXCELLENT IPA, perhaps the best normal (non-imperial) IPA I have ever had. Perfectly balanced West Coast hops and sweel caramel malt. Appearance is golden and slightly translucent, mouthfeel is satisfying. Could not ask for much more out of this one.

Pours orange copper with pillowy white head.  Beautiful citrus bouquet, with a slight pale malt presence and some wonderful earthy-herbal notes.  Flavor contains tons of citrus, initially tempered with caramel and cherry notes, followed by herbal tea, and finishing bitter and oily like orange peel.  Great dry finish.  If this isnt the best ipa in the world, its definitely up there.

22 oz. bottle, picked up at the brewery today.  Very clear golden bronze, lots of bubbles and a frothy white head that sticks around.  Amazing fresh hop aroma with some citrus.  Bitterness is a little less than I expected, which is not a bad thing.  Definitely some pine, and citrus.  Mild malt sweetness.  A nice balanced finish of dry bitterness.  Overall this is amazing.  Almost perfect, but a little light on the palate.

Bottle at Lundbeck Christmas party. Clear golden/amber - white head. High hoppy, citrus, grape, peppery, pine needles, pineapple, sweetness, resin, light caramel, nice smooth, smooth malty. Light bitter aftertaste. Lovely.

pours a lovely cloudy burnt orange with a decent frothy head with slight lacing. The nose of grapefruit, orange rind, pure citrus, and hops is quite delectable. Well on first taste all you can really say is balanced. Extremely balanced fruit, hop, alcohol. Same fruits as in the nose. Very attractive hops not to tannic yet not to subtle. Type of IPA you can just sit around and drink, and drink, and drink, and drink, and finally pass out. MMM Delicious.

Pure amber with a few bubbles and big white head.  Big fruity flavours, and a tinge of hops. The fruit is hard to place but I would  tend to go with a banana and passionfruit mix with something a bit more citric a great smell.  Enormous hops hit that mellows out perfectly to a yeasty dryness. Quite oily in the mouth which adds to its smooth qualities.  Fantastically refreshing, with quite complex flavours really great with a little heady booze to it.

This beer starts off with a fantastic aroma, with fresh citrusy fruit smells with a strong backdrop of piney hops.  The head is strong and leaves very good lacing.  Solid gold color, with a very white head.  The flavor of hops is very strong, but even though it has strong bitter characteristics there is a hint of honey at the end which smooths out the overall taste profile.  It is very complex and enjoyable.

Crushed with Jakebra.  Woo!  Two Hearted will always be my favorite, however this biotch is moving in next door.  Intense hops, kinda musty on the nose, too.  Lots of bittering hops in flavor, but mellows into a smooth, kinda honey flavor in the finish.  Complex, robust, excellent, and fun to drink.

On tap at The Local in San Diego. Clear bronze, dense cream head generating thick lace. Very fresh aroma of tangerines and lychee. Medium sweet malt supports a much more resinous hop profile than the aroma hints at-- all citrus oil and pine. Finish is very bitter and long. Delicious.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Pours bright amber into a tulip.  Beautiful head top-hats rim.  Resin and pine aromas.  Dry, crisp grapefruit and malt.
Great floral and citrus hops with great balance with sweet malts. Some red ale type malts in there giving a hint of chocolate. Lots of floral hops in the finish.

aroma is full of citrus primarily orange and grapefruit.  very hazy golden color.  substantial malt backbone with nice bitterness.  slightly puckering aftertatse that leads to slight dry finish.  faint plastic taste is the only fault I can find.

The Brewers at Alesmith are too humble...stating that IPA stands for "Its Pretty Awesome".  I would call it an IVA for "Its Very Awesome"  For my taste, this is as perfectly balanced between the smooth malty flavor and hoppy bitterness as any IPA.  Very mild undertones can have you imagining all kinds of flavors.  This complex yet tasty beer works great with complex and tasty Thai dishes.  In my opinion, it is the best value at $8.00 a bottle for this quality.

From a big bottle, this poured a cloudy copper-orange color with an fat slightly off-white head a rich lacing rings.  Nose is of citrus and pine hops.  Caramel malts in good balance.  Very rich and clean mouthfeel.  Flavor is not complex,. but is delightful in a perfect balance of malts and hops that makes this very easy to drink.   
Long bitter finish. Right up there at top of the very best IPAs.

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2009 Thanks to soonah for the bottle!<b /r>A little gush upon opening. Opaque tangerine with a large, foamy white head, long-lasting. Nose is very salty and sour, with grapefruit, mangoes, and kiwi. Citric bitterness is present, but not like the flavor where it dominates all else but the caramel. Foamy, over-carbonated mouth. Nose is great, flavor a bit less so, but overall, this is solid stuff.

Poured from a bomber courtesy of BOLTZ7255 -- Thanks again Jason! I’ve wanted to try this for a long time.  I’ve had this bottle in the cellar for about three months now, probably should have cracked it sooner because the hop punch has faded a bit. Caramel malt presence dominates now, but the hops are still there -- citrus, floral aroma/taste with raisins on the finish. Very nice mouthfeel -- smooth but slightly more carbonated than say a Two Hearted. Great head retention.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2012 Bottle.

Strong caramel malty IPA in the classic SoCal vein. Cascade-style hops in abundance, lots of caramel malt. All the same flaws as Yulesmith. A reasonably good beer, but I simply dont understand the hype. #1 IPA? Youve got to be kidding me. 10/26/2008

Rerate 9/16/2012. Ive had a few bottle since the original rating, but given that it was not until recently distributed in Washington State, this may be the first time Ive had a really fresh bottle. Im impressed this time around; its really nice. Malts in the back seat, big piney aroma and citrus flavors, a c-hopped IPA in the Sculpin/BigEye vein (or vice versa) with an almost belgian richness in the subtler non-hop flavor components and that vanilla that is mentioned in the commercial description. I didnt give this one enough respect the first few times around. This time Id go more like 8/4/8/4/16. Ill lean heavily in this direction.

WOW.  Poured a nice hazy yellow orange with chunks.  Nose was very very sweet floral amazing.  Flavors nice sweet unique hop taste.  Bitter at first but then resides to sweet quickly.  Nice medium malt character.  This is the best single IPA ive ever had next to two hearted.  This had so much vibrancy.

Bomber from Hi-Times. Hazy golden/amber pour with a persistent white head. Beautiful heavy aroma of hops and grapefruit with a touch of spice. Nice flavor combo of fruit, hops and malt with a perfect amount of bitter grapefruit in the finish. Alchohol is masked by the hop charge. Fairly full mouthfeel.

From the moment you open the bottle you know this one is special.  Cascade hop aroma dominates everything, however the malt keeps pace and is an excellent paring.  The abv is perfect for this level of bitterness.  An amazing IPA, it could easily pass as a double IPA.  Great color, lacing, amazing mouthfeel.  The aroma and flavor are almost all you can ask for.  The hops shine with everything else strong enough to support with out overpowering.  Its tough to be sure this is the best IPA in the world, but its easy to call it top 5.

Lots of sediment floating around in the glass, but thats probably my fault for not pouring it very well.  Orange red pour with thick fluffy white head.  After a few minutes the yeast all settled on the bottom of the glass and the beer settled into a weird motionless suspended animation.  Very fruity aroma with lots of grapefruit, peach and citrus.  Some herbal notes, maybe celery.  Bitter piny hops with hints of citrus.  Very fruity.  This could be a double IPA.  Bitter hops do overpower a bit.  I was actually a bit underwhelmed by this beer, but I think thats just because my expectations were so high.  Still one of the best IPAs out there.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2009 From Hi-Time Wine Cellars.  Pours a clear copper-orange color with a thick long-lasting head.  Lots of lacing ends up on the glass.  The aroma is wonderful, loads of hops, with some notes of citrus and malt as well.  This is a great beer and what an IPA should taste like. Big bitter piney hoppy flavor with grapefruit and some lemon too.  Real solid sweet malt backing which I get as soon as my palate adjusts to the blast of hops.  Too bad I have to order this to get it.  Ive got it rated even higher than Stone IPA.  Re-rate 4/27/09.  Ordered a couple more bottles.  Not much more to add really other than this is simply fantastic.  Wonderful hop combination with big puckery grapefruit and bitter pine with some tropical fruit in there too.  Perhaps the best IPA out there.

22 oz bottle from JimboWood, thanks Jimbo! Pours a murky dark orange with a huge, fluffy, white, rocky head. Aroma is piney, citrusy and floral, with a bit of honey and spice. Flavor has a great hop bite balanced with the nice sweet malt. The hops in this brew are incredibly flavorful. It has the same bitter bite as two-hearted, but so much more flavor. It’s comparable, and maybe better. Another IPA that I wish I could get all the time, but sadly, can’t.

Thanks Hellbilly.Thick white rocky foamy head, murky orange. Smells extremely hoppy, orange zest, spices and I can almost smell the bitterness. The coloration after completely settling is a little on the brown side for an ipa and is almost a light ice tea like color. Tastes very bitter, orange, and really hoppy. The bitterness created by the hops masks the alcohol and lingers for quite some time.

Bottle.  Poured a hazy gold/orange with a three finger whitish head.  Aroma of citrus hops, with pine notes as well.  Flavor had a well balanced malt taste, supported by citrus and a pine finish.  Medium/full body with good carbonation.

a great ipa...peter really did a great job 
Much better than most regular production ipas...I think i only like the blind pig better.....

Pours a hazu orange color from the bottle with loads of carbonation and an obnoxious off-white head of creamy foam.  Smells mildly of hops which build in the flavor along with notes of citrus and salt. Awfully bitter on the finish, but highly drinkable in the AleSmith tradition.

Pours a clear dark orange, close to transparent, with a thick frothy head. 
Very pungent aroma, a nice balance of piney hops, sweet orange juice, and grass. 
Full well balanced hop flavor, citrus (orange and lemon), piny, grassy, with a soft bitterness in the finish. 
Palate is full, crisp, and smooth. A very well crafted IPA.

Pours clear golden cobber with a nice big white creamy head. Very nice aroma of fruity hops, caramel and honey. The flavour is fruity to begin with, then the hops strikes and together with the great creamy palate it fills op your mouth - claims your tastebuds - and gives a fantastic aftertaste. A very very nice and refreshing beer.

Bottle. [thank you after4ever] Pours a pretty golden with a slight orange teint to it. A stunning creamy off-white head. Nice duration and fine lacing. Aroma is wonderful, lots of oranges, pine, ginger, honey, strawberries, light doughy malts, grapefruit. Lots of hoppiness in general.
