Impressive creamy mouthfeel - especially considering how the beer looks so light. Flavour is impeccably crisp, good biscuity maltiness, light viniousness and a great balance of bitterness and hops flavours. Strawberries, pine, grapefruit. LIghtly burning in a long, lingering, bitter finish. Wonderful IPA.

22 oz bottle split into two glasses.  Deep orange color with a rocky off white head.  Great citrus aroma.  mostly orange and grapefruit.  Hop bitterness matches the aroma.  There is also a perfume like hop taste.  Slightly sweet malt backbone with some honey.  Nice west coast IPA.  Not totally what I was expecting.  Not a hop bomb like most IPA tend to be these days.

Bomber. Poured a hazy orange gold in color with a thick sticky beige head that left great lacing on the glass. Aroma of pine, citrus, sweet caramel malt.  Aroma is absolutely awesome. Flavors of piney and citrus hops, grapefruit, light tropical fruits, sweet caramel malt backbone that is very well balanced.  I can easily see how this is the #1 IPA. Really incredible.

Lovely hop aroma.  Exactly how I would imagine an IPA to smell like.  Hops of citrus, pine, and floral notes balanced beautifully with yeast and malts.  Other notes include vanilla and also caramel (anyone else get that??).  Appearance is perfect orange gold with a off white head that stays.  Flavor is great, starts with the hops of citrus and pine flavors, then you get some malty and yeasty balancing.  Mouthfeel is smooth and warm.  Finishes dry and bitter.  When drank with the head, gives it a nice creamy body.  Yes, this is a freaking awesome beer.  I will drink this all day and night and you should too.

From bottle. $8.  August Dayton Beer Tasting event - Favorite Summer Brews - Bonus Beer.
Viscous orange pour with long lasting head.  Strong pine aromas with citrus.  Intense flavors meld together to create a seemless IPA.  Such a solid brew - not for everyday drinking but a classic IPA.

bottle thanks to mashmaster.  dark gold amber pour with a thick cream head.  smooth citrus hop scent along with floral notes in the background.  wow, not overly hoppy and not bitter at all.  I heard this was a good IPA but this is freakin awesome.  easy on the palate and nice on the way down.

Poured from 75cl bottle at Alesmith dinner.  Phenomenal IPA plain and simple.  Not overly hopped where it covers evertyhing else.  Amazing balance between citrus, piney bitterness and just enough malt.  Best IPA I’ve tried so far and I’m not even a huge IPA fan.

Bottle.  Strong citrus hop aroma with malt.  Flavor is the same...hoppy with a big malt backbone. But not overly malty like some IIPAs....just enough to balance.  Citrus hops throughout.  A wonderful IPA.

Aroma is hoppy with fresh pine and orange citrus. Pours amber orange with rocky off-white head. Flavor begins with nice citrus/pine and finishes with a nice dry hoppy throat.  There is a nice balance between the hops and the malt (for an IPA). Nice finish of toasty and carmel malt. A very good American IPA.
On tap at the brewery for RBSG 08. Pours a clear gold with a nice, white head. Big aroma of citrus and pine hops. Crisp, clear taste with a lot of hops. Lingering hoppy bitterness. Really great IPA.

22 oz bottle.  Bright quarter inch head reduces to dense impenetrable blanket.  Smells hoppy/piney.Any movement stains the side of the glass with gooey foam.  Sharp and bitter, then fruity and sweet, then bitter again.  Way bitter afterburn.  Stronger than some doubles.  Nice.

pours a nice deep golden hugh.  very floral scent.  some citrus and fruit as well.  taste is of lots of hops and a little citrus.  very similar to the bells hopslam.  very impressive beer.  I would purchase this again for sure.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2008 Thanks to Kegbear for this brew.  Pour is a very clean and clear medium golden with a fluffy off white head.  Aroma is amazing with tons of fresh hops, light fruit, malt, pine, and much more.  Flavors are all well blended together perfectly balanced.  Flavors include mellow but dominant biterness, peach, light pine, and sweet delicious malt.  Damn good brew, damn good.

2007 Bottle - Pours dk orange with jagged and yeasty off white head,  aroma is all citrus and light malt, slight pine, flavour is what most expect from an IPA, huge bitter hops, huge malts, lingers on the back end, best IPA i’ve tasted so far...

This beer pours a very light copper, with about an inch of the prettiest off white head you will ever see. This is by far the clearest IPA you will find and tastes as clean.The aroma is very floral, like fresh cut flowers with just enough of citrus to balance perfectly. The upfront is so smooth, it leaves you wanting more. The flavor changes at least 4 times, as it starts from the front of your tounge to the back of your throat. Take the time to drink this beer at different temps, as it wil show the complexity of the different available flavors that this beer represents. I hope this beer does not ruin all other IPA varietties for you.
Pours a dark orange color, with nice head.  Massive amount of flavor, along with the taste of malt. One of my favorite IPA’s.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2009 A Delicious, top notch beer. For a regular IPA, it is in a small class with Two Hearted and a few others. Pours a deep dark orange. Creamy and bitter at the same time. Lots of flavors dancing around in this one, strong flowers and pine, but also a real malty character. Hints of vanilla and dark fruit in the background. Slightly boozy, but nothing that detracted from the flavor. Awesome!!

Tried thanks to Jason! Pours an orangey light brown with a lovely fluffy white head. Tangelo oranges on the nose, it has an amazing soft palate with a full body. Huge overstated flavours which are also balanced at the same time, it has hints of vanilla and oak with an extremely orangey finish almost like a Fullers 1845 on steroids. This beer is what Id imagined an IPA in the 18th and 19th centuries would taste like.obviously more refined and not subject to a sea voyagebut an absolutely amazing beer!

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2009 22oz bottle. Pours a clear gold/amber with a frothy, creamy head that stays with you for the entire journey. Fantastic aroma of citrus and bready malts. Flavor of complex hops with notes of pine, citrus and a slight malt background. Crisp and refreshing mouthfeel. Not to thick, not too thin. Bitter hops at the finish. One of the best IPAs money can buy. Essential.

From tap at the brewery. Pours clear and golden orange with a lacing white head. Dense grapefruity and slight peachy aroma. Peachy and towards dense fruity hops flavour. Medium sweet to dry and quite bitterhops. Fruity and mild acidic to citric hops finish. Smooth and solid hoppy.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2008 Finally I rate the number one IPA in the world. A very potent IPA that has a HUGE body due to the strong malty backbone the hops are checked by. Lots of citrus flavors, orangey and limes are everywhere. It finishes piney and a bit hop-oily, but is nice because the flavor profile changes with the swallow so the flavor is constantly changing and exerting itself. It’s like when you start eating ice cream, and then your mouth goes numb because of the cold and you can no longer taste the ice cream because of both the cold and the fact that you have been eating the same flavor the entire time--it just tastes like you’re eating creame; well this beer’s flavor actually changes halfway through the in-mouth experience so it is continually bombarding the palate with new flavors that excite and invigorate the tongue. It is really quite different and deserved of its #1 rating, but I’ll have to only give it a 4.2 because it is only sold in $6 bombers. Who sells single-ipa in only bombers?, that seems ridiculous that I can’t pick up a six pack of this stuff. Worth the wait for sure though.

Bottled sample via (and shared with) oakbluff. Hazy orange in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas of pine cone, tangerine, and black pepper. Citrus flavors are upfront in the mouth, before the pine, floral, and grassy notes take over. The citrus re-emerges on the finish too, which was kinda cool. Great lasting bitterness. Malts are definitely playing second fiddle here, but are present enough to keep things in check. A fantastic IPA.

Bottle.  This is impressive.  Only the second Alesmith I’ve had but they are on the way of becoming one of my favorite brewers.  Deep slightly hazy amber with a fabulous off white head and great lacing.  Aroma is huge with earthy, citrus, and some slightly floral hops.  Malt balances well and there is some interesting flavor I can’t identify but it fits in nicely.  Smooth with a mild lingering bitterness.  I rated this compared to other IPA’s but this is easily better than some Double IPA’s.

A few months old and still very very good.  The hops still noticible for a bottle that was purchased back in Feb.  This gem kind of got lost in my cellar and today I realized I got some IPAs that are getting old.  This brew pours cloudy golden with a huge head.  Aroma is hops and more hops.  Seems to be some cascade/centinnial in there but not too sure but definitely get the pine and citrus.  Smooth and thick on the palate with light carbonation.  Like the description it does feel warm in the mouth.  Flavor is a hop bomb of citrus and pine followed by a sweet finish.  What a good brew I’ll be getting this fresh to drink up in the future.

Amazing, I wish i could describe this in just that singular word. The best part about this IPA is the hop flavor and lack of astringent bitterness. The aroma is an overwhelming combination of hops. Flavor is very malty sweet with a wonderful hop flavor and mild bitterness.  Loved this and wish I had much, much more
Bottle brought to Poland for me by cousin. I’m gonna write desciption with next bottle, as I came to San Diego by myself now :)

This is my favorite beer in the world.  I’m from Florida and I order this beer by mail.  It’s very expensive because of the shipping costs but it’s worth it to me.  This is the creamiest thickest IPA I have ever tasted.  The balance between the pale malt and the formidable hops is perfect.  Thick and rich this is almost a double IPA but I like it just the way it is.  I love this beer and it has a certain San Diego hop load that is very similar to Racer 5 by Bear Republic.  I’m guessing that Cascade and Centennial hops are used in this fantastic concoction.  The head is a supremely jagged cloud like affair and is very sticky leaving plenty of lace on my pint glass.  The color is a little darker than most IPAs and I like that.  If you have never had this IPA, I suggest you do whatever it takes to get it, like I do.  Well worth the extra expense and a real treat.

22 oz. bottle.. phenomenal extra from BrianK. My review from cvillebeergeek.blogspot.com... 

A massive thanks to trading partner Brian of West Orange, New Jersey who apparently felt that the really good extras he included with the main part of our trade weren’t enough, so he sent a second box with this gem a week later. Also, this just happens to be my 600th beer rating. 

Appearance: Beautiful reddish-orange color with a medium sized head. The head does disappear rather quickly, leaving little specks of lacing. The head does stick around as a thin film on the top of the beer that creeps just slightly up the sides of the glass. Slight haze and vigorous carbonation. 3.75/5.0. 

Aroma: Very appropriate IPA aroma... floral, citrus and pine hop notes with a sweet background. Not terribly complex, but very pleasant. 4.0/5.0

Taste: Nicely complex taste. It hits me as sweet, bitter, sweet bitter with the sweetness having a honey-like quality juxtaposed with a strong citrus hop bitterness. I am reminded of lemonheads candy. Maybe the slightest vegetal note. Very nice. 4.0/5.0

Mouthfeel: The carbonation gives this a lively feel. Bitterness and sweetness balance fairly well. The beer has a slightly viscous feel and the alcohol is absolutely hidden. 4.5/5.0

Drinkability: Bitter, sour, sweet, but absolutely smooth and approachable. It’s not perfectly balanced, but every aspect of this beer stays relatively in check with the others. It’s not cheap (Brian paid $8.99 for this somewhere in Jersey), but 22 ounces is absolutely no problem, and is a very pleasant experience. 4.5/5.0

Overall: This is a top-notch IPA, in the league of anything Stone, Bell’s or Russian River can produce. A joyful experience, and a worthy 600th rating.
Bottle from Cooke’s market in El Segundo. Golden Orange, nice head, great lacing throughout. Great balance, wonderful flavor. Surpasses Stone IPA as my fave!!
Bottle at Craig’s house. bread, citrus, golden, hazy, frothy, lightly bitter, light body, creamy, lively,

Bottle at home  Thanks to WeeHeavySD for this  Golden orange ... Really resniny juicy piney american hops ... Tarty Dry intense overpowerfully hop ... quite a lot of bitterness ... quite spicy ... tasty enough but not for me the best of its type ... and quite heavy going
bottle, orange color, foamy head, very good bready citrus flavors with a sticky grapefruit finish

Burnished gold with some hop haze and nice long lasting off white head
Nose of Citrus (grapefruit, tangerine) some resin. With honeyish malt with some alcohol notes as well
Flavor: Really rich complex hop flavor with a big hop bite. Honey, toast, vanilla, tangerine,grapefruit, rind, spice and round out the party.
Palate: Really long lasting, changing flavors from initial burst of malt sweetness to a drying hop finish.
Overall an IPA I have been trying to find for a while and especially being one of the highest rated IPAs. I have to say "EXCELLENT" The aroma and flavor seems to have dulled a touch from time and transport.
This comes across almost as a double IPA with its malt and alcohol but the drying finish with honeyish notes is the signature for this one.

Pours with a large, thick white head covering a slightly hazy golden body with tiny bubbles. Strong, heavy, sip by sip lacing left on the sides of my Stone Gaurdian glass. Retention from the head is full throught the lifetime of the glass. Aroma is very nice with citrus (mainly grapefruit) and floral hops galour, a little bit of spiceyness, and some sweet malts and some rich nearly dark fruits in the back. Taste is nice and balanced IPA with a very refreshing hop bitterness in great balance with the sweet malts and alcohol. Finishes with a rich spiceyness that is not too common in basic IPAs. Mouthfeel is velvety with lively bubbles. Deserves to be the best IPA on the site.

Bottle, many thanks to stefanje.  Amazing IPA.  Just amazing.  Cloudy amber color with a nice head.  Wonderful floral hop aromas and citrus as well.  Flavor is so great.  Hops kick your ass at first but then they give way to a nice rich malty massage on your tongue.  Hell yes, what a beer!

Golden orange with a generous head that retained its thickness for a while and left lots of lacing. Strong pine hops aromas, with grapefruit and lemon evident. Taste was dominated by the hops, but well balanced with sweet maltiness. Slightly creamy texture, lots of carbonation. Not sure where you draw the line between IPA and IIPA, but this must come close. Excellent, excellent beer.

This is probably pound for pound one of the best IPAs that categorically fits into an Imperial, but is just perfect just as it is.  The overly hoppy pine nose, follows right on through into the flavor, with some light citrus fruitiness, and a strong caramel maltiness.  Has a slick sweetness, balanced by a bitter orange rind acidity.  This is really a beautiful beer to drink.

22oz bottle:  Pours a clear light orange with a nice medium ivory head. The aroma is sweet with a little orange and other citrus. The flavor is classic west coast IPA with a balance of flavorful citrus focused hops but balanced with a nice malt character. The mouth feel is on eht heavier side of medium. This beer exceed my previous experience and expectations. This is a top notch IPA as so many AleSmith beers are.

Bottle shared by Eric. Somehow Ive never had this awesome beer. Pours a light orange with a thin white head. The aroma is full of hops; pine and floral notes abound. Like a botanical garden. The taste is really great; a smooth and crisp hop presence, mostly pine and some citrus, and it is well balanced by rich malt. As others have said this is a excellent IPA. Could be a great everyday selection, that is if we could get it out here.

22 oz. bottle poured into a tulip glass has a light caramel amber color and a beautiful thick fluffy white head that has great retention. like a fluffy cloud floating above the surface. aroma has bold sweet hops with a good dose of bitter resins, pine, citrus peel, and light sweet fruit. great balance in the nose of sweetness and hop character. the hops in the flavor hit right away with a battle of citrus sweet hops and piny resinous ones competing to take over. plenty of malt body to keep it grounded and finishing with bitterness and citrus. as it warmed sweet grapefruit and a touch of honey sweetness popped in. absolutely fantastic stuff, wish it was available on the east coast.
gold large fluffy white head pine and grapefruit lots of sweet malt very dry finish

Nice light amber pour with a big foamy head that leaves great laging.  Lots of hops in the aroma, with pine, grapefruit, citrus peel and a hint of malt.  Very similar flavor.  Lots of hops balanced by a touch of malt with a huge pine-grapefruit finish.  Truly a fantastic IPA!
The "GRAND DADDY" of all IPAs!!!  The model of what an IPA should be...citrus, hops and malt all coalesce to a fine point of perfection...finishes hoppy, dry and smooth...refreshing and wonderful!

Pours a nice light copper color.  Nice frothy head with a little lacing.  Aroma is of light spicy hops.  very nice and right on for style.  Flavor as light malt and spicy hops.  Nice lingering hop finish.

Pours a transparent reddish color with a huge white head that leaves a ton of lacing. Aroma of sticky pine, resiny hops, citrus and malts. Flavor is hop bitterness, balanced out by the malts,  citrus, and deliciousness. Excellent IPA, one of my favorites.

(bottle, thanks Bartzilla!) Pours hazy copper-orange with a lasting white head that leaves sticky lacing; a perfect five.  The aroma is just great.  First, I get a big blast of grapefruit, and a cotton candy-like sweetness, followed up by mandarin orange and ambrosia salad.  Some pine and grass emerges as well.  Wow, this is something else.  The taste however, fallls flat.  Theres a little caramel taste in here, with just a weak hop finish.  The complexity that the nose displayed is not exhibited at all in the flavor.  Mouthfeel is medium.  This beer is paradoxical, the aroma is probably the best Ive ever smelled in an IPA, but the flavor is very run of the mill.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2010 Rating #300!  bomber, thanks to Sparky27.      Amazing.... for sure, the best IPA Ive ever had - it lives up to its rating as the #1 IPA.  pours a deep golden with a nice thick white head which holds well throughout as a nice lacing and slim top.  piney hop aromas... solid full body over the palate, with a huge hop presence.  sticky, chewy and creamy.  slight malt undertone... huge bitter finish which sticks with you - literally.  lots of citrus fruits from start to finish.  the hops in this one will smack you.... a true delight.

OK, the pivotal, highest of high, in terms of IPA beers.  Pours medium gold from bomber forming large foamy head.  Aroma of hopped up pine resines, citrus flowers with an apricot mash of peach and malted buds.  Flavour was of a full flavoured beer, premium IPA style beer.  Full on hopped pine resins with a slight grapefruit and rhine character.  Wet forrest flowers with pepper endings demands to be heard too.  The holy of holies?  Damn near, this is truly the best beer to experience in terms of overall style and comfort.  Bring me kegs!  A remarkable beer to behold and experience!!!
user_location: The Crystal Coast, North Carolina, USA

text: Finally got to try the highest rated beer of my favorite style.  Bomber poured into small tulip glass.  Hazy cascading orange forming a billowy head.  Thick webby lacing.  Awesome aroma of floral hops, tropical fruit, peach, and bright citrus (tangerine, grapefruit).  Flavor marked by zesty grapefruit hops-fresh and spritzy- like a twisting of grapefruit rind on the tongue.  Has a robust hoppy bitterness which is at the same time mellow and smooth.  Clean resiny finish--no astringency.  Nice biscuity malt foundation to support all the hoppy goodness.  Im not sure if this or Bells Two Hearted is the best single IPA Ive had, but this has to be way up there nonetheless. Bottle from Pacific Standard.

Bottle. Nice dark golden color with very long lasting and fluffy off white head. Aroma is wonderfully hoppy with citrus and pine resins dominating. Flavor is really great with the malts offering a good balance. A first rate IPA that I will buy again.

Bouteille 650ml, courtoisie de Hogtownharry. De couleur dorée-ambrée et claire. Nez de houblon résineux, citrique (pamplemousse), légèrement herbeux (herbes fraîches) et floral, fruité (agrumes, abricots), malté de biscuits, léger de caramel  et avec des traces de pain. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture crémeuse et légèrement résineuse. Goût amer de houblon citrique (pamplemousse), résineux et moyennement floral (une amertume sèche et fraîche, présente toute la gorgée) accompagné dun goût fruité (agrumes sucrées, abricots) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût malté de biscuits au caramel avec des notes de pain et de céréales puis en finale lon assiste à un regain damertume de houblon plus asséchante, herbeuse (herbe fraîches, notes de thé et traces de menthe) et légèrement plus résineuse ainsi quavec des notes dalcool. Post-goût long et sec, amer de houblon résineux, citrique, herbeux et légèrement floral ainsi quavec un léger goût fruité (zest dagrumes, noyau de pêche) et de traces dalcool doux.

bomber into pint glass. Pours hazy amber orange.  Big slightly off-white head.  Sweet citrus and pine hops and sweet malt aroma - smells like hopslam.  Strong but smooth hops (not extremely bitting).  Alcohol is hidden really well.  Soft and medium bodied on palate. Overall:  Check this out if you can find it.  I got it at "From The Vine" outside of Columbus; really sweet store.

BOTTLE: Obvious sediment in golden color with thick white head and fabulous lacing.  Very piney with a hint of grapefruit in the nose.  Flavor is extremely piney, like picking up a tree and eating it.  Palate is lively but oh so dry.  This is just too much of an IPA for my liking, or at least not as balanced as Id prefer.

Sampled at the pre-DLD party. Took me this long to finally get to an Alesmith. Pours a frothy head over a light pale ale color. Crisp, tasty hop smell and taste; not quite as fresh as the Odells IPA I just had, but thats the luck of the draw. But theres plenty of good piney resin to this lip-smacker, with a good backing of caramel malts. Worth the wait, and Im watching out for another.
Bottle.  Pours amber white head.  Flavor is full of citrus hops, good amount of malt and plum in the flavor.  Pine and grape.  Yum.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2008 22 oz. Bottle, pours a hazy orange-amber with a lively white to slighty off-white head of thick, creamy fine bubbles with some larger mixed in, head reminds me of some belgian ales, lots of sticky bubbled lacing clings to the glass, this ale has a great head and lacing, lots of sweet cake mix and bread aromas with orange, grapefruit citrus fruit and floral fragrances, some sweet malt fragrances, the sip has lots of hop bitterness, flavor of toasted malt, some caramel in the background with orange citrus fruit flavors, very dry at the finish, hop bitterness lingers for a while on the palate with herbs and pine needles, this has a medium mouth feel, I found this to be very easy to drink, a very good IPA.

Thanks to boltz7555 for the bottle. Shared with Ian and Deanna. Pours a cloudy orange   gold with a thick white head. Hoppy citrus aroma that is big and resinous. Bitter hoppy citrus taste, this is just loaded with hops! There is some sense of malt somewhere in there to give it some balance. Finishes bitter and grapefruit dry. Very good.

Pours orange/yellow with a moderate white head, nice lace, decent retention. Smells crisp and clean hoppy with some orangey citrus. Tastes bitter and hoppy with a lingering sweetness. Great citrus hop flavors of orange and grapefruit. Medium body with nice, smooth carbonation. Seems like theyve toned the carbonation down a bit. Best single IPA ever in my opinion.
Very floral, piney hop nose. Huge lacing. Beautiful copper color with an off white fluffy head. Very hoppy profile with a caramel sweet mid, followed by a clean bitter finish.

Pours very nice dark golden color with very long lasting and fluffy off white head. Aroma is excellent and hoppy, nice citrus and pine resins dominate. Flavor is similarly great, similar to the aromas, but the malts offer a great balance, not as bitter as the aroma might suggest. Very smooth body, and although the high alcohol content is somewhat noticable through the warmth, it is very well hidden. A top notch IPA from my favorite brewery.

Pours a clear, bright golden with a beautiful thick fluffy head that hangs around for ages. Fantastic lacing and a great looking IPA all the way around.  Big citrus and piny hops in the nose with a pleasant malt aroma in the background. Strong lemon and grapefruit smells on top of the fragrant pine.  Initial bitterness of the piny hop blast almost immediately gives way to the citrus, with lemon zest, oranges, and grapefruits dominating. Very subtle malt background throughout before the pine hop bitterness reenters the fray in the lingering aftertaste. Pretty aggressive but well balanced.  Medium bodied with enough carbonation and bitterness to zing the tongue nicely. Despite the zing, the overall mouthfeel is actually very smooth.  One of the more drinkable IPAs out there and a solid example of a West Coast IPA. This is about as big as you can get without getting into DIPA territory. Another great beer from the folks at AleSmith who rarely disappoint.

The color was light brass.  The head was thin, creamy, and off-white.  The aroma was apricot, pine, hops, and fruit.  The flavor was hoppy, waxy/bitter, fruity, citrisy, and pine.  The palate was full-bodied.  The finish was warm and waxy.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2009 Bonus from Smokepot23, thanks Joe. Pours a nice copper amber with a creamy light yellow head. The nose was intense and fruity, very nice fresh hop nose, mango, grapefruit peel, mild spicy character. Flavor is very fruity and hoppy, mango, citrus rind, well contained bitterness. Wonderful flavor. Palate has a nice spicy bitterness that doesnt dominate. Funtastic IPA.
Deep golden color, leaving off-white lacing. Potent hop estery aromas are mostly grassy. Body is heavy. Solid.

A- Pours an orangey hue with an absolutely phenomenal head which sticks around all the way through, leaving torrents of lacing on the side of my glass.

S- Very floral hops and a sweet malt backbone.

T- Taste is smooth and sweet, definitely hopped up but not obtrusively so.

M- Mouthfeel is smooth and creamy, not too viscous with about an average amount of carbonation.

D- This is a monumentally drinkable IPA. I shared the bomber with my dad but could have easily had the whole thing to myself.

FINALLY got to try this thanks to dra19.  Nice piney grapefruit right away even after about a year on this bottle i think.  Thick head that clings to the glass long after the pour.  For all the hops this thing has its a smoother drinking IPA than some.  Very well balanced.  I need to go to California and get this fresh from the kegs.  Thanks again dra19.

Draught  Yellow medium head; pale orange-amber colour. Passionfruit & grapefruit notes, bitterish fruitsherbet aromas. Very perfumey-hoppy flavours; enhanced by the alcohol coming out. Quite clean palate, quite slick. Good IPA, basically not overpowering, enticing.

AleSmith IPA is at the top of the list when it comes to this hoppy west coast style IPA.  A rush of piney and citrusy hop aroma sweeps over you when you crack open this bottle of real ale.  As you pour into your glass the light amber nectar releases carbonation carrying the aroma of a fresh hop field to your nose as you anxiously wait for the white head to settle down to take your first sip.  Intense hop flavor is balanced with a malty sweetness creating a symphony of flavors on the tongue with a dry finish.  Hops are intense throughout the entire experience but no so much that you need a break between quaffs.  Excellent presentation of the sinfully hoppy west coast IPA.

Aroma is of peaches with some conifer and citrus. Good taste of peaches and hops with the aftertaste of In N Out burgers for some reason. Good beer but not as good as I was expecting. Improves as it warms up.Might buy again
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text: definitely worth the hype. over the top hops but lovely lovely lovely. the king of IPAs for good reason

Bottle pours a syrupy golden hue.  When I hold this up to the light it looks like malt extract syrup in my glass with lots of hop particles in it.  Has a little alcohol smell with some hops.  Taste is very smooth with lots of citrus and lots of lots of thick resin flavors of hops.  A very nice IPA.

In a trade with stefanje Encapsulates most of what I love in an American-style IPA. Huge cascade nose, with lychees and flowery subnotes. Slightly opaque coppery colour with tight rocky white head that when deflated leaves frothy lacing. Noticeable caramel malt sweetness and rose petal and orange flavours counter the piney fresh green hops and biting bitterness that is softened by the exquisitely gentle mouthfeel. A better example of what bottle-conditioning can do for a beer youll be hard pressed to find. Seductively easy to drink.

I know that one day this beer and I are gonna to get married on top of a mountain, and theres going to be flutes playing and trombones and flowers and garlands of fresh herbs. And we will dance till the sun rises. And then our children will form a family band. And we will tour the countryside and you wont be invited.

The cadillac of IPAs. This beer defines what "balance" is in a beer. A lush citrus hop balanced by smooth malty sweetness. The aroma is magnificent with a forest full of fruit to savor. The mouthfeel lends itself to a session despite the 7.25%. A pleasure to drink from beginning to end. Im still waiting for regular distribution out here in the East. Damn.

Bottle. [Courtesy of wetherel]. Clear medium amber orange color with a large, frothy to creamy, good - excellent lacing, fully lasting, off-white to beige head. Aroma is heavy hoppy, pine, citrus - grape. Flavor is heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily - creamy, carbonation is soft. Very very nice ;o)) (180308)
nice lacy white head.amazing aroma.flavor is text book san deigo style ipa,hops,hops,and when your screaming more hops.this is the apex of west coast ipa.thank you alesmith

Big thanks to Shyam for sending this my way. To my US palate living on European soil, this tastes like America. Bomber pours bright amber with a tall, fluffy and lasting white head. Very pretty. Big, classic, citrus-floral hoppy nose. Flavor offers a light, juicy sweetness before blossoming into fresh-hoppy bitterness that gains strength and lasts and lasts. Im left with a memory and wishes for more. My only complaint is a lack of sessionability. But this is a doozy.

Ah, the highest rated IPA in the world.  Ive been craving this one for a long time.  Nice frothy head with a slick lacing on the side of the glass.  The character Alesmith hop aroma present.  Many layers of complexity in regards to the hop presence.  Qutie nice.  However, the malt itself really took away from the experience.  A bit cloying and pushed the beer out of balance for me.  Quite a contrast here between the strong hop profile and the overly sweet malt backbone.
wow.........soooooooooooooooooooooooooo hoppy. just amazing, not very balanced, cause there isnt much malt, but dear god a hop addicts wet dream!!

Courtesy of dpjuart. Pours a hazy orange with a large white head. Smells citric and piney, with a strong burnt plastic aroma. Not bad taste though, very bitter with some caramel malt notes and a touch of yeasty fruitiness. Finishes very dry and grainy. Meh..
From a bomber I picked up while I was able to visit AleSmith.  Pours a orange/amber color.  Amazing hoppy nose.  Great citrus and pine hops.  One of the best IPAs out there.

22 oz. bomber.  Pours clear copper with thick, foamy white head, lingering and good lacing.  Good old hoppy nose, slight grass with a touch of ozone.  Earth and floral hop taste with a big bitterness, w a good, balancing malt, caramel and bread.  Slight citrus, touch of chocolate.  Oh, and some more bitter.  Not bad.  Not quite what I expected.  Again, there may have been some age on this that didnt help anything.  Would like to try it fresh.

Courtesy of Juart. Pours a murky amber orange color and has a thick two-finger head that lasts.  Great lacing.  Has a strange plasticy ozone smell with a floral hoppiness and some peach.  Has an almost numbing bitterness when it first hits your tongue.  Kind of strange, but in a good way.  Brown sugar and toffee sweetness balance it out.  A good creamy texture.

From bottle courtesy dpjuart. Ozone, resin, grassy hoppiness, caramel, biscuit, light vapory alcohol, too. Medium-dark amber, slight haze, with a bit of floaters. Creamy off-white lacing head. Medium-heavy watery body with medium carbonation. Starts with medium sweet maltiness, followed by quite a heavy hop presence. Alcohol warming. Medium dry bitter finish with light fruity dry nutty bitter after. Tasty IPA.
Very hoppy.  One of my favorite IPAs.  Too bad they dont distribute in the Seattle area.  Crossing my fingers and hoping they will soon.

Pours clear coppery gold, with a massive four-inch head of foamy white.
Lacework smears the glass throughout the duration. Ripped curtains, dots, and shredded ropes make for a grand appearance.
Aromatics are floral, citrus-ladel, and plenty hoppy.
Tangerine, melon, mangoe, grapefruit pith, spruce dew, and a hint of cracked coriander.
Quite aromatic, but not incredibly pungent.
The mouthfeel is medium, crisp, and tacky.
Tropical fruit, snappy hop resins, and juicy lupulin burst onto the pallet.
Bitterness is firm, drying, and smooth. 
Alcohol is warming, but not overbearing, and the malt base is quite light.
Finishes with lingering citrus fruit, an earthy spruce note, and drying powdered grapefruit.

Great IPA, and probably in my top ten for the style. To have a screaming fresh pitcher would be bliss.

punch in the nose hops, I love it. big thick head nice dark honey color. smooth mouth feel. big hops, lemon citrus bitterness up front, subtle sweetness of yeast and malt, honey, bitterness lingers. 22oz bottle. nice IPA.

Recieved from RiversideAK in trade providing my first Alesmith experience. Aroma is huge of citrusy and piney hops. Pours a cloudy orangish yellow with barely any head. Tastes of smooth piney hops with a nice malt aftertaste to mellow it out, great IPA!
Pours golden amber with fizzy white head. Aromas of pine and citrus. Flavors of citrus, pine, and resin. Very good IPA, very impressed. Nice smooth finish.
user_location: back in NJ!, New Jersey, USA

text: Great beer from Alesmith. Everything in balance and nothin extreme. A good beer to start as you warm up to the yulesmith !

UPDATED: APR 16, 2010 well rounded hop aroma, fresh and sweet. amber/gold, thick clean white fluffy head. piney and soft, long bitter finish.  041610 Finally drank another bottle and I expect this to be more fresh.  Bursting with pineapple and piney greatness finishes fairly dry and clean, a touch of new vinyl.

pours cloudy apricot light tan dissipating head.  aroma of citrus, hops, but rather mild.  flavor of hops, pine, citrus.  smooth non-bitter finish.  not bad, but not a bullseye.  much too mild for a great ipa.

Via trade from tertons.  Golden hazy poor witha thick frothy beige head, nice lacing.  Aromas are extreme of hops, cascade to be exact, citrus, pepper, caramel, pine, pears, sea salt, vanilla, fresh ground malts... again very hoppy.  Nice IBU (guessing around 100), sweet, very bitter, creamy, medium body... starts somewhat salty and finished on the sweet side all while keeping a nice long lasting hoppy bitterness.  Nice flavor explosion.  Added citrus greatness and lots of pepper, very spicy, spruce... Just an all around great IPA.  Definitely up there with the best.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2010 Wow! Awesome smell of citrus and pine hops right away. Golden orange color with a great head. Taste is just as it smelled. Citrus/pine flavored hops. Floral sweetness. But well balanced. Great bitteness but not offensive... Extremely smooth. Soft on the palate which makes it so easy to drink. It just sits in your mouth....perfectly. Simple but great IPA. I only wish this was available in my area. I cant even imagine how amazing this must taste on tap at the brewery!  So easy to drink. I wish I could give the texture/palate a ten. I like drinking it on the warmer side (50-55 degrees) Everything I ever wanted in a beer...All other IPAs and beers will be compared to this, only to be let down. This is the perfect beer, reasonabley priced, widely available (not in my area) not a one off/limited beer. Thanks to every one who has sent me this beer...

Aroma of resiny hops and citrus.  Taste is also malty and somewhat spiced..  Malts take a back seat to hops.  Mouth is light with some carbonation.  Appears copper and has a white lacing head.  Finish is not as bitter as would be expected.  A nice brew.

22 oz bomber from adrian910ss, thanks Adrian. Pours a slightly hazy orangey amber with an average size frothy white head. Aroma of caramel, toffee and slight grapefruit. Medium bodied that leaves a creamy mouthfeel and finishes slightly bitter. Flavor is alcohol, malts, bread and slight citrus hops. This is like the fifth IPA I have had in the last few weeks that has passed its prime. The hops in this beer faded quicker then Rudy Guilianis presidential possibilities.

Pours a wonderful cloudy amber/orange color with big carbonation which produces a decent head and leaves nice lacing. Aroma is resiny, orange peel, grapefruit, floral and carmelly sweet. Flavor is a wonderful combination of NW hops and caramel roasted barley. Has a nice hop bite but not as overdone as many California IPAs. Big sticky texture, finishes long and piney bitter. This would be my every day beer if I could get it!

Bottle thanks to LeopoldStoch, thanks for hooking me up Brandon.  Pours a clear golden-copper color with a thick, rocky off-white head that left great lacing.  Aroma of spicy pine and resin with nice citrus (grapefruit) back.  Opens up with a nice citrus flavor and some malty sweetness that leads into a piny, resiny hop hit that fades slowly and lingers with some more citrus and fruity undertones.  Feels great on the palate, just the right amount of carbonation and hop bitterness.  Definitely a first class beer, thanks again for the bottle Butters, I appreciate it.

Aroma is citrusy, floral and light airy yeasts. Flavor is citrus, huge, in your face floral hops, light fruits, a balancing malt spine, so damn good. A big ass beer for being only 7.25%. Im a hophead at heart, but you tell me. Could this brewery have a more fitting name?

Bottle at patrick767 gathering. Small fizzy ivory head that mostly diminished, very little lacing, carbonation noted, semi-transparent, and an orange brown hue. Nose was caramel, citrus, pine, hoppy, fruity, sweet, and malty. Flavor was hoppy, Ditto for the flavor. Tingly mouthfeel and medium body. For not being a hophead, I truly enjoyed this IPA. It was a delight to drink, worthy of a try and I would absolutely drink this one again if the opportunity presented itself.

Thanks to Riverside ak for this!  Pours gold with fluffy white head and some decent lacing.  Sweet citrusy fresh hops on the nose.  Very similar flavor profile with a very becoming vanilla citrus like finish.  This is a perfect blueprint on how do an IPA

Bottle courtesy of alohac (thanks!).  Pours a hazy orange with large white head.  Tiny bubbles, just like the bottle said.  Decent retention and great lacing.  Aroma is grapefruity hops along with some other vaguely sweet fruit as well. Taste is hoppy all the way; more grapefruit coming in, along with some pine and a little malty sweetness.  Way too easy to drink.  Average palate with a smooth, bitter finish.  An excellent IPA, no doubt.

Pours a nice golden color with a white head.  This was a very strong IPA, felt more like a double/imperial to me.  Excellent flavor, but bitterness might have dominated a bit too much for me.  But admittedly a lot of that is based on my own expectations, as I went in thinking it would be a smaller beer.  No matter the category, a top notch beer.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2009 22oz bottle.   Clear amber with a sticky lasting head that laces.   Big fruity aroma with lots of mango, some grapefruit, pine, and a little caramel.   Some toasty, caramel maltiness with lots of hops over it.   Almost balanced, but the hops are huge and win out with a bitter finish.   Very nicely drinkable, but you can still feel the alcohol.   Medium, clean palate with soft carbonation.   My one hang up is that there is a slight soapy note in the finish that tastes like a weird play between the hops and alcohol.   Hardly distracting, but keeps it from being a perfect IPA for me. (8,4,7,4,15=3.8)
Rerate:   22oz bottle.   I wish they would date these bottles because this cant be too fresh.   Nice peach/grapefruit/pineapple hop aroma, though not incredibly punchy.   Maybe Im just expecting too much though.   Fruity and floral with a resiny-bitter finish that isnt too intense.   Some toasty sweetness up front, but dry and bitter in the finish with almost no alcohol.   Medium bodied with medium carbonation and a nice feel from the bottle conditioning, minus some chunks.   Despite my suspicions that this would be punchier with a fresher bottle, this is quite good.   I really need to find it on tap now.

Courtesy SoLan.  Pours a mostly clear, very lightly hazy golden honey color.  A frothy, off-white head settles to a thin layer with a marshy gathering of bubbles towards the center.  Organic splotches of lacing look like cobwebs on the glass.  The aroma is very fresh and fruity, with very well balanced blend of sweet malt and bitter hop character.  Fresh orange juice and grapefruit hops blend well with caramel and lightly buttery toffee.  The flavor follows suit, with incredibly tasty citrus perfectly complimenting the substantial maltiness.  A touch of honey adds a unique sweetness.  Very well balanced.  The body and mouthfeel are on the heavy side of medium and are incredibly smooth.  Very tasty and satisfying.
Bomber. Pours golden with white head. Aroma is citrus and hops. Taste is hops,citrus and a little pine. Perfet balance for a IPA.
Gold/copper. Small, foamy white head. Full spectrum hops- pine, citrus, resin, spicy florals- backed some lightly sweet pale malt. Medium body, balanced. Awesome IPA.
Very nice IPA  Golden color with small white head.  Aroma of light citrus and pine.  Taste is of citrus, pine, malt but the flavors are nicely blended and none overpowering.

Bomber.  Poured a murky orangeish yellow color with a huge white head  nice lacing.  Aroma of pine, hops, and grapefruit on the nose and palate. This was a really smooth IPA. Doesnt have the knock you over the head hops bite but this is really solid drinkable beer.

High quality IPA here, on par with Alpha King...but in a MUCH BIGGER BOTTLE!!!  There is definitely more to enjoy!!!  Complex characteristics but undoubtedly an IPA with pronounced sticky hops and piney resin.  Another "perty" beer (yes, I meant to spell it like that) by AleSmith with depth.  Great job.

June 2006 - Had this in parallel with some of the other "greats", and this held up well.  Perhaps the richest flavored IPA out there...pushing the limits of Imperial IPA land.  Pour was impressive, with nice head and lacing, even in my small glass.  The beer was kinda one dimensional, heavy grapefruit...but that "AleSmith flavor", which Ive noticed in all of their beers (a biscuity flavor from the yeast maybe?), doesnt fit as well here as in the other styles.  A fine brew, but a step below Stone and Two-Hearted, in my book.

This bottled brew from Patrick767 at a rating party poured a head of finely sized off-white colored bubbles that were and left behind a very hazy dark orange brown colored body and a good lacing. The mild aroma was hoppy malty and musty. The mouth feel was very tingly at the start and at the finish with a strong hoppy aftertaste. The mild flavor contained notes of mild hops and floral. A decent one that I would consider having again.

Bottle massive huge thanks to miketd. Aroma is everything i love about american hops, the citrus character is amazing, however as time goes on i get a plastic varnish note. Taste is pritty full for an ipa, toffee malt backing the huge hop character, however again theres this plastic note which totally gets in the way. The thing is i recon the problems in this beer come from the yeast, i cant figure out why its bottle conditiond like its an ipa its ment to be clean and fresh and the yeast stops it from being so, im guessing that if it wasnt bottle conditioned it would get a 4.5.

Immediately hoppy nose of citrus.  First couple sips stay with you but  the beer seems to become slightly lacking once into it.  Malts are far to overpowered, leaving you wanting more half sip.  Hops seem to overcompensate for lack of body.  Overall, a decent IPA but betters are easily found.

Bottle from a trade with kenb. Thanks Ken! Pours a hazy, golden color with a hugh creamy, off-white head with massive laces. Aroma of hops, hops and more hops. Once you get past the hops you can detect a bit of citrus, mainly grapefruit I think. Taste is piney, resiny hops with a hint of caramel. Has a dry bitter finish. To me it was another typical overly hopped west coast IPA.

A gorgeous pour results in a hazy dark gold beer topped with a nice 2 finger head. Huge sheets of lacing composed of very fine carbonation adorn the sides of the pint glass. 

An alluring grapefruit and orange hop scent emanates from the head, complemented by a hint of caramel from the sweet bready malts. 

Taste is like biting into a grapefruit covered in maple syrup! Amazingly juicy. The balance is seriously a thing of beauty and awe. 

Medium body, pretty significant carbonation. A bit sticky but pretty crisp and eventually drying, begging for the next sip. 

I wish I had more, nuff said. 

Best IPA Ive ever had.

Bottle - Thanks Harry!!!! Hazy orange colour - slight suddy white head. Aroma - if I could market this as a perfume, I would; sexy sweet hop aroma, what a thrill to inhale, literally hypnotic, like an Arabic Princess gliding by you in an old city market. Flavour - Delicious, delicious, delicious: Hops and candyfloss and baby Jesus tears. An absolute assault on the senses, a sexy assault. Amazing. I cried a little.

Tap @ the brewery.  Pours a cloudy golden copper color with a fluffy white head.  Aroma is heavily citrus hops with a slight bit of malt thrown in for good measure.  Taste is grapefruit and pine needles up front dissolving into an absolutely wonderful citrus hop finish.  The beer remains smooth and supremely drinkable despite the heavy carbonation.  This immediately became my new favorite IPA, and another smash hit from AleSmith.
Another quality brew by AleSmith.  Pours a murky copper with a head that lingers.  Nose of citrus and hops, very nice on the palate with a nice dry finish.  Very high quality beer for the price.

Deep golden/copper in color this poured a big head of small bubbles that stayed tight.  The nose was filled with grapefruit followed by some piney hops and a bit of caramel coated malt balls.  In the mouth these flavors continued into a balanced midpalate of medium density.  The finish showed off the bitterness though through the midpalate it was well-balanced with sweet malt.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2008 [Bottle, thanks Skyview!] Pours hazy orange with a big cream head. Aroma and taste are both dominated by citrus hoppiness. Caramel malt also in there. Not overly bitter as some IPAs end up being. Medium-thick mouthfeel. Good finish. Didnt find it to be too complex, but really well made and a very nice IPA. Original rating: 8/4/7/4/17=4.0Re-rate: [Bottle, thanks Guerde!] I split half a bottle this time, and I actually liked it less. The aroma is pretty good, but the taste really left a lot to be desired. Good, but really falls well short of IPAs like Surly Furious.

Picked up a 22-oz bomber at Johns Marketplace in Portland, Oregon during the summer of 07. Pours a slight hazed golden brew with thin particles and a thick, lumpy off-white head that just barely goes away. Aroma of sweet tangerines, some citrus zest, pine and a hint of caramel malt. Taste is medium bodied with some carbonation. The flavor really kicks up a few notches with a sweet tangerine, grapefruit and caramel flavor. Finish has a nice bitter bite with a dry flavor that lingers around after the finish. Another excellent brew from Alesmith.

Another great brew courtesy of Skyview.  Slightly hazy golden color with a nice finger thick dirty white head.  Great cirtusy hop aroma with apparent pine as well as a floral quality too.  The flavor is great.  Citrus grapefruit and lemon and a hint of caramel with a nice smooth bitter finish.

22oz bottle-pours a rich to rocky off white head that laces and gold color.  Aroma is sweet lemon zest-citrus (Amarillo), pine hops-bite (also cascade?), secondary/faint medium malt-caramel.  Taste is solid, sessionable, just off from the great aroma, sweet lemon zest-citrus (Amarillo), pine hops-some bite (also cascade?), secondary medium malt-caramel.. Further in the taste gets closer to the aroma and the bite strengthens a bit.  Nice American IPA.  OK/mild carbonation.

(bottle): Pours a soft golden yellow color, fizzy. Huge head, very lasting w/big bubbles & good lacing. Very piney aroma, some nuttiness present too. Very sweet smelling, almost like a candy. Soft fizzy mouthfeel. Piney hops & some malt. Bittery good but not too caustic. Warming up, drier, less bitter & hoppy.

22oz Bottle Pours out light gold amber topped with a cream off white head. A very nice pine hop aroma. Tast of sweet caramel and pine along with citrus hops. A nice light bitter end. A very smooth and easy drink. no alcohol picked up by me for over 7% that is pretty good. A very nice IPA. But hey what did you expect from ALE SMITH.

Smelled citrusy and hoppy. Appeared a slightly brownish color with a large head that was off-white. Tasted hoppy, grapefruit, bitter aftertaste and good. Overall a good beer that I would love to have another of.

In short: One of the most intense <8% IPA.  Extremely bitter grapefruit and pine-needles hopping.  Amazing stuff.
How: 22oz bottle from my Secret Festivus.  A million thanks whoever you are.
The look: Clear golden body with a medium beige head
In long: Intense nose of grapefruit with some pineapples and pine-tree.  Taste is just as intense as the nose.  Almost too intense!  The initial attack is smooth and surprisingly sweet.  Not thick caramel-sweet, more like crisp sugary honey/caramel sweetness. But then the intense fruity bitterness kicks-in and is it ever tasty.  Im talking intensely bitter to the point of making faces.  And thats a hop-head talking.  The bitter hops flavours we equally grapefruit and pine-tree seconded by pineapples and citrus.  The more the beer warmed up the more the pine-tree was coming out and it was drying out the beer quite nicely.  More highly drinkable chilled than cold.  This beer is a slap in the face and unless your idea of a good time is being chained and tied-up in a tight latex suit this is the most pleasant slap in the face you can get.

The baby was put to bed. We had 15 minutes until 30 Rock came on. Dinner was finished. This is the moment in the evening when things feel calm, a lull takes over the living room, we have peace of mind until the baby starts waking up, until night completely takes over. Im sitting deep in an over-sized couch.  I dont give a damn about New Hampshire. I open the Alesmith IPA I bought from South Bay a few weeks ago. Total floral aroma. Sweet hops. Citrus. All the cliches of IPA talk, yes. But this beer makes me feel good. It makes the lull feel good. It makes the night feel good. This is a damn good IPA. One of the best Ive had.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2009 Good IPA - but I wouldnt say its the greatest, as it has been rated here. Stone, Racer 5 and Hop Devil are all better IPAs. But dont get me wrong, the Eagles are the most overrated band in the world, and they still make good music. 
The hops are very aromatic in this one - you can practically smell the bottle across the room. It pours a hazy amber with minimal head. First flavor is pine, which dominates, peeling back into a finish that is bittersweet. 
ON LATER ANALYSIS: This stuff is smooth, but at the same time giving a very nice hop nose. For that alone, Ive knocking this up a point or two.

Yellowish-amber color with a frothy two finger white head. 
Strong floral and piney hop aroma with a whiff of caramel. 
Medium bodied with mild carbonation. 
Big hop flavors dominate the first taste of this brew . A smooth , sweet caramel flavor makes a brief appearance only to be snuffed out by a big, hop garden taste to finish. 
A great IPA here.Jan 2006
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: 22 oz. bottle. One of the more fragrant IPAs. The taste is fresh and bitter, strong but not challengingly so. A refreshing aside from the IPA arms race.

Pours a deep gold colored beer, with a one finger head and lacing all the way down. Smells of citrus, grapefruit, hops. Tastes of citrus and hops, nice balance. A pretty strong amount of carbonation with a bitter finish.
well-balanced, solid IPA; nice, light copper body with light brown, eggshell head that is tight and revealingly lacy; sweet yet hoppy and dry... smooth and well; i just want more...
Golden color with a thick head and floral hop aromas.  Floral hop flavors with fruity overtones.  Crisp and refreshing perfectly hopped.

Thanks to xnoxhatex for sharing this one on NYE 07.  Pours a clear orange/yellow with a white head that lasts the glass down.  Fresh nose.  Pine, citrus, grapefruit with caramel notes coming through.  Tastes similar.  Fresh hops balanced well with the malts.  All the standards that you want in a fresh IPA.  Nicely done.
WOOO can you say hops!  This beer is packed with them. Very nice golden hue with a thin lacey head. Beer is just absolutely packed with hops. An excellent brew!

Pours a cloudy copper with a gynormous frothy head that lasts forever. Laces throughout the entire beer and looks delicious. Smells are abundant. Hoppy but not a slap in the face. Sweet malt, caramel, fruit, rind, pine. Tastes exactly as it smells, exquisite and complex, all covered in hops. Mouthfeel is full and creamy with low carbonation. A session beer for sure. Love how this is an obvious IPA but is so complex and different at the same time. A classic.

Pours a slightly hazy amber color with a thick but small white head.  Aroma of heavy citrus and hops.  Flavor is piney hops,  grapefruit,  orange and a bit of malt.  Little flashes of sweet fruit as well.  Finishes bitter yet very smooth.  Everything really mixes well in this.  Very complex without too much of anything overpowering,  yet it is bursting with flavor.  Wow.

From a 22-oz. bottle--Poured a light amber hue with a thick white head. Nose of thick, sticky, floral, piny, fruity hops.  Big and bold as hell.  This is what IPAs are all about.  Finished bitter and piquant. Love it!

Mreusch, thanks! Pours a clear amber with a large rocky off-white head and very nice lacings. Sweet with a light to medium bitterness. Some malt and caramel aromas, but mostly a good layer of hops. Grapefruit with a hint of resin. Also a bit of alcohol. Medium to full bodied with a slightly creamy texture. Medium carbonation with a long bitter and hoppy finish. Very good hops profile. Good stuff.
Beautiful amber colour with nice rocky off-white head. Very nice flowerish caramel scent followed by a smooth hoppy taste. A great experience - thank you for that.

22oz bottle.  Pours a clear, light amber with a half-inch high white head.  It lingered to produce nice lacing on the glass.  The aroma is huge hops sweet citrus and pine.  Mmmm!  This is the type of smell I expect from an IPA.  The taste was not as citrusy as the aroma, but still  fruity and could taste the sweet malt as well.  The mouthfeel was medium with lots of bitterness, yet it did not overpower the smoother sweetness.  Great beer!.  One of my top 3 IPAs.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2009 22 oz. bottle - pours clear copper with big hop nose coming off the thick white head; considerable lacing and added aroma mix of pine and sweet citrus; hops are very under the radar in the flavors as it leans much more to the malty and creamy finish; so tasty; a few weekends back i compared my first home brewed IPA to a few other brands with favorable comparisons, but an IPA like this really humbles me as a home brewer and a beer drinker!!  great stuff

As Ive come to expect from AleSmith, this pours with a dense head that lasts.  Smell is beautifully balanced between hops and malt; bitter, herbal, slightly grassy hop taste against a warm, lightly tooasted biscuit with honey malt flavor.  Touch of apricot fruitiness,  Body is full for an IPA, finish is mostly hop bitterness with a little fruit.

Thanks Tim! I had one of these but drank it before realizing that I had never rated it. Pine, flowery, citrus, and honey aroma. Taste is honey, pine, flowers, and tangerines. (tastes like simcoe & amarillo) Nice bitterness, but not overpowering. Nice flavor, nice mouthfeel.

Ah, its wonderful to find a beer that is exactly what you want from that style and more.  This one is loaded with hoppy goodness with aroma of pine, maple syrup, smoky pleasent-ness, and sweetness.  The body is full with just the right balance of alcohol, sweet syrupy malt, and bitter hop nature in the finish.  It has a thicker smoother texture than a thin IPA.  
The one weakness is that it has a huge white head that disappears very quickly.  One of my favourite beers.

Beautiful beer all around. Crystal clear dark amber reddish body with tons of visible carbonation. The white head on top was about a half inch and stuck to the sides.

Grapefruit, citrus, a touch of pine, and tasty. Just like an IPA should smell. Not as sweet as a double IPA would be which is perfect.

The hops are strong and up front in the flavor also, but they arent as citrusy as they were in the aroma. The hop flavors are more piney which seems to make it more sticky malty. The hop flavor is really clear but not what I expected or prefer in an IPA really. Just personal preference really. Big malt presence and a great amount of bitterness.

On the heavier end of what I would expect in an IPA, but still good. The malty backbone adds body.

Not my favorite IPA, but thats because I like a lot of grapefruity flavor. Certainly a top notch IPA though.

Aromas of light caramel malt, lots of pine and floral notes.  Flavor is toasted bread, nutty caramel and pine-hop flavor.  Very solid and satisfying, an almost perfect balance of sweet and bitter.  The texture is full with lively carbonation and it leaves your mouth slightly dry, which for me is a good thing.  Huge thanks to Brigadier for the unexpected surprise.

One of the best IPAs I have ever had.  The only thing was a little dissapointed in was the aroma, I expected a little more.  Was my first alesmith experience.  Did not leave a overpowering taste in my mouth.  I reccomend

10-14-07 bottle 
Peaches and apricots in the smell.  Strong flavor, quite thick and yummy (with hints of alcohol slightly).  Heavy and strong - but good.  This is warming (almost like whiskey is).  A slight bit drying on the finish.  Semi-translucent amber with lasting soapy head. Enjoyable - just a bit heavy.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2008 This is the best IPA available in a bottle, in my experience.  Extreme hops.  An amazing experience for the true hophead.  I really wish it was available in NM.

update to rating:
I was a little too excited when posting the above rave, and forgot to include much content.  But what more needs to be said about this one?  Here are some tasting notes anyway: Color is hazy gold, perfect frothy head, lots of little bubbles; aroma of flowers and citrus; this IPA hits your taste buds with a hops blast similar to stepping out of a warm house into an arctic windstorm; bitter citrus, lots of resiny effects that get your saliva glands going; long finish of fresh hops.  Every time I travel out of state I look for Alesmith products and try to smuggle them home.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2009 This beer hurts sometimes.  It isnt folded-in discomfort like Ruination; its just outright pain.  Its like they figured out how to sharpen IPA and use it like a blade.  This is not a sweet, floral or fruity IPA, but a piney one.  Despite the sharpness it is clean.
HUGE aroma!  Great head!  Lots of bitterness.  This beer is an excellent example of what an IPA is all about!  Lots of citrus aroma and flavor with big bitterness.  Compliments to the brewer!

Bottle: Poured a cloudy amber color with an offwhite head which left decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is classic good IPA. Strong and hoppy. Taste has a strong pine hop presence with a subtle hint of malt. An excellent IPA.
had this beer with my friend in Phoniex aat the Papago Brewery.  Great place and a great beer.  Cant get this one on the east coast, sadly so.

Bottle.  Pours an orange/amber color with a full-sized slightly off-white head.  Potent hop aroma, with lots of citrus, some pine and some slight floral notes.  Delicious aroma.  Flavor is also on the hoppy side.  Juicy citrus, pine & earthy notes and then a nice malt backbone.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2008 Thanks to lamas for the bottle.  22 oz. bottle.  Poured clear orange/amber with fluffy off-white head.  Pungent floral, citrusy nose.  Intense citrus, grapefruit, piney flavor.  Mouthfeel was a bit thin.  Definite warming alcohol noticeable.

Going on memory from last nights tasting.  Intense hop aroma, big head, solid IPA flavor with some citrus and slight fruit character.  One fellow taster even mentioned thinking there was smokiness in there, which is unusual.  I do need to give this another try and do a more thorough and proper rating.  But my impression is quite positive.
Pours a light amber with a medium sized head. Aroma of citrus, pine, some malt. Good flavor, bitter but not too bitter. Very good IPA.

pours a hazy honey with a big fluffy off-white head, with a bunch of little floaters hanging out.  big floral and citrus hops in the smell, with bubblegum turning to grapefruit turning into a big milkshakey malt smell.  taste is big grapefruit and a lot of that same tasty malt from the nose.  finishes with big but not harsh bitterness.  fairly full bodied for an almost chewy mouthfeel.  with a bit more alcohol and maybe a bit more hoppy bitterness, this would be a double ipa.  very big beer and great for a regular american ipa.  reminds me a lot of the summer yulesmith.

22 oz bottle via trade with JCB. Beautiful aroma of pine, citrus and the requisite sweet caramel and toffee to balance the hops. I could honestly smell this beer all day. Theres also just the smallest hint of flowers as well. Pours hazy orange with a nice creamy white head. Good lacing. Knocks you over the head with some bracing hops initially, but the malt kicks in to balance a bit. Its still quite hoppy, though. Lots of grapefruit and pine. Really fresh tasting. Rich and creamy on the palate with a nice dry, bitter kick on the finish. Tasty stuff!

Pours out a nice warm orange color with a thick light orange head. Aroma is sweet citrus, straight up grapefruit really. Throw in some pine and a bit of a flowery smell and there you have it. Taste is rediculously good the first thing you are hit with is a blast of sweetness so sweet at first it took me by surprise. Not to worry though, a second later the bitter grapefruit and evergreen taste rush in to save the day and blalance this guy out well. Very smooth to swallow, this beer goes down quick. Mouthfeel is about spot on and perfect to make this beer nice and refreshing. Dont let me fool you though this is still pretty "high gravity" and you will notice once your done.
22 oz. Bottle. Amber, orange pour, long lasting white head. Great citrus and hops aroma. Flavor was a more intense hops and citrus. Truely a great IPA !!!

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2007 Bottle. Amber body with hanging sediment, nice off-white head, piney nose with a hint of malt sweetness. Nice caramel malts balanced with PNW hops, silky mouthfeel, bitter but balanced.

22 oz bottle, lots of yeast left in the bottle.  Pours a orange, light amber.  Lots of head, 2 cm at a time, white to slightly off white, long lasting.  Aroma is sweet and strong with citrus, hint of pine.  Initial taste is mostly overwhelmed by the sweetness, turning citrusy, then very dry from all the hops.  There might be other components in there, but honestly when you dump that much hop-action in there, forget it.  Aftertaste is very hoppy and long lasting.  Light to medium body, very light carbonation.  Alcohol is well hidden and drinkable.  For the price Id prefer something else, but maybe worth another drink down the line.

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2007 Thanks so much to Fordest for the bottle and my 400th rating.
Amber pour with a huge white meringue like sticky and lasting head.  Smell is sweet fruity hops at first, with some citrusy notes and then hops turn more earthy.  Taste is a quite sharp hoppy bitterness and flavor.  Some light sweetness, but I personally would like to see just a touch more to balance out the big hops.  After pouring the end of the bomber, it clouds up and is a nice hazy amber, and the body seemed to thicken up a bit.  The alcohol is well hidden, and although this isnt one of my top 2 or 3 favorite IPAs its still quite good, strong in hop flavor, and one worth trying.

frothy off white head.  hops aroma. Grapefruit, spruce, citrus.  Color is a dark golden orange.  crisp very drinkable beer. More hops with a some malts for backbone. Great balance. Finish is a little dry with good lingering bitterness. Perfect finish.  Great IPA.
Strong piney-citrusy character. The alcohol is blended well for a big IPA. This is one of those classic IPAs that you use to judge other IPAs by. I would love to try it on-tap, only had the bomber.

Huge head, clear orange pour with nice lacing.  Malt - cookie and a hint of caramel.  Hops - grapefruit, citrus, maybe spruce.  Alc is noticeable but doesnt detract.  Lots of bitterness with a long somewhat dry finish.

Bottle: Pours orange and copper color with big white frothy head. Aroma of citrus fruits, lots of fresh orange and grapefruit hop aroma. Flavor is malty but overpowered by the hops, lots of citrus, pithy rind  bitterness, clean and smooth with lots of tingly bitterness at the finish all over the tongue.

Bottled. Thx Marsiblursi. 
Amber colour, with big foam. Delicat aroma, very much finesse here: Wheat? Laid back hoparoma with oranges. Wonderful flavour in perfect balance, starting with excellent maltiness at first, then comes waves of tropical fruits, before a very nice, lingering bitterness sets in. Very soft mouthfeel with tad vanilla. IPA meets IIPA here.

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2008 (Bottle, thanks WeeheavySD) Pours hazy amber with a big foamy white head. Hops up front in the aroma with tones of citrus, mostly grapefruit, pine and resin. Some subtle tropical mango tones. Nicely toasted malt is well integrated with sweet tones of white bread, light caramel and light cookie. Hints of creamy vanilla ice cream. Creamy, toasted malt and balanced, creping up on you style-ish hop bitterness in flavour. Grapefruit up front with fruits, citrus and hints of berries in the background. Tiny caramelly. Also some floral/pine and resin. Creamy, round and velvety mouthfeel with a minty touch. Light sweet and perfect medium to full bitterness. Light to medium body. Best IPA in the world? Probably!

poured into tulip.  pours a cloudy orange with full frothy white head.  citruss, strong hoppy aroma.  almost a milky smooth palate.  smooth, sweet citruss orange front, with a great mouthfeel to it.  bitterness peeks at the perfect time in the middle, but goes into a nice smooth finish.  complexity at how it approaches the palate and finishes off.  good.

Thanks to Liquorama for still delivering this to Maryland for me.  Lord only knows when Id have had the chance to try it otherwise.
A very light, dry IPA that finishes very clean.  Bitterness at the end is very rounded & complementary.  Floral hoppy aroma from the start hints at the complex flavor of this excellent beer.
Alesmith must know my tastebuds because everything I have tasted has been excellent! Perfect smell floral hops and guess what it also taste perfect with appropiate amount of bitterness. Great beer.

This beer made me sad. Sad that even though I live in California, I dont have access to it in Northern California. I had to make a SoCal trip to get it. If I had access to it, I would have this stocked at my house 24/7. This is a beer that is just simply stunning from start to finnish. Aroma is perfectly balanced with big bready sweet malts, and juicy citrusy hops. Smelling this beer just made my mouth water. This beer was just insanely tasty. Once the beer hit my tastebuds it was over. Im used to solid WC IPAs but this was clearly a breed apart. Its citrusy hop blast is counterbalanced with the malts in a way that is something to appreciate. You start getting all kinds of different flavors...passion fruit, grapefruit, tart apples, papayas. Excellent beer. Highly recommended.

650ml Bottle from Bevmo. This is rating #100. Pours a a deep rich, slightly cloudy, copper color with a big off-white sudsy head. Plenty of lacing and long retention in the head. Aroma is very strong and is dominated by grapefruit, lemons, sugar cane and hops. Flavor was a bit subtle and subdued compared to many IPAs that Ive sampled. The taste experience starts with dry hazelnuts and walnuts in the forefront, oranges, pine and grapefruit fill in the edges, and biter hops and clean malts bring up the rear. Mouthfeel was robust, full and creamy, carbonation was ample and prickly. The finish was long with biter hops and sweet malts. Overall: every sip left me wanting another bigger sip, needless to say this beer went down fast. This is one truly great IPA.
Bottle courtesy of bonus per KingG.  One of the better IPAs that had more of a IIPA feel to it.  Lots of citrus and pines to it.  Will try to get more of this one.

bottle shared by bdigi66 - Pours copper with a lingering head.  It has a nice citrus hop aroma.  Theres really good hop flavor with citrus and pine notes and enough malt to balance it.  Medium bodied, crisp hops finish... this is an excellent brew.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2009 
Date: February 21, 2004
Mode: Bottle
Source: Tasting, RateBeer SE Gathering, 2004
Appearance: dark yellow
Aroma: sweet carmel malt aroma with lots of hops
Flavor: well balanced flavor with enough malt to back up the tempered hops
Overall: does not quite live up to the aroma

Date: February 21, 2007
Mode: bottle
Source: tasting
Score: 3.6 to 3.9
Appearance: lots of lace
Flavor: great creamy hop flavor
Overall: still short of the aroma but a wonderful hop flavor

Aroma: 8/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 16/20
Rating: 3.9/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: **4

Holy sh..........  Damn this was good.  Deep caramel in color and had a small, bubbly white head.  Ridunculous lacing.  Sweet candied sugar aroma, notes of piney hops and citrus.  This smell penetrates the inner-workings of the olfactory system and holds it hostage.  Very good mouth feel, smooth and perfectly carbonated.  Grassy, flowery, sweet citrus taste that is all balanced and melded together remarkably.  This brew rocked.
Pours amber with a thick frothy white head.... aroma is very floral and hoppy... bitter taste with a hint of citrus and pines.... very smooth texture

I got a bottle from CBKSCHUBERT and I have one thing to say about this, it is the best IPA Ive ever had, hands down.  Loaded with grapefruity goodness and just the proper amount of bitterness this beer pleases IPA lovers and people who cant really handle the intense bitterness an IPA can put out.

Poured a nice golden color into a pint glass.  Smelled nice, but not as aggressive as some.  Taste is hints of citrus, lemon, pine, with some nice balancing malt.  This beer is quite drinkable and very balanced.  Not as sharp or powerful as a lot of other IPAs, but expertly crafted.  Comes together great.

Bottle from Bevmo in Solana Beach, CA. Pours a amber brown with a very nice beige head. Smells of spicy hops and sweet malt. Taste is over pine, grapefruit, and resin with a nice caramel sweet malt backing. This beer has so many subtleties that it is hard to describe it all. But Ill say this.. you see everyone saying this is a great beer and the best of the IPAs... well, it is. It is definitely one the best out there and deserving of a great rating. If you have a chance to have this beer, dont pass it up. Also had this on draft at the Stone World Bistro and Gardens, but didnt rate it at that time.

Bottle.   Pours  lightly hazy copper with a large light tan head.   Aroma is citrus, pine, grapefruit, orange, mango.   Flavor is grassy, pine, grapefruit, caramel malt, orange.   Palate is medium bodied, medium carbonation, finishes bitter, with a prickly feel.   Very nice, could drink this all day.

Pours lightly hazy copper with a large light tan head.  The aroma is a citrus hop bomb with lost of grapefruit, some orange and pine needles.  There is also some sweet toasted malt in the background.  Medium smooth body with prickly carbonation and oily resin that lingers around.  The flavor starts with pine, woody, earthy hops and a minor amount of grapefruit.  The finish is highly resiny with pine needles and very sweet bubblegum style malt.  The malt is mostly muted by the thick malts.  A very nice IPA.
Thanks KingpinIPA for sharing this one! Pours a golden yellow color with a white head. Awesome hoppy/citrus aroma. Nice big hop flavor.Great bitter ending that seems to last for awhile! Great IPA!

Amber golden with a huge, nice and creamy head and a wonderfully hoppy aroma with loads of citrus and resin. The flavour is hoppy, really hoppy with a nice and powerful bitterness with loads of citrus, resin, grass and some caramel. Its very harmonic and a real pleasure for any hop-head - yummi - thank you After4ever/Tom for this gem!! 2473
Thanks to Juancho.  Pours a cloudy, golden color with a long head.  Taste is complex that you have to have it at the right temperature.  Hoppy to the extreme, but well balanced with the citrus taste.

22oz. Bomber
$6.33
Liquid Solutions

Ive been looking forward to drinking some AleSmith IPA. Finally getting my chance tonight. An average pour produced a half glass full of head. Letting it die down a little the head became very dense and craggy leaving big chunky lacing down the glass. The body has a very mild chill haze with few tiny carbonation bubbles swirling throughout. The body has a slight orange tint along the lines of iced tea. Very nice looking beer.

Very enjoyable aroma with a big but not overpowering pine needle nose. As it warms grapefruit rind comes forward. Biscuity malt lingers in the background and compliments the pine nicely. Mild alcohol vapors rise through and add a spicy note.

More caramel malt in the flavor than the biscuity malt that was in the aroma. The biscuity malt is there but takes a back seat to the caramel. The main flavor component is the hops, just like any good IPAs main characteristic is. Pine oils coat the tongue and linger on after the malt presence fades. As this beer warms the grapefruit becomes more pronounced. Again, very mild alcohol adds a welcomed spiciness. Very solid. 

The mouthfeel is spot on. Medium body with a creamy airy texture. Nice bitterness on the swallow in the back of the throat. Exactly as I would want a good IPA to feel like.

Highly drinkable. In no way over the top which hurts the drinkability of other IPAs. Somewhat balanced but leaning toward the hops. After every sip you immediately want another.

A solid IPA from AleSmith. Perfect example of a left coast IPA. My first foray into AleSmith beers and it definately wont be my last. I just need to figure out how to get more.

7/1/07
Very good IPA, amber color with slight carbonation. Hops smell with a dry finish. Cant go wrong with Alesmith

Bomber. Strong mixed aroma of citrus and pine. No room for malt. Golden amber color with a frothy white head. It laces a little. Thin to medium body. Mild carbonation that turns creamy. The flavor is strong citrus, with a lesser amount of evergreen resin, and some malt sweetness lurking about. You have to focus to notice the malt. Theres fruit in the finish, but Id say more grapefruit than stone fruit. Mild heat. Nice enduring grapefruit. Its a good one. Could stand up to some IIPAs. Made my millenium. Damn. A surge of sweet malt just snuck in. Looks like it will vary with time. Cool.
Cloudy orange pour with off white head. Decent lacing. Aroma is nice mix of hops, citrus and some grassy notes. Flavor is sweetness and hops...peaches as well.

Drank it out of a bottle before work the other day, probably should have actually sat down and enjoyed it.  Strong in hops as soon as you pop the top.  Lets you know what to expect, and doesnt let you down.  A very nice IPA.

Bottle:  Pours a clear, orange amber with a few suspended particles.  Thick off-white head and thick lacing.  Nose is simple enough, citrus and floral hops with a sweet maltiness.  Flavor is hoppy, yet not overly aggresive.  Citrus and florals go well with the malt presence.  I expected more flavor intensity, but this is still a pleasant and top notch IPA.
bottled.  like a milder version of yulesmith in its uniqueness.  some grapefruit and licorice, apple, berry, citrus, and lots of hops.  some vanilla, so freakin awesome.
Tried at the brewery, while buying some Decadence.  Nice hoppy aroma.  Mild carbonation from draft.  Burnt yellow color.  Grassy nose and taste.  Veery drinkable.

Bottle.  Pours a murky amber color with lots of floating sediment and a thick off-white head.  Aroma is hoppy with a strong pine nose to it.  Flavor is nice and hoppy, with hints of grapefruit and a bitter pine finish to it.  Another top-notch offering from Alesmith.
UPDATED: JUN 5, 2008 Poured amber with a lot of head. Smell is awesome, lots of citrus notes and hops. Taste is hoppy and pretty rich for an IPA.
