i am so mad this was the first bottle of "bad" beer ive gotten, the conditioning must have gone awry because there was no carbonation, so the beer ended up being horribly unbalance without any bubbles, ill judge how i can though, and how id imagine it taste

I think I want to try another bottle of this, in hopes the one I had was "aged" or not stored properly.  It was too fluffy for me, I felt like I was drinking a marshmellow.  Note: not a marshmellow beer, but actually like a melted overly sweet cloying a little marshmellow.  Anyway, pour was goldenish.  Nose was mild hops with a fair share of malt as well.  Taste was barely IPA at all, just the fore mentioned marshmellow.  Now dont get me wrong, I like marshmellow, just not in my ipa.

Mmmm i need an air freshner that smells like this. Tasty times, other then when i popped the top that bottle damn near exploded brew all over, never fear, i shotgunned most of it before it hit the floor. Lots of hops, much like many other IPAs before this. Im a big fan, but have come to the conclusion that i will not find an IPA as good as Furious, but i am bias a weeee bit as well. SITTM came real close though....

Wow this is amazing IPA. Beautiful amount of hops that memorize your pallet. I love the Stone IPA, but this is better! I recommend draft if you have the option. One of the best IPAs I have ever had. Delicious.

Sampled at csbosoxs tasting 7/3. Pours a hazy amber/orange with a creamy off-white head. The nose is big grapefruit and a faint pine. I began salivating like Pavlovs dog when the aroma hit me. Medium-bodied, creamy, smooth and clean with a lightly bitter finish. Grapefruit, pine and resiny hops with a nice malt backing. This beer is way to easy to drink for 7.25% & if they ever start selling it in KS or MO, well be spending a whole lot of time together. (If you want a more flowery and amusing review, read MrRains. I agree w/everything he says, except perhaps the "urine of a dehydrated man" part. That scores a 5 on appearance, huh?)

This beer is the same color as the urine from a dehydrated man.  The head is thick, fluffy and persistent.  It leaves a lace like those little doilies your grandma put under her imitation Ming vase.  It smells like hop resin and citrus.  The nose is quite bitter and almost burns a little.  Just smelling this gem makes my mouth water.  The first sip slides down the groove in the center of your tongue like a thief gliding, unseen down an alleyway.  When it gets to the big buds on the back side of your mouth it splashes like a flood to the sides of your tongue where suddenly your mouth lights up in happy ecstasy.  The corners of your lips curl up slightly and your eyes narrow.  Ah!  Hops and grapefruit permeate the flavor.  On the next swallow you hold the beer in your cheeks and roll your tongue around in a bath of Romanesque indulgence.  A slight pine wood flavor can be detected.  After drink thereafter requires that you sniff the glass as you raise it to your lips in a passion of foreplay.  The body does this involuntarily.  As the beer warms up it gains body and dimension, becoming fuller and more complex.  Images of small hexagonal beer molecules dance in your head like sugarplums on Christmas Eve.  The stratus-like lacing hides the beer from the Budweiser fan sitting across from you at the table.  He doesnt even understand and you have no way to explain it to him.  This beer is the epitome of what an IPA should be.  This beer should have been included on the Voyager for extra-terrestrial life to sample.  This beer iconifies one of mans greatest achievements.

Golden pour thick off-white head.  Citrus and hops on the nose.  Grapefruit and hops in the flavor.  Bitterness is subdued but builds as I get into the beer.  Everything is working right with this one.

thanks dirty_martini! Clear amber with a great off white head. the head will not go away and it leaves some fantastic lacing. big piney caramel orange aroma. bittersweet piney orange caramel flavor. bitter piney caramel orange finish. boatloads o hops on the finish. the big side of medium bodied. fantastic soft subtle carbonation. perfect. fairly standard but fantastic ipa.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2010 Initial rate 7/2/2007...22oz bottle, light amber hue, lasting creamy white head with nice lacing, very sweet hoppy smell (went nice with peanut butter,) creamy texture, a little nector + piney which is how I like my IPAs, this is has a touch of a bitter finish but nicely hopped and not too overbearing, really this is a great one, crisp...Re--rate 3/12/2010...Golden yellow hue with very big explosive head, candy and honey mixed with citrus, light feathery mouthfeel, somewhat sweet, comparable to the best

Bottle.  Pours a nice glowing deep orange color with a light tan head.  Aroma has a caramelized grapefruit tone to it and overall is real earthy and grassy.  Nice sticky palate.  Grassy hop kick to start, great malt base underneath, strong, almost peppery finish.  The finish lingers nicely and the alcohol isnt too apparent.  Damn tasty.

22 oz bottle. Poured a clear dark orange color. Head was off white, thick, creamy, and left some lace on the glass as I drained it. Smelled of grapefruit, pine resin, and cotton candy. Flavor was a nice mixture of toffe and grapefruity hops. The body was a bit lighter than I had expected and there was only mild hop bitterness.

Deep golden/light orange pour with plenty of carbonation to retain a light beige head. The aroma is almost entirely hops that release gentle but focused and hearty notes of grapefruit, tangerine, orange and a hefty swath of pine that cuts a path through all the aforementioned citrus and gives the nose a pleasant earthy feel. Malt is evident, but just barely. Alcohol is well concealed. The flavor is wonderful and very stimulating. More hops and light toasted grains. Light sweetness and heavy bitterness. Acidity is mild and the taste is very green. The mouthfeel is very creamy and appropriately carbonated, light to medium bodied. Its incredibly smooth, the strongest facet of the entire experience. The finish is bone dry, crisp and clean, with acidic notes lingering and lightly cutting into the tongue. An exceptional IPA, no surprise at all.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2007 Rating #400.  22 oz. Bomber from South Bay Drugs Pharmacy via mail order.  Shared with csbosox on the porch on a perfect early summer afternoon.  Pour is a slightly cloudy deep orange with a big rocky white head.  Aroma is pine, grapefruit and resiny hops.  A nice maltiness is in the background of the nose.  Taste is more of the hops, especially the grapefruit all nicely balanced with the malt backbone.  The finish is a nice bit of sourness to it.  Very nice beer all the way through.

pours a lovely cloudy burnt orange with a decent frothy head 
                  with slight lacing. The nose of grapefruit, orange rind, pure 
                  citrus, and hops is quite delectable. 

                  Well on first taste all you can really say is balanced. 
                  Extremely balanced fruit, hop, alcohol. Same fruits as in the 
                  nose. Very attractive hops not to tannic yet not to subtle. 
                  Type of IPA you can just sit around and drink, and drink, and 
                  drink, and drink, and finally pass out. MMM Delicious.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2007 Pour was a slightly murky dark gold and pale copper color.  The head was foamy, thick and ever so slightly off-white.  Good rings of lacing.  The initial aroma was a blast of citrus that smelled like fresh-squeezed orange juice.  Butter and caramel as well as pine and floral hops are noted as well.  The flavor was malt and citrus up front and pine bringing down the hop hammer in the back.  Expectedly succinct finish.  Nice, medium bodied mouthfeel.  Very good.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2008 Wow. The most amazing IPA that I have had to date.  Pours a light, fluffy, golden color with an off-white head.  Taste is of soft passion fruit and a little bit of pine.  A very transitional IPA that goes from juicy hops to a sweet malt, back to a slightly pine hop bitterness. Nearly perfect IPA.
---re-rate---
Another fresh bottle from Joey at South Bay.  
Well, this one has the same passionfruit aroma with lots of citrus and a touch of alcohol kick to it to boot.
Taste is a lot more caramel and punchy fruit, but the fruit/hop note is subdued by the alcohol and bitterness until the very end, when it finishes creamy and smooth. 
I don’t think I’ll change my rating too much at this point.  I mean, it is an IPA.  
Definitely a lot of citrus and pine behind the passion fruit.
848417

pours a hazy deep golden with moderate rocky head.  aroma is a huge pineapple, citrus and somewhat pine with some sweet malt behind.  taste is big pineapple and citrus with some nice sweet malt behind.  finish is wonderfully biscuit and citrus bitter.  some soapiness to it but it is quite nice.  this beer has a quite oily hop nature to the body but is quite refined.

22 oz bomber bought at From the Vine. Loved the nose on this. I coould smell it as soon as I started to pour. A very lush looking orange brown in color. Hop heaven. One of those beers I will always keep around.

Dear Alesmith, may I make a proposition? If you send me a case or two of this heavenly IPA, I will promote your beer free of charge. That may not sound like much but let me clarify that Ill do this in a classroom filled with mostly underage drinkers. Using the power of chalk and personality, I will sow the seeds of social degeneracy by promoting this specific beer, possibly the finest IPA Ive had. I will talk about its lovely look, its huge mouthfeel, its immense flavor of floral and citrus hops and its pleasing malt heft. But mostly Ill just corrupt the young (oh, and Ill wear a sandwich-board too).

The Dan Journal #22.  Tasted 5/30/07.  22oz bomber.  Hazy and orange brown hue.  Caramel malts and citrus in the nose.  Zesty.  Big citrus boom.  Delicious!  Tight palate.  FnA.  Nice malt kick with a bitter lingering hop finish.  This is a tremendous brew!  Absolutely wonderful!

Bottle, split with NachlamSie. Pours hazy amber with a very tall fluffy beige head. Aroma is juicy sweet pineapple, grapefruit, and pine. Not very aggressive, just nicely stated. Flavor is very resiny, lots of sticky pine and grapefruit, with a sufficient amount of malty backbone. Mouthfeel is non-aggressive and actually fit for massive consumption. Wish I could get this more easily.

Bottle split with Muenster. Pours a cloudy amber/orange with a very tall white head that lasts, lasts, lasts, and lasts. Great smelling IPA here. Its heavy on the pineapple with dry pine resin, a bit of malts. Its exotic and spicy all around. Okay, here I am being critical, I could use some more hops, but jeez, it is hoppy indeed. Finish is dry with just a hint of juiciness resonating from a grilled pineapple flavor. Its insanely drinkable. An appealing level of sticky pine is found throughout. This is a damn good beer, it is.

(Bottle 65 cl) Courtesy of Storm. Hazy, amber golden with a creamy, off-white head leaving laces. Fresh, citrusy hop aroma. Medium body, light notes of caramel and very distinct citrus and peach from the hops. Rather hoppy finish. Solid West Coast IPA. 310507
Greta looking brew. Pours a chrytal clear amber color. Head is very nice, stays with the brew all the way through. Very drinkable, and good IPA

Pours a reddish brown with a thick head. Aroma of hops and malt. The hops have a strong citrus element in the aroma and lend a grapefruit finish that meshes well with the peppery, yeasty, sweetness of the beer.  Best IPA of the 25 or so Ive tried.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2009 Bottle in a pint glass.  Pours copper with a dense rocky lasting white head and excellent lacing.  Aroma of fresh hop flowers and some citrus.  Flavor of bitter hops and more hops and then some hops.  Surprisingly medium-light body.  Super-dry disappearing flavor seems like it should linger at least a little.  Nice beer, but the best IPA in the world?  Well, Ill have to rate some others and see.

re-rate: Now that Im a big fan of hoppy IPAs, this one is awesome.  Just the right amount of biscuit honey fruit aromatic hop bitterness and bouquet and flavor and orangy citrus. Outstanding.  More points for everything.

22oz bottle. pours golden-amber with white head. nice nose of PNW hops, piney and grapefruit. flavor is nice and bitter with piney grapfruit hop notes and a bit of biscuit. taste fresh, clean, and highly refreshing. abv well hidden. carbination is smooth. real tasty.

Bomber, brought back from San Diego in December.  Dark orange color with huge, long lasting, creamy head.  Aroma is citrus hops, some bitter hops in aroma, sweet malt, doughy yeast, toffee, very nice.  Nice full body, with little carb, very creamy, very apropiate.  Very balanced malt and hops, toffee, piney.  This is an amazing beer, I will have to taste it fresh.

Bottle.  Outstanding hop aroma of citrus, pine, mango, and pineapple.  Smells a little chalky.  The mouthfeel is about perfect (smooth and just the right amount of carbonation).  Flavor has significant malt with all the nice hop flavors mentioned before but a little too resiny.  Probably my favorite IPA.

22 oz bottle.  Pours dark dull orange color with huuuge white head that lingers forever.  Lots of yeast floaties, nice lacing.  Smells very sweet, lots of citrusy hops.... tastes the same... very well balanced.  Would buy again.

22oz.  Pours a fiery orange with a gigantic, rocky white head that takes forever to go away and leaves monster lace down the entire glass.  A lot of bubbles flow to the top on this one.  This is a perfect looking beer.  The aroma is quintessential IPA smell: sweet, citrusy hops.  Very sweet without smelling sugary or artificial, just nice natural fruit.  Taste is sweet, fruity hops, crisp and bitter and even refreshing.  It could use more hop kick but now Im just being greedy.  This beer does all it should do and does it very well.  The best IPA Ive had.
22oz  Pours mostly orange, clear, thick head.  Smells really citrusy, and hoppy.  Flavor is grapefruit, lots of hops, quite bitter.  Mouthfeel is carbonated.  Good ipa overall.

Orange amber with fluffy head, good lacing. Smells like hops and oranges. Nice smooth palate and added grapefruite flavor. More bitter than sweet... a bit lacking of malts. But overall very well done, finishes milky smooth and dry.

Bottle; Poured an orange-amber-gold, with a large off white head; lacing.  Aroma of pine and citrus, with some caramel malt.  Great smooth flavor and mouthfeel.  Nice pine and citrus to start with some caramel and toasted malt behind it.  Some sweetness, but not much.  Lingering finish, slightly dry.  Some alcohol warmth.  Due to the flavor and creaminess of the mouthfeel, I might have drank this too quickly.

This starts off with a strong citrus/pine aroma, with a hint of tannin underneath.  It pours a slightly cloudy amber, with about a quarter of an inch of head that left great lacing.  This has a wonderful bitter taste, with a bit of astringency in it and a nice long finish.  This is simply an amazing IPA.

Poured an amber color with a white fluffy head. Aroma of pine, hops, and citrus.Taste was exceptionally smoothe with earthy hops and citrus. At first it started off a tad sweet and finished with a hoppy bitterness. A very smoothe bitter flavor. Another excellent brew from AleSmith. Thanks again Larry.
UPDATED: SEP 29, 2016 22 oz bottle. Pours a nice orangeish color with a good size head. Smells citrusy and the hops taste citrusy as well, with a good bitterness. A good IPA.

Rusty orange hue, letting through a very marginal amount of light.  Nose exhibits grapefruits, band-aid and soured whiskey, similar to rotting wood.  Tastes crisp and vegetal to start - pine needles and a hint of garlic.  Some sweetened tea flavor, chemicals, peaches.  Woodsy caramel malts affect the aftertaste.  Resinous but distantly sweet palate.  A disappointment considering its pedigree - it might be just slightly past its prime.  Still easily enjoyed.  Thanks Jason!

Very clear copper pour, big white head from the yeast. Aroma is big on citrus and floral, with a touch of peach  and just smells dry-hopped. Flavor is citrus hops all the way and very leafy and fresh from being dry-hopped its like opening a bag of hops. Sweet caramel malts to balance it out. Very creamy mouthfeel almost like drinking it on cask with low carbonation and just an extremely soft and easy mouthfeel, I drank the whole bottle by myself in like 15 minutes. Good beer.
On tap at Stone.  Good storng hoppy, citrus, and pine aroma.  Good crisp taste with decent bitterness.  I damn good IPA!

Bottle. A hoppy IPA. Bitter and dry and not as aggressively hoppy a othe USIPAs. This has some grapefruit, pine and lychee notes, leafy hop flavours. Yes it was hoppy, but i didnt think it was over the top. very nice.

Bottle- thanks to Sickboy282. Awesome. The hype is huge on this one, but beer deserves the praise. Amber/orange in appearence, great head retention. Smells of pnws, but offers much more than many in the style. Very piney. The malt backbone is also great, and its complexity is what distinguishes this beer from many other west coast ipas. Wish I had more of these.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2007 Ive had my eye on this one for awhile and finally decided to give it a go.
Pours a golden amber with a nice quarter inch head.  The frothiness sticks around and leaves plenty of lacing as you drink.
Smell isnt really strong, but I get plenty of hops in the nose.
The taste is simply amazing.  This is a very well rounded IPA.  Plenty of hops, but balanced perfectly by the malt and alcohol.  This is one of the best Ive had.  I would love to drink this on a regular basis.
Words cant really explain how well this is melded together and how smooth of a IPA it is.  If you have access to this beer, definitely pick it up.  I know Ill be frequenting this beer often.

Ive got to say, this is really worth the effort to track down, especially if its not distributed to your state. Hazy pour with nice amounts of billowy head. Like many IPAs the piney scent is there, but not overpowering. Before I drank this I downed a NXNW Kodiak IPA, which I had aged for little over a month, and the piney scent of that was much stronger. The AleSmith was a great combination of grapefruit, nectarine, orange cream, and malty hop. The finish isnt long enough when it comes to something as satisfying in the mouth as this. Didnt pick up too much Vanilla--like the label says, but it was no biggie--this was truly great. Now one of my favorites.

pours copper with a nice off white head. aroma of pine and grapefruit. mouthful is a smooth hoppy pine and citrus with a great malty backbone, but the hops dominate. very nice... too bad it is not distributed to VA.

Bottle: One of the finest beer to touch these lips. Very well balanced for me and extremely easy to drink. Pours a nice orange haze with a creamy white head. Great beer, especially early. Cant say enough good things about this brew.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2015 Bottle. Thanks to BockeyHorsey and Batkins for sending this to me. Pours a deep golden body with nice head. Aroma is very hoppy with a nice earthy feel. Taste has a slight syrupy citrus feel, hoppy. Smooth and ends in a nice bite. Well balanced IPA. Rerate, taste is very balanced with an almost perfect mouth feel. I enjoy how the citrus and grapefruit seem to linger later on in the palate.

22oz bottle shared with DeuceDeuceOU, deliciously dark IPA, much heavier in the "dark" bitterness than a 2hrted ale, Piney and citrusey, a good combo in my book,not going for balance they sure hit the mark with this one.

Having just recently trying this IPA for the first time, I was throughly impressed.  Impressed enough to buy a few more and ship one to my buddy.  He agrees with me, the best IPA I have ever tried.  I like this so much because its simple, easy to drink, and excessively hoppy.  The simple, less malty consistancy allows the hops to take control.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2008 Aroma is very floral perfumey with grapefruit as well. Orange in color with a velvet 1/2 inch head. Flavor is more floral and citrus hops with slight sweet balancing malt. I also tasted a little sweet vanilla as I was getting down to the bottom of the beer. Not too chewy or resiny, could taste a little alcohol. A nice IPA>

Pours a hazy dark orange with a light white head.  Rich floral hops smell, some citrus blended in as well.  Very nice, nothing too overwhelming.  Really pleasant hops.  Tastes of rich, strong hops as well, not piney, more citrus than anything.  A little bitter up front, but nothing offensive.  Finishes really smooth and the aftertaste has a little cinnamon or brown sugar which makes it sweet.  Just a fantastic IPA from a fantastic brewery.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2009 Bottle at Chris O bottlefest 2007.  Great grapefruity aroma with citrus and tangerine.  One of the best aromas Ive had on a beer.  In mouth, fantastic, but harsh on finish.  So much tangerine, its pretty awesome as the label says, but it fades as a beer towards the end. 4.3/5.  Bottle from BeerMerchants.com Feb 2009.  I agree with my rating about the aroma, the hops attack you even before they are out of the bottle, but it really is a sublime hop aroma.  Not harsh, just creamy and floral and flowery and full of lychee.  Up against Stone Ruination, its hard to call, but nice to be given the chance.  THis is more floral on the hop, almost more delicate if that can makes sense for such a hugely hoppy beer.  Is it worth £11?  Yes.  Definitely, better than most wines of the same price.   I certainly cant rate it any lower than Ruination.  The more I drink it the more I like it, or is that the more I drink it, the more drunk I get?  Along with the Speedway, this is a world class beer.  Big hop without being harsh, unbelievably huge but subtle at the same time.  Really quite an experience.  You really do feel that this is an event rather than a beer.   Really quite exceptional.  Just about flawless in terms of an ipa from the West Coast.

Nice citrus and herbal hop nose with a soft biscuity malt note. Clean, crisp and dry on the palate. It builds resinous hop notes as it warms and develops a wonderful lingering bitterness. nice dry clean finish.

Bomber, pours a clear golden with a large white pillowy head and great lacing.  Aroma of floral, grapefruit, pine/resin, and maybe a hint of caramel malt.  Taste is a nice hops bite with a smoother malty finish.  This is one nice IPA that leans a bit to an IIPA, but not so much so as to be hops intense.  Theres some nice subtly going on here that isnt usually present in your average IPA.  Highly recommended.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2008 thanks to az wine for the free bottle, although $3.89 is a great price to pay.  citrusy, soapy nose. starts out quite malty and citrusy and finishes with a huge hop drop kick.. im not really an IPA guy but could find myself silly drinkin this. 3.7
re rate...been sitting on a bottle for about a year. still a bunch of grapefruit in the nose.hops flavors have mellowed a bit to let the malt sugars shine. for a regular ipa, this kicks. still a little on the sweet side though

fresh bottle...orange hue with a soft white head. candy grapefruit and orange aroma with a touch of pine essence. flavor is still a bit on the sweet side but worth it in the end... nice dry finish is rather twig-ish without being bitter. super soft mouth feel. 8/3/8/4/18=4.1

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2008 A nice step up from the Anvil, this IPA serves up a nice dose of hoppy aroma coming from a pillowy head, with a good copper/deep golden color. Grapefruit, orange, and slight hay notes in the flavor that finishes with nicely in a dry hop bitterness. Great session beer again, this is one of my go-tos as far as IPAs are concerned. I am very appreciative to live in San Diego with all the great Alesmith stuff here.
Good IPA. Pours a clear amber with good head retention. Slightyly sweet maslt with a nice bitter finish. Got a "soapy hint a couple of times.
ChrisFest Grapefruit flower aroma. Intense and too much. Quite ugly and aggressive. Like drinking washing up liquid.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2008 Big fan of this beer, just like most of the AleSmith collection.  Very aromatic and citrus like - oranges, dry hoppy finish - very excited for each and every sip.  Could enjoy this anytime.  Try it!

Most definitely one of the best "single" IPAs.  Gives Stone IPA a run for its money...whatever that means.  Maybe its better than Stone...I dunno...its really close.  Anyway...the aroma and flavor resemble that of a DIPA.  In fact, this one out DIPAs a lot of DIPAs out there.  Obviously, its hoppy and citrusy, as any good IPA is.  And, I think there was some vanilla caramel in there.  A wonderful drinking experience.

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2009 fruitpunch...grapefruit kandy pez and hops with a meek malt backbone. nice foamy white head that is weak but lasting. hoppy fruity and tart without chalk it morphs and at times is a bit plastic. eventful and satisfying.

A mix of floral, soapy and citrusy hops atop a pleasant, but subdued, orange-juice like sweetness pushes this IPA well above average for me. Hazy orange pour with small, but creamy head. Huge nose of grapefruit, pine, orange peel, flowers and perfume. The flavor is sweet, but only for a short time before turning bitter and staying that way for long after the swallow. The medium body is smooth and comfortable. Nicely carbonated.

22 oz. bottle: Honey orange pour with a dull copper core.  The thick white head settles to an ever present thin cap.  The nose is near perfection, layer upon layer of hoppy goodness.  Sweet perfume, rose petals, sugary oranges, bitter grapefruit - all in perfect balance.  Creamy caramel malts work to balance the resiny hops in the body.  Bright and citrusy, this really teeters on a DIPA for me.  Long, lingering bitterness is a nice last impression for this hop monster.

A Mes rate: Bottle at Chris O’s extravaganza. Amber colour with and off white head. Hoppy and spicy aroma with plenty of lemon and grapefruit. Gives just a hint of the full on hop assault that you are about to experience. For me the flavour is just way too hoppy. Floral and soapy and just whatever, WAY too much. Palate is just too tangy due to the excessive hopping you have just endured. Hops are great. An overload of hops does not a good beer make. Compared to say a Russian River this is just seriously lacking finesse. Way over rated in my opinion.
Not a bad IPA but not the best i have had, has good strong aroma of hops and you can taste those hops too, nice crisp bitterness to it

Duane shared a bottle of this gem with me.  Thanks Dad!  Id been wanting to try this for a long time and I was not disappointed when I finally got to try it!  Light copper/amber in color with a nice fluffy head and good retention.  Strong hoppy aroma with a some smooth malt mixed in there as well.  Strongly hoppy flavor with a decent amount of malt to balance it out.  Reminds me of Two Hearted, only not quite as balanced.  Lots of sticky hop resins hold on to your tongue and linger around long after youve swallowed.  AleSmith never disappoints!
Very good, hop aroma is not as strong as sculpin(sp?) but definitley a great taste. Strong, bitter flavor, one of the better IPAs.
user_location: New York City, New York, USA

text: Bomber.  Pours light amber with copper tones with reddish highlights.  Great cream head.  Unbelievable apricot, resiny aroma.  Very well balanced.  Light caramel malt flavor.  Finish is dry and bittersweet, as in plums and black cherries, as the commercial description states.  Everything an IPA should be and more.  If every beer tasted like this Id die a happy person.

bottle form odeed: pours a cloudy cooper orange colour with a large white foamy head, very lacy. aroma is sweet citrus hops and not to over powering with a nice malt background. flavour is really hoppy showing mostly earthy hops with some citrus in it. the fornt is quite sweet and finishes a wonderful bitter hop. makes my palate happy

Bottled at Chris_O Fest March 2007.  A slightly hazy copper coloured beer.  The aroma is lovely and fresh.  Grapefruit and freshly squeezed lemon in abundance.  The taste is also really hoppy.  Lemony and fruity.  Sticky and tasty.  A damn fine IPA after the slight disappointment of the ESB earlier.

Bomber courtesy dirty_martini. Pours a hazy copper with a massive and lacy white head. Arguably an imperial or double version of the style, but a tasty beer either way. A bit of sweet malty flavor shines through a wave of citrus and pine. This is one tasty IPA. Thanks, Larry!
Wow I cant believe it this beer looked like it was gonna suck when I got it but I was completely wrong, this beer fulfilled everything I expected in a beer

22, thanks to the kind hand of BitBucket. Towering moussy tan head over a hazy orange body. Gorgeous, but prepare to sit around for a while while the head settles to clingy, somewhat flotsamy foam. Big candied fruit nose--lots of sweet citrus knocking around, and some of them smell like theyve dusted in powdered sugar for a while. Theres some caramel, maybe a hint of butterscotch in there to remind you that this beer does not consist entirely of boiled hops. Think of these malt notes as a hostage photo; theyre polaroids of the barley taken with the San Diego Union Tribune, brew day edition. Cause this beers all about the hops. Tangy citrus throughout the attack, mid-palate, and finish. Incredibly smooth and drinkable, and the 7.25% was a shocking number, at least a good point higher than I suspected. They say the local price on the bombers is reasonable. Other than the abv this beer screams sessionability in every way. Complex, satisfying, interesting, refreshing, not at all in danger of growing repetitive...and its not available here and it gets you too drunk. Ah, quandaries.
clear amber body and a big rocky vanilla head, fruity fresh hop nose, well balanced, warming and syrupy and crispy, amazing ipa

22 oz bottle. Pours a slight hazy amber with a huge frothy head and big lacing.  Citrus with a large hop nose.  Flavor is very well balanced between sweet malts and bitterness.  You can taste the citrus presense with pine notes. Creamy to oily mouthfeel with a dry finish and a bitterness that lingers.  Commercial description is all true. Excellent IPA!

Deep amber beer, thin off-white head.  Sweet hoppy aroma, with strong citrus, grapefruit and a mango/pineapple tropical fruitiness.  Very fruity flavour with the sweet malts accenting the sweet fruity hops producing a juicy tropical character.  Long sweet orange, mango and grapefruit flavour on the back with just a touch of resin.  Nice brew.

appearance. amber orange color, small white head.
Pine, orange peel, grapefruit in the aroma.
not overly bitter but with a good hop bite. Resiny pine goodness flavor.
This is the kind of thing I wish was readily available. Good stuff.
Dark malt sweetness carries a significant hop load- pine, citrus, peach all mingle in this well constructed IPA. Very nice- but not the best IPA.

Now this is another nice IPA.  Pours out a nice deep orange, yellow color with a nice beige head.  Aroma is very hoppy with grassy, grapefruit notes throughout.  Flavor is very nice, although i was hoping for a bit more hoppiness to it.  Other than that, this was a great brew.

22 oz bottle thanks to Larry Pitonka, pours into a Trappist glass.  Pours a golden orange color with massive sediment flakes and a slightly tanned head.  Huge malty and citrus aroma with a massive hop presence.  The flavor is just solid in every way.  Almost seems like a IIPA flavor with the huge malt up front, moving into a very well balanced pine and citrus hop note thats as smooth as silk gliding over the palate and down the throat.  Ending on a vanillay hop note, this is one damn, DAMN good IPA.  Thank Alesmith!!!!

Sweet floral citrus hop flavors burst out of this beer. As soon as you crack the cap it just fills the air with its smell. Very well built IPA that really strikes a nice balance of flavor and bittering hops. Often I forgot I was drinking an IPA, this feels like an imperial ipa at times, but the floral character of the hops made sure the bitterness never felt overwhelming.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2007 bomber...poured a muddy dark orange-brown with a thick white head. i really liked the appearance of this one....aroma had a pretty strong citrus and hop profile, flowery as well....taste is really where this beer took off for me.  very grapefruity, yet so smooth, and even a small hint of sweetness.  there was very little bitterness to it at all.  all in all, i like hopslam slightly better but this one holds up extremely well.  i totally recommend this IPA.

Damn Im glad my father travels. Aroma is resiny pine hops. Pours a deep hazy copper, with a large, everlasting, rounded, foamy head that leaves lace rings.  Flavor is bitter hops with a mild hint of caramel sweetness poking through in a valiant attempt to balance things. This IPA is verging on Douple IPA territory, in my opinion. Well Done. More AleSmith products are going on my wish-list.

Bottle from trade with Puddintane (fantastic extra!!) Encapsulates most of what I love in an American-style IPA. Huge cascade nose, with lychees and flowery subnotes. Slightly opaque coppery colour with tight rocky white head that when deflated leaves frothy lacing. Noticeable caramel malt sweetness and rose petal and orange flavours counter the piney fresh green hops and biting bitterness that is softened by the exquisitely gentle mouthfeel.  A better example of what bottle-conditioning can do for a beer youll be hard pressed to find. Seductively easy to drink.

Ive been meaning to try this for a while and finally got a chance to pick it up. Copper orange body, creamy beige head. Big hoppy nose. Big bold hoppy flavor, supported by caramel malts. Bitter. What more can I say about this? A really well-crafted IPA, really tasty, and drinks more like a double.

Bottle from Naven.  Amber color.  Smell of malt, hops, caramel, grapefruit, cinnamon, pine, zest and a little pepper.  Taste of the same but even better.  Everything was evenly balanced out.  Not too strong nor weak.  What a great IPA!

Wow, this beer is a very well put together IPA.  A ridiculous helping of hops give way to a subtle citrus aroma.  The taste is very hoppy and may be a little underbalanced.  A crisp, delightful finish to a truly great beer

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2007 A nice well balanced hop character to this beer. Bitter but not overpowering. This bottle lacked the true citrus and pine aromas and flavors I was expecting. Will have to try another bottle for sure..
Pours a golden color with a white head.  Nice, not very pungent, grapefruit aroma.  flavor is of grassy bitter hops.

Amber body with a creamy, off-white head, lasting cover, some lace. The aroma is freash citrus hops and caramel. The flavor is moderately sweet, slightly bitter, with lots of caramel and grapefruit and a clean yeast profile. Medium body with a slightly chewy texture and a bitter finish. Well made, but too much caramel sweetness for my tastes.

Wow! After a long hiatus from my style of choice I come back to my roots and understand why I love IPAs! This beer was near perfect. Beautiful hazy orange pour with a 2 finger white head. Aroma of earthy hops and nothing else. Taste was all hops with a little malt background to just balance the citrusy hop bitterness. My eyes water when I think about this beer...not just because of how good it is but how bitter.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Amber brown and cloudy, with a ridiculously tall head.  Pine resin is the first thing that comes to mind when smelling the aroma.  That resin carries through into the taste.  But, thats not all bad.  In fact, the heavy balance of malt to hops and the high ETOH points to an IIPA.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Athens, Ohio, USA

text: [173-20061231] 1pt6floz. Strong lemony-citrusy aroma with hops and some sweet pineapple grapefruit. Slightly cloudy, orange light brown body with lots of medium-small bubbles on outer rim and a medium-lasting creamy white head. Flavour continues strong grapefruit citrus hops. Medium body, fairly complex. Hoppiness and blending is much appreciated but not a fan of grapefruit.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2010 22oz bottle, purchased at Bottle Barn. Pours a medium orange-copper color, effervescent, boldly colored; fluffy, textured off-white head with great retention and lacing that stick; beautiful pour. Lots of pine in the aroma, to the degree of being beautifully pungent and dank; followed by plenty of citrus: grapefruit and oranges; just a gorgeously presented tart note from the grapefruit; quiet, sufficient malt character is barely of any consequence; this is all dense, varied hop character. Medium-to-full body: following the aroma, theres a whole lot o grapefruit, pine, and citrus here; not quite the tartness suggested by the aroma, but certainly present; the malt character appears as a basic bready and toasty malt sweetness at the core, with hints of honey and vanilla; non-astringent hop character, nicely dank and resiny - this is just a lovely IPA, and Im glad to finally revisit a fresh bottle. Great, multifaceted hop character with that soft vanilla note at the core. Lengthy, dry finish: citrus, hints of grapefruit, nicely toasty and crisp ending.
9.5.8.4.16=4.1

22oz bottle, courtesy of Naven??  Its been a while, and I put one of these aside in the hopes that it would carbonate more, to no avail.  Pours a cloudy, dark pink-grapefruit appearance; minimal head formation.  Huge, chewy aroma, showing oranges and grapefruit and maple syrup.  Full, chewy mouthfeel: light carbonation; lots of grapefruit and tropical fruit hops; plenty of resiny chewiness; backed up by a prominent wet-malt and vanilla character; but its really just an under-carbonated and chewy mess.  Ive had three bottles over the last couple months, and Ive not really enjoyed any of them.  Medium, sugary finish.  Tasty, but this just seems thrown together.  Maybe this is a poor batch? 8.3.7.4.14=3.6

Thanks to awaisanen for the trade.  Pours a translucent golden amber with a large foamy off white head that left a bunch of sticky lacing with great retention.  Exactly what an IPA should look like!  Aroma of orange, pine, grapefruit, caramel malt, toasted malts and just an overall great hop/malt balanced aroma.  Flavor of pine, grapefruit, caramel, nuts, vanilla and an excellent hop flavor and bitterness.  Yet this still has enough caramel malt to balance it beautifully.  In terms of yeast this beer drinks very clean with some fruity esters but no real off flavors.

bottle.  golden/copper pour, carbonated with frothy white head.  rich sweet malt and citrus hip aroma.  crisp huge floral hops with equally big malt backing. caramel.  big cirtrus bitter finish.  this is a hop lovers beer.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2007 one of the better IPAs ive had. the aroma hits you like a ton of hop bricks, the pour leaves you a nice fluffy white head with aroma of pine and citrus. flavor was much more of the same...piney citrus/grapefruity hops with a nice full mouthfeel and a nice dry finish. yet another excellent alesmith brew

22 oz. bottle in a trade with awaisanen. Pours a mostly clear coppery gold with a large, fluffy, linen white head. Strong aroma of pine and grapefruit. Initially, there is some slightly sweet malt which is followed up with pine and grapefruit. Not excessively bitter, which I liked.  Long, dry finish. Good stuff.

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2014 Pours hazy deep orange/copper with a huge white head that hangs around the whole glass.  Orange, citris, grapefruit and pine aroma and flavor dominate.  But just enough malt sweetness to balance.  Makes you want to go get an orange to go with this fine beer. 

Re-rate: havent had this in a few years and its as good if not better then I remember.  Love when that happens!  Bumping this up a couple of notches.

Just pouring this brew on this brew into a glass tells most of the story. It fills the room with a beautiful citrus aroma. I swear I have never nosed an IPA with so much aroma, hell I did not know an IPA could have so much aroma. I didnt want to keep the glass down, and continue to extract the various layers of essence bursting out of the glass. I want to give it an 11 on 10 on aroma. On taste, my first impressions were brilliant - crisp, fruity, hoppy and variantly complex. However the finish was another story. After being uplifted with an out-worldly experience, you are presented with an overly hoppy, cloying bitter finish that disappoints. I did not know an American micro was able to produce such a nose and such subtle brilliance. But as usual the finish is that of an overly excited, overly done, American micro. I was so impressed by this brew initially, that Im going to humbly ask Alesmith to please reduce that hoppy cloying bitterness, you are destroying the one beer that has the potential to be the quintessential example for what American micros are capable of.
Bomber poured into a chilled pint glass. Big white foamy head. Beer is a murky golden color. Very clean smooth taste. Excellent IPA

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2008 Thanks to dunk for the bomber. Clear amber/orange color with a large head. Head leaves fair lacing. Aroma of oily hops; resin, citrus, and also caramel malt. Tastes of peaches and citrus. West coast balanced. Medium body, oily texture.  Nicely bitter finish, although theres some astringency.

Bottle. Body-hazy dirty orange with a thick foamy film. Nose-sweet, orange dishwashing liquid, oily, thick. Taste-medium to high bitter, high CO2, alcohol, roasty malts, prickly, low to medium sweetness, clean, pineapple, tangerine, lightly buttery. Very well done-the hops are not too citric or bitter, the malt is not too sweet, and the alcohol is balanced out well. Almost meaty tasting.
Citrus and piney hops in the aroma.Pours amedium copper with an off white head.Very nice balance of hops and malt in the flavor.Medium to full mouthfel with a sweet malt finish.

brewery fresh growler.  Pours amber with a good, with slighly off white head. aroma is huge. citrusy hops with a sweet maltiness to for good measure. Flavor  starts with the citrusy hops but is balenced with a fruity sweet. finishes slighly dry and very smooth.  Not the assualt on taste buds like some other SD IPas, but and absolutely perfectly crafted brew. If I had to chose one IPA to drink for the rest of my life, this would be it.

Pours an amber color with an off-white head.  Aroma is huge of citrus and pine hops, caramel, and some sweet maltiness.  Flavor starts off with huge citrus and pine hop that leaves to a caramel and sweet maltiness.  Finishes bitter and with some slight alcohol warming.  Another great AleSmith brew.
A good IPA. I loved the mild hops and enjoyed the taste of plums and cherries.

Wonderful hop aroma.  I could swear I was getting strawberries in the aroma.  Golden brown in color with a big frothy head.  The palate is thick.  Taste is very malty--but Im not getting the expected hops.  Bready with some earthy hops.  Not a pleasant aftertaste.  This is the first Alesmith beer that I havent completely loved.

Bottle: Pours amber in color with a pretty nice, just slightly off white head. The smell is much like youd probably expect from an IPA: citrus, earthy smell. The taste is not overwhelming like some IPAs can be. The hops were just bittering enough to make this a good beer, but definitely not over the top and I love hops. I do notice a bit of a grapefruit taste on the back of this one.
deep orange/red cloudy with lasting and lacing off white frowth.  apple citrus hop flavor.  mild alcohol notes.  Very delicious.

So smooth that I forgot that it was an IPA.  Compared to stones Ruination IPA, this is a walk in the park.  However, the hops REALLY is present, but more delicious and less of a palate assault than its san diego equals.

Smells of sharp NW hops when pouring a filtered dark amber with a hardy head.  Hops smack one in the face upon first taste, whats even more impressive is how the ale leaves such a small and non-intrusive aftertaste on the palate after such a flavor burst.  The goodness evaporates off the taste buds and prepares you for the next piney sip with hints of molasses in the back ground. Kudos!

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2007 Clear amber orange color with a big rocky white head.  Aroma is really attractive, actually its fantastic.  I smell grapefruit, orange, spice... what a wonderful mix.  Flavor is almost as good as the aroma.  Pine, grapefruit, some pepper, resin, awesome.  The body is just about perfect.  Fantastic IPA.

2007 Bottle- Fresh.  Since my first encounter with this delicious beer back in January, Ive been remembering how fresh and exciting it was to drink.  Ive been looking forward to our next encounter with some apprehension.  Im afraid it will fail to live up to the first experience.  Here goes...
Pour is a dark melon/amber color with a head of white lace. The aroma is the beautiful mix of hops and malt that I remember although this time Im not detecting the same diversity of aromas I experienced the first time around.  The hops are spicy and citric, the malts are Caramely and smooth.  As it pours over my tongue I get the spicy hops and then as it falls to the sides of my tongue and the back it is the sweet malts that show themselves.  Still a true champion of the style.

The aroma was a little weak for the wonderful experiences in appearance, flavor, and palate.  This has to be one of the best IPAs ever made.  Thick, very thick, head with a well balanced flavor of hops, malt, bread/yeast, and citrus/fruit.  The alcohol is detectable while in the mouth and the carbonation is a little, just a little, too present.  Yum!  Thanks Bartzilla.

In my opinion, Alesmith is the ultimate IPA.  As a homebrewer, I have no idea how they are able to get such an incredible hop aroma in a bottle.  It seems impossible.  Another great thing about Alesmith is that they are able to make a beer with a huge hop presence without being unpleasantly bitter.  This is a fantastic beer.

Rating #300. 22oz bottle via trade with Ty5592.  Aroma:  Lots of maltiness here with a good caramel quality.  Some light breadiness, too.  Grapefruit, resin, pine, and floral hops.  Appearance:  Dark amber in color and hazy.  Off white head was huge and foamy with great retention.  Head lasted almost to bottom of the glass.  Great lacing.  Flavor:  Malt and hops present themselves almost simutaneously.  Bready, sweet malt again with a nice caramel character.  Resin and grapefruit hops are the main flavors, but pine, floral, earthy, and grassy hop flavors come through too.  Bitterness is medium strong but balances  with the maltiness well.  Very nice.  Palate:  Medium bodied and smooth.  Medium carbonation.  Light alcohol warming in back of mouth.  Overall:  Definatly the best IPA Ive had to date.  Great flavors, well balanced, and a smooth drinker.   Great beer!

Bottle. Pours with an ornage golden color and a giant head with excellent retention.Aromas ar sdtrong resin, pine and grapefruit. Flavors start of with complex grapefruit, hops and pine mixture that then turns sweeter due to the malts but finishes with some pure hops bitterness. Nice mouthfeel as well.
Overall, a great brew.  These guys never fail to impress.  Dark golden pour, heavy body, citrus aroma.  Could be a little more hoppy for my taste, but definately a well-balanced beer.

Dark Yellow/Orange Coloring with No Head.  Light Hop Aroma.  Creamy Mouthfeel...Almost Like a Hop Creme...Wonderful Hop Profile.  This One Leaves you Jaw Dropping from the Goodness.  Wonderful Example of What an IPA Can Be.

Wonderful IPA.  AleSmith consistently puts out great beers.  It is no wonder they are among the leaders in the industry.  Nice golden pour with medium head.  Delicious hop character with nice malt balance.  Big hoppy bitter finish.  Great IPA!

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2009 Finally got my hands on the "#1" IPA and my first brew from Alesmith.  Pretty dark orange color with plenty of foam.  Sweet floral-citrus hop aroma that is very appetizing.  Taste is surprisingly sweet with a pleasant malt backing that supports some fantastic hops.  This is one IPA that gets more appetizing the more you drink.  I thought Bells 2 hearted and Stone IPA were pretty good, but this takes it to the next level.  Well done by Alesmith.  Wow.

Pours a nice hazy orangeish color with thick head. Its body is thick and slightly viscous. Theres a big underlying sweetness to this beer to balance a huge hop presence. Strong grassy notes and a grapefruity piney finish. Sweeter than I expected, but still a great IPA.
Its great tasting but contains too little kick for my tastes.  Tastes almost more like a cider than a beer.  Its lovely but lacks bite.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2007 22 oz bottle acquired via trade from Hair.  Thanks alot!  This beer was split two ways.  Pours a hazy orange with an off white head. The aroma of citrus blends perfectly with caramel malts creating a very clean fruity aroma.  The taste is similar, very smooth, citrus, and sweet malts that are in perfect balance.  Light to moderate bitterness in the taste and finish.  Usually I like my IPAs to be a bit more aggressive but this beer was so incredibly well balanced that it did not make a difference.

Had this one before, but never bothered to rate it. Pours out a hazy copper color with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus and slight pine/woodsy aroma. Taste is very well balanced with a nice creamy/fruity backbone that is a perfect compliment to the hops. The hops flavors were mainly citrus and had that nice bitter aftertaste. Very solid IPA from a world class brewery

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2007 Re-rate 
11 October 2007

Mostly the same impression as far as appearance and mouthfeel go, but this must have been a fresher bottle. Had a much more pronounced citrus nose and just an outstanding hop character in the flavor.  Great IPA.


------ amber pour under a giant foamy off-white head.  Citrusy hop aroma - reminds me of oranges more than the usual grapefruit.  Mouthfeel is smooth with lively carbonation.  Nice citrusy hop flavor with great bitter finish.  Overall this was a fine IPA, but maybe I expected a bit more from Alesmith

I mostly agree with the commercial description, though I must say that I got more piney than citrus on the aroma.  There were tons of minor notes in there, giving it a very interesting complexity.  Good head retention is also an unerstatement.  Ive still got a mound of off-white suds in the middle of my glass.  Flavor is definitely sweet and resiny at the start and moderately bitter at the end.  I didnt get any dark fruits; maybe the hint was too faint.  In any event, a world-class IPA.

This smells great, fruity and fresh (apricots almost). This is one great IPA. Lots of floral characteristics. I like this a lot, and would buy it all the time if we could get it here in Las Vegas.  In fact, I think it is probably my favorite.

Wow this is REALLY good. Wonderful, fragrant hoppy aromas waft from the minimal thin head. Very light, velvety carbonation.

Golden tawny color, slightly hazy. 

Sweet, but  balanced by an mellow hoppy bitterness. 

Plenty of peach, pine and grapefruit in the finish.

wow.

Best IPA Ive ever drunk.  Full-bodied yet  kind of light.  Pleasant amber color.  Definitely a peach-citrus taste to this beer but yet not too sweet.  Bought this directly from AleSmith in 22-oz. bottles, though Ive also seen this in Whole Foods here in San Diego too.

22oz bottle:  the sound made upon opening  think and the little head formed by a vigorous pour makes me think that my bottle flat/under carbonated.  pours a brilliant hazy honey color with very little head.  aroma is stong of grapefruit and pine.  maybe some lemon and orange with just a tinge of malt.  the mouth feels is less carbonated that what i am used, but i like it.  i do think that mine is some how under carbonated.  flavor is amazing though.  tons of grapfruit and pine with hints of caramel, peaches and a tiny bit of vanilla.   very balacned and very drinkable.  i hope my other bottles dont have the same carbonation problem.

Bottle. Pours a clear amber color with a nice off-white head on top. Aroma is full of hops with hints of pine and citrus. Flavor is full of hops at initial sip. Notes of citrus, fruit, and pine hit the tongue and give it a nice lashing. Malts come in to balance out the deal with nice sweetness at the end. A medium bodied beer that is smooth and very enjoyable. By far one of the best IPAs around.

Finally!  Took 2 seperate trips to southern California to find this elusive brew (not that I minded "having" to go back).  Hazy orange/copper pour with a modest but sturdy off-white head and good lacing.  Typically floral/fuity/piney hop aroma for a top tier west coast IPA with consistant flavors.  A touch of brown sugar, peaches and plenty of malt sweetness in the flavors as well.  Rich mouthfeel and a brisk bitter finish with hints of vanilla at the end.  A great IPA from a region seemingly crowded with fantastic offerings.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2014 22oz bomber. Murky orange to copper color with very thin white head. Rich sweet caramel malty aroma with some light pine hops. Taste as it smells. Caramel malts, some earthiness, some wet hops and pine hop bitterness. Maybe what Im tasting is hop flavor since the bitterness is on the light side. Finally trying a fresh bottel of this. Thank you Alesmith for putting dates on the bottle. This fresh bottle is just yummy with crisp tangerine, dank spicy onion, some shallot and light floral hops around the edges. This has plenty of crisp fresh hoppiness that is both snappy and bitter and flavor as well.

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2007 Bottle via trade with Ty5592. I have been wanting thing one for quite some time now. This is the best IPA I have ever had. Incredibly balanced, sweet floral and citrus hops and a perfect malt balance to go with it. Wow.  Alchohol hidden well, Amazing taste. I could drink this all day, every day. I need more. Must contact Liquid Solutions immediately.

Bottle.
Cloudy amber coloured with a white head.
Aroma of caramel, pine needles and hops.
Flavour of caramel, hops and pine needles.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2006 Bottle. This was a very good beer, Orange with fluffy white head which lasted until the last drop. Very lively carbonation. Aroma of apricots and citrus. The taste was the same with pine and malty flavors throughout. Smooth body with mild alcohol/sticky hop finish.

Thanks to Odeed for the great bonus brew.  Hazy golden orange color with large white head and lots of lacing.  Aroma is mixture of citrus and floral hops.  Flavor is citrusy with a minty pine kick.  Could have been a bit fuller bodied and the alcohol presence is a little much.
Bottled. Hazy golden coloured with a rather large white head. Very well balanced all though it was milder than expected. Very round and nice.

Bottle thanks to the boys at Ølbaren. Light hazy golden colour with a white head. Plesant malty, floral hoppy aroma and a light sweet malty, dry hop, floral, citrus taste. Medium body with a sweet, dry finish.

Murky orange with a dirty white head that lasts forever. Good lacing all the way down the glass. Aroma is citrus orange and lemon with tons of floral notes. Well hopped and floral tasting. Flavor is dominated by herbal notes, but the citrus is noticable. Bitter dry malty finish. Lots of hop character.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2008 22oz bottle.  Ive had this beer many times in bottle and a few times on tap at the brewery.  I thought it was about time I rated it.  The beer pours a nice golden straw color with a big thick imposing head.  The scent is light and hoppy and not overwhelmingly hoppy.  The taste has a nice hoppy bite and a bigger taste then an average ipa with that nice big 7.25% abv.  It is a high quality IPA and another great brew from Alesmith and nicely low cost as well.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2008 22 oz bottle from HiTimeWine.com. Pours an almost clear golden amber color with a massive chunky head. Leaves a ton of lace on glass as it SLOWLY SNAILISHLY dissipates. Floral/fruity aroma of fresh bread, pine and orange. Starts and finishes a bit sourish, with some caramel, orange, and pine tucked nicely in between. Very balanced, perhaps a bit sweet and malty for an IPA..still a very fine IPA, my favorite. I could drink this all day, every day.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2007 Tasted with OhioGuzzler and side-by-side with Stone Ruination IPA...  The AleSmith IPA is an orange/copper color (just slightly darker than the Stone Ruination IPA).  Mild carbonation and a foamy plale yellow head.  Aroma is sweet like syrup with a tinge of yeast and alcohol aged candied fruit.  Flavor is sweet and malty with a really nice apricot finish.  The hop flavor and bitterness gradually amplifies through the finish and then lingers away with the wonderful apricot flavor.  Smooth on the tongue with just enough thickness.  The hop profile on this one is quite different than most IPAs is it doesnt really just out right away in either the aroma or flavor.  This IPA seems more like a really nice strong ale or barley wine.   I think this beer might have been aging in the bottle for awhile, attributing to its smooth sweetness and wonderfully balanced flavors.  I wish this IPA was more widely available in the area as it is so good!  I love the pronounced apricot flavor and finish.

22 oz bottle (7.25% alcohol), $8.99+tax from Belmont Party Supply.

Tasted this guy next to a stone ruination - very similar on the pour - nice thick white head with a beautiful light copper coloring.  Smells syrupy and yeasty.  Taste is deeper than most IPAs.  It doesnt dance light on your tongue,  its a smooth combination of brown sugar and malt that slides down with ease.  Leaves its mark with a distinct apricot profile on the finish.  A very fine IPA
Bottle sampled pours amber with a large off white head. Aroma of citrusy hops, slight fruit, and pine. The flavor is citrus, caramel, floral hops, smooth, with a bitterness up-front, finishes nicely.

22 oz bottle.  Cloudy buckwheat honey with a brief white head.  Sweet grapefruit and orange with a little toffee.  Rich citrus with a whisper of kirsch.  Woody, brown sugar backbone; touch of soap.  Beautifully balanced; elegant.  Dense flavor without overpowering.  My favorite IPA.

Poured a orange to light amber color with a thick and very long lasting white head.  Aroma has a strong mineral charcter that is very aggressive and upfront.  Also a grassy and citrusy aromas are quite noticable.  Vlavor has a very sweet light crystal malt chacter than follows into a strong grassy and citrus hop flavor.  Bitterness is well balanced.  A good IPA, though I was definitely expecting more.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2006 Pours a golden amber with large white head.  The people that say it has a small head must have poured it wrong.  Im using a tulip glass and the head is quite large and lasting, with little bit of lacing.  Delicous mouthwatering citrus fruity aroma.  Tastes better than the aroma. Initial taste is of fruit, maybe cherries, then citrus, grapefruit, caramel, pine, and sweetness with a wonderful hoppy finish.  Close to perfect IPA.

22oz bottle poured clear amber with a small white head. Aroma was sweet caramel hops and citrus hops. Had a good bitterness with a big caramel sweetness and a light dry alcohol finish. Overall a nice IPA, but not as good as I remember it.

Great body color, nice orange-brown with a thin white head.  Aroma is excellet, citrus hoppiness with a nice light fruitiness in the back of it.  Awesome taste, citrus hoppiness, light pine and some cherry and apple.  Excellent ending, sweet yet with the light bitterness that is to be expected of an IPA.  A very nice beer that Im gratefull to have had the chance to have.

Thanks to Numenor for getting stiffed on a trade and getting this instead. Slightly hazy dark amber body. Sweet mild citrus hops aroma with some caramel in the background. Sweet citrus hops flavor, some hints of floral hops, and a caramel end.

bottle decants a fairly bright amber with a well-formed white head that retains well and leaves good lace.  pungent hop nose is predominantly citric, but some floaral piny-ness also manifests itself, as well as some caramel notes.  beer starts with a burst of sweetness, that carries a wave of hop flavor. strong bitterness dries it out a bit in the finish.  big IPA - skirting the DIPA mark by not much. heavy malt body eventually becomes a distraction, even with the hops. characteristic high-cohumulone hop burn in the finish.

22-oz. bottle from realale420, shared with chadzter.  Pours amber with a medium foamy off-white head, fizzy, lasting head, some lined lacing.  Aroma is citrus hop, resin and pine notes, yeast (dough, grass), caramel malt, alcohol nose.  Moderate acidity and bitterness, pine and citrus rind hops, meal and caramel malt with an alcohol finish.  Medium bodied, smooth and fizzy palate.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2007 Bottle.  Marvelous IPA.  All the hops, floral, and citrus notes you could ever want.  Amazingly smooth and flavorful, with a great crisp grassiness.  A classic style done the way it should be.  Way better than Stones IPA.

22oz bomber via trade with 46er3498! - Thanks Tom!  Pours cloudy amber wtih a nice full creamy offwhite head that stays very well and laces the glass.  Aromas of beautiful c-hops..   Nice pine and grapefruit blast mainly but there is some subtle caramel behind it too.  Flavor is good and hoppy.. Grapefruit, apricots, pine..  But there are sweet caramel and toffee notes underneath that balance this one out quite well..  Good smooth creamy palate with adequate carbonation and a good soft mouthfeel due to the balance..  This is probably the most drinkable IPA Ive had to date..  Delicious..  Used to be common around here but for some reason  I had to trade for it..  Id do it again in a minute though.. I really liked this one..

Bottle provided by Odeed, Thanks Jake! Nose was hops, hops, and more hops, along with a citrus hint; Golden color with a good off-white head. Flavor of hops and more hops without being overly bitter, and a little caramel. Almost as good as Hopsicle

Bomber poured a clearamber with a large lasting amber head. Aromas of carmel, pine, a bit of earthiness and some faint citrus notes. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of sweet carmel, earthiness and pine with a lingering moderatly bitter finish. A very drinkable and well balanced IPA!

22 oz. bottle poured a clear gold/amber with ahuge white frothy head that left fantastic lace. At the end of the glass, and I only poured half of the bottle intitially, there was still a 1/4" head left. Amazing for an IPA. Substantial citrusy and spicy aroma with a backgrond of some sweet caramel. Rich, smooth mouthfeel with medium bodythat leaves a rsinous coating. The carbonatin is surprisingly light given the huge head. The flavor starts off with a light maltysweetness, but is soon replaced by the bitterness of peppery spice and grapefruit. A long lightly bitter finish brings everything to a satisfying end. I was expecting this to be overrated, but it certainly lives up to its well deserved reputation. A simlply wonderful beer.

From the Columbus gathering, brought by slify. Orange with a white head. THe aroma had that nice combo of piney hops and caramel malt. The flavor seemed to be the same way...pretty balanced all the way through. It seedmed at times like the sweetness was coming out more dominate than the bitterness. Overall a smooth blanced IPA.

Bottle thanks to santa: Orange color with an off white head. Aroma of grapefruits, citrusy hops, and pale malt. Flavor was some caramel and other lighter malts up front, with a nice lingering bitter finish. Exactly what an IPA should be.
Columbus gathering beer#9. Brought by Sliffy. Strong hop aroma and a little bitterness. Sweet but still a great balance with hoppiness. Another great beer from alesmith.
This amber ale poured with a massive off-white head and a lemony aroma. Theres a nice balance of malt and hops, resulting in a smooth sweet taste with a more bitter finish. This is a very good IPA!

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2006 Bottle from liqourama.  Beautiful amber color with a huge head.  Nice floral aroma.  Taste of hops and hops.  Very smooth to going down.  The bitterness is excellent.  Alcohol was very subtle.  I love hoppy beers, but cant seem to tell them aprt from one another.  Maybe because Im still new to this.  Hopefully my palat will mature in due time.

Bottle: Poured a deep amber color ale with a huge foamy head with standard retention. Aroma of citrus hops is quite powerful and dominate. Taste is also overpowered by citrus hops with a metallic aftertaste. There is some caramel malt that is discernable though very faint. Im not sure I see why this is rated so highly. Overall, this beer is one-dimensional and not properly balance.

22oz bomber acquired via trade from Jason @ Knightly Spirits, no date.  Aroma of big resiny pine and grapefruit hops, some caramel malt sweetness.  Pours a hazy orange golden with a moderate frothy off white head.  Taste follows aroma with some grassiness, lotta bitterness throughout--about midway through the caramel malts attempt to sweeten it up, but fail until the end with a biscuity finish.  Medium bodied, smooth mouthfeel, moderate carbonation--though soft.  Very good, though it seems that IIPAs and IPAs start tasting the same.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: UPDATED: JUN 29, 2009 On tap at Downtown Johnny Browns in SD. Pours amber orange in color with a strong large ivory head. Hop aroma is piney and spicey, of ginger perhaps? Flavor is citrus, caramel and delightful sweetness. Yum. Update 5/19/9: On tap at the Local in SD. Pours deep dark gold to borderline amber with a thick white head that holds on but settles to a "hill and valley" sheen. Unfortunately, they served this in an iced glass. At arctic temperatures, the aroma still manages to generate a candy malt hoppy orange scent. Has a mango and pineapple sweetness as its first big flavor. The palate is thick and slick. The finish is remarkably dissipative. This does not seem to be as big a beer as it is. Very solid and close to perfect.

Big orange bud nest aroma.  Hazy near brown amber body.  Tangy bud-bud skunk flavo, good milky palate, tastes almost like a cask ipa in palate.  Lick your lips bittersweet. semi-subdued malt is decent bone structure for tons o hops.

One of my favortie examples of the California IPA. Lots of hops. Amber hued with a cram colored head. The head gripped very nicely to the glass and stuck around for quite sometime. Leaves some lacing on the glass after every sip, but not much. Smell was mostly hops, but a small amount of malt sweetness sneaks through. Taste was citrus and pine followed by a hint of alcohol. Finish is very winelike. Nice balance as it isnt overly bitter but it will still satisify most hopheads. Goes down smooth even though the alcohol will warm as it goes down. Great beer!
I was kind of drunk by the time I had this but I could tell it was pretty good.  Quite hoppy and citrusy but I would have like to see more hops.  Was well balanced but a little too sweet.

Lives up to its reputation.  Love Hollingshead Deli. On-tap there.  Wow [to both Hollingshead and Alesmith].  Darker amber color, with darker head.  Great head retention.  That [what i call] grassy and fruity IPA aroma.  Sticky lace all the way down.  Great hoppy finish.  This goes up against my favorite, and local, Mineral King IPA.  Will try to do a side by side comparison.  This is great, and so is Hollingshead.

Looks, smells, and tastes like Jesus in a beer bottle.  My Sweet Lord, what an amazing beer.  Aroma is terribly complex, fruity, pine, grapefruit, orange, lilacs on a spring day, caramel.  Pours an amber color with nice lacing, small white head.  Taste hits malty and citrus, kind of sweet, then a strong hoppy pine finish.  Perfect body for the style.  This is an amazing beer.  Hopefully my first of many Alesmiths.
Copper body with decent off white head.  Floral hop nose with some citrus hops in the taste. Creamy smooth on the palate, and quite bitter but smooths out with some sweetness at teh finish.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2007 Poured an amber color with a huge huge head that was impressive, sustained itself well, and laced well. The aroma was strong and hoppy (some pine) and grapefruit. Flavor was much of the same with a not too sweet malt base. I enjoyed this one, but have a hard time distinguishing the better IPAs from one another. Re-rate: 6/26/06, similar experience, although the maltiness was a bit rich and bitter, some citrus rinds in there. A slightly off spicey and peppery type flavor (their yeast?) in the aftertaste. Bordered on a chemical type flavor. Pushed the higher malty and alcohol levels of a dIPA, but good stuff, nonetheless. Re-rate, 12/07: Full malt body, darned bitter finish, a darned fine IPA, but a little over the top for my top likings. Spicey/peppery aspects noted by me again, definitely distinctive if you get it at the right temperature.

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2007 One of the great things about living here in San Diego, among others, is that I can walk into just about any ol store (even some 7-11s) and grab a bomber of this stuff to go.  This beer, in my opinion, exemplifies every characteristic of what makes a really good IPA.  Anyone can make a hoppy beer, but Alesmith has fine tuned the craft of balancing this one.  Its sweet, but not to sweet, hoppy, but not overbearing, fragrant, but not overtly, etc, etc.   In short, it kicks ass.
Terrific.  Nearly perfect balance.  Just remember to pour carefully to avoid the yeasts.

Got in a trade with cbkschubert. Really liked most everything about this beer. A nice hops aroma, with a flavor of malt and alc. that just make it a pure pleasure to drink. It had a rich buttery toffe/caramel flavor that just spread out across your entire mouth. The hops reached out there and grabbed you without squeezing the life out of your tastebuds. A real beer.

Dark for an IPA but nice and clear. Much more malt and body that a usual IPA. This was an asset to the brew not a deterent. Excellent hop aroma along with an excellent  hop flavor. Great palate great overall

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2015 Slightly dark amber body with a moderate to large head with good lacing and retention. Aroma is grapefruit, citrus, tropical fruit, wood. Medium bodied, big bitterness. This is so rock solid its well... pretty awesome.

22 oz bomber.  Pours a dark golden/orange with a large white foamy head.  Big pine followed by citrus/floral hop notes in the aroma.  The taste starts out with a large malt presence followed by the solid hop bitterness that really hangs on.  A solid IPA.

22 oz bottle purchased from Tops Liquors in Tempe, AZ.  This beer is why its worth the pain in the ass of carting 30 pounds of beer through an airport.  Piney, sweet citric hempy caramel goodies present in the nose.  Very west-coast and very aromatic.  Smells great.  Mildly hazy copper color with a big, long-lasting frothy off-white head and attractive lacing.  Starts chewy, malty, caramelly and roasted.  Turns a bit more hopped and bitter with some piney and earthy notes along with mild hemp flavors.  A very sticky, chewy IPA that has the scales tipped a bit too far in favor of the malts.  Either way, Id rather this than too hopped.  This is tasty and well crafted!  I need more.

Thanks Saarlander for this treat.  Poured into an English pint, light amber, slight dry hop haze with a billowing white head that lasted the entire time I was drinking this beer.  Im getting all facets of hop aroma here.  Citurs, spice, earth, and flowers are all in line. Some nice honey aroma works its way through to represent the malt.  Again a quality blend of hop flavor takes over as I drink also.  Stong bitterness is sure to get your attention.  Very resinous, and stinky from the lips to the tonsils.  Reminds me of a wannabe Racer 5.  Almost as good, but falls just short.

Subtle nose of spice, yeast, some pine & spruce, and a hint of alcohol.  Much more tame
than I would expect from the style.  Pours a hazy golden copper.  The tall rocky off white
head is fully lasting and has very pronounced lacing.  It is the best head Ive seen in several
samplings.  The flavor is both interesting and titillating.  Superb balance for the style.  Not
your usual IPA hops assault - much more complex than other examples of the style; but at
the same time not impotent.  This is as good as it gets!  The medium to full body is both
soft and creamy.  Exceptional offering, highly recommended.

"Its Pretty Awesome".  Says so right on the bottle, for those of you who take notes.  Delicious IPA.  The commercial description pretty much nails it.  Havent had a chance to get too crazy off this ale, but Im sure itd be a great time.

A great IPA.  Pours a medium copper color with a nice frothy white head.  Aroma is mostly of hops,  some citrus and pine as well.  It was actually a little hoppier than I was expecting.  A great beer from a great brewery.

Got this one via trade with Fordest, thanks Sean! From bomber.  Pours a cloudy copper with BIG tan head.  Nose is big on citrus, pine and some floral hops.  Flavor is where the malt comes on strong, with a solid body and under-lying sweetness that never seems to be able to take over the hops, which are resiny and bitter, while taking after the nose.  Finish is retrained bitter and relatively clean.  Very good IPA.
UPDATED: JUN 9, 2006 Rerate. This one had a great color, piney, hoppy aroma, and a big frothy head that one would expect from the alesmith brews.  They have not let me down yet.

A wonderully well balanced IPA. Pours an amber-orange color under a dense, but thin, whipsy white head. Aroma of course is dominated by the hops with tons of freshly sliced grapefruit and orange, along with some faint notes of honey, pine, lemon and yeast rolls. Pleasing full palate; smooth and creamy with just the right amount of spritz. Although this is a typical west coast hop monster, the semi-sweet malt profile comes through nicely in the flavor department balancing impeccably with the big, bitter hop notes. Finish is long, dry, bitter, clean and crisp. In summary, simply one of the best American IPA,s out there.
What a great IPA!  Strong hop aroma, a great palate, and the flavor!  Strong hops, fruity, great malt balance.  Id buy this again for sure.

MN Ratebeer Winter Gathering 06. Bottle. Faint hops compared to other CA IPAs. No visible carbonation, not much head, which is white; slightly hazy. Not the best IPA Ive had but excellent initial mouthfeel. A little sour. Body comes through at back of tongue. Somewhat perfumy. A little disappointing.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2009 2009-10-30, bottle at Ølbaren, Copenhagen, 9-5-7-4-16=41Hazy deep blond color. The aroma is very citrusy. It has a lean body, with a strong bitterness, resiny and fruity; I miss some sweetness, but its a great IPA.
2009-06-20, 8-5-7-5-16=41Copper color: big frothy head. Sharp spicy aroma, coriander, peppercorns, cloves; then some fruity hop too. Lean body, with dry toffee flavor and hazelnuts; the hopping is good, oily, nutty, a bit resiny, not much fruity. Less than I remembered, but very good. 2006-03-28, at Freakin Frog, Las Vegas, 9-5-8-5-17=44Hazy amber color. Nice hoppy aroma, very fruity (apricots, persimmon, oranges). Good malty body, very strong, excellent hopping, aromatic sweet fruity and resiny. Well blended.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2007 Pours a deep golden honey color w/ a full, semi creamy froth. Head retention is  lengthy. Residual lacing is thick, sticky, and creamy. Nice! Aroma is of citrus rind perfume. Full nectar w/ silky residual effers. It has a thick creamy texture. Malt driven bomb squad. Big citrus with rich, malty caramel flavors. A defined perfume essence is unique yet questionable. Hop rate is high yet it doesnt bite back. A very luscious style. This brew has a mild sweetness and a touch of grapefruit on the finish w/ only mild bittering.  There is a lingering dose of asprin taht intriges me. Highly recommended.

Very unique IPA Id love to smell this beer all day...unreal hop aroma. Very rich and thick caramel...thats why its unique...most IPAs I have had have been very dry and thin with high alcohol. This one is extremely malty and thick.

Bomber. Thanks Bro! This is why Im becoming a big hop head. I love great IPAs like this. Poured a great copper color with a creamy off-white head that diminished to a ring over time but left excellent lacing. Big IPA aroma of grapefruit and pine. The flavor found grapefruit citrus, pine, orange, and a light malt background of butterscotch and chocolate. Medium body and dry but smooth. Awesome bitterness.
.. it is pretty awesome.  omg.. its fanfuckingtastic, this IPA.  great pour from a bomber, perfect aroma, color is great.. tastes wonderful.. some cinnamon even.. great, great IPA.  must buy more.

Hops, caramel , bubbles, heat, alcohol in that order and in perfect percentages. Dry hopped  in description sya it perfect. This is almost a perfect IPA...read the description and you will know evrything about this brewha.
Bottled.  This IPA has a fruity hoppy aroma to it.  The taste is almost sweet for just a moment, but finishes bitter.  I dont normally care for the bitterness, but this is such a quality beer.

Bottled.  Dark honey color, hazy (yeast floaties), large offwhite head that is creamy//fluffy and a bit lumpy.  Body is sparkling.  Lace is in rings, also in sheets, is quite generous and head is fully lasting.  Aroma is honeycomb, floral, orange, pine and sweet dough.  Body is medium to full with light, soft carbonation and a semi-dry finish.  Flavor is honeycomb, flowers, touch of light honey, strong pine aftertaste with a light alcohol presence proving some warmth.  Honey-floral is throughout.  Not very sweet, pretty bitter and well blended flavor.  Nothing super exciting except the appearance, but this beer is really well done.  Thoroughly enjoyed.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2007 22 oz. bottle from Plaza Liquor -  Pours a very slightly hazy amber color with a nice tight one finger thick off white head that lasts.  Lots of citrus and pine hop aroma.  Lots of hop flavor that lingers.  Not much malt, but thats OK.  Slight alcohol warming.  Palate is a little thin.  Medium body.  An excellent beer.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2007 Um, not much to say about this one except that it probably should replace sierra nevada as the quintessential ipa.  I mean these guys nailed it.  The hops are perfectly balanced and dont kill you with their aromas or flavors.  Great beer to drink.  Glad I had a chance to try this one.  Thanks to dhlesq.  Very floral aromas.  Very bitter, citrusy tastes.
Bottle 650ml. Appearance: hazy golden with big creamy white head. Aroma: hoppy,  grapefruit. Flavor: hops, caramel, pine, grapefruit. Thank Harry for this amazing beer.

Bottle. 22oz.  Pours a deeper golden color with a regular head. Strong scents of hops on the nose.  Flavors of hops (of course) caramel and butterscotch and maybe some apple cider.  Malts and hops are pretty balanced in this brew, but hops win. Thanks Flaco Alto !
